original: 'dab ma brgya phrag du ma zhig yod kyang shing de la lo ma bdun pa zhes bya ba de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma brgya phrag du ma zhig yod kyang shing de la lo ma bdun pa zhes bya ba de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Although there are many hundreds of petals, the tree is called the seven-leaved tree.

original: dpe gnyis nye bar bkod pa'i dgos pa ni dpe dang po ni gsung rab la grub pa yin la /
analyzed: dpe gnyis nye bar bkod pa'i dgos pa ni dpe dang po ni gsung rab la grub pa yin la /
translated: The purpose of the two examples is that the first example is established in the scriptures,

original: gnyis pa ni 'jig rten na grags pas so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'jig rten na grags pas so //
translated: and the second is known in the world.

original: gal te bdun tshan du mthun pa'i phyir re ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa yin no zhes 'chad na /
analyzed: gal te bdun tshan du mthun pa'i phyir re ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa yin no zhes 'chad na /
translated: If one explains that the seven-timer is so called because he is reborn seven times in accordance with the seven sets,

original: 'o na gang mdo las gsungs pa de dang 'gal te /
analyzed: 'o na gang mdo las gsungs pa de dang 'gal te /
translated: then this contradicts the sutra.

original: de'i phyir bshad pa 'di ni ngan to snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa 'di ni ngan to snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this explanation is bad.

original: 'gro ba gcig tu srid pa brgyad pa mngon par mi 'grub kyi /
analyzed: 'gro ba gcig tu srid pa brgyad pa mngon par mi 'grub kyi /
translated: The eighth existence does not manifest in the same realm,

original: 'gro ba gzhan du ni mngon par 'grub par 'gyur bas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: 'gro ba gzhan du ni mngon par 'grub par 'gyur bas 'gal ba med do //
translated: but it does manifest in other realms.

original: 'on te lha rnams dang mi'i nang du lan bdun 'khor zhing song nas sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed do zhes 'byung ba sgra ji bzhin du brtags na ni lha dang mi zhes 'byung ba'i phyir srid pa bar ma yang yod par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /üîΩlha dang mi'i 'gro ba dag tu srid pa bdun mngon par 'grub kyi /
analyzed: 'on te lha rnams dang mi'i nang du lan bdun 'khor zhing song nas sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed do zhes 'byung ba sgra ji bzhin du brtags na ni lha dang mi zhes 'byung ba'i phyir srid pa bar ma yang yod par mi 'gyur ba zhig na / lha dang mi'i 'gro ba dag tu srid pa bdun mngon par 'grub kyi /
translated: If one analyzes the literal meaning of the sutra, then since it says gods and humans, intermediate existence would not exist.

original: srid pa @185a * //
analyzed: srid pa @185a * //
translated: But it is asserted that seven existences are actualized in the realms of gods and humans,

original: bar ma rnams ni ma bgrangs so zhes bya bar yang 'dod do //
analyzed: bar ma rnams ni ma bgrangs so zhes bya bar yang 'dod do //
translated: but not in intermediate existence.

original: gal te srid pa bar ma rnams dang bcas te srid pa bdun du bgrang bar gyur na ni de'i skye ba bzhi kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te srid pa bar ma rnams dang bcas te srid pa bdun du bgrang bar gyur na ni de'i skye ba bzhi kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If intermediate existence were counted as one of the seven existences, then one would have only four births.

original: de ltar na mi 'dod par 'gyur ba'i tshig 'dis ni bdag nyid kyi rnam par bshad pa 'gro ba gcig tu dgongs pa yin no zhes bya ba de gzhung 'dzugs par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na mi 'dod par 'gyur ba'i tshig 'dis ni bdag nyid kyi rnam par bshad pa 'gro ba gcig tu dgongs pa yin no zhes bya ba de gzhung 'dzugs par byed do //
translated: Thus, this statement that is not asserted by the Vaibhasikas establishes their own interpretation that the seven existences are in one realm.

original: cig shos kyis de ltar yang srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du gong du 'pho ba zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /
analyzed: cig shos kyis de ltar yang srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du gong du 'pho ba zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /
translated: The other says: It is also possible to upgrade to the summit of existence.

original: gal te 'gro ba gcig tu srid pa brgyad pa mngon par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes rnam par 'chad par byed na /
analyzed: gal te 'gro ba gcig tu srid pa brgyad pa mngon par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes rnam par 'chad par byed na /
translated: If you explain that it is because the eighth existence is not actualized in one realm,üîΩthen how could an upgrade to one realm actualize the eighth existence?

original: 'o na ji ltar gong du 'pho ba 'gro ba gcig tu srid pa brgyad pa mngon par 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar gong du 'pho ba 'gro ba gcig tu srid pa brgyad pa mngon par 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: It is said:

original: de 'phar phyed 'phar thams cad du //
analyzed: de 'phar phyed 'phar thams cad du //
translated: Those who upgrade to half or all

original: 'chi 'pho gzhan srid rtse mor 'gro //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho gzhan srid rtse mor 'gro //
translated: die and are reborn in the summit of existence.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'og min gyi bar du gong du 'pho ba la yang srid pa brgyad pa mngon par 'grub pa srid na /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'og min gyi bar du gong du 'pho ba la yang srid pa brgyad pa mngon par 'grub pa srid na /
translated: If it is possible that the eighth existence is actualized by upgrading to Akani·π£·π≠ha,

original: ci'i phyir srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du zhes bya ba khyad par du smos she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du zhes bya ba khyad par du smos she na /
translated: why is it specified that it is possible to upgrade to the summit of existence?

original: de yang brjod par bya ba ni yin mod kyi bsam pa ni srid pa'i mchog brjod par 'dod nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du gong du 'pho ba smos pa yin no zhes bya bar mngon no //
analyzed: de yang brjod par bya ba ni yin mod kyi bsam pa ni srid pa'i mchog brjod par 'dod nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du gong du 'pho ba smos pa yin no zhes bya bar mngon no //
translated: Moreover, although it is indeed something to be expressed, it is evident that the intention is to speak of the highest existence, since it mentions ‚Äúthose who rise to the peak of existence.‚ÄùüîΩThere is no fault because it is stated with reference to the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa'i khams las dgongs te gsungs pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba gcig po mi'i 'gro ba'am lha'i 'gro ba gang yin pa deng srid pa brgyad pa mngon par mi 'grub kyi gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu ni ma yin
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams las dgongs te gsungs pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba gcig po mi'i 'gro ba'am lha'i 'gro ba gang yin pa deng srid pa brgyad pa mngon par mi 'grub kyi gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu ni ma yin
translated: It is stated with reference to the desire realm, but not to the form and formless realms.üîΩWhat is the scriptural evidence and reasoning here?

original: no // de ni 'dod pa'i khams las dgongs te gsungs so zhes bya ba ni 'di la shes par byed pa mdo'am rigs pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba la mdo ni lung ngo //
analyzed: no // de ni 'dod pa'i khams las dgongs te gsungs so zhes bya ba ni 'di la shes par byed pa mdo'am rigs pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba la mdo ni lung ngo //
translated: A scripture is a sutra.

original: rigs pa ni don rjes su dpog pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa ni don rjes su dpog pa'o //
translated: Reasoning is inferring a meaning.

original: gang gis 'di la shes par byed pa mdo'am rigs pa ci zhig yod ces glengs pa de nyid kyis yang lha dang mi dag gi nang du so sor zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: gang gis 'di la shes par byed pa mdo'am rigs pa ci zhig yod ces glengs pa de nyid kyis yang lha dang mi dag gi nang du so sor zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: What is the scripture or reasoning that proves this?

original: lha dang mi dag gi nang so sor lan bdun du 'khor gyi lha dang mi gnyi ga'i nang du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la yang shes par byed pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: lha dang mi dag gi nang so sor lan bdun du 'khor gyi lha dang mi gnyi ga'i nang du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la yang shes par byed pa ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the proof that one transmigrates seven times among gods and humans, but not among gods and humans together?

original: 'di skad du gang zhig mi rnams kyi nang du bden pa mthong ba de ni lha rnams kyi nang du lan gsum du 'khor la mi rnams kyi nang du yang @185b lan gsum kho na 'khor nas de nas lha rnams kyi nang du 'ongs te yongs su myaüîΩngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: 'di skad du gang zhig mi rnams kyi nang du bden pa mthong ba de ni lha rnams kyi nang du lan gsum du 'khor la mi rnams kyi nang du yang @185b lan gsum kho na 'khor nas de nas lha rnams kyi nang du 'ongs te yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: It is said that one who sees the truths among humans transmigrates three times among humans and seven times among gods, and then attains nirvana among gods.

original: gang zhig lha rnams kyi nang du bden pa mthong ba de yang de kho na bzhin du mi rnams kyi nang du lan gsum 'khor la /
analyzed: gang zhig lha rnams kyi nang du bden pa mthong ba de yang de kho na bzhin du mi rnams kyi nang du lan gsum 'khor la /
translated: One who sees the truths among gods transmigrates three times among gods and seven times among humans, and then attains nirvana among humans.

original: lha rnams kyi nang du yang lan gsum kho na 'khor nas de nas mi rnams kyi nang du 'ongs te /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi nang du yang lan gsum kho na 'khor nas de nas mi rnams kyi nang du 'ongs te /
translated: and after circling among the gods three times, he comes to the human realm and

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o zhes smras pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o zhes smras pa yin no //
translated: then attains nirvana.

original: 'di skad du lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du lan bdun zhes 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni spyi'i ngo bor 'byung gi khyad par du byas nas so sor zhes ni mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di skad du lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du lan bdun zhes 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni spyi'i ngo bor 'byung gi khyad par du byas nas so sor zhes ni mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The expression ‚Äúseven times among gods and humans‚Äù occurs in a general sense, but not in a specific sense, as ‚Äúseven times among gods and seven times among humans.‚ÄùüîΩThus the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas consider this to be a doubtful point.

original: de ltar bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs the tshom dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs su byas pa dang / slob dpon gyis gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir 'od srungs pa rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de ltar bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs the tshom dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs su byas pa dang / slob dpon gyis gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir 'od srungs pa rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: The master Vasubandhu composes his text in order to clarify this point.

original: 'od srungs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni sde ba gzhan dag go //
analyzed: 'od srungs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni sde ba gzhan dag go //
translated: The expression ‚Äúthe KƒÅ≈õyapƒ´yas‚Äù refers to other schools.

original: de dag ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de dag ni 'di skad du /
translated: They recite the s≈´tra as follows:

original: lha rnams su lan bdun mi rnams su lan bdun zhes 'don te /
analyzed: lha rnams su lan bdun mi rnams su lan bdun zhes 'don te /
translated: ‚ÄúSeven times among gods and seven times among humans.‚Äù

original: de ltar na so so zhes bya ba'i don du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na so so zhes bya ba'i don du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus the meaning of ‚Äúamong‚Äù is established.

original: de lta bas na 'dis ni 'dod pa'i khams las dgongs te gsungs so zhes bya ba 'di la shes par byed pa mdo'am rigs pa ci zhig yod ces gang smras pa dang / lha dang mi dag gi nang du so sor lan bdun skye'i gnyi ga'i nang du lan bdun ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di la yang shes par byed pa ci zhig yod ces smras pa gnyi ga'i lan yang btab pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dis ni 'dod pa'i khams las dgongs te gsungs so zhes bya ba 'di la shes par byed pa mdo'am rigs pa ci zhig yod ces gang smras pa dang / lha dang mi dag gi nang du so sor lan bdun skye'i gnyi ga'i nang du lan bdun ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di la yang shes par byed pa ci zhig yod ces smras pa gnyi ga'i lan yang btab pa yin te /
translated: What is the proof that it is seven times in the realms of gods and humans, but not seven times in both?

original: so sor yin pa'i don smos pa kho nas 'dod pa'i khams la dgongs par yang bstan pa yin te /üîΩgzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du lan bdun 'khor bar rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: so sor yin pa'i don smos pa kho nas 'dod pa'i khams la dgongs par yang bstan pa yin te / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du lan bdun 'khor bar rung ba ma yin te /
translated: The mere mention of the meaning of each is also an indication that this refers to the desire realm.

original: der skyes pa'i phyir mi 'ong ba rnams mi'i nang du mi 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der skyes pa'i phyir mi 'ong ba rnams mi'i nang du mi 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not tenable that gods and humans circle seven times in the form and formless realms because nonreturners born there do not return to the human realm.

original: rigs pa yang de nyid kyi phyir khong du chud par byed de /
analyzed: rigs pa yang de nyid kyi phyir khong du chud par byed de /
translated: This is also understood through reasoning.

original: gang du re ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun par bshad pa'i sa de kho nar srid pa brgyad pa bkag par zad kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang du re ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun par bshad pa'i sa de kho nar srid pa brgyad pa bkag par zad kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: The eighth existence is only prohibited in the realm where the seven existences are explained, not elsewhere.

original: de bas na 'di la yang shes par byed pa ci zhig yod ces 'di la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di la yang shes par byed pa ci zhig yod ces 'di la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, what is the point of this explanation? Do not be attached to it.

original: de 'dra ste zhes bya ba ni gang gis na dus de srid kyis gdon mi za bar rgyud yongs su smin pa'i phyir srid pa brgyad mngon par mi 'grub pa de lta bu yin no //üîΩsbrul gom pa bdun @186a * //
analyzed: de 'dra ste zhes bya ba ni gang gis na dus de srid kyis gdon mi za bar rgyud yongs su smin pa'i phyir srid pa brgyad mngon par mi 'grub pa de lta bu yin no // sbrul gom pa bdun @186a * //
translated: ‚Äú It is like this‚Äù means that it is like this, that the stream is matured in that time, and the eighth existence is not necessarily actualized.

original: pas zin pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni dper na sbrul gom pa bdun pa zhes bya ba des zin na gom pa bdun por nas 'chi'i phan chad du yang ma yin la tshun chad du yang ma yin te /
analyzed: pas zin pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni dper na sbrul gom pa bdun pa zhes bya ba des zin na gom pa bdun por nas 'chi'i phan chad du yang ma yin la tshun chad du yang ma yin te /
translated: ‚Äú It is like a person bitten by a seven-step snake‚Äù means that if a person is bitten by a snake called ‚Äúseven steps,‚Äù they die after seven steps, not after eight steps, and not after six steps.

original: dug gi rigs de de lta bu yin pa dang / rims nyin bzhi pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dug gi rigs de de lta bu yin pa dang / rims nyin bzhi pa bzhin te /
translated: The poison of that type of snake is like that. It is like a four-day fever.

original: dper na rims nyin bzhi pa ni nyi ma bzhi zhing 'debs kyi phan chad kyang ma yin la tshun chad kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na rims nyin bzhi pa ni nyi ma bzhi zhing 'debs kyi phan chad kyang ma yin la tshun chad kyang ma yin te /
translated: For example, it is like a four-day fever that lasts for four days and not more or less.

original: nad kyi rigs de de lta bu yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: nad kyi rigs de de lta bu yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: This is the type of illness.

original: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa gnyis //üîΩzhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dag ste /
analyzed: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa gnyis // zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dag ste /
translated: Two are conducive to the lower part.

original: 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i phyir de gnyis yod do //
analyzed: 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i phyir de gnyis yod do //
translated: Desire and malice exist there because one is not free from attachment to desire realm objects.

original: gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga //
analyzed: gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga //
translated: Five are conducive to the higher part.

original: zhes bya ba na gzugs dang gzugs med pa las skyes pa'i 'dod chags gnyis dang / rgod pa dang / nga rgyal dang / gti mug go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba na gzugs dang gzugs med pa las skyes pa'i 'dod chags gnyis dang / rgod pa dang / nga rgyal dang / gti mug go //
translated: Attachment born from the form and formless realms, excitation, pride and delusion exist there.

original: de'i phyir tshun chad du yang mya ngan las 'das pa mi 'thob la srid pa brgyad pa yang mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshun chad du yang mya ngan las 'das pa mi 'thob la srid pa brgyad pa yang mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, nirvana is not attained in less time and the eighth existence is not actualized.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzangs na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzangs na re /
translated: Master Sa·πÉghabhadra says:

original: kun du sbyor ba bdun lus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ni gtan tshigs su mi rung ste /
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba bdun lus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ni gtan tshigs su mi rung ste /
translated: Because the seven fetters remain.

original: gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa rnams ni sa gong ma pa yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba 'grub par byed mi nus so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa rnams ni sa gong ma pa yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba 'grub par byed mi nus so zhes zer ro //
translated: That is not a correct reason, because the factors associated with higher realms cannot establish birth in the desire realm.

original: gtan tshigs de smra ba na re yang de dags gong ma yin mod kyi de dag gi thob pa'i mthus srid pa de snyed cig mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de smra ba na re yang de dags gong ma yin mod kyi de dag gi thob pa'i mthus srid pa de snyed cig mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: When the reason is stated, the opponent says: ‚ÄúAlthough they are higher, the existence of that many rebirths is established by the power of their obtainment.

original: de dag ni lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir gong mar yang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu nyid du ni rnam par mi gzhag go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de dag ni lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir gong mar yang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu nyid du ni rnam par mi gzhag go zhes zer ro //
translated: Because they are neutral, they are not posited as the cause of karmic maturation in higher realms.‚Äù

original: bar skabs su zhes bya ba ni bar du ste tshun chad du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bar skabs su zhes bya ba ni bar du ste tshun chad du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In the interim means in the middle, that is, in the period before death.

original: chos nyid kyis thob pa zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa'i lam gyi mthus thob pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: chos nyid kyis thob pa zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa'i lam gyi mthus thob pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: Obtained by the power of reality refers to the meaning of obtained by the power of the path of no learning.

original: yang dge slong gi rtags dang sbyor bar byed pa de ni de'i rang bzhin no //üîΩlog par ltung ba'i chos can ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mdo las rgyun du zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dge slong gi rtags dang sbyor bar byed pa de ni de'i rang bzhin no // log par ltung ba'i chos can ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mdo las rgyun du zhugs pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the fact that he is endowed with the marks of a monk is his nature.üîΩHe is not subject to falling away.

original: log par ltung ba'i chos can ma yin pa dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par gzhol ba yin /
analyzed: log par ltung ba'i chos can ma yin pa dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par gzhol ba yin /
translated: The sutra says that he is a stream-enterer who is not subject to falling away, who is certain to attain complete enlightenment,

original: re ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa yin te /
analyzed: re ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa yin te /
translated: and who will be reborn at the most seven times in existence.

original: lha rnams dang mi rnams kyi nang du lan bdun 'khor zhing song nas sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lha rnams dang mi rnams kyi nang du lan bdun 'khor zhing song nas sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Having transmigrated and gone among gods and humans for seven existences, he puts an end to suffering.

original: ci'i phyir de lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: Why is he like that?

original: der 'gro ba'i las mi sogs @186b pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: der 'gro ba'i las mi sogs @186b pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He is not subject to falling away because his karma does not accumulate.

original: log par ltung ba ni ngan song ste /
analyzed: log par ltung ba ni ngan song ste /
translated: Falling away is a miserable state,

original: dmyal ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩder 'gro bar 'gyur bas na der 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs pa'o // der 'gro bar 'gyur bas na der 'gro ba ste /
translated: such as the hells and so on.üîΩOne who goes there is one who goes to a miserable state.

original: der 'gro ba nyid der 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: der 'gro ba nyid der 'gro ba yin no //
translated: The act of going there is going there.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na las te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na las te /
translated: Why? Because of karma.

original: 'phags pa'i gnas skabs na de mi sogs pa'i phyir dang bsags pa yang rgyud rnam par smin pa dang mi mthun par byas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gnas skabs na de mi sogs pa'i phyir dang bsags pa yang rgyud rnam par smin pa dang mi mthun par byas pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it does not accumulate in the state of an ƒÅrya, and because it is transformed into a continuum that is incompatible with the maturation of karma.

original: so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na der 'gro ba'i las myong bar 'gyur ba ma nges pa bsags pa yang rgyud rnam par smin pa dang mi mthun par byas pa'i phyir log par ltung ba'i chos can ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na der 'gro ba'i las myong bar 'gyur ba ma nges pa bsags pa yang rgyud rnam par smin pa dang mi mthun par byas pa'i phyir log par ltung ba'i chos can ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: Even though one accumulates karma that would lead to rebirth in the lower realms in the state of an ordinary being, one is not subject to falling to the lower realms because it is transformed into a continuum that is incompatible with the maturation of karma.

original: de'i phung po'i rgyud de der 'gro ba'i las bsags pa rnam par smin pa dang mi mthun par gnas pa de lta bur yongs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phung po'i rgyud de der 'gro ba'i las bsags pa rnam par smin pa dang mi mthun par gnas pa de lta bur yongs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: The continuum of aggregates is transformed in such a way that it is incompatible with the maturation of karma that would lead to rebirth in the lower realms.

original: yang ci'i phyir phung po'i rgyud de der 'gro ba'i las bsags pa rnam par smin pa dang mi mthun par gnas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir phung po'i rgyud de der 'gro ba'i las bsags pa rnam par smin pa dang mi mthun par gnas pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the continuum of aggregates transformed in such a way that it is incompatible with the maturation of karma that would lead to rebirth in the lower realms?

original: de'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba stobs dang ldan pas bsgos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba stobs dang ldan pas bsgos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te ;
translated: To answer this, the root text states, ‚Äúbecause it is imbued with powerful roots of virtue.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar phung po'i rgyud de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba stobs dang ldan pa rnams kyis bsgos shing bsgos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po'i rgyud de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba stobs dang ldan pa rnams kyis bsgos shing bsgos pa yin no //
translated: Thus, that stream of aggregates is saturated and saturated by the powerful roots of the wholesome.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba stobs dang ldan pas kyang ji ltar bsgos she na /üîΩsbyor ba dang bsam pa dag pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba stobs dang ldan pas kyang ji ltar bsgos she na / sbyor ba dang bsam pa dag pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: How is it saturated by the powerful roots of the wholesome?üîΩHe says: by means of the purity of application and the purity of aspiration.

original: sbyor ba dag pa dang / bsam pa dag pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba dag pa dang / bsam pa dag pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: By means of the purity of application and the purity of aspiration.

original: de la sbyor ba dag pa ni 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: de la sbyor ba dag pa ni 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: Therein, the purity of application is morality pleasing to the noble ones.

original: bsam pa dag pa ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa la dad pa mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa dag pa ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa la dad pa mi phyed pa'o //
translated: The purity of aspiration is unshakable faith in the Buddha, etc.

original: skad cig kyang bskyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skad cig kyang sems bskyed par mi 'gyur na sbyor ba lta ci smos snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig kyang bskyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skad cig kyang sems bskyed par mi 'gyur na sbyor ba lta ci smos snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: He thinks: if one does not generate even a single moment of the thought of the ≈õrƒÅvaka vehicle or the pratyekabuddha vehicle, then what need is there to mention the application?

original: yang na ngan song du nges pa'i las yod na ni gang zag des nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bzod pa yang bskyed par mi 'gyur na zag pa med pa'i lam lta ci zhig smos zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na ngan song du nges pa'i las yod na ni gang zag des nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bzod pa yang bskyed par mi 'gyur na zag pa med pa'i lam lta ci zhig smos zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Or, if there is karma that is certain to lead to the lower realms, then that person will not even generate the acceptance that is a gateway to penetration, let alone the uncontaminated path.

original: ji ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba stobs dang ldan pas bsgos pa'i mi dge ba bsags pa rnam par smin pa dang mi mthun par 'gyur ba de tshigs su bcad pas ston pa'i phyir /üîΩmi mkhas pas ni sdig pa chung ngu byas kyang zhes bya ba thams cad smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba stobs dang ldan pas bsgos pa'i mi dge ba bsags pa rnam par smin pa dang mi mthun par 'gyur ba de tshigs su bcad pas ston pa'i phyir / mi mkhas pas ni sdig pa chung ngu byas kyang zhes bya ba thams cad smos so //
translated: The verse shows how the accumulation of nonvirtue is transformed into a ripening that is not in accord with the power of the virtuous roots that have been infused.üîΩThe unwise, even if they commit a small nonvirtue,

original: mi mkhas pas ni sdig pa chung ngu byas kyang 'og tu ste ngan song du 'gro'o //
analyzed: mi mkhas pas ni sdig pa chung ngu byas kyang 'og tu ste ngan song du 'gro'o //
translated: go below, to the lower realms.

original: mkhas pas ni sdig pa chen po byas kyang @187a * //üîΩgnod pa ste /
analyzed: mkhas pas ni sdig pa chen po byas kyang @187a * // gnod pa ste /
translated: The wise, even if they commit a great nonvirtue,

original: ngan song rab tu spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngan song rab tu spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: go above, to the higher realms.üîΩThe unwise, even if they commit a small nonvirtue, go below, to the lower realms.üîΩThe wise, even if they commit a great nonvirtue, go above, to the higher realms.

original: don 'di gnyis go rims bzhin du dpe gnyis kyis sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: don 'di gnyis go rims bzhin du dpe gnyis kyis sgrub par byed de /
translated: These two points are established by two examples, respectively.

original: lcags kyi gong bu ste thu lum gyi ngo bo chung ngu yang bcos legs ma byas pa'i phyir chu'i gting du 'bying bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: lcags kyi gong bu ste thu lum gyi ngo bo chung ngu yang bcos legs ma byas pa'i phyir chu'i gting du 'bying bar 'gyur la /
translated: Even a small mass of iron, that is, a lump of iron, sinks in water because it is not well fashioned.

original: lcags de nyid snod du byas na cher yang bcos legs byas pa'i yon tan gyis chu'i steng du 'phyo zhing 'bying bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lcags de nyid snod du byas na cher yang bcos legs byas pa'i yon tan gyis chu'i steng du 'phyo zhing 'bying bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if that very iron is made into a vessel, it floats on the water because of the quality of being well fashioned.

original: de bzhin du mi mkhas pa ni yon tan rnams kyi snod du ma byas pa'i phyir 'bying bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi mkhas pa ni yon tan rnams kyi snod du ma byas pa'i phyir 'bying bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: In the same way, the unwise sink because they are not made into a vessel of good qualities.

original: mkhas pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mkhas pas ni ma yin te /
translated: But the wise do not,

original: yon tan dag gi snod du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan dag gi snod du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are made into a vessel of good qualities.

original: gang phan chad sdug bsngal med pa zhes bya ba ni srid pa gzhan gyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: gang phan chad sdug bsngal med pa zhes bya ba ni srid pa gzhan gyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom which suffering does not remain‚Äù refers to the remainder of existence.

original: sdug bsngal gyi mtha' ni sdug bsngal gyi mjug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi mtha' ni sdug bsngal gyi mjug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The end of suffering is synonymous with the conclusion of suffering.

original: gzhan yang 'chi ba'i tshe sdug bsngal gyi mtha' yod mod kyi sdug bsngal de ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba dang bcas pa yin pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi nying mtshams mi sbyor bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'chi ba'i tshe sdug bsngal gyi mtha' yod mod kyi sdug bsngal de ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba dang bcas pa yin pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi nying mtshams mi sbyor bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Moreover, at the time of death, there is an end to suffering, but that suffering is accompanied by rebirth. Therefore, it is said that one makes an end of suffering, that is, one does not link up with suffering.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ci ltar byed ces bya ba ni rtag pa'i phyir bya bar mi rung ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ci ltar byed ces bya ba ni rtag pa'i phyir bya bar mi rung ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: How can one make nirvana? He thinks that it is not proper to make it because it is permanent.

original: de 'thob pa'i gags bsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i gags bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'thob pa'i gags bsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i gags bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For the purpose of removing the obstruction to attaining it, that is, for the purpose of removing the obstruction to attaining nirvana.

original: de 'thob pa'i gags ni nyon mongs pa'am phung po yin no //
analyzed: de 'thob pa'i gags ni nyon mongs pa'am phung po yin no //
translated: The obstruction to attaining it is the afflictions or the aggregates.

original: de bsal ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa byed de /
analyzed: de bsal ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa byed de /
translated: For the purpose of removing that, one makes nirvana.

original: dper na nam mkha' ni khang pa'i gnas na mi mngon te /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' ni khang pa'i gnas na mi mngon te /
translated: For example, space is not manifest in the location of a house.

original: de ni de'i gags yin pas so //
analyzed: de ni de'i gags yin pas so //
translated: That is its obstruction.

original: de bsal ba'i phyir rtag kyang nam mkha' byed do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bsal ba'i phyir rtag kyang nam mkha' byed do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: In order to dispel that notion, it is said, ‚ÄúSpace is permanent.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir dper na smra ba po 'dun khang rtib  la nam mkha' gyis zhes 'dzer ba lta bu yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dper na smra ba po 'dun khang rtib  la nam mkha' gyis zhes 'dzer ba lta bu yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is like the statement, ‚ÄúO people, demolish the assembly hall and build it in space.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'i rgyud yongs su smin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'i rgyud yongs su smin pa'o //
translated: Moreover, means the maturation of the continuum of an ordinary being.

original: ma nges pas zhes bya ba ni gal te na 'di nyid dam srid pa bar ma la sogs par yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur bas de'i phyir mi brjod do //
analyzed: ma nges pas zhes bya ba ni gal te na 'di nyid dam srid pa bar ma la sogs par yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur bas de'i phyir mi brjod do //
translated: Because it is indeterminate means that it is not mentioned because he may attain nirvana in this very life or in the intermediate existence, and so on.

original: tshe gnyis gsum zhes bya ba ni 'di la tshe gnyis sam gsum yod pas na tshe gnyis gsum mo //
analyzed: tshe gnyis gsum zhes bya ba ni 'di la tshe gnyis sam gsum yod pas na tshe gnyis gsum mo //
translated: Two or three lives means that he has two or three lives.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i nang du ni gnyis shig smos zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang tshe dag go //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i nang du ni gnyis shig smos zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang tshe dag go //
translated: In the verse, only two are mentioned means that only two are mentioned in the verse: the abandonment of afflictions and life.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mthar gyis pa'i rgyun du @187b zhugs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs nas phyis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams las rnam pa gcig nas bzhi'i bar spong bar byed na de'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: mthar gyis pa'i rgyun du @187b zhugs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs nas phyis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams las rnam pa gcig nas bzhi'i bar spong bar byed na de'i gnyen po ste /
translated: The serial abandoner, having previously abandoned objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing, later abandons one to four types of objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: rnam pa gcig dang gnyis dang gsum la sogs pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig dang gnyis dang gsum la sogs pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: The antidote to those is the antidote to one, two, three, and so on.

original: zag pa med pa'i dbang po 'thob pa ni ma smos kyang 'grub pa'i phyir de tshigs su bcad pa las ma smos so //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dbang po 'thob pa ni ma smos kyang 'grub pa'i phyir de tshigs su bcad pa las ma smos so //
translated: Although one obtains uncontaminated faculties, they are not mentioned in the verse because they are established without being mentioned.

original: gnyen po med par ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa spong ba med de /
analyzed: gnyen po med par ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa spong ba med de /
translated: Without an antidote, it is impossible to abandon the aspects of affliction.

original: 'phags pa de ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa spangs na yang de'i gnyen po zag pa med pa'i dbang po 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa de ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa spangs na yang de'i gnyen po zag pa med pa'i dbang po 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When ƒÅryas abandon the aspects of affliction by the mundane path, they obtain the uncontaminated faculty that is the antidote to those.

original: skye ba ni gal te na ches nyung bar yang 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni gal te 'di nyid du 'am srid pa bar ma'am skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni gal te na ches nyung bar yang 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni gal te 'di nyid du 'am srid pa bar ma'am skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur na'o //
translated: He would be born in a very few places, because he would attain nirvana in this life, in the intermediate existence, or after being born.

original: gong ma'i skal ba dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gong ma'i skal ba dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because he possesses the good fortune of the higher fruits.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i gong ma lan cig phyir 'ong ba nyid nas dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar gyi skal pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i gong ma lan cig phyir 'ong ba nyid nas dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar gyi skal pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He possesses the good fortune of the higher fruits, from the fruit of once-returner to the fruit of arhatship.

original: de'i phyir 'di'i tshe ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di'i tshe ni /
translated: Therefore, his life

original: tshe gnyis gsum du rigs nas rigs zhes nges par bya ba'i phyir smos pa yin no //
analyzed: tshe gnyis gsum du rigs nas rigs zhes nges par bya ba'i phyir smos pa yin no //
translated: is said to be two or three lives, because he is born in the same family.

original: 'dir 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Here, this should be investigated:

original: gang zhig rnam pa gcig gam gnyis las grol ba de ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig rnam pa gcig gam gnyis las grol ba de ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is it that is liberated from one or two types?

original: kha cig na re rigs nas rigs su skye ba yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re rigs nas rigs su skye ba yin te /
translated: Some say: It is one who is born in the same family.

original: rnam pa gsum dang bzhi las grol ba smos pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum dang bzhi las grol ba smos pa ni /
translated: The statement that he is liberated from three or four typesüîΩis for the sake of illustration.

original: dper na brjod pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: dper na brjod pa'i phyir ram /
translated: For example, it is like the expression ‚Äúthe son of a barren woman.‚ÄùüîΩ

original: de phan chad du ni ma yin no zhes tshad du bya ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro /üîΩ// / bam po bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad pa /
analyzed: de phan chad du ni ma yin no zhes tshad du bya ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro / // / bam po bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad pa /
translated: But it is not beyond that, because it is the measure.

original: gzhan dag na re rnam pa gcig gam gnyis las grol ba ni tsho lnga'am drug pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rnam pa gcig gam gnyis las grol ba ni tsho lnga'am drug pa yin te /
translated: Others say: One who is free from one or two types is a five or six time born being,

original: rnam pa gsum mam bzhi las grol ba zhes khyad par smos pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum mam bzhi las grol ba zhes khyad par smos pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
translated: because it is specified that one who is free from three or four types is a seven or eight time born being.

original: 'di ni bshad pa byed pa rnams kyis ma dpyad pas 'di dpyad dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bshad pa byed pa rnams kyis ma dpyad pas 'di dpyad dgos pa yin no //
translated: This is not analyzed by the Vaibhasikas, but it should be analyzed.üîΩWhy is it not because one abandons five types?

original: ci'i phyir rnam pa lnga spangs pa'i phyir ma yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam pa lnga spangs pa'i phyir ma yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: rigs nas rigs su skye bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: rigs nas rigs su skye bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
translated: It is the context of one who is born in the same class.üîΩIf one abandons that,

original: de spangs na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rnam pa lnga spangs na rnam pa drug pa yang gdon mi za bar spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de spangs na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rnam pa lnga spangs na rnam pa drug pa yang gdon mi za bar spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if one abandons five types, one definitely abandons the sixth type.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: smras pa / de'i rnam pa drug pa gcig gis ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bgegs bya bar mi nus so //üîΩbar @188a * //
analyzed: smras pa / de'i rnam pa drug pa gcig gis ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bgegs bya bar mi nus so // bar @188a * //
translated: He says: One of the six types of this cannot obstruct the fruit of once-returner.

original: chad gcig pa'i bzhin du zhes bya ba 'di ni bzlog pa'i dpe yin te /
analyzed: chad gcig pa'i bzhin du zhes bya ba 'di ni bzlog pa'i dpe yin te /
translated: This is a counterexample.

original: ji ltar bar chad gcig pa'i rnam pa dgu pa gcig gis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bgegs bya bar nus pa de ltar rgyun du zhugs pa 'di'i rnam pa drug pas ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bgegs bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: ji ltar bar chad gcig pa'i rnam pa dgu pa gcig gis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bgegs bya bar nus pa de ltar rgyun du zhugs pa 'di'i rnam pa drug pas ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bgegs bya bar mi nus so //
translated: Just as one of the nine types of the once-returner can obstruct the fruit of non-returner, so one of the six types of this stream-enterer cannot obstruct the fruit of once-returner.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: khams las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: khams las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says: Because one does not transcend the realm.

original: bar chad gcig pa ni 'dod pa'i khams las 'da' bas de'i phyir 'di rnam pa dgu pa gcig gis kyang 'bras bu la bgegs bya bar nus te /
analyzed: bar chad gcig pa ni 'dod pa'i khams las 'da' bas de'i phyir 'di rnam pa dgu pa gcig gis kyang 'bras bu la bgegs bya bar nus te /
translated: The once-returner transcends the desire realm, and therefore one of the nine types can obstruct the fruit.

original: khams las 'da' ba ni dka' ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: khams las 'da' ba ni dka' ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because transcending the realm is difficult.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba ni khams las mi 'da' bas de'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa drug pa gcig gis 'bras bu la bgegs bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba ni khams las mi 'da' bas de'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa drug pa gcig gis 'bras bu la bgegs bya bar mi nus so //
translated: Once-returners do not transcend the realm of desire, and the sixth type of affliction cannot obstruct the fruit.

original: lha'i ris de 'am gzhan du zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lha'i ris de 'am gzhan du zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: In that or another god realm means in that or another god realm of the Thirty-three.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa dag gi nang du bden pa rnams mthong nas rigs gnyis sam gsum du 'khor te /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa dag gi nang du bden pa rnams mthong nas rigs gnyis sam gsum du 'khor te /
translated: Having seen the truths among the Thirty-three, they transmigrate in two or three families and

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa de nyid kyi nang du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'am gzhan rgyal chen rigs bzhi ba'am /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa de nyid kyi nang du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'am gzhan rgyal chen rigs bzhi ba'am /
translated: they completely transcend sorrow among the Thirty-three or among the Four Great Kings or

original: 'thab bral ba rnams kyi nang du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'thab bral ba rnams kyi nang du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba lta bu ste /
translated: among the Yamas.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the others.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams bsrabs pa'i phyir zhes 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni mdo sde las so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams bsrabs pa'i phyir zhes 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni mdo sde las so //
translated: Because attachment, hatred, and delusion are reduced means as stated in the sutra.

original: ji skad du zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du zhe na /
translated: What does it say?

original: kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs pa'i phyir dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams bsrabs pa'i phyir lan cig phyir 'ong ba zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs pa'i phyir dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams bsrabs pa'i phyir lan cig phyir 'ong ba zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they abandon the three fetters and because their attachment, hatred, and delusion are reduced, they are called ‚Äúonce-returners.‚ÄùüîΩBecause they retain the small degree of the small.

original: chung ngu'i rnam pa lus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chung ngu'i chen po dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chung ngu zhes bya ba de tsam zhig lus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chung ngu'i rnam pa lus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chung ngu'i chen po dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chung ngu zhes bya ba de tsam zhig lus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The small degree of the small, the small degree of the medium, and the small degree of the great are retained.

original: nyes cha bdun dang brgyad zad pa //
analyzed: nyes cha bdun dang brgyad zad pa //
translated: Those who have destroyed seven or eight

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: of the categories of defilements are called ‚Äúthose who go from family to family.‚Äù

original: nyes cha ni nyes pa'i cha shas te /
analyzed: nyes cha ni nyes pa'i cha shas te /
translated: The categories of defilements are the parts of the defilements.

original: rnam pa bdun dang brgyad kyi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun dang brgyad kyi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: They have the nature of seven or eight categories.

original: 'dir yang dbang po las ni zhes bya ba rgyu gsum pa mdor ma byas pas de kho na bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dbang po las ni zhes bya ba rgyu gsum pa mdor ma byas pas de kho na bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: Here, the third cause, ‚Äúdue to the faculties,‚Äù is not mentioned in the verse, but it should be explained as before.

original: ji ltar na 'di'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji ltar na 'di'i rnam pa dgu pa gcig gis 'bras bu la bgegs bya bar nus kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'di'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji ltar na 'di'i rnam pa dgu pa gcig gis 'bras bu la bgegs bya bar nus kyi /
translated: How is it that one of the nine types can obstruct the result?

original: rigs nas rigs su skye ba'i rnam pa gcig gis ni 'bras bu la @188b bgegs bya bar mi nus she na /
analyzed: rigs nas rigs su skye ba'i rnam pa gcig gis ni 'bras bu la @188b bgegs bya bar mi nus she na /
translated: How is it that one of the types that is born in the same class cannot obstruct the result?

original: smras pa / khams las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / khams las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said: because it transcends the realm.

original: 'di ltar 'di ni rnam pa dgu pa spangs na 'dod pa'i khams las yang dag pas 'da' bar 'gyur bas der yang mi skye la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni rnam pa dgu pa spangs na 'dod pa'i khams las yang dag pas 'da' bar 'gyur bas der yang mi skye la /
translated: Thus, when one abandons the ninth type, one completely transcends the desire realm, and one is not born there.

original: rnam pa dgu pa de yang las dang lhan cig tu der skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa dgu pa de yang las dang lhan cig tu der skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: And that ninth type is karma that is to be experienced after rebirth together with that.

original: de'i phyir de'i rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i sa las 'da' bas 'bras bu la bgegs byed par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i sa las 'da' bas 'bras bu la bgegs byed par nus pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it transcends the realm of the result that is its karmic maturation and the result that is its natural outflow, it can obstruct the result.

original: gong du las rnams ni gnas skabs gsum du bgegs bya ba'i phyir nye bar gnas so zhes bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gong du las rnams ni gnas skabs gsum du bgegs bya ba'i phyir nye bar gnas so zhes bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It was previously stated that karma is present in order to obstruct in three circumstances.

original: bzod dang phyir mi 'ong dgra bcom //üîΩ'thob la las bgegs shin tu byed //
analyzed: bzod dang phyir mi 'ong dgra bcom // 'thob la las bgegs shin tu byed //
translated: Patience, nonreturn, and arhatship

original: ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba yin no //
translated: are attained through the power of karma.

original: 'dir nyon mongs pa dag dang sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dir nyon mongs pa dag dang sbyor ba yin te /
translated: Here, afflictions and karma are combined.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: las rnams ji lta bar nyon mongs pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩde'i mya ngan las 'das pa la tshe gcig gis chod pa'i phyir ram zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bdun dang brgyad zad pa'i lan cig phyir 'ong ba de'i mya ngan las 'das pa la tshe gcig gis chod pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: las rnams ji lta bar nyon mongs pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // de'i mya ngan las 'das pa la tshe gcig gis chod pa'i phyir ram zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bdun dang brgyad zad pa'i lan cig phyir 'ong ba de'i mya ngan las 'das pa la tshe gcig gis chod pa'i phyir ram /
translated: it is said that afflictions are like karma, and so on.üîΩBecause his nirvana is separated by one life,üîΩor because he is separated from the result of nonreturn by one affliction,

original: 'di'i phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gcig gis chod pas na bar chad gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gcig gis chod pas na bar chad gcig pa yin no //
translated: he is called ‚Äúone who has one separation.‚Äù

original: de srid du rigs nas rigs su skye ba'am bar chad gcig pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni sngon 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis rnam pa gsum dang bzhi las grol yang /
analyzed: de srid du rigs nas rigs su skye ba'am bar chad gcig pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni sngon 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis rnam pa gsum dang bzhi las grol yang /
translated: Until then, they are not born in the same type or have one obstruction.

original: re zhig rigs nas rigs su skye ba ma yin la /
analyzed: re zhig rigs nas rigs su skye ba ma yin la /
translated: They are not born in the same type for a while, even though they are previously freed from three or four types by the mundane path.

original: rnam pa bdun dang brgyad zad kyang re zhig bar chad gcig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa bdun dang brgyad zad kyang re zhig bar chad gcig pa ma yin te /
translated: They do not have one obstruction for a while, even though they have extinguished seven or eight types.

original: de dag gi gnyen po zag pa med pa'i dbang po thob pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen po zag pa med pa'i dbang po thob pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not obtain uncontaminated faculties that are antidotes to those.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore it is said,

original: ji srid du 'bras bu khyad par can gyi lam mngon du ma byas pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ji srid du 'bras bu khyad par can gyi lam mngon du ma byas pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: as long as they do not manifest the path that is the special result.

original: de dag gi gnyen po'am de dag gi gong ma'i gnyen po 'bras bu khyad par can mngon du byas na /
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen po'am de dag gi gong ma'i gnyen po 'bras bu khyad par can mngon du byas na /
translated: When they manifest the path that is the special result, which is the antidote to those or the antidote to those that are higher,

original: de'i tshe zag pa med pa'i dbang po 'thob pa'i phyir rigs nas rigs su skye ba'am /
analyzed: de'i tshe zag pa med pa'i dbang po 'thob pa'i phyir rigs nas rigs su skye ba'am /
translated: at that time they are born in the same type or have one obstruction because they obtain uncontaminated faculties.

original: bar chad gcig pa yin no zhes shugs kyis bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar chad gcig pa yin no zhes shugs kyis bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is explained implicitly.

original: kun du sbyor ba /
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba /
translated: The fetters

original: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga //
analyzed: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga //

original: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mdo sde las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mdo sde las /

original: kun du sbyor ba tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga spangs pa'i phyir @189a * //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga spangs pa'i phyir @189a * //
translated: Because they abandon the five factors associated with inferior states,üîΩthey are called nonreturners.

analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ba ni spangs pa bsdoms pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: sngon gnyis sam gsum spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gal te re zhig 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig nges pa la 'jug na sngon 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa'i 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang gnyis spangs pa yin te /

analyzed: 'on te mthar gyis pa zhig yin na ni mngon sum spangs pa yin no //

original: gang gis she na /

analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis te /
