translated: Since there are two types of nirvana, nirvana that is the remainder of the aggregates is specified because it is the nirvana that is the remainder of the aggregates.üîΩIt is the nirvana that is the remainder of the aggregates because it is the nirvana that is the remainder of the aggregates.

original: mngon par brtson pa dang / lam ngang gis 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba la mngon par brtson pa ni brtson 'grus dang @189b ldan pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par brtson pa dang / lam ngang gis 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba la mngon par brtson pa ni brtson 'grus dang @189b ldan pa ste /
translated: Those who are endowed with intense effort are those who possess effort,

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
translated: that is, those who have begun to make effort.üîΩThe path arises effortlessly in them,

original: 'di la lam ngang gis 'byung ba yod pas na lam ngang gis 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la lam ngang gis 'byung ba yod pas na lam ngang gis 'byung ba'o //
translated: thus they are those in whom the path arises effortlessly.

original: ji ltar lam ngang gis 'byung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar lam ngang gis 'byung ba yin zhe na /
translated: How does the path arise effortlessly?

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med par mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med par mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it manifests without the need for intense effort.

original: 'di ni mngon par brtson pa yang yin la lam ngang gis 'byung ba yang yin pas mngon par brtson pa dang lam ngang gis 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mngon par brtson pa yang yin la lam ngang gis 'byung ba yang yin pas mngon par brtson pa dang lam ngang gis 'byung ba'o //
translated: They are those who are endowed with intense effort and the path arises effortlessly in them.

original: de'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The nature of that is

original: de'i phyir skyes pa tsam las mi 'chi bar yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes pa tsam las mi 'chi bar yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: thus they attain nirvana without dying immediately after they are born.

original: de yang phung po'i lhag ma med pas so zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag na re bar mdor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba 'ba' zhig dgra bcom pa nyid thob nas tshe yongs su ma rdzogs par phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'da' bas
analyzed: de yang phung po'i lhag ma med pas so zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag na re bar mdor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba 'ba' zhig dgra bcom pa nyid thob nas tshe yongs su ma rdzogs par phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'da' bas
translated: Others say: One who attains nirvana without remainder in the intermediate state is an arhat who has not completed his life span.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar ma zad kyi /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only does he attain nirvana without remainder,

original: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yang de dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yang de dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
translated: but one who attains nirvana upon birth is also like that.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,üîΩbecause he lacks power over relinquishing his life.

original: tshe 'dor ba la dbang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de yang phung po'i lhag ma med pas so zhes bya ba de ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: tshe 'dor ba la dbang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de yang phung po'i lhag ma med pas so zhes bya ba de ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: That is not so, because he lacks power over relinquishing his life.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩtshe 'dor ba la dbang med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / tshe 'dor ba la dbang med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause he lacks power over relinquishing his life.

original: de ni tshe dor bar bya ba la dbang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni tshe dor bar bya ba la dbang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He lacks power over relinquishing his life.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'di de la dbang med ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'di de la dbang med ce na /
translated: Why does he lack power over that?

original: 'di ltar rab kyi mtha' ba'i bsam gtan bzhi pa thob pa ni tshe 'dor ba la dbang la rab kyi mtha' ba'i bsam gtan de yang gling gsum dag tu mi rnams kyi nang du skyed par byed na de ni gzugs kyi nang du skyes pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar rab kyi mtha' ba'i bsam gtan bzhi pa thob pa ni tshe 'dor ba la dbang la rab kyi mtha' ba'i bsam gtan de yang gling gsum dag tu mi rnams kyi nang du skyed par byed na de ni gzugs kyi nang du skyes pas so //
translated: For one who obtains the fourth absorption of the peak of existence has mastery over relinquishing life, and that fourth absorption of the peak of existence is generated among humans of the three continents.

original: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba tshe 'dor ba la dbang ngam zhe na /
analyzed: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba tshe 'dor ba la dbang ngam zhe na /
translated: But does one who attains nirvana in the intermediate state have mastery over relinquishing life?

original: gang gi phyir 'di go 'di ltar phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di go 'di ltar phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' zhe na /
translated: Why does one who attains nirvana without remainder attain nirvana in this way?

original: de la yang dbang med mod kyi srid pa bar mar gnas par byed pa la ni skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i ci 'dra ba de lta bu'i las ni med do //
analyzed: de la yang dbang med mod kyi srid pa bar mar gnas par byed pa la ni skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i ci 'dra ba de lta bu'i las ni med do //
translated: Although one does not have mastery over that, one does not have karma similar to that of one who attains nirvana after birth that maintains the intermediate existence.

original: de'i phyir bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni myur du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' la /
analyzed: de'i phyir bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni myur du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' la /
translated: Therefore one who attains nirvana in the intermediate state quickly attains nirvana.

original: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni tshe ji srid bar gnas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba kho na phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i yongs su @190a * //
analyzed: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni tshe ji srid bar gnas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba kho na phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i yongs su @190a * //
translated: One who attains nirvana with practice is one who attains nirvana by means of nirvana with remainder.üîΩOne who attains nirvana without practice is one who attains nirvana by means of nirvana without remainder.üîΩOne who attains nirvana after birth is one who attains nirvana after remaining alive for some time.üîΩOne who attains nirvana after birth attains nirvana only by means of nirvana with remainder.üîΩOne who attains nirvana without practice is one who attains nirvana by means of nirvana without remainder.üîΩOne who attains nirvana with practice is one who attains nirvana by means of nirvana with remainder.üîΩOne who attains nirvana after birth is one who attains nirvana after remaining alive for some time.üîΩOne who attains nirvana after birth attains nirvana only by means of nirvana with remainder.üîΩOne who attains nirvana without practice is one who attains nirvana by means of nirvana without remainder.

original: mya ngan las 'da' bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o zhes bya'o //üîΩmngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o zhes bya'o // mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: One who attains nirvana with practice is one who attains nirvana by means of nirvana with remainder.üîΩOne who attains nirvana after birth is one who attains nirvana after remaining alive for some time.üîΩOne who attains nirvana after birth attains nirvana only by means of nirvana with remainder.üîΩOne who attains nirvana without practice is one who attains nirvana by means of nirvana without remainder.

original: grag go zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung lugs rjod par byed pa yin te /üîΩrang gi gzhung lugs ni mdo sde dang mthun par phyis 'chad do //üîΩsbyor ba ma btang zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi sbyor ba'i 'phen pas sbyor ba ma bor bar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: grag go zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung lugs rjod par byed pa yin te / rang gi gzhung lugs ni mdo sde dang mthun par phyis 'chad do // sbyor ba ma btang zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi sbyor ba'i 'phen pas sbyor ba ma bor bar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: One who attains nirvana with practice is one who attains nirvana by means of nirvana with remainder.üîΩOne who attains nirvana after birth is one who attains nirvana after remaining alive for some time.üîΩOne who attains nirvana after birth attains nirvana only by means of nirvana with remainder.üîΩOne who attains nirvana without practice is one who attains nirvana by means of nirvana without remainder.üîΩOne who attains nirvana with practice is one who attains nirvana by means of nirvana with remainder.üîΩOne who attains nirvana after birth is one who attains nirvana after remaining alive for some time.üîΩOne who attains nirvana after birth attains nirvana only by means of nirvana with remainder.üîΩOne who attains nirvana without practice is one who attains nirvana by means of nirvana without remainder.üîΩOne who attains nirvana with practice is one who attains nirvana by means of nirvana with remainder.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas shing 'bad pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas shing 'bad pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: One who attains nirvana after birth is one who attains nirvana after remaining alive for some time.üîΩOne who attains nirvana after birth attains nirvana only by means

original: mngon par brtson pa dang lam ngang gis 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa de mngon par brtson pa'i phyir dang / lam ngang gis 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mngon par brtson pa dang lam ngang gis 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa de mngon par brtson pa'i phyir dang / lam ngang gis 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because those yogis are not diligent and the path does not arise naturally.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'grub bo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, they attain nirvana through exertion.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med par zhes bya ba ni snga ma las bzlog pa ste sbyor ba btang ba'i phyir ro ;üîΩ/ mngon par brtson pa dang / lam ngang gis 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mngon par brtson pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med par zhes bya ba ni snga ma las bzlog pa ste sbyor ba btang ba'i phyir ro ; / mngon par brtson pa dang / lam ngang gis 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mngon par brtson pa ste /
translated: Without exertion means the opposite of the former, because they give up application.üîΩBecause they are not diligent and the path does not arise naturally means that they are not diligent.

original: brtson 'grus med pa'i phyir dang / lam ngang gis 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brtson 'grus med pa'i phyir dang / lam ngang gis 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means because they lack effort and the path does not arise naturally.

original: de lta bas na de ltar mngon par brtson pa la sogs pa de dag tha dad pa'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i khyad par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na de ltar mngon par brtson pa la sogs pa de dag tha dad pa'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i khyad par bshad pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, because of the difference in their exertion, etc., the difference in their parinirvƒÅ·πáa is explained.

original: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la ni mngon par brtson pa dang lam ngang gis 'byung ba gnyi ga yang yod do //
analyzed: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la ni mngon par brtson pa dang lam ngang gis 'byung ba gnyi ga yang yod do //
translated: One who attains parinirvƒÅ·πáa after birth has both exertion and the path that arises naturally.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la ni mngon par brtson pa yod kyi 'di la lam ngang gis 'byung ba ni med do //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la ni mngon par brtson pa yod kyi 'di la lam ngang gis 'byung ba ni med do //
translated: One who attains parinirvƒÅ·πáa through effort has exertion but not the path that arises naturally.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la ni gnyi ga yang med de /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la ni gnyi ga yang med de /
translated: One who attains parinirvƒÅ·πáa without effort has neither.

original: mngon par brtson pa yang med la /
analyzed: mngon par brtson pa yang med la /
translated: There is no exertion and

original: lam ngang gis 'byung ba yang med do //
analyzed: lam ngang gis 'byung ba yang med do //
translated: there is no path that arises naturally.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la dmigs pa'i lam gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la dmigs pa'i lam gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because one attains parinirvƒÅ·πáa through the path that focuses on the conditioned and unconditioned.

original: 'dus byas dang 'du byed ces bya ba ni don gcig ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'du byed ces bya ba ni don gcig ste /
translated: The terms conditioned and formation have the same meaning.

original: 'dus ma byas dang 'du byed ma yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o //üîΩgang zhig 'du byed la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas dang 'du byed ma yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o // gang zhig 'du byed la dmigs pa ste /
translated: The same applies to unconditioned and non-formation.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang / lam la dmigs pa'i lam @190b gyis nyon mongs pa rnams spong bar byed pa de ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yin la /üîΩgang zhig 'du byed ma yin pa la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang / lam la dmigs pa'i lam @190b gyis nyon mongs pa rnams spong bar byed pa de ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yin la / gang zhig 'du byed ma yin pa la dmigs pa ste /
translated: Those who eliminate the defilements by means of the path that has the truths of cessation and path for its object and that has the formations for its object, they attain final nirvƒÅ·πáa through exertion.

original: 'gog pa la dmigs pas spong ba de ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yin no zhe'o //üîΩde ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa la dmigs pas spong ba de ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yin no zhe'o // de ni mi rung ste /
translated: Those who eliminate the defilements by means of the path that has the truth of cessation for its object and that has the non-formations for its object, they attain final nirvƒÅ·πáa without exertion.üîΩThis is not correct, because it is absurd.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: This is not so, because it is absurd.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it absurd?

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is absurd to maintain that the path that has the truth of cessation for its object is the path of cultivation.

original: bar ma do dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dag kyang 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas la dmigs pa'i lam gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas /
analyzed: bar ma do dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dag kyang 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas la dmigs pa'i lam gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas /
translated: and those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state and those who attain nirvana after they are born also attain nirvana by the path that focuses on conditioned and unconditioned states.

original: so sor mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so sor mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would follow that they would attain nirvana either with or without exertion.

original: de'i phyir gang zag gnyis kho nar thal bar 'gyur gyi lnga ni ma yin no //üîΩmngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba sngar 'byung bas zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba 'di mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zag gnyis kho nar thal bar 'gyur gyi lnga ni ma yin no // mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba sngar 'byung bas zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba 'di mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba
translated: Therefore, it would follow that there would be only two types of persons, not five.üîΩSince those who attain nirvana without exertion arise first, those who attain nirvana without exertion arise first because they attain nirvana without exertion.

original: bas sngar 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bas sngar 'byung ngo //
translated: Those who attain nirvana with exertion arise later because they attain nirvana with exertion.

original: de kho na bzhin du rung ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du rung ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: It is suitable to explain it in just that way.

original: gang zag mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba lam ngang gis 'byung ba dang / ngang gis 'byung ba ma yin pa dag gis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dag ni go rims bzhin du snga ma ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: gang zag mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba lam ngang gis 'byung ba dang / ngang gis 'byung ba ma yin pa dag gis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dag ni go rims bzhin du snga ma ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Those who attain nirvana without exertion and with exertion, respectively, are those who attain nirvana through the natural power of the path and through the power of applied practice.

original: cig shos ni mngon par 'du byed pas mngon par bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig shos ni mngon par 'du byed pas mngon par bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The former is to be accomplished without exertion and the latter is to be accomplished through exertion.

original: ji ltar na de ltar bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de ltar bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How are they to be accomplished in that way?

original: smras pa / de dag gi yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dag ni go rims bzhin du 'bad pa med pa dang / 'bad pas 'thob pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: smras pa / de dag gi yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dag ni go rims bzhin du 'bad pa med pa dang / 'bad pas 'thob pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: They are respectively due to the attainment of nirvana without effort and through effort.

original: yang na lam ngang gis 'byung ba dang ngang gis 'byung ba ma yin pa dag kho na mos pas gang zag dang mi sbyar gyi 'bad pa med pa dang 'bad pas 'thob pa'i sgo nas te /
analyzed: yang na lam ngang gis 'byung ba dang ngang gis 'byung ba ma yin pa dag kho na mos pas gang zag dang mi sbyar gyi 'bad pa med pa dang 'bad pas 'thob pa'i sgo nas te /
translated: Or else, the paths that are and are not naturally flowing are not applied to persons by way of their being and not being naturally flowing, but by way of their being attained without effort and by effort.üîΩThe former path is manifested without effort, and the latter is attained by effort.

original: lam snga ma 'bad pa med par mngon du 'gyur ba dang / cig shos 'bad pas 'thob pa'i sgo nas lam ngang gis 'byung ba ni @191a * //üîΩmngon par 'du byed pa med pas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: lam snga ma 'bad pa med par mngon du 'gyur ba dang / cig shos 'bad pas 'thob pa'i sgo nas lam ngang gis 'byung ba ni @191a * // mngon par 'du byed pa med pas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: The path that is naturally flowing is to be accomplished by way of non-application,

original: ngang gis 'byung ba ma yin pa ni mngon par 'du byed pas bsgrub bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngang gis 'byung ba ma yin pa ni mngon par 'du byed pas bsgrub bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the path that is not naturally flowing is to be accomplished by way of application.

original: de ltar na mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba snga bar rung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba snga bar rung ngo //
translated: Thus, it is appropriate that the nirvana without remainder is earlier.

original: smras pa / gal te mngon par 'du byed pa med pas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i lam ngang gis 'byung ba yin na /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te mngon par 'du byed pa med pas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i lam ngang gis 'byung ba yin na /
translated: Objection: If the path to nirvana without application arises effortlessly because it is to be accomplished by the absence of application,

original: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i lam yang dang gis 'byung ba yin pas de gnyis la khyad par ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i lam yang dang gis 'byung ba yin pas de gnyis la khyad par ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: then what is the difference between that and the path to nirvana that arises effortlessly after birth?

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:üîΩThe path to nirvana after birth arises effortlessly and is greater than the path to nirvana without application.

original: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni lam ches ngang gis 'byung ba dang ches che ba yin gyi mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni de ltar rgyu bsags pa'i sgo nas ches che ba ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni lam ches ngang gis 'byung ba dang ches che ba yin gyi mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni de ltar rgyu bsags pa'i sgo nas ches che ba ma yin no //
translated: The path to nirvana without application is not greater in this way because it is not accumulated through causes.

original: lam ches che ba nyid kyis zad par byas pa'i phyir phra rgyas ches chung ba yin no //
analyzed: lam ches che ba nyid kyis zad par byas pa'i phyir phra rgyas ches chung ba yin no //
translated: Because it is greater, it eliminates the most subtle of the negative tendencies.

original: gong du 'pho ba zhes bya ba ni 'di la gong du 'pho zhing 'gro ba yod pas na gong du 'pho ba dag go //
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba zhes bya ba ni 'di la gong du 'pho zhing 'gro ba yod pas na gong du 'pho ba dag go //
translated: Those who are called ‚Äúthose who transfer upward‚Äù are those who transfer upward and go.üîΩBecause they increase and do not increase the absorptions.

original: bsam gtan spel ba dang / spel ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bsres pa dang / bsres pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan spel ba dang / spel ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bsres pa dang / bsres pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This means that they mix and do not mix the absorptions.

original: bsam gtan zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dang bsres pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dang bsres pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they mix contaminated and uncontaminated absorptions.

original: 'dir bsam gtan rnams spel nas bsam gtan gsum las yongs su nyams pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir bsam gtan rnams spel nas bsam gtan gsum las yongs su nyams pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, ‚Äúthose who fully degenerate from three absorptions after increasing the absorptions‚Äù

original: dang por bzhi pa spel bar byed //
analyzed: dang por bzhi pa spel bar byed //
translated: First, they increase the fourth absorption.

original: ces 'byung bas bsam gtan spel ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa spel ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
analyzed: ces 'byung bas bsam gtan spel ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa spel ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
translated: Since it is said, ‚ÄúFirst, they increase the fourth absorption,‚Äù increasing the absorptions is preceded by increasing the fourth absorption.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa kho nas dang por spel bar nus kyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa kho nas dang por spel bar nus kyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: They are able to increase the absorptions first by means of the fourth absorption alone, but not by means of others.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa las yongs su ma nyams par bsam gtan dang po la sogs par skye ba med pas de'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa las yongs su nyams pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa las yongs su ma nyams par bsam gtan dang po la sogs par skye ba med pas de'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa las yongs su nyams pa zhes smos so //
translated: He does not retrogress from the fourth meditation and is not reborn in the first meditation, etc.

original: ji ltar yongs su nyams she na /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su nyams she na /
translated: How does he retrogress?

original: bsam gtan dang po'i ro myangs te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i ro myangs te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He retrogresses from the third meditation, having tasted the joy and happiness of the first meditation.

original: bar du mi 'gro bas na zhes bya ba ni bar mar mi 'gro bas so //
analyzed: bar du mi 'gro bas na zhes bya ba ni bar mar mi 'gro bas so //
translated: He does not go in the middle, i.e., he does not go to the second meditation.üîΩHe goes up by half, i.e., he goes to the fourth meditation.

original: phyed du 'phar bas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byang ba ni gnas gtsang ma rnams su skyes @191b nas ;
analyzed: phyed du 'phar bas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byang ba ni gnas gtsang ma rnams su skyes @191b nas ;
translated: He enters Akani·π£·π≠ha, having been born in the ≈öuddhƒÅvƒÅsa, i.e., the Pure Abodes.

original: gnas gzhan 'ga' tsam yang rgal te 'og min du 'jug pa gang yin pa'o zhes tshig de ltar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas gzhan 'ga' tsam yang rgal te 'og min du 'jug pa gang yin pa'o zhes tshig de ltar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: He enters Akani·π£·π≠ha, having passed over some other place.

original: lta ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa chen po dang / dang por skyes pa rnams kyang tshangs pa chen po la sprul pa po yin par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: lta ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa chen po dang / dang por skyes pa rnams kyang tshangs pa chen po la sprul pa po yin par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because it is the abode of the view, i.e., because the newly born MahƒÅbrahmƒÅs, through pride, believe that MahƒÅbrahmƒÅ, who is not their creator, is their creator.

original: ; gtso bo gcig tu zad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: ; gtso bo gcig tu zad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: Why? Because there is only one principal being.

original: 'phags pa ni tshangs chen pa dag gi nang du mi skye ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa ni tshangs chen pa dag gi nang du mi skye ste /
translated: Aryans are not born among the Mahabrahma gods.

original: 'phags pa der skye na mthu'i sgo nas gnyi ga gtso bo nyid du 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'phags pa der skye na mthu'i sgo nas gnyi ga gtso bo nyid du 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If an ƒÅryan were born there, then by the power of karma, both would be principal beings.

original: de'i bdag po ni 'gran zla med pa'i las kyis 'gyur bas de'i phyir 'gran zla dang bcas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag po ni 'gran zla med pa'i las kyis 'gyur bas de'i phyir 'gran zla dang bcas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But since the lord of that realm is established by karma that is without rival, therefore there is no rival.

original: gnas gzhan thams cad du zhes bya ba ni tshangs ris pa dag gi nang nas shi 'phos te changs pa'i mdun na 'don la sogs pa gya nom snang ba la thug pa'i bar gnas gzhan bcu bzhir 'phos nas 'og min du 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas gzhan thams cad du zhes bya ba ni tshangs ris pa dag gi nang nas shi 'phos te changs pa'i mdun na 'don la sogs pa gya nom snang ba la thug pa'i bar gnas gzhan bcu bzhir 'phos nas 'og min du 'jug pa yin no //
translated: In all other abodes means that having died from among the Brahmakayika gods, they are born in the other fourteen abodes, from Brahmapurohita up to Sudar≈õana, and then enter Akani·π£·π≠ha.

original: gong du skyes pa de'i 'og dang deng gtan du mi 'ong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang du skyes pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gong du skyes pa de'i 'og dang deng gtan du mi 'ong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang du skyes pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Because those born above do not descend there and because they do not return there forever means that those born in the form realm do not descend to the desire realm, and those born in the formless realm do not descend to the form realm.

original: bsam gtan dang por skyes nas de'i 'og 'dod pa'i khams su gtan mi 'ong ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin du gong du skyes pa der yang gtan mi 'ong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang por skyes nas de'i 'og 'dod pa'i khams su gtan mi 'ong ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin du gong du skyes pa der yang gtan mi 'ong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because one who is born in the first absorption never returns to the desire realm, and similarly, one who is born in a higher level never returns to a lower level.

original: bsam gtan dang po der yang gtan mi 'ong ba'i phyir lan gnyis su phyir der mi skye bas phyir mi 'ong ba nyid yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po der yang gtan mi 'ong ba'i phyir lan gnyis su phyir der mi skye bas phyir mi 'ong ba nyid yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: Because one never returns to the first absorption, one never returns to that level twice. Thus, the state of a non-returner is complete.üîΩThis is one who practices serenity.

original: 'di ni zhi gnas spyad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mor thug pa gang yin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin la dga' ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni zhi gnas spyad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mor thug pa gang yin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin la dga' ba yin te /
translated: One who is born in the summit of existence is one who delights in concentration.

original: gzugs med pa dag gi ting nge 'dzin ni rab tu zhi ba yin pas de'i phyir 'di gzugs med bdag tu 'jug go//
analyzed: gzugs med pa dag gi ting nge 'dzin ni rab tu zhi ba yin pas de'i phyir 'di gzugs med bdag tu 'jug go//
translated: Because the concentration of the formless realm is extremely peaceful, one enters the formless realm.üîΩThe former is one who practices insight.

original: snga ma ni lhag mthong spyad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'og min gyi mthar thug par bshad pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab la dga' ba yin te /
analyzed: snga ma ni lhag mthong spyad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'og min gyi mthar thug par bshad pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab la dga' ba yin te /
translated: One who is born in Akani·π£·π≠ha is one who delights in wisdom.

original: gnas gtsang ma rnams su 'jug go //
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma rnams su 'jug go //
translated: One enters the pure abodes.

original: bar skabs su yang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di ni bstan bcos byed pa rnams kyis bris pa yang med la bkag pa yang med do //
analyzed: bar skabs su yang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di ni bstan bcos byed pa rnams kyis bris pa yang med la bkag pa yang med do //
translated: This is not written by the authors of the treatise, nor is it refuted.

original: de'i phyir ma bkag pas gong du 'pho ba 'og min gyi mthar thug pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug pa yang 'og min dang srid pa'i rtse mor ma zhugs par bar skabs su mya ngan las 'da' bar rung bar lta sta srid par @192a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma bkag pas gong du 'pho ba 'og min gyi mthar thug pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug pa yang 'og min dang srid pa'i rtse mor ma zhugs par bar skabs su mya ngan las 'da' bar rung bar lta sta srid par @192a * //
translated: Therefore, since it is not refuted, it is possible that those who migrate to higher levels and reach Akani·π£·π≠ha or the summit of existence attain nirvana in the interim without entering Akani·π£·π≠ha or the summit of existence.

original: lta'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩ'og min gyi mthar thug pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug pa zhes bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / 'og min dang srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug pa nyid ni phan chad du 'gro ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lta'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // 'og min gyi mthar thug pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug pa zhes bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na / smras pa / 'og min dang srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug pa nyid ni phan chad du 'gro ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is the meaning of the text.üîΩBut aren‚Äôt those who reach Akani·π£·π≠ha and the summit of existence explained?üîΩThey are, but they are not the ultimate limit of Akani·π£·π≠ha and the summit of existence because they do not go beyond them.

original: 'og min dang / srid pa'i rtse mo las gong du 'gror med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'og min dang / srid pa'i rtse mo las gong du 'gror med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not go beyond Akani·π£·π≠ha and the summit of existence.

original: dper na rgyun du zhugs pa mchog tu thogs na lan bdun pa nyid bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na rgyun du zhugs pa mchog tu thogs na lan bdun pa nyid bzhin te /
translated: For example, it is like the stream enterer who is at most seven times aüîΩreturner.üîΩAlthough it is not impossible for him to attain nirvana after establishing

original: de la srid pa gnyis sam gsum mngon par grub nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba mi srid pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de la srid pa gnyis sam gsum mngon par grub nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba mi srid pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: two or three existences,üîΩhe does not establish an eighth existence beyond that. Therefore, he is called

original: de phan chad srid pa brgyad pa mngon par 'grub par mi byed pas mchog tu thogs na lan bdun pa zhes bshad do //üîΩde yang rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba med pa'i phyir rnam pa lnga ni med do //
analyzed: de phan chad srid pa brgyad pa mngon par 'grub par mi byed pas mchog tu thogs na lan bdun pa zhes bshad do // de yang rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba med pa'i phyir rnam pa lnga ni med do //
translated: ‚Äúat most seven times a returner.‚ÄùüîΩThere are four types of nonreturners who attain nirvana in the intermediate state, who attain nirvana upon birth, who attain nirvana with effort, and who attain nirvana without effort.

original: de dag ni phyir mi 'ong ba drug yin no zhes bya ba ni bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang /
analyzed: de dag ni phyir mi 'ong ba drug yin no zhes bya ba ni bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang /
translated: These are the six types of nonreturners.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / gong du 'pho ba dang drug pa gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba ste dbye ba rnam pa bzhi pa bgrangs so //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / gong du 'pho ba dang drug pa gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba ste dbye ba rnam pa bzhi pa bgrangs so //
translated: These are the four types of nonreturners.

original: mthong ba'i chos la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni tshe 'di la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni tshe 'di la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Attaining nirvana in this life means attaining nirvana in this lifetime.

original: gsum po gang dag ce na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni pha rol po phyir mi 'ong ba gsum zhes nges par phye ste /
analyzed: gsum po gang dag ce na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni pha rol po phyir mi 'ong ba gsum zhes nges par phye ste /
translated: What are the three?

original: ma bshad pas khong du ma chud de 'dri ba yin no //
analyzed: ma bshad pas khong du ma chud de 'dri ba yin no //
translated: Since they are not explained, they are not understood and so they are asked about.

original: slob dpon gyis kyang de dag ni don gyi shugs gyis bshad pa yin no zhes bya bar gzigs nas rnam par 'grel par mdzad de /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang de dag ni don gyi shugs gyis bshad pa yin no zhes bya bar gzigs nas rnam par 'grel par mdzad de /
translated: The Master also sees that they are explained by the force of the meaning and he comments on them.

original: bar ma do dang skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dag ni bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bar ma do dang skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dag ni bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Those who attain nirvana as an intermediate being or after taking birth are called those who attain nirvana as an intermediate being and those who attain nirvana after taking birth.

original: gong du 'pho ba ni gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba ni gsum pa yin no //
translated: Those who transfer to a higher level are the third type.üîΩThey attain nirvana quickly, not quickly, and after a long time, respectively, because they are like the three examples.

original: dpe gsum gyis myur ba dang / myur ba ma yin pa dang / yun ring mo zhig na yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni myur bar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / myur ba ma yin par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang /üîΩyun ring @192b mo zhig na yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dpe gsum dang sbyar bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dpe gsum gyis myur ba dang / myur ba ma yin pa dang / yun ring mo zhig na yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni myur bar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / myur ba ma yin par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / yun ring @192b mo zhig na yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dpe gsum dang sbyar bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Those who attain nirvana quickly, not quickly, and after a long time are to be applied to the three examples.

original: dper na zhog ma chung ngu'i me mngon par 'grub bzhin du 'chi bar 'gyur ba ltar dang po de /
analyzed: dper na zhog ma chung ngu'i me mngon par 'grub bzhin du 'chi bar 'gyur ba ltar dang po de /
translated: For example, it is like the fire that arises from rubbing two sticks together that is extinguished before the sticks are consumed.

original: myur bar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: myur bar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: That is the first type who attains nirvana quickly.

original: dper na lcags kyi thu lum mam /
analyzed: dper na lcags kyi thu lum mam /
translated: For example, it is like a red-hot iron ballüîΩthat is struck by an iron hammer, and the sparks fly upward and then die out.

original: thong lcags me kun du 'bar pa rab tu bsregs pa lcags kyi tho bas brgyab pa rnams kyi tsha tsha gyen du yar bzhin du 'chi bar 'gyur ba ltar gnyis pa myur ba ma yin pa yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa yang de dang
analyzed: thong lcags me kun du 'bar pa rab tu bsregs pa lcags kyi tho bas brgyab pa rnams kyi tsha tsha gyen du yar bzhin du 'chi bar 'gyur ba ltar gnyis pa myur ba ma yin pa yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa yang de dang
translated: The second type of parinirvƒÅ·πáa is like that.

original: 'dra'o // dper na lcags kyi thu lum mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: 'dra'o // dper na lcags kyi thu lum mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin te /
translated: For example, it is like a red-hot iron ballüîΩthat is struck by an iron hammer, and the sparks fly upward and then die out before they reach the ground.

original: tsha tsha gyen du yar nas sa la ma lhung ba kho nar 'chi bar 'gyur ba ltar gsum pa yun ring mo zhig na yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: tsha tsha gyen du yar nas sa la ma lhung ba kho nar 'chi bar 'gyur ba ltar gsum pa yun ring mo zhig na yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The third type of parinirvƒÅ·πáa is like that.

original: mdo 'di ni gong du bris zin pas yang mi 'dri'o //
analyzed: mdo 'di ni gong du bris zin pas yang mi 'dri'o //
translated: Since this s≈´tra has already been cited above, it will not be cited again.

original: skyes nas dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med bar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: skyes nas dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med bar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa dang /
translated: Because they attain nirvana after birth, through application and without application.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir rnam pa gsum du phye bas phyir mi 'ong ba dgu yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir rnam pa gsum du phye bas phyir mi 'ong ba dgu yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is applied to the nine types of nonreturners who are classified as three types: because they attain nirvana after birth, through application,üîΩand without application.

original: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni skyes pa tsam gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa ste /üîΩmngon par 'du byed pa'am /
analyzed: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni skyes pa tsam gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa ste / mngon par 'du byed pa'am /
translated: Attaining nirvana after birth is attaining nirvana merely through being born.üîΩIt is not attaining nirvana through application or

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni ma yin no //
translated: without application.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni skyes pa tsam kho nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin no //üîΩ'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni skyes pa tsam kho nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin no // 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Those who attain nirvana through exertion do not attain nirvana merely through birth.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa dang / sngon mngon par 'du byed pa ma btang ba'i mthus yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yin no //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa dang / sngon mngon par 'du byed pa ma btang ba'i mthus yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yin no //
translated: But rather, they attain nirvana through exertion, by the power of previous exertion that has not been abandoned.

original: 'di la ni lam ngang gis 'byung ba ni yod mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di la ni lam ngang gis 'byung ba ni yod mod kyi /
translated: In this case, the path arises naturally,

original: mngon par brtson pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' la skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni mngon par brtson pa med pas khyad par yod do //
analyzed: mngon par brtson pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' la skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni mngon par brtson pa med pas khyad par yod do //
translated: but they attain nirvana through exertion. Those who attain nirvana after birth attain nirvana without exertion. There is a difference.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni sngon gyi mngon par 'du byed pa btang ba ste /üîΩmngon par 'du byed pa @193a * //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni sngon gyi mngon par 'du byed pa btang ba ste / mngon par 'du byed pa @193a * //
translated: Those who attain nirvana without exertion abandon previous exertion

original: med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yin no //
analyzed: med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yin no //
translated: and attain nirvana without exertion.

original: de ltar na de dag gi khyad par ni de yin par khong du chud par bya'o //üîΩji ltar na mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dag kyang skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i ming thob par 'gyur ba de bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir de dag thams cad kyang skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir
analyzed: de ltar na de dag gi khyad par ni de yin par khong du chud par bya'o // ji ltar na mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dag kyang skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i ming thob par 'gyur ba de bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir de dag thams cad kyang skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir
translated: Thus, one should understand that these are their differences.üîΩIn order to show that those who attain nirvana with and without exertion also obtain the name ‚Äúthose who attain nirvana having been born‚Äù because they attain nirvana after birth, he says,

original: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dag yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dag yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúAll of them are those who attain nirvana having been born because they attain nirvana after birth.‚Äù

original: 'phar ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis so zhes bya ba ni 'phar ba dang / phyed du 'phar ba dang / thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba'i bye brag gis so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'phar ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis so zhes bya ba ni 'phar ba dang / phyed du 'phar ba dang / thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba'i bye brag gis so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúDue to the distinctions of leaping over, etc.‚Äù means due to the distinctions of leaping over, leaping over half, and leaping over all.

original: yang na gsum po thams cad ces bya ba ni bar ma do dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / gong du 'pho ba rnams myur ba dang / myur ba ma yin pa dang / yun ring mo zhig na yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /üîΩbar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yang la la ni myur bar yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: yang na gsum po thams cad ces bya ba ni bar ma do dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / gong du 'pho ba rnams myur ba dang / myur ba ma yin pa dang / yun ring mo zhig na yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir rnam pa gsum du dbye ste / bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yang la la ni myur bar yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: Or else, all three types are classified as three types because they attain nirvana quickly, not quickly, and after a long while, respectively.üîΩThose who attain nirvana in the intermediate state attain nirvana quickly.

original: la la ni myur ba ma yin par yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: la la ni myur ba ma yin par yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: Those who attain nirvana after birth attain nirvana not quickly.

original: la la ni yun ring mo zhig nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: la la ni yun ring mo zhig nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: Those who go upstream attain nirvana after a long while.

original: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / gong du 'pho ba yang de dang 'dra ste //
analyzed: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / gong du 'pho ba yang de dang 'dra ste //
translated: Those who attain nirvana after birth and those who go upstream are also classified as three types because they attain nirvana quickly, not quickly, and after a long while, respectively.

original: rnam pa gsum du dbye ba'i phyir yang phyir mi 'ong ba dgu yin no zhes sbyar ba de nyid brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum du dbye ba'i phyir yang phyir mi 'ong ba dgu yin no zhes sbyar ba de nyid brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore it should be stated that nonreturners are nine in number because they are classified as three types.

original: de dag gis ni khyad par rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gsum po bar ma do dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / gong du 'pho ba dang de dag nyid so sor rnam pa gsum du phye bas dgu po de dag gi khyad par ji skad du brjod pa ni las dang /
analyzed: de dag gis ni khyad par rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gsum po bar ma do dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / gong du 'pho ba dang de dag nyid so sor rnam pa gsum du phye bas dgu po de dag gi khyad par ji skad du brjod pa ni las dang /
translated: The distinctions among the three are due to the distinctions of karma, affliction, and faculties.üîΩHow is that?üîΩThe text says:üîΩFirst, the distinctions among the three are due to the distinctions of karma, affliction, and faculties.

original: nyon mongs pa dang / dbang po'i bye brag las te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / dbang po'i bye brag las te /
translated: The distinctions among the three are due to the distinctions of karma, affliction, and faculties.üîΩHow is that?üîΩThe text says:üîΩFirst, the distinctions among the three are due to the distinctions of karma, affliction, and faculties.

analyzed: skyes nas @193b myong bar 'gyur ba'i las bsags pa'i phyir skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yin no //

analyzed: lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las bsags pa'i phyir gong du 'pho ba yin te /

original: re zhig gsum po de dag gi khyad par las kyi bye brag las gyur pa ni de lta bu yin no //üîΩnyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa chung ba dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i phyir go rims bzhin du de dag nyid kyi khyad par nyon mongs pa'i bye brag las gyur pa yin no //
