original: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba rnams gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba rnams gang yin pa'o //
translated: They are due to the differences of karma, faculties, and so on.üîΩThey are due to the differences of karma, faculties, and so on.üîΩThey are due to the differences of karma, faculties, and so on.üîΩThey are due to the differences of karma, faculties, and so on.üîΩThey are due to the differences of karma, faculties, and so on.üîΩThey are due to the differences of karma, faculties, and so on.

original: gsum tshan de gnyis kyi khyad par ni nyon mongs pa dang dbang po'i bye brag las 'gyur te /
analyzed: gsum tshan de gnyis kyi khyad par ni nyon mongs pa dang dbang po'i bye brag las 'gyur te /
translated: They are due to the differences of karma, faculties, and so on.üîΩThey are due to the differences of karma, faculties

original: nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa chung ba dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i phyir dang / dbang po chen po dang / 'bring dang / chung ngu'i phyir go rims bzhin du khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa chung ba dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i phyir dang / dbang po chen po dang / 'bring dang / chung ngu'i phyir go rims bzhin du khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: They are distinguished by the strength of their affliction, weak, medium, strong, and by the strength of their faculty, strong, medium, weak.

original: las kyi bye brag las ni ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar gsum tshan dang po'i las mngon par 'grub pa myong par 'gyur ba yang mtshungs la /
analyzed: las kyi bye brag las ni ma yin te / 'di ltar gsum tshan dang po'i las mngon par 'grub pa myong par 'gyur ba yang mtshungs la /
translated: They are not distinguished by the strength of their karma.üîΩBecause the karma of the first group of three is similar in that it is to be experienced after being born,

original: gnyis pa'i las skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba yang mtshungs pas so //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i las skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba yang mtshungs pas so //
translated: and the karma of the second group of three is similar in that it is to be experienced after rebirth.

original: gsum tshan tha ma ni lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi bye brag las kyang khyad par du blta ste /
analyzed: gsum tshan tha ma ni lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi bye brag las kyang khyad par du blta ste /
translated: The last group of three is distinguished by the strength of karma to be experienced in other lives.

original: 'phar ba la sogs pa'i las lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba ni tha dad pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phar ba la sogs pa'i las lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba ni tha dad pas de'i phyir /
translated: Because the karma of leaping over and so on to be experienced in other lives is distinct.

original: lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi bye brag dag kyang zhes bya bas drangs pa nyon mongs pa dang / dbang po'i bye brag las khyad par du 'gyur te /
analyzed: lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi bye brag dag kyang zhes bya bas drangs pa nyon mongs pa dang / dbang po'i bye brag las khyad par du 'gyur te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand also by the specific karma to be experienced in a third life‚Äù indicates that they are distinguished by the specific affliction and faculty.

original: nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i phyir dang / dbang @194a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i phyir dang / dbang @194a * //
translated: They are distinguished by the specific affliction and faculty because they are distinguished by the specific affliction that is weak, medium, or strong, and by the specific faculty that is strong, medium, or weak.

original: po chen po dang / 'bring dang / chung ngu'i phyir go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: po chen po dang / 'bring dang / chung ngu'i phyir go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the above passage.üîΩThey are distinguished by the nine types of affliction and faculty.

original: de dag ni nyon mongs pa dang dbang po'i rnam pa dgu'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba de dag ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dgu'i phyir dang / dbang po'i rnam pa dgu'i phyir phyir mi 'ong ba dgu yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni nyon mongs pa dang dbang po'i rnam pa dgu'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba de dag ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dgu'i phyir dang / dbang po'i rnam pa dgu'i phyir phyir mi 'ong ba dgu yin no //
translated: They are distinguished by the nine types of affliction and the nine types of faculty.

original: las ma smos pa ni khyab pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: las ma smos pa ni khyab pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Karma is not mentioned because it is pervasive.

original: gsum tshan dang po gnyis ni las kyi bye brag las khyad par du gyur pa med do //
analyzed: gsum tshan dang po gnyis ni las kyi bye brag las khyad par du gyur pa med do //
translated: The first two groups of three are not distinguished by the specific karma.

original: yang ji ltar na nyon mongs pa de dag rnam pa dgu yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na nyon mongs pa de dag rnam pa dgu yin zhe na /
translated: How are the afflictions ninefold?

original: 'di la nyon mongs pa ni chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'di la nyon mongs pa ni chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The afflictions are threefold: weak, medium, and strong.

original: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba rnams kyi ni chung ngu yin no //
analyzed: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba rnams kyi ni chung ngu yin no //
translated: The weak are for those who attain nirvƒÅ·πáa in the intermediate state.

original: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba rnams kyi ni 'bring yin no //
analyzed: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba rnams kyi ni 'bring yin no //
translated: The medium are for those who attain nirvƒÅ·πáa after they are born.

original: gong du 'pho ba rnams kyi ni chen po yin no //
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba rnams kyi ni chen po yin no //
translated: The strong are for those who proceed to the higher realms.üîΩThose who attain nirvƒÅ·πáa in the intermediate state have weak afflictions.

original: de yang bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang po ni nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chung ngu can yin no //üîΩgnyis pa ni nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i 'bring po can yin no //
analyzed: de yang bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang po ni nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chung ngu can yin no // gnyis pa ni nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i 'bring po can yin no //
translated: Those who attain nirvƒÅ·πáa after they are born have medium afflictions.üîΩThose who proceed to the higher realms have strong afflictions.

original: gsum pa ni nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chen po can yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chen po can yin no //
translated: Those who attain nirvƒÅ·πáa in the intermediate state are further divided into three: those with weak-weak afflictions, those with weak-medium afflictions, and those with weak-strong afflictions.

original: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba rnams la yang dang po ste /
analyzed: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba rnams la yang dang po ste /
translated: Those who attain nirvƒÅ·πáa after they are born are also divided into three: those with medium-weak afflictions, those with medium-medium afflictions, and those with medium-strong afflictions.üîΩThose who proceed to the higher realms are also divided into three: those with strong-weak afflictions, those with strong-medium afflictions, and those with strong-strong afflictions.

original: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni nyon mongs pa 'bring po'i chung ngu can yin no //
analyzed: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni nyon mongs pa 'bring po'i chung ngu can yin no //
translated: Those who obtain nirvƒÅ·πáa after having been born are those who possess the weak middling afflictions.

original: gnyis pa mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni nyon mongs pa 'bring po'i 'bring po yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni nyon mongs pa 'bring po'i 'bring po yin no //
translated: Those who obtain nirvƒÅ·πáa with application are those who possess the middling middling afflictions.

original: gsum pa mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni nyon mongs pa 'bring po'i chen po can yin no //üîΩgong du 'pho ba rnams la yang 'phar ba ni nyon mongs pa chen po'i chung ngu can yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni nyon mongs pa 'bring po'i chen po can yin no // gong du 'pho ba rnams la yang 'phar ba ni nyon mongs pa chen po'i chung ngu can yin no //
translated: Those who obtain nirvƒÅ·πáa without application are those who possess the middling strong afflictions.üîΩThose who go upstream are those who possess the strong weak afflictions.

original: phyed du 'phar ba ni nyon mongs pa chen po'i 'bring po can yin no //
analyzed: phyed du 'phar ba ni nyon mongs pa chen po'i 'bring po can yin no //
translated: Those who go upstream half the time are those who possess the strong middling afflictions.

original: gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba ni nyon mongs pa chen po'i chen po can yin no //
analyzed: gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba ni nyon mongs pa chen po'i chen po can yin no //
translated: Those who die in all abodes are those who possess the strong strong afflictions.

original: ji ltar na dbang po'i rnam pa dgu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dbang po'i rnam pa dgu yin zhe na /
translated: How are there nine types of faculties?

original: de bzhin du dbang po yang chen po dang 'bring po dang chung ngu rnams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po yang chen po dang 'bring po dang chung ngu rnams te /
translated: The faculties are also strong, middling, and weak.

original: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba rnams kyi ni chen po yin no //
analyzed: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba rnams kyi ni chen po yin no //
translated: Those who obtain nirvƒÅ·πáa in the interval have the great faculties.

original: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba rnams kyi ni 'bring yin no //
analyzed: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba rnams kyi ni 'bring yin no //
translated: Those who obtain nirvƒÅ·πáa as soon as they are born have the medium faculties.

original: gong du 'pho ba rnams kyi ni chung ngu yin no //
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba rnams kyi ni chung ngu yin no //
translated: Those who go higher have the weak faculties.

original: de la yang bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang po ni dbang @194b po chen po'i chen po can yin no //
analyzed: de la yang bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang po ni dbang @194b po chen po'i chen po can yin no //
translated: Among those who obtain nirvƒÅ·πáa in the interval, the first has great great faculties.

original: gnyis pa ni dbang po chen po'i 'bring po can yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dbang po chen po'i 'bring po can yin no //
translated: The second has great medium faculties.

original: gsum pa ni dbang po chen po'i chung ngu can yin no //üîΩskyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba rnams la yang dang po ste /üîΩskyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni dbang po 'bring po'i chen po can yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni dbang po chen po'i chung ngu can yin no // skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba rnams la yang dang po ste / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni dbang po 'bring po'i chen po can yin no //
translated: The third has great weak faculties.üîΩAmong those who obtain nirvƒÅ·πáa as soon as they are born, the first has medium great faculties.üîΩThose who obtain nirvƒÅ·πáa as soon as they are born have medium great faculties.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni dbang po 'bring po'i 'bring po can yin no //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni dbang po 'bring po'i 'bring po can yin no //
translated: Those who obtain nirvƒÅ·πáa with effort have medium medium faculties.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni dbang po 'bring po'i chung ngu can yin no //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni dbang po 'bring po'i chung ngu can yin no //
translated: Nonreturners attaining nirvana without manifest exertion are those with small faculties of the medium faculty type.

original: gong du 'pho ba rnams la yang 'phar ba ni dbang po chung ngu'i chen po can no /
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba rnams la yang 'phar ba ni dbang po chung ngu'i chen po can no /
translated: Those who progress higher are those with great faculties of the small faculty type.

original: phyed du 'phar ba ni dbang po chung ngu'i 'bring po can yin no //
analyzed: phyed du 'phar ba ni dbang po chung ngu'i 'bring po can yin no //
translated: Those who progress halfway are those with medium faculties of the small faculty type.

original: gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba ni dbang po chung ngu'i chung ngu can yin no //
analyzed: gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba ni dbang po chung ngu'i chung ngu can yin no //
translated: Those who die in all abodes are those with small faculties of the small faculty type.üîΩIf that is so, how do you interpret the teaching in the sutras that there are seven abodes of the holy beings?üîΩThe sutra states:

original: 'o na mdo las skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun bstan pa ji lta bu zhe na zhes bya ba ni dge slong dag ngas skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun dang / nye bar len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yang bstan par bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'o na mdo las skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun bstan pa ji lta bu zhe na zhes bya ba ni dge slong dag ngas skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun dang / nye bar len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yang bstan par bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Monks, I will teach you the seven abodes of the holy beings and the nirvana that is without the appropriation of any other appropriated aggregates.

original: mdo de thams cad ni 'gro mdo las zhes bya ba'i phyogs der bris zin pas yang mi bri'o //
analyzed: mdo de thams cad ni 'gro mdo las zhes bya ba'i phyogs der bris zin pas yang mi bri'o //
translated: Since this sutra is cited in the section on the sutra on the seven abodes, it will not be cited again.

original: mdo de las ni skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun bstan te /
analyzed: mdo de las ni skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun bstan te /
translated: This sutra teaches seven destinies of holy beings:

original: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gsum dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gsum ste /
analyzed: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gsum dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gsum ste /
translated: three who attain nirvana in the intermediate state and three who attain nirvana after being born.

original: 'gro ba drug go //
analyzed: 'gro ba drug go //
translated: These are the six destinies.

original: bdun pa ni gong du 'pho ba'i 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: bdun pa ni gong du 'pho ba'i 'gro ba yin no //
translated: The seventh is the destiny of those who migrate to a higher level.üîΩBecause it is taught without distinction,

original: de ma phye bar bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gong du 'pho ba de 'phar ba la sogs pa phye ste ma bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de ma phye bar bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gong du 'pho ba de 'phar ba la sogs pa phye ste ma bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: because it is taught without distinguishing the leapers and so on.

original: mdo las bstan pa ni gdul pa'i bsam pa la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo las bstan pa ni gdul pa'i bsam pa la ltos pa yin no //
translated: The teaching in the sutra depends on the intention of those to be guided.üîΩIt is not the other destinies of learners,

original: slob pa'i 'gro ba gzhan dag ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'gro ba dag ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: slob pa'i 'gro ba gzhan dag ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'gro ba dag ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: that is, it is not the destinies of stream enterers and once returners.

original: 'gro ba dang / skye ba dang / tshe phyi ma zhes bya ba 'di dag ni mod las rnam grangs su bshad do //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang / skye ba dang / tshe phyi ma zhes bya ba 'di dag ni mod las rnam grangs su bshad do //
translated: Destiny, birth, and future life are synonyms.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba dag ste /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba dag ste /
translated: Those who are nonreturners

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi byed pa'i phyir las dam pa la 'jug cing mi tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa mi byed pa'i phyir dam pa ma yin pa la mi 'jug ste /üîΩmi tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa ni mi dge ba'i bsam @195a * //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi byed pa'i phyir las dam pa la 'jug cing mi tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa mi byed pa'i phyir dam pa ma yin pa la mi 'jug ste / mi tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa ni mi dge ba'i bsam @195a * //
translated: engage in pure action because they do not kill and so on, and they do not engage in impure action because they do not engage in sexual misconduct and so on.

original: pa'i sems kyis byed na /
analyzed: pa'i sems kyis byed na /
translated: If one engages in sexual misconduct and so on with a mind possessing nonvirtuous intention,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba de dag ni mi dge ba spangs pa'i phyir dam pa kho na la 'jug gi dam pa ma yin pa la mi 'jug go //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba de dag ni mi dge ba spangs pa'i phyir dam pa kho na la 'jug gi dam pa ma yin pa la mi 'jug go //
translated: then those who are free from attachment engage in pure action alone because they abandon nonvirtuous intention and do not engage in impure action.

original: yang phyir 'ong ba med ces bya ba ni 'gro ba gang dag tu skyes pa de'i 'og gam der gtan mi 'ong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang phyir 'ong ba med ces bya ba ni 'gro ba gang dag tu skyes pa de'i 'og gam der gtan mi 'ong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They do not return means they do not return to any realm in which they have been born.

original: ji skad du bshad pa 'di gzhan la ni med pas zhes bya ba ni dam pa kho na la 'jug cing dam pa ma yin pa la mi 'jug pa dang / yang phyir 'ong ba med pa gang yin pa de rgyun du zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa 'di gzhan la ni med pas zhes bya ba ni dam pa kho na la 'jug cing dam pa ma yin pa la mi 'jug pa dang / yang phyir 'ong ba med pa gang yin pa de rgyun du zhugs pa dang /
translated: Since this is not the case for others, it is said that the stream enterer is the best of all migrators, but not the best of all sentient beings.üîΩSince the stream enterer does not return to the desire realm, he is called a nonreturner.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba la med pas so //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba la med pas so //
translated: But since he returns to the form realm, he is not a nonreturner.

original: gzhan dag la yang zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dag la yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dag la yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Others means stream enterers and once returners.

original: rnam grangs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs las byung bas na rnam grangs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs las byung bas na rnam grangs pa ste /
translated: The term nominal is derived from the term nominality.

original: rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means in some way.üîΩHow so?

original: ji ltar zhe na sdig pa rnam pa lnga gtan mi byed pa'i sdom pa thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na sdig pa rnam pa lnga gtan mi byed pa'i sdom pa thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He obtains the vow to never commit the five types of negative action.

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / chang 'thung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi sdig pa rnam pa lnga mi byed pas mi byed par sdom pa ni sdom par byed pa ste /
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / chang 'thung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi sdig pa rnam pa lnga mi byed pas mi byed par sdom pa ni sdom par byed pa ste /
translated: The restraint of non-performance is the restraint of not performing the five types of evil deeds characterized by killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, and drinking alcohol.

original: de thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One obtains that restraint.

original: 'phags pa ni tshe rabs gzhan na yang sdig pa rnam pa lnga po 'di mi spyod do //
analyzed: 'phags pa ni tshe rabs gzhan na yang sdig pa rnam pa lnga po 'di mi spyod do //
translated: The noble one does not perform these five types of evil deeds in other lives as well.

original: mi byed pa'i sdom pa zhes smos pa ni yang dag par len pa'i sdom pa ni gdon mi za ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi byed pa'i sdom pa zhes smos pa ni yang dag par len pa'i sdom pa ni gdon mi za ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase restraint of non-performance is used because the restraint of perfect undertaking is not necessarily [obtained].

original: phal cher zhes bya ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni mi dge ba thams cad gtan spangs pa'i phyir dang / ci rigs bar bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba 'dod pa na spyod pa kha cig spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phal cher zhes bya ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni mi dge ba thams cad gtan spangs pa'i phyir dang / ci rigs bar bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba 'dod pa na spyod pa kha cig spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the most part means that the view-abandonable [deeds] are completely abandoned, and some of the deeds to be abandoned by cultivation in the desire realm are abandoned.

original: gang dag la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang dag la rnam grangs med par yod pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang dag la rnam grangs med par yod pa ste /
translated: Those who are called ‚Äúperfected beings‚Äù are those who possess the state of an arhat without exception.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba ltar rnam pa gzhan gyis skyes bu dam pa nyid yin pa lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba ltar rnam pa gzhan gyis skyes bu dam pa nyid yin pa lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not like stream enterers and once returners who are perfected beings in another sense.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: sdig pa thams cad gtan mi byed pa'i sdom pa thob pa'i phyir dang / mthong bas spong bar bya ba mi dge ba thams cad spangs pa'i phyir dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod pa na spyod pa rnam pa dgu po thams cad spangs pa'i phyir mdo 'dir skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro @195b ba bdun zhes gsungs pa ni skyes bu dam pa phyir mi 'ong ba da dag gi skabs yin no //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad gtan mi byed pa'i sdom pa thob pa'i phyir dang / mthong bas spong bar bya ba mi dge ba thams cad spangs pa'i phyir dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod pa na spyod pa rnam pa dgu po thams cad spangs pa'i phyir mdo 'dir skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro @195b ba bdun zhes gsungs pa ni skyes bu dam pa phyir mi 'ong ba da dag gi skabs yin no //
translated: In this sutra, the seven steps of a perfected being refer to the seven steps of a nonreturner, because they obtain the vow to never commit any misdeed, they abandon all nonvirtue that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing, and they abandon all the nine aspects of affliction that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the desire realm.

original: de'i phyir gzhan dag kyang rnam grangs pa'i skyes bu dam pa nyid yin pa ni mi dag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan dag kyang rnam grangs pa'i skyes bu dam pa nyid yin pa ni mi dag go //
translated: Therefore others are not perfected beings in the sense of being a perfected being in the category of a nonreturner.

original: ci phyir mi 'ong ba tshe yongs su gyur pa la yang bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i dbye ba 'di yod dam zhes bya ba phyir mi 'ong ba tshe yongs su gyur pa ni gang zhigüîΩtshe dang po la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'am /
analyzed: ci phyir mi 'ong ba tshe yongs su gyur pa la yang bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i dbye ba 'di yod dam zhes bya ba phyir mi 'ong ba tshe yongs su gyur pa ni gang zhig tshe dang po la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'am /
translated: Nonreturners who have changed their birth are those who,

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob nas tshe gnyis pa la phyir mi 'ong bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob nas tshe gnyis pa la phyir mi 'ong bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: in their first lifetime, obtain the fruit of stream entry or the fruit of oncereturner and in their second lifetime become nonreturners.

original: 'dod par zhes bya ba khyad par smos pa ni 'di ltar gzugs kyi khams su tshe yongs su gyur pa ni res 'ga' gzugs med pa dag tu 'jug pas so //
analyzed: 'dod par zhes bya ba khyad par smos pa ni 'di ltar gzugs kyi khams su tshe yongs su gyur pa ni res 'ga' gzugs med pa dag tu 'jug pas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the desire realm‚Äù is specified because those who change their birth in the form realm sometimes enter the formless realm.üîΩBecause they attain nirvana in that very lifetime.

original: tshe de nyid la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di 'dod pa'i khams la sdug bsngal mang ba nyid kyis shin tu skyo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe de nyid la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di 'dod pa'i khams la sdug bsngal mang ba nyid kyis shin tu skyo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are extremely disgusted with the desire realm because of its many sufferings.

original: 'o na brgya byin gyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni brgya byin gyis bdag 'di nas shi 'phos te mi'i nang du skyes nas gal te dgra bcom pa nyid thob ste /
analyzed: 'o na brgya byin gyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni brgya byin gyis bdag 'di nas shi 'phos te mi'i nang du skyes nas gal te dgra bcom pa nyid thob ste /
translated: If Indra said, I will be reborn among humans after dying from here and if I obtain the state of an arhat,

original: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'i /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'i /
translated: I will not attain nirvana,

original: bdag ni tha mar nyams na lha gang 'og mi na zhes /üîΩrnam par grags pa der ni skye bar 'gyur bar shog / ces smras te de ni lha dag gi nang kho nar rgyun du zhugs par gyur nas mi dag gi nang du 'ongs te /
analyzed: bdag ni tha mar nyams na lha gang 'og mi na zhes / rnam par grags pa der ni skye bar 'gyur bar shog / ces smras te de ni lha dag gi nang kho nar rgyun du zhugs par gyur nas mi dag gi nang du 'ongs te /
translated: but if I degenerate in the end, may I be reborn among the gods who are humans‚Äô inferiors,üîΩthen he would be reborn among the gods and not attain nirvana.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o zhes smras pa'i phyir tshe yongs su gyur pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o zhes smras pa'i phyir tshe yongs su gyur pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: He would be reborn among the gods and not attain nirvana because he said, I will attain nirvana after coming to the human realm.

original: tha mar ris mthun pa'i mjug tu nyams na ste /
analyzed: tha mar ris mthun pa'i mjug tu nyams na ste /
translated: If he degenerates in the end, he degenerates at the end of his homogeneous collection of parts.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid ma thob par ma thob pa'i yongs su nyams pas nyams na /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid ma thob par ma thob pa'i yongs su nyams pas nyams na /
translated: If he degenerates through the degeneration of nonobtainment of the state of an arhat, he degenerates through the degeneration of nonobtainment.

original: 'og min der ni skye bar 'gyur bar shog / ces don du gnyer bar smras pa'i phyir khams gzhan du 'gro ba yod do zhes bstan pa yin no zhes bya bar mngon na de ji ltar mdo'i don 'dod pa'i khams su tshe gzhan du yongs su gyur pa'i
analyzed: 'og min der ni skye bar 'gyur bar shog / ces don du gnyer bar smras pa'i phyir khams gzhan du 'gro ba yod do zhes bstan pa yin no zhes bya bar mngon na de ji ltar mdo'i don 'dod pa'i khams su tshe gzhan du yongs su gyur pa'i
translated: It is said that one should strive to be born in Akani·π£·π≠ha,üîΩand it is taught that one goes to other realms.

original: 'phags pa khams gzhan du mi 'gro'o zhes bshad do zhes bya bar snang /
analyzed: 'phags pa khams gzhan du mi 'gro'o zhes bshad do zhes bya bar snang /
translated: If you say that the meaning of the sutra is that aryas do not go to other realms in the desire realm in another life,üîΩthen why did the Bhagavan not stop him when he heard him say,

original: khyod brgya byin gyis chos kyi mtshan nyid mngon par mi shes pa'i phyir de skad du smras par zad de /
analyzed: khyod brgya byin gyis chos kyi mtshan nyid mngon par mi shes pa'i phyir de skad du smras par zad de /
translated: ‚ÄúYou say that because you do not understand the characteristics of phenomena like ≈öakra.

original: de lta bas na zhes pa med do zhes zer na /üîΩbcom ldan 'das de skad du gsan pas kyang ci'i phyir khyod de skad du ma smra shig ces de ma bzlog ce na /
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes pa med do zhes zer na / bcom ldan 'das de skad du gsan pas kyang ci'i phyir khyod de skad du ma smra shig ces de ma bzlog ce na /
translated: Therefore, it does not exist.‚ÄùüîΩIf you say that the Bhagavan did not refute him because he was pleased with his correct praise,

original: de'i phyir yang dag par dga' bar bya ba yin pa'i @196a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag par dga' bar bya ba yin pa'i @196a * //
translated: then why did the Bhagavan not refute him when he heard him say,üîΩ‚ÄúYou say that because you do not understand the characteristics of phenomena like ≈öakra.

original: phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ma bkag go zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ma bkag go zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it does not exist.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal yongs su spang bar 'dod pas yang dag par dga' bar bya ba yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal yongs su spang bar 'dod pas yang dag par dga' bar bya ba yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: One should think, ‚ÄúI will delight in the truth in order to completely abandon the suffering of the desire realm.‚Äù

original: slob dpon 'dus bzangs na re shi 'pho ba'i rgyu mtshan can gyi skye ba'i sdug bsngal gyis yid byung ba ni yang dag par dga' bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzangs na re shi 'pho ba'i rgyu mtshan can gyi skye ba'i sdug bsngal gyis yid byung ba ni yang dag par dga' bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Master Sa·πÉghabhadra says: One should delight in the truth because one is disgusted with the suffering of birth that has the characteristics of death and transmigration.

original: dbang po rnams ches yongs su smin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shes rab la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / rten khyad par can thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba
analyzed: dbang po rnams ches yongs su smin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shes rab la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / rten khyad par can thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba
translated: Because the faculties are very mature means that because the faculties of wisdom and so on are the special result of the dominant result, it is said that they are very mature.

original: ni 'di ltar rten khyad par can ma nyams pa lam mngon du 'gyur ba dang mthun pa thob pa ste /
analyzed: ni 'di ltar rten khyad par can ma nyams pa lam mngon du 'gyur ba dang mthun pa thob pa ste /
translated: Because one obtains a special support means that one obtains a special support that is not impaired and is suitable for manifesting the path.

original: dbang po rnon po dag yin yang rten mi mthun pas yon tan dag las nyams pa snang ngo //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po dag yin yang rten mi mthun pas yon tan dag las nyams pa snang ngo //
translated: Even though one has sharp faculties, it appears that one degenerates from good qualities due to an unsuitable support.

original: de lta bas na tshe rabs gzhan nas yongs su 'dris pas dbang po rnams ches yongs su smin pa'i phyir dbang po 'pho ba med la /
analyzed: de lta bas na tshe rabs gzhan nas yongs su 'dris pas dbang po rnams ches yongs su smin pa'i phyir dbang po 'pho ba med la /
translated: Therefore, since the faculties are fully ripened due to thorough familiarity from other lives, they do not upgrade faculties.

original: rten khyad par can thob pa'i phyir yongs su nyams pa med de /
analyzed: rten khyad par can thob pa'i phyir yongs su nyams pa med de /
translated: And since they obtain a special support, they do not fully degenerate.

original: tshe rabs gzhan nas yongs su 'dris pa de nyid kyis khams gzhan du 'gro bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan nas yongs su 'dris pa de nyid kyis khams gzhan du 'gro bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And due to that very thorough familiarity from other lives, they do not proceed to other realms.üîΩThey do not attain nirvana in the intermediate state because they are not familiar with the path and it does not manifest.

original: lam ma 'dris pas mngon sum du mi 'gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir lam ma 'dris pas mngon sum du mi 'gyur ba rgyu de'i phyir slob pa 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lam ma 'dris pas mngon sum du mi 'gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir lam ma 'dris pas mngon sum du mi 'gyur ba rgyu de'i phyir slob pa 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they are not familiar with the path and it does not manifest, learners who are not free from attachment do not attain nirvana in the intermediate state as stream enterers and once returners.

original: phra rgyas rnams shin du chung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de'i phra rgyas rnams shin du chung ba ma yin pa de'i phyir bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin te 'di
analyzed: phra rgyas rnams shin du chung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de'i phra rgyas rnams shin du chung ba ma yin pa de'i phyir bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin te 'di
translated: Because their negative tendencies are not extremely small.

original: ni slob dpon gyi lan yin no //
analyzed: ni slob dpon gyi lan yin no //
translated: This is the master's answer.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi lan gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi lan gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the answer of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas?

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re 'dod pa'i khams las 'da' bar dka' ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re 'dod pa'i khams las 'da' bar dka' ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say, Because it is difficult to transcend the desire realm.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: smras pa / 'dis nyon mongs pa mi dge ba dang lung ma bstan pa spang pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa / 'dis nyon mongs pa mi dge ba dang lung ma bstan pa spang pa ste /
translated: They say, By this, one abandons the afflictions that are nonvirtuous and neutral.

original: 'dis mi dge ba 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams dang / lung du ma bstan pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams spang bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: 'dis mi dge ba 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams dang / lung du ma bstan pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams spang bar bya dgos so //
translated: By this, one must abandon the nonvirtuous ones that operate in the desire realm and the neutral ones that operate in the form and formless realms.

original: @196b slob pa 'dod chags dang bral bas ni lung du ma bstan pa kho na spang bar zad do //
analyzed: @196b slob pa 'dod chags dang bral bas ni lung du ma bstan pa kho na spang bar zad do //
translated: Those in training who are detached from the realm of desire abandon only the neutral.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu gnyis sam gsum thob pa zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu gnyis sam gsum thob par bya dgos te /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu gnyis sam gsum thob pa zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu gnyis sam gsum thob par bya dgos te /
translated: Obtaining two or three fruits of the ≈õrama·πáa.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong bas ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu dang / dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu gnyis thob par bya dgos la /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong bas ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu dang / dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu gnyis thob par bya dgos la /
translated: The once-returner must obtain two fruits of the ≈õrama·πáa: the fruit of nonreturn and the fruit of arhatship.

original: rgyun du zhugs pas ni gsum ste /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pas ni gsum ste /
translated: The stream-enterer must obtain three fruits:

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: the fruit of the once-returner, the fruit of nonreturn, and the fruit of arhatship.

original: 'dod chags dang bral bas ni dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu gcig kho na thob par bya bar zad do //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bas ni dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu gcig kho na thob par bya bar zad do //
translated: Those detached from the realm of desire must obtain only the fruit of arhatship.

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral bas khams gsum las yang dag par 'da' bar yang bya dgos la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral bas khams gsum las yang dag par 'da' bar yang bya dgos la /
translated: One who is not free from attachment must transcend the three realms.üîΩOne who is free from attachment but not free from attachment to the form realm must transcend the two realms.üîΩOne who is free from attachment to the form realm but not free from attachment to the formless realm must transcend the formless realm.üîΩOne who is free from attachment to the formless realm must transcend the three realms.üîΩOne who is free from attachment to the summit of existence must transcend the three realms.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang ma bral ba bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur bas ni khams gnyis las yang dag par 'da' bar bya bar zad do //üîΩspel bar byed ces bya ba ni sre bar yang byed cing 'dren mar byed pas te /

analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa ni skyon brgyad las grol ba'i phyir de dag gi nang na mchog yin no //
translated: The fourth absorption is supreme among them because it is free from the eight errors.

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la /
translated: When one is free from attachment to the third absorption,

original: grag ces bya ba ni /üîΩbye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung lugs ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: grag ces bya ba ni / bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung lugs ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: one obtains the fourth absorption.üîΩThe VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say that the fourth absorption is obtained through two moments.

analyzed: rang gi gzhung lugs ni 'og nas skad cig ma spel bar ni mi nus te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung bas ston to //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas‚Äô own system is explained below in the line: ‚ÄúOne cannot increase moments.‚ÄùüîΩTwo moments are like the uninterrupted path,

original: skad cig ma gnyis ni bar chad med pa'i lam lta bu yin zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dag go //
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis ni bar chad med pa'i lam lta bu yin zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dag go //
translated: which is both uncontaminated and contaminated.üîΩThe third is like the liberated path,

original: gsum pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam lta bu yin no zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam lta bu yin no zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'o //
translated: which is uncontaminated.

original: dbang po rtul po rnams ni nyon mongs pas kyang 'jigs pa'i phyir spel bar byed de /
analyzed: dbang po rtul po rnams ni nyon mongs pas kyang 'jigs pa'i phyir spel bar byed de /
translated: Those of dull faculty increase moments because they fear affliction.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gnas gtsang mar skye bar bya ba'i phyir dang / mthong ba'i @197a * //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gnas gtsang mar skye bar bya ba'i phyir dang / mthong ba'i @197a * //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the root text indicates that they do so in order to be born in the pristine abodes and to see the truths.

original: chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir yang spel bar byed do //
analyzed: chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir yang spel bar byed do //
translated: They also increase it in order to abide happily in the Dharma.

original: dbang po rnon po rnams ni gnas gtsang mar skye bar bya ba'i phyir dang / mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba kho na'i phyir spel bar byed kyi de dag la yang yongs su nyams pa mi srid pa'i phyir nyon mongs pas 'jigs pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po rnams ni gnas gtsang mar skye bar bya ba'i phyir dang / mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba kho na'i phyir spel bar byed kyi de dag la yang yongs su nyams pa mi srid pa'i phyir nyon mongs pas 'jigs pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: Those of sharp faculty increase it in order to be born in the immaculate abodes and in order to abide happily in this life alone, but not because they fear affliction, since complete degeneration is impossible for them.

original: yang ji ltar na nyon mongs pas 'jigs pas yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir spel bar byed ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na nyon mongs pas 'jigs pas yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir spel bar byed ce na /
translated: How do they increase it in order to not completely degenerate due to fear of affliction?

original: ro myong ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin thag bsring ba'i sgo nas yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te 'bras bu las yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ro myong ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin thag bsring ba'i sgo nas yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te 'bras bu las yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They say: in order to not completely degenerate through the experience of meditative attainment, because they do not completely degenerate from their result.

original: rnam pa lnga yin te zhes bya ba ni chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang / shin tu che ba dang / shin tu ches che ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga yin te zhes bya ba ni chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang / shin tu che ba dang / shin tu ches che ba'o //
translated: There are five types: small, medium, great, very great, and exceedingly great.

original: dang po la ni sems gsum zhes bya ba ni gang zag de la nus pa de tsam zhig yod pas te /
analyzed: dang po la ni sems gsum zhes bya ba ni gang zag de la nus pa de tsam zhig yod pas te /
translated: In the first, there are three minds, because that person has only that much ability.

original: de bzhin du 'og ma rnams la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og ma rnams la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the others.

original: gnyis pa la ni drug go zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa zhes bya ba gsum dang / yang zag pa med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa zhes bya ba gsum ste drug yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni drug go zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa zhes bya ba gsum dang / yang zag pa med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa zhes bya ba gsum ste drug yin no //
translated: In the second, there are six, that is, three consisting of uncontaminated, contaminated, and uncontaminated, and three consisting of uncontaminated, contaminated, and uncontaminated, making six.

original: gsum pa la ni dgu'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni dgu'o //
translated: In the third, there are nine.

original: bzhi pa la ni bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni bcu gnyis so //
translated: In the fourth, there are twelve.

original: lnga pa la ni bco lnga ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lnga pa la ni bco lnga ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the fifth, there are fifteen.

original: yang de kho na bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang de kho na bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Again, they should be connected in the same way.

original: de dag gi 'bras bu ni grangs bzhin du zhes bya ba ni spel mar bsgom pa de dag gi 'bras bu ni grangs bzhin du gnas gtsang ma lnga yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu ni grangs bzhin du zhes bya ba ni spel mar bsgom pa de dag gi 'bras bu ni grangs bzhin du gnas gtsang ma lnga yin te /
translated: The results of those meditations are the five pure abodes, respectively.

original: bsgom pa chung ngu'i 'bras bu mi che ba yin pa nas bsgom pa shin tu ches che ba'i 'bras bu 'og min yin pa'i bar du'o //üîΩdad pa'i dbang po la sogs pa lhag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dpal len gyi gzhung lugs yin te /
analyzed: bsgom pa chung ngu'i 'bras bu mi che ba yin pa nas bsgom pa shin tu ches che ba'i 'bras bu 'og min yin pa'i bar du'o // dad pa'i dbang po la sogs pa lhag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dpal len gyi gzhung lugs yin te /
translated: The result of small meditation is the Minor, and the result of extremely great meditation is Akani·π£·π≠ha.üîΩThe result of meditation that is dominated by faith is the Minor, and the result of meditation that is dominated by wisdom is Akani·π£·π≠ha.

original: bsgom pa dang dad pa shas che ba'i 'bras bu mi che ba yin pa nas de bzhin du bsgom pa shes rab shas che ba'i 'bras bu 'og min yin pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa dang dad pa shas che ba'i 'bras bu mi che ba yin pa nas de bzhin du bsgom pa shes rab shas che ba'i 'bras bu 'og min yin pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The result of meditation that is dominated by faith is the Minor, and the result of meditation that is dominated by wisdom is Akani·π£·π≠ha.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba gang la la zhes bya ba ni dad pas mos pa'am mthong bas thob pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba gang la la zhes bya ba ni dad pas mos pa'am mthong bas thob pa'o //
translated: Any nonreturners who attain nirvana in the intermediate state are called ‚Äúthose who attain nirvana without application.‚Äù

original: lus kyi mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sems med pa'i phyir lus kho nas mngon sum du byed do//
analyzed: lus kyi mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sems med pa'i phyir lus kho nas mngon sum du byed do//
translated: They are called ‚Äúthose who attain nirvana without application‚Äù because they attain nirvana without applying the antidote of the transcendent path to the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the transcendent path.

analyzed: @197b ji ltar lus kho nas yin zhe na /
translated: How is it only by the body?

original: smras pa / lus la brten te skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / lus la brten te skye ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'di lta bu yin par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni slob dpon rang gi gzhung lugs yin no //

original: thob pa dang zhes pas mngon sum du byed pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dus na de dang mthun pa'i rten gyis thob pa mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir dang langs pa'i dus na de yang so sor yang dag par myong ba'i shesüîΩpas mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa dang zhes pas mngon sum du byed pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dus na de dang mthun pa'i rten gyis thob pa mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir dang langs pa'i dus na de yang so sor yang dag par myong ba'i shes pas mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By means of obtainment and manifestation means that at the time of meditative absorption, it is manifested by the obtainment of a basis that is compatible with it, and at the time of rising from meditative absorption, it is manifested by the knowledge that experiences it.

original: mngon sum du gyur pa ni mngon du byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus zhi ba thob pa'i gnas skabs na mngon du byed par rung ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum du gyur pa ni mngon du byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus zhi ba thob pa'i gnas skabs na mngon du byed par rung ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Manifestation is the act of manifesting. This means that it is suitable to manifest it in the context of attaining the pacification of the body that is accompanied by consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus zhi ba thob pas rnam par shes pa med pa'i lus zhi ba'i gnas skabs na yang de thob par mngon no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus zhi ba thob pas rnam par shes pa med pa'i lus zhi ba'i gnas skabs na yang de thob par mngon no //

analyzed: mdo las slob pa bco brgyad ces gsungs pa der zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das la khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyis zhus pa ;

translated: those who have entered to manifest the result of stream enterer,üîΩthose who have entered to manifest the result of once returner,üîΩthose who have entered to manifest the result of nonreturner,üîΩthose who have entered to manifest the result of arhat,üîΩthose who follow by faith, those who follow by dharma, those resolute in faith, those who obtain through seeing,üîΩthose who are born in the same class, those with one obstruction, those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state, those who attain nirvana as soon as they are born, those who attain nirvana through application,

analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / gong du 'pho ba ste /

original: khyim bdag de dag ni slob pa bco brgyad yin no //
analyzed: khyim bdag de dag ni slob pa bco brgyad yin no //
translated: Householder, these are the eighteen learners.

original: mi slob pa dgu gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: mi slob pa dgu gang yin zhe na /

original: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dang / 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can dang / rjes su srung ba'i chos can dang / gnas @198a * //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dang / 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can dang / rjes su srung ba'i chos can dang / gnas @198a * //
translated: Those who fully degenerate, those who contemplate death, those who guard the path, those who are steadfast,

analyzed: khyim bdag de dag ni mi slob pa dgu yin no zhes 'byung ba yin no //

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i shes rab bo //

original: de dag gi 'bras bu ni bral ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu ni bral ba'o //
translated: Their result is detachment.üîΩThe learners are established by the distinction of that,

original: de'i khyad par gyis slob pa rnams rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i khyad par dang / de'i 'bras bu'i khyad par gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: de'i khyad par yang ji lta bu zhig yin zhe na //
analyzed: de'i khyad par yang ji lta bu zhig yin zhe na //
translated: What is the distinction of that?

original: slob pa bco brgyad kyi bslab pa dang / 'bras bu bral ba gzhan dang gzhan mi 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: slob pa bco brgyad kyi bslab pa dang / 'bras bu bral ba gzhan dang gzhan mi 'dra ba yin no //
translated: The training of the eighteen learners and the detachment which is their result are not similar.

analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni spong ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir bslab pa yang ma yin la /

analyzed: bral ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir slob pa'i 'bras bu yang ma yin te /

original: de'i phyir de dang ldan pas te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dang ldan pas te /
translated: Therefore, one who possesses it is not a learner.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan pas slob pa bco brgyad po de dag ji lta bar slob pa'i bye brag tu ma gsungs kyi /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan pas slob pa bco brgyad po de dag ji lta bar slob pa'i bye brag tu ma gsungs kyi /
translated: The eighteen learners who possess meditative attainment of cessation are not mentioned as a specific type of learner.

original: 'di slob pa ma yin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di slob pa ma yin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are not nonlearners.

original: de la mdo las /
analyzed: de la mdo las /
translated: In a sutra it says:üîΩThere are eighteen learners.üîΩWhy is direct realization by the body not mentioned there?

original: slob pa bco brgyad ces gsungs pa der lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa ci'i phyir ma gsungs zhes gang zer ba de ni de lta bu'i slob par ma gsungs par zad do //
analyzed: slob pa bco brgyad ces gsungs pa der lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa ci'i phyir ma gsungs zhes gang zer ba de ni de lta bu'i slob par ma gsungs par zad do //
translated: It is said that it is not mentioned as a type of learner.üîΩThe above is a rough analysis.

original: dbye ba che long yin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba lnga zhes bya ba dang / gzhan ni gzugs med 'gro rnam bzhi //
analyzed: dbye ba che long yin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba lnga zhes bya ba dang / gzhan ni gzugs med 'gro rnam bzhi //
translated: The Abhidharmakosa states, Five nonreturners go to the form realm, Four go to the formless realm,

original: zhes bya ba dang / gzhan ni 'di la mya ngan 'da' //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / gzhan ni 'di la mya ngan 'da' //
translated: And others attain nirvana here.

original: zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o /
translated: And so on.

original: // / bam po bzhi bcu rtsa dgu pa /
analyzed: // / bam po bzhi bcu rtsa dgu pa /
translated: PART III

original: zhib tu dbye ba ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'dir slob dpon gyis brtse ba'i thabs rab tu bstan pa'i phyir dang po'i bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i dbang po dang / sa dang rigs la sogs pa'i khyad par bye brag tu ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: zhib tu dbye ba ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'dir slob dpon gyis brtse ba'i thabs rab tu bstan pa'i phyir dang po'i bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i dbang po dang / sa dang rigs la sogs pa'i khyad par bye brag tu ston par mdzad do //
translated: Here, the master teaches the distinctions of faculties, stages, lineages, and so on, in order to demonstrate the method of compassion.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de'i bye brag bgrangs na ji ltar bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dbang po @198b la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa ltar gong du 'pho ba'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bsgre sla bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bye brag bgrangs na ji ltar bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dbang po @198b la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa ltar gong du 'pho ba'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bsgre sla bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one counts the distinctions, it is easy to infer that just as attaining nirvana in the intermediate state is differentiated by faculties and so on, so too is relocating to higher levels.

original: de dag nyid sa'i bye brag gis bzhi'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag nyid sa'i bye brag gis bzhi'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are four by the distinction of stages.

original: de dag nyid ni bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba rnams so //
analyzed: de dag nyid ni bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba rnams so //
translated: They are those attaining nirvana in the intermediate state.

original: sa dag ni bsam gtan bzhi yin te /
analyzed: sa dag ni bsam gtan bzhi yin te /
translated: The stages are the four absorptions.

original: gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba rnams brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba rnams brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he wishes to describe nonreturners who proceed to the form realm.

original: de la bsam gtan dang por bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar te bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang por bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar te bzhi'o //
translated: There are four types of nonreturners who attain nirvana in the intermediate state, from those who attain nirvana quickly to those who attain nirvana after a long time.üîΩThere are six types due to the specific types of those who fully degenerate and so on.

original: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa'i rigs kyi bye brag gis drug go zhes bya ba ni de nyid yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dang / 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can dang / rjes su srung ba'i chos can dang / gnas pa las mi g-yo ba dang /
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa'i rigs kyi bye brag gis drug go zhes bya ba ni de nyid yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dang / 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can dang / rjes su srung ba'i chos can dang / gnas pa las mi g-yo ba dang /
translated: There are sixteen due to the specific abodes.

original: rtogs pa'i skal ba can dang / mi g-yo ba'i chos can zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩgnas gzhan gyi bye brag gis bcu drug go zhes bya ba ni tshangs ris la sogs pa 'og min la thug pa dag go //üîΩtshangs chen ni bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs kyis kyang gnas gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i skal ba can dang / mi g-yo ba'i chos can zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩgnas gzhan gyi bye brag gis bcu drug go zhes bya ba ni tshangs ris la sogs pa 'og min la thug pa dag go //üîΩtshangs chen ni bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs kyis kyang gnas gzhan ma yin la /
translated: There are twenty due to the specific abodes and intellectual faculty.

original: nyi 'og pa'i lugs kyis ni gnas gzhan nyid yin mod kyi der 'phags pa mi skye bas mi bgrang ste /
analyzed: nyi 'og pa'i lugs kyis ni gnas gzhan nyid yin mod kyi der 'phags pa mi skye bas mi bgrang ste /
translated: The AparƒÅntakas say that it is a different realm, but since ƒÅryas are not born there, it is not counted.

original: de ltar na gnas gzhan gyi bye brag gis bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba bcu drug yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gnas gzhan gyi bye brag gis bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba bcu drug yin no //
translated: Thus, there are sixteen types of intermediate nirvana due to the distinction of realms.üîΩThere are thirty-six due to the distinction of freedom from attachment to the levels.

original: sa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bye brag gis sum cu rtsa drug ste zhes bya ba ni sa'i bye brag dang de la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bye brag gis bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba sum cu rtsa drug go //
analyzed: sa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bye brag gis sum cu rtsa drug ste zhes bya ba ni sa'i bye brag dang de la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bye brag gis bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba sum cu rtsa drug go //
translated: There are thirty-six intermediate nirvana due to the distinction of the levels and the distinction of freedom from attachment to the levels.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung bas ston par byed de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung bas ston par byed de /
translated: It is explained in detail with the words: ‚ÄúOne who possesses all the bonds of the form realm...‚Äù

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan dang po'i 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa dang rnam pa gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba nas rnam pa brgyad las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar dgu'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan dang po'i 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa dang rnam pa gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba nas rnam pa brgyad las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar dgu'o //
translated: There are nine in the form realm: those who possess all the bonds of the first absorption and those who are free from attachment to one stage up to those who are free from attachment to eight stages.

original: gnyis pa'i yang 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa nas rnam pa brgyad las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar dgu'o //üîΩde bzhin du gsum pa'i dgu dang / de bzhin du bzhi pa'i dgu ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i yang 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa nas rnam pa brgyad las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar dgu'o // de bzhin du gsum pa'i dgu dang / de bzhin du bzhi pa'i dgu ste /
translated: There are nine in the second absorption: those who possess all the bonds and those who are free from attachment to one stage up to those who are free from attachment to eight stages.üîΩThere are nine in the third absorption and there are nine in the fourth absorption.

original: dgu bzhi sum cu rtsa drug yin no //üîΩbsam gtan bzhi pa'i rnam pa brgyad las @199a * //
analyzed: dgu bzhi sum cu rtsa drug yin no // bsam gtan bzhi pa'i rnam pa brgyad las @199a * //
translated: Thus there are thirty six in the four absorptions.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those who are free from attachment to the eight stages of the fourth absorption.

original: bar zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bsgres pa'i don 'di 'thob bo //
analyzed: bar zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bsgres pa'i don 'di 'thob bo //
translated: The word ‚Äúup to‚Äù in the root text has the meaning of ‚Äúincluding.‚Äù

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i dgu pa'i rnam pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes ni mi brjod de /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i dgu pa'i rnam pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes ni mi brjod de /
translated: One is not called ‚Äúfree from attachment to the ninth stage of the fourth absorption.‚Äù

original: 'di ni gzugs med pa'i 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs med pa'i 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: This is because they possess all the bonds of the formless realm.

original: 'dir ni gzugs med par 'gro ba'i dbang du byed pa ma yin gyi /üîΩsrid pa bar ma dang sbyar bas 'dir gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba rnams brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni gzugs med par 'gro ba'i dbang du byed pa ma yin gyi / srid pa bar ma dang sbyar bas 'dir gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba rnams brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But this is not from the perspective of those who proceed to the formless realm.üîΩHere, those who proceed to the form realm are mentioned because they are the focus of this discussion, since they are related to the intermediate state.

original: de lta yin pas gnas gzhan dang rigs dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang dbang po'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de lta yin pas gnas gzhan dang rigs dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang dbang po'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Since that is so, it is said:

original: gnas gzhan rnams dang / rigs rnams dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams dang / dbang po rnams kyi bye brag gis bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba de dag nyis stong lnga brgya dgu bcu rtsa gnyis yin te /
analyzed: gnas gzhan rnams dang / rigs rnams dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams dang / dbang po rnams kyi bye brag gis bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba de dag nyis stong lnga brgya dgu bcu rtsa gnyis yin te /
translated: Those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state are 2,592 due to the distinctions of realm, type, freedom from attachment and intellectual faculty.

original: rtsa dgu bcu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: rtsa dgu bcu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: There are 92 roots.

original: ji ltar byas pas de ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas de ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How do they become that way?

original: smras pa / gnas gcig na ste /
analyzed: smras pa / gnas gcig na ste /
translated: It is said: In one realm.

original: dper na tshangs ris lta bu na yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rigs drug go //
analyzed: dper na tshangs ris lta bu na yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rigs drug go //
translated: For example, in the Brahma realm, there are six types due to the distinctions of those who fully degenerate and so on.

original: rigs re re la zhes bya ba ni zlog pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs re re la zhes bya ba ni zlog pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfor each of the lineages‚Äù is a reversal of the order of the text.

original: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa nas rang gi gnas dper na tshangs ris lta bu'i rnam pa brgyad las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar gang zag dgu dgu'o //
analyzed: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa nas rang gi gnas dper na tshangs ris lta bu'i rnam pa brgyad las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar gang zag dgu dgu'o //
translated: There are nine types of persons, ranging from one who possesses all of the fetters up to one who is free from attachment to the highest realm of the form realm.

original: rigs dang ldan pa'i gang zag dgu dgu smos pa'i phyir dgu drug ni lnga bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: rigs dang ldan pa'i gang zag dgu dgu smos pa'i phyir dgu drug ni lnga bcu bzhi'o //
translated: Since there are nine types of persons for each of the lineages, there are fifty-four types of persons.

original: gnas gzhan bcu drug smos pa'i phyir lnga bcu rtsa bzhi phrag bcu drug na brgyad brgya drug cu rtsa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gnas gzhan bcu drug smos pa'i phyir lnga bcu rtsa bzhi phrag bcu drug na brgyad brgya drug cu rtsa bzhi ste /
translated: Since there are sixteen different abodes, there are eight hundred and sixty-four types of persons.

original: rtsa drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: rtsa drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: Thus, there are sixty-four types of persons.

original: yang dbang po bye brag gis gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dbang po bye brag gis gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, there are three types of persons based on their faculties:

original: chung ngu dang 'bring dang / chen po'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: chung ngu dang 'bring dang / chen po'i bye brag gis so //
translated: those with dull faculties, those with sharp faculties, and those with dull and sharp faculties.

original: de ltar byas pas so //
analyzed: de ltar byas pas so //
translated: This is the way it is.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: nyis stong lnga brgya dgu bcu rtsa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: nyis stong lnga brgya dgu bcu rtsa gnyis yin no //
translated: There are two thousand, five hundred and ninety-two types of persons.

original: tshul gang gis 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa nas rnam pa brgyad las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar gang zag dgu dgur rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshul gang gis 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa nas rnam pa brgyad las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar gang zag dgu dgur rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The nine types of person from one who possesses all the bonds up to one who is free from attachment to the eighth stage are posited.

original: bsam gtan 'og ma'i zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /üîΩbsam gtan 'og ma ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan 'og ma'i zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te / bsam gtan 'og ma ste /
translated: To explain that, he says,

original: dang po nas gsum pa'i bar gyi rnam pa dgu las 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni bsam gtan gong ma ste /
analyzed: dang po nas gsum pa'i bar gyi rnam pa dgu las 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni bsam gtan gong ma ste /
translated: One who is free from attachment to the nine types of lower meditative stabilization possesses all the bonds of higher meditative stabilization.üîΩLower meditative stabilization refers to the first to third absorptions.üîΩOne who is free from attachment to the nine types of lower meditative stabilization possesses all the bonds of higher meditative stabilization.

original: @199b gnyis pa nas bzhi pa'i bar gyi 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: @199b gnyis pa nas bzhi pa'i bar gyi 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Higher meditative stabilization refers to the second to fourth absorptions.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dra bar brtsi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: 'dra bar brtsi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: He says, because they are counted as similar.

original: ci nas kyang bsam gtan bzhi pa na dgu dgur 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci nas kyang bsam gtan bzhi pa na dgu dgur 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to count the fourth absorption as nine types,

original: gzhan du na mi 'dra bar brtsis par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na mi 'dra bar brtsis par 'gyur te /
translated: otherwise they would be counted as dissimilar.

original: bsam gtan dang po na 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa nas rnam pa dgu las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar bcur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po na 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa nas rnam pa dgu las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar bcur 'gyur ro //
translated: In the first absorption, there are ten types of beings: those who possess all the ties bandhana, those who are free from one type of affliction, up to those who are free from nine types of affliction.

original: gnyis pa ni rnam pa gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba nas rnam pa dgu las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar dgur 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rnam pa gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba nas rnam pa dgu las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar dgur 'gyur te /
translated: In the second absorption, there are nine types of beings: those who are free from one type of affliction up to those who are free from nine types of affliction.

original: gsum pa na yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gsum pa na yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same applies to the third absorption.

original: bzhi pa na ni rnam pa gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba nas rnam pa brgyad las 'dod chags las bral ba'i bar brgyad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bzhi pa na ni rnam pa gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba nas rnam pa brgyad las 'dod chags las bral ba'i bar brgyad du 'gyur te /
translated: In the fourth absorption, there are eight types of beings: those who are free from one type of affliction up to those who are free from eight types of affliction.

original: rnam pa dgu las 'dod chags dang bral ba ni gzugs med pa'i 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: rnam pa dgu las 'dod chags dang bral ba ni gzugs med pa'i 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: Those who are free from nine types of affliction possess all the ties of the formless realm.

original: gong du 'pho ba'i bar du yang de dang 'dra bas zhes bya ba ni skyes nas dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa dang mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / gong du 'pho ba rnams kyang gnas gzhan dang / rigs dang /
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba'i bar du yang de dang 'dra bas zhes bya ba ni skyes nas dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa dang mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / gong du 'pho ba rnams kyang gnas gzhan dang / rigs dang /

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i rnam pa brgyad kyi bar zad par byed pa nas srid rtse'i bar cha brgyad zad pa ste /
translated: This is the exhaustion of the eight aspects of the summit of existence up to the exhaustion of the eight aspects of the summit of existence.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i rnam pa brgyad kyi bar zad par yang byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;üîΩ; phyir mi 'ong ba de bsam gtan dang po'i rnam pa gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba nas bzung ste zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral bas phyir mi 'ong ba rnam par gzhag pa de'i phyir de yan chad ni
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i rnam pa brgyad kyi bar zad par yang byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ; ; phyir mi 'ong ba de bsam gtan dang po'i rnam pa gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba nas bzung ste zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral bas phyir mi 'ong ba rnam par gzhag pa de'i phyir de yan chad ni
translated: It is the exhaustion of the eight aspects of the summit of existence up to the exhaustion of the eight aspects of the summit of existence.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: The non-returner who is free from attachment to one stage of the first absorption and so on is one who enters the result of an arhat because he is free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: @200a * // ji ltar rdo rjes thams cad 'joms pa de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin 'dis kyang bra rgyas thams cad 'joms pas mthu'i sgo nas 'di rdo rje dang 'dra bas na rdo rje lta bu yin no //
analyzed: @200a * // ji ltar rdo rjes thams cad 'joms pa de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin 'dis kyang bra rgyas thams cad 'joms pas mthu'i sgo nas 'di rdo rje dang 'dra bas na rdo rje lta bu yin no //
translated: Just as a diamond destroys all gems, so too this concentration destroys all afflictions.

original: bcom zin pa'i phyir 'dis thams cad 'joms pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod pa na spyod pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i rnam pa brgyad kyi bar dag go //
analyzed: bcom zin pa'i phyir 'dis thams cad 'joms pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod pa na spyod pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i rnam pa brgyad kyi bar dag go //
translated: Because it has already been destroyed, it does not destroy all because it does not destroy the eight types of objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing in the three realms and the eight types of objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the desire realm up to the summit of existence.

original: gal te thams cad mi 'joms na ci'i phyir phra rgyas thams cad 'joms pa yin zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad mi 'joms na ci'i phyir phra rgyas thams cad 'joms pa yin zhes bya zhe na /
translated: If it does not destroy all, why is it called the destroyer of all negative tendencies?

original: de'i phyir thams cad 'joms par nus pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad 'joms par nus pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, it is able to destroy all.üîΩIt is said that it is able to destroy all because it is able to destroy the summit of existence.

original: srid pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad do snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: srid pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad do snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: It is said that it is able to destroy all because it is able to destroy the summit of existence.

original: mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid ni sa dgu po mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / srid pa'i rtse mo ma gtogs pa gzugs med pa gsum la brten nas 'thob ste /
analyzed: mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid ni sa dgu po mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / srid pa'i rtse mo ma gtogs pa gzugs med pa gsum la brten nas 'thob ste /
translated: The state of an arhat is obtained in dependence on nine levels: unrestricted access concentration to the first absorption, special absorption, the four absorptions, and the three formless states, excluding the summit of existence.

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar spros so //üîΩsdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa brgyad ces bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i sdug bsngal la dmigs pa rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar spros so // sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa brgyad ces bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i sdug bsngal la dmigs pa rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi dang /
translated: Therefore, it is elaborated in this way.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i kun 'byung ba la dmigs pa rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa gzhan bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi ste brgyad do //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i kun 'byung ba la dmigs pa rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa gzhan bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi ste brgyad do //
translated: Eight associated with the aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truths of suffering and origin are associated with the four aspects of subsequent knowledge that focus on the suffering of the summit of existence and four associated with the four other aspects of subsequent knowledge that focus on the origin of the summit of existence.

original: 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa brgyad ces bya ba la'ang de kho na bzhin du brjod par bya ste /üîΩbsgom pa'i lam la 'gog pa'am //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa brgyad ces bya ba la'ang de kho na bzhin du brjod par bya ste / bsgom pa'i lam la 'gog pa'am //
translated: Eight associated with the aspects of Dharma knowledge of the truths of cessation and path are also explained in the same way.üîΩAny Dharma knowledge of cessation or

original: lam la chos shes gang yin te //
analyzed: lam la chos shes gang yin te //
translated: path on the path of meditation

original: khams gsum gyi ni gnyen po yin //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi ni gnyen po yin //
translated: is an antidote to the three realms.

original: zhes 'byung bas 'dir de gnyis kho na nye bar dgod kyi sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la chos shes pa dag ni mi gzung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas 'dir de gnyis kho na nye bar dgod kyi sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la chos shes pa dag ni mi gzung ngo //
translated: Therefore only those two are set forth here, but the Dharma knowledge of the truths of suffering and origin are not included.

original: de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i bar du zhes bya ba la /üîΩbar du zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ji ltar bsam gtan dang po'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi yin pa de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / @200b bzhi pa dang / nam mkha' dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i bar du zhes bya ba la / bar du zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ji ltar bsam gtan dang po'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi yin pa de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / @200b bzhi pa dang / nam mkha' dang /
