translated: Similarly, up to the aspects focusing on the cessation of the summit of existence.üîΩThe word up to indicates that just as there are four aspects and so on that are concomitant with the aspects focusing on the cessation of the first absorption, so too there are four each that focus on the cessation of the second, third, fourth absorptions, the base of infinite space,

original: rnam shes dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa dag kyang so sor bzhi bzhi yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam shes dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa dag kyang so sor bzhi bzhi yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: the base of infinite consciousness, the base of nothingness and the summit of existence.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba 'di ni so so'i lam la dmigs pa rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi bzhi zhes mi brjod do //
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba 'di ni so so'i lam la dmigs pa rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi bzhi zhes mi brjod do //
translated: This does not say that there are four associated with each aspect of subsequent knowledge that focuses on the individual path.

original: ci'i phyir lam la zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lam la zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the path?

original: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun par zad pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun par zad pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Because it focuses on the elimination of the aspects of subsequent knowledge.

original: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam ni gnyen po'i ngo bor yang khyad par med la lam ni phan tshun gyi rgyu yang yin pas ril kho na la dmigs kyi 'gog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam ni gnyen po'i ngo bor yang khyad par med la lam ni phan tshun gyi rgyu yang yin pas ril kho na la dmigs kyi 'gog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The path that is compatible with subsequent knowledge is not distinguished in terms of its essential antidote. Since the path is the mutual cause of the path, it focuses on the whole path, but it does not focus on cessation.

original: de'i phyir lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni bzhi kho nar zad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni bzhi kho nar zad do //
translated: Therefore there are only four associated with the aspects of subsequent knowledge of the path.

original: de dag ni shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang dmigs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag dang / dmigs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang dmigs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag dang / dmigs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa'o //
translated: They are differentiated by the specific aspects and objects of consciousness.

original: yang na shes pa rnams dang rnam pa rnams dang / dmigs pa rnams kyi bye brag gis tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: yang na shes pa rnams dang rnam pa rnams dang / dmigs pa rnams kyi bye brag gis tha dad pa ste /
translated: They are differentiated by the specific aspects of consciousness, by the specific objects, and by the specific consciousnesses, aspects, and objects.

original: re zhig shes pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re zhig shes pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are differentiated by the specific aspects of consciousness, because they are described as ‚Äúthe aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truths of suffering and origin,‚Äù and so on.

original: dmigs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa yang srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la dmigs pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa yang srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la dmigs pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are differentiated by the specific objects, because they are described as ‚Äúhaving suffering and origin as their objects in the summit of existence,‚Äù and so on.üîΩThey are the fifty-two that are mentioned in the Abhidharmasamuccaya.

original: lnga bcu rtsa gnyis yin no zhes bya ba ni dang po brgyad tshan gnyis te /
analyzed: lnga bcu rtsa gnyis yin no zhes bya ba ni dang po brgyad tshan gnyis te /
translated: The first are the two sets of eight.

original: bcu drug dang / bsam gtan dang po'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa bzhi nas lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi'i bar du bzhi tshan dgu la sum cu rtsa drug ste /
analyzed: bcu drug dang / bsam gtan dang po'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa bzhi nas lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi'i bar du bzhi tshan dgu la sum cu rtsa drug ste /
translated: There are thirty six: four sets of nine, from the four concomitant with the aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truth of path that focus on the sixteen moments of subsequent knowledge and the four that focus on the first absorption's state of nondiscernment.

original: bcu drug dang sum cu rtsa drug ni lnga bcu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcu drug dang sum cu rtsa drug ni lnga bcu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus there are sixteen and thirty six, making fifty two.

original: mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa ji lta bar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dngos gzhi'i bsam gtan la ma brten cing ma zhugs par skye bas na mi lcogs pa med pas te /üîΩbshad ma thag pa'i rnam pa gang gis mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa'i rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin lnga bcu rtsa gnyis @201a * //
analyzed: mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa ji lta bar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dngos gzhi'i bsam gtan la ma brten cing ma zhugs par skye bas na mi lcogs pa med pas te / bshad ma thag pa'i rnam pa gang gis mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa'i rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin lnga bcu rtsa gnyis @201a * //
translated: Just as the formless realm is subsumed by the unrestricted state,üîΩthe vajra like concentration subsumed by the unrestricted state is fifty two.

original: yin pa'i rnam pa de nyid kyi bsam gtan khyad par can gyis bsdus pa yang lnga bcu rtsa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: yin pa'i rnam pa de nyid kyi bsam gtan khyad par can gyis bsdus pa yang lnga bcu rtsa gnyis yin no //
translated: The vajra like concentration subsumed by the special actual basis of absorption is also fifty two.

original: ji ltar shes pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes pas she na /
translated: How is this known?

original: bsam gtan khyad par can gyis bsdus pa srid pa'i rtse mo ba'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la dmigs pa sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa brgyad dang / 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa brgyad dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can gyis bsdus pa srid pa'i rtse mo ba'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la dmigs pa sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa brgyad dang / 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa brgyad dang /
translated: Eight are concomitant with the aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truths of suffering and origin that focus on the suffering and origin of the summit of existence subsumed by special absorption.üîΩEight are concomitant with the aspects of Dharma knowledge of the truths of cessation and path and four are concomitant with the aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation that focus on the cessa

original: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bsam gtan dang po'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa bzhi nas de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i bar du bzhi dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bsam gtan dang po'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa bzhi nas de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i bar du bzhi dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi ste /
translated: tion of the first absorption and so on up to the four that focus on the cessation of the summit of existence and four are concomitant with the aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truth of path.

original: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa zad par la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa zad par la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They focus on the aspects of subsequent knowledge and the summit of existence.

original: de dag ni shes pa'i rnam pa dang / dmigs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa'i phyir lnga bcu rtsa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni shes pa'i rnam pa dang / dmigs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa'i phyir lnga bcu rtsa gnyis yin no //
translated: They are fifty-two because they are differentiated by the aspects and objects of consciousness.

original: bsam gtan khyad par can gyis bsdus pa ji lta ba de bzhin du bsam gtan dang pos bsdus pa lnga bcu rtsa gnyis yin pa nas bsam gtan bzhi pas bsdus pa'i bar du lnga bcu rtsa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can gyis bsdus pa ji lta ba de bzhin du bsam gtan dang pos bsdus pa lnga bcu rtsa gnyis yin pa nas bsam gtan bzhi pas bsdus pa'i bar du lnga bcu rtsa gnyis yin no //
translated: Just as they are included in the special meditative stabilization, so they are included in the first meditative stabilization, and so on, up to the fourth meditative stabilization.

original: grangs bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyis bsdus pa ni nyi shu rtsa brgyad do //
analyzed: grangs bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyis bsdus pa ni nyi shu rtsa brgyad do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin accordance with the number‚Äù is explained in detail. They are included in the base of infinite space.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyis bsdus pa ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyis bsdus pa ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: They are included in the base of infinite consciousness.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa ni nyi shu'o //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa ni nyi shu'o //
translated: They are included in the base of nothingness.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo na ni 'phags pa'i lam med pas des bsdus pa med pa'i phyir mi bsam mo //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo na ni 'phags pa'i lam med pas des bsdus pa med pa'i phyir mi bsam mo //
translated: They are not considered in the peak of cyclic existence because the noble path is absent there and they are not included in it.

original: de dag na chos shes pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni chos shes pa ni sa drug pa yin pa'i phyir de lta bas na 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa brgyad med do //
analyzed: de dag na chos shes pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni chos shes pa ni sa drug pa yin pa'i phyir de lta bas na 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa brgyad med do //
translated: Since Dharma knowledge is on the sixth level, there are no eight that are concomitant with the aspects of Dharma knowledge of the truths of cessation and path.

original: rjes su shes pas sa 'og ma'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa med pa'i phyir 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bsam gtan bzhi'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa bcu drug kyang med pas nyi shu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rjes su shes pas sa 'og ma'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa med pa'i phyir 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bsam gtan bzhi'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa bcu drug kyang med pas nyi shu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur te /
translated: Since subsequent knowledge does not focus on the truth of cessation of lower level, there are also no sixteen that focus on the cessation of the four absorptions and are concomitant with the aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation.üîΩThus there are twenty eight.

original: lnga bcu rtsa gnyis las brgya dang bcu drug de ltar bor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lnga bcu rtsa gnyis las brgya dang bcu drug de ltar bor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are subtracted from fifty two and one hundred and sixteen.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyis bsdus pa @201b srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la rjes su shes ba'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa brgyad do //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyis bsdus pa @201b srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la rjes su shes ba'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa brgyad do //
translated: There are eight that are concomitant with the aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truths of suffering and origin that are subsumed by the base of infinite space and the summit of existence.

original: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa bcu drug dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa bcu drug dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi ste /
translated: The sixteen focusing on the cessation of the base of infinite space and so on that are concomitant with the aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation and the four concomitant with the aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truth of path.üîΩ

original: de dag ni shes pa'i rnam pa dang / dmigs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa'i phyir nyi shu rtsa brgyad yin no //üîΩde bzhin du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyis bsdus pa ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi 'gog pa la dmigs pa bzhi bor nas nyi shu rtsa bzhi yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag ni shes pa'i rnam pa dang / dmigs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa'i phyir nyi shu rtsa brgyad yin no // de bzhin du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyis bsdus pa ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi 'gog pa la dmigs pa bzhi bor nas nyi shu rtsa bzhi yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The sixteen that focus on the cessation of the base of infinite space and so on concomitant with the aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation and the four concomitant with the aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truth of path are distinct because they are differentiated by the aspects and focal objects of knowledge.üîΩThus there are twenty eight.üîΩSimilarly, those subsumed by the base of infinite consciousness are twenty four, excluding the four that focus on the cessation of the base of infinite space.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa ni rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi 'gog pa la dmigs pa gzhan bzhi yang bor nas nyi shu yin no /
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa ni rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi 'gog pa la dmigs pa gzhan bzhi yang bor nas nyi shu yin no /
translated: Those subsumed by the base of nothingness are twenty, excluding the other four that focus on the cessation of the base of infinite consciousness.

original: yang ci'i phyir gzugs med pa rnams rang gi sa dang sa gong ma pa kho na'i 'gog pa la dmigs kyi /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir gzugs med pa rnams rang gi sa dang sa gong ma pa kho na'i 'gog pa la dmigs kyi /
translated: Why do the formless realm meditative attainments focus on the cessation of their own level and higher levels,

original: bsam gtan bzhin du sa 'og pa ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhin du sa 'og pa ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: but not on lower levels, as do the absorptions?

original: sa 'og ma'i sdug bsngal la ma dmigs par de'i 'gog pa la dmigs par mi nus so //
analyzed: sa 'og ma'i sdug bsngal la ma dmigs par de'i 'gog pa la dmigs par mi nus so //
translated: One cannot focus on the cessation of a lower level without focusing on the suffering of that level.

original: sdug bsngal yang thams cad zag pa dang bcas pa yin la /üîΩgzugs med rnam bzhi dge rnams kyi //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang thams cad zag pa dang bcas pa yin la / gzugs med rnam bzhi dge rnams kyi //
translated: Also, all suffering is contaminated.üîΩThe formless realm is not the domain

original: spyod yul zag bcas 'og ma yin //
analyzed: spyod yul zag bcas 'og ma yin //
translated: of contaminated lower levels.

original: zhes bya ba 'di yang nges pas 'di ni rgyu yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di yang nges pas 'di ni rgyu yin no //
translated: This is also ascertained.

original: bsam gtan rnams ni kun du lta ba yin pa'i phyir mi dgag ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams ni kun du lta ba yin pa'i phyir mi dgag ste /
translated: The absorptions are not blocked because they are pervasive.

original: bsam gtan dge yul yod dgu yin //
analyzed: bsam gtan dge yul yod dgu yin //
translated: It is said that the domain of virtue of the absorptions is all.

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //üîΩyang ci'i phyir 'gog pa kho na la dmigs kyi sdug bsngal lam kun 'byung ba la ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro // yang ci'i phyir 'gog pa kho na la dmigs kyi sdug bsngal lam kun 'byung ba la ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: This will be explained.üîΩWhy do they focus on cessation alone and not on the truths of suffering or origin?

original: srid pa'i rtse mo man chad kyi sa las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo man chad kyi sa las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are free from attachment to all levels below the summit of existence.

original: de la ni srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i rnam pa dgu pa rdo rje lta bus gzhom par bya ba kho na lus so //üîΩsa 'og ma pa'i gnyen po la dmigs pa ni yod de zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i dbang du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: de la ni srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i rnam pa dgu pa rdo rje lta bus gzhom par bya ba kho na lus so // sa 'og ma pa'i gnyen po la dmigs pa ni yod de zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i dbang du byas pa yin te /
translated: The remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.üîΩThe remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.üîΩThe remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.üîΩThe remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.

original: de yang rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan par rig par bya'o //üîΩgnyen po de ni phan tshun du rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de yang rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan par rig par bya'o // gnyen po de ni phan tshun du rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.

original: sa dgu'i lam ni phan tshun du //
analyzed: sa dgu'i lam ni phan tshun du //
translated: The remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.üîΩThe remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.üîΩThe remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.üîΩThe remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.üîΩThe remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.üîΩThe remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.üîΩThe remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.üîΩThe remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.üîΩThe remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.üîΩThe remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.üîΩThe remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.üîΩThe remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.üîΩThe remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.üîΩThe remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.üîΩThe remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.üîΩThe remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.üîΩThe remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.üîΩThe remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.üîΩThe remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.üîΩThe remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.üîΩThe remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.üîΩThe remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.

original: mnyam dang khyad par can dag gi / zhes bya ba'i phyir lam la rjes su shes pa thams cad ni rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa sa dgu pa'i dmigs pa @202a * //üîΩyin no // gang dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni chos mngon pa gang dag 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: mnyam dang khyad par can dag gi / zhes bya ba'i phyir lam la rjes su shes pa thams cad ni rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa sa dgu pa'i dmigs pa @202a * //üîΩyin no // gang dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni chos mngon pa gang dag 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: The remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vajra like fourth absorption.üîΩThe remaining aspects are to be conquered by the vaj

original: lam la rjes su shes pa yang sa re re'i gnyen po la dmigs pa yin par 'dod pa de dag gi ltar na nyi shu rtsa brgyad lhag par bsnan na mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa'i rdo rje lta bu ni brgyad cu yin no //
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa yang sa re re'i gnyen po la dmigs pa yin par 'dod pa de dag gi ltar na nyi shu rtsa brgyad lhag par bsnan na mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa'i rdo rje lta bu ni brgyad cu yin no //
translated: If one adds twenty eight to that, then the vajra like concentrations subsumed by unrestricted access concentration are eighty.

original: ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: How is this calculated?

original: snga ma ltar na rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa zad par la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: snga ma ltar na rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa zad par la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi yin no //
translated: If it is calculated according to the former system, then it is four since it is concomitant with the four aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truth of path, because it focuses on the limit of exhaustion of the side of subsequent knowledge.

original: da ni kha cig gi gzhung lugs kyis sa re re'i gnyen po la dmigs pa yin par yang rnam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: da ni kha cig gi gzhung lugs kyis sa re re'i gnyen po la dmigs pa yin par yang rnam par 'jog ste /
translated: Now, according to the textual system of some, it is also posited that it focuses on the antidote to each level.

original: mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa bsam gtan dang po'i gnyen po la dmigs pa /
analyzed: mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa bsam gtan dang po'i gnyen po la dmigs pa /
translated: The vajra like concentration subsumed by unrestricted access concentration focuses on the antidote to the first absorption.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi nas /
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi nas /
translated: It is concomitant with the four aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truth of path.

original: de bzhin du ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi gnyen po la dmigs pa lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bar du bzhi ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi gnyen po la dmigs pa lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bar du bzhi ste /
translated: So too, there are four aspects concomitant with the aspect of subsequent knowledge of the truth of path that focuses on the antidote to the base of nothingness.

original: de ltar na nyi shu rtsa brgyad lhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na nyi shu rtsa brgyad lhag pa yin no //
translated: Thus there are twenty eight more.

original: lnga bcu rtsa gnyis la nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyis lhag par bsnan na brgyad cur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lnga bcu rtsa gnyis la nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyis lhag par bsnan na brgyad cur 'gyur ro //
translated: When twenty eight are added to fifty two, there are eighty.

original: yang ci'i phyir srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po la dmigs pa lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi mi bgrang zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po la dmigs pa lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi mi bgrang zhe na /
translated: Why are the four aspects concomitant with the aspect of subsequent knowledge of the truth of path that focus on the antidote to the summit of existence not counted?

original: smras pa / zag pa med pa'i lam srid pa'i rtse mo'i bsdus pa srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po ni med kyi /
analyzed: smras pa / zag pa med pa'i lam srid pa'i rtse mo'i bsdus pa srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po ni med kyi /
translated: The uncontaminated path subsumed by the summit of existence is not the antidote to the summit of existence.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyis pa'i bar ni yod de /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyis pa'i bar ni yod de /
translated: But it is the antidote to the first absorption up to the base of nothingness.

original: de lta bas na de dag gi gnyen po la dmigs pa kho na bshad kyi srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po la dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag gi gnyen po la dmigs pa kho na bshad kyi srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po la dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is said that they focus on their antidote alone, but not on the antidote of the summit of existence.

original: gzhan dag 'chad pa ni gang dag lam la rjes su shes pa yang sa re re'i gnyen po la dmigs pa yin par 'dod pa ni 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'dod pa zhes bya bar bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag 'chad pa ni gang dag lam la rjes su shes pa yang sa re re'i gnyen po la dmigs pa yin par 'dod pa ni 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'dod pa zhes bya bar bsam pa yin no //
translated: Others explain that those who assert that subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path focuses on the antidote of each level are similar to those who assert that subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation focuses on the antidote of the summit of existence.

original: de dag gi ltar na srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa brgyad dang / 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa brgyad dang /
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa brgyad dang / 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa brgyad dang /
translated: According to them, there are eight that are concomitant with the aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering and origin of the summit of existence and eight that are concomitant with the aspects of Dharma knowledge of the truths of cessation and path.

original: @202b 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bsam gtan dang po'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa bzhi nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i bar du bzhi ste sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / de bzhin du lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang de dang 'dra bar sum cu rtsa gnyis yin pas mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa rdo rje lta bu ni brgyad cu yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: @202b 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bsam gtan dang po'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa bzhi nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i bar du bzhi ste sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / de bzhin du lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang de dang 'dra bar sum cu rtsa gnyis yin pas mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa rdo rje lta bu ni brgyad cu yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: There are four that focus on the first absorption's cessation and so on up to four that focus on the peak of existence's cessation.üîΩSimilarly, there are thirty two that are concomitant with the aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truth of path.üîΩThus there are eighty vajra like concentrations subsumed by unrestricted access concentration.

original: de dag gi ltar na rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun par zad par la dmigs pa'i phyir lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi po gang dag yin pa dag ni med kyi de dag gi gor srid pa'i rtse mo'i
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun par zad par la dmigs pa'i phyir lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi po gang dag yin pa dag ni med kyi de dag gi gor srid pa'i rtse mo'i
translated: According to them, there are no four that are concomitant with the aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truth of path because they focus on the limit of exhaustion in the context of subsequent knowledge.

original: gnyen po la dmigs pa dag yod pas 'dir rdo rje lta bu brgyad cu yin no //
analyzed: gnyen po la dmigs pa dag yod pas 'dir rdo rje lta bu brgyad cu yin no //
translated: Thus, there are eighty vajra-like concentrations.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pas bsdus pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pas bsdus pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same holds for the concentrations included in the other three meditative concentrations.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this so?

original: nyi shu rtsa brgyad lhag par bsnan nas bsam gtan khyad par can gyis bsdus pa'i rdo rje lta bu brgyad cu yin no //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa brgyad lhag par bsnan nas bsam gtan khyad par can gyis bsdus pa'i rdo rje lta bu brgyad cu yin no //
translated: By adding twenty-eight to the number of vajra-like concentrations included in the special meditative concentration, there are eighty vajra-like concentrations.

original: bsam gtan khyad par can gyis bsdus pa ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can gyis bsdus pa ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the special meditative concentration is included,

original: bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pas bsdus pa'i rdo rje lta bu yang brgyad cu yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pas bsdus pa'i rdo rje lta bu yang brgyad cu yin no //
translated: so too the first, second, third, and fourth meditative concentrations are included.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa dag ni zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo ma gtogs pa'i gzugs med pa gsum po dag na ni go rims bzhin du bzhi bcu dang / sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / nyi shu rtsa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa dag ni zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo ma gtogs pa'i gzugs med pa gsum po dag na ni go rims bzhin du bzhi bcu dang / sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / nyi shu rtsa bzhi yin no //
translated: In the three formless meditative attainments, beginning with the sense field of infinite space, there are, respectively, forty, thirty-two, and twenty-four.

original: ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: How is this so?

original: re zhig nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin nyi shu rtsa brgyad la nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi gnyen po la dmigs pa lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi nas ci yang
analyzed: re zhig nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin nyi shu rtsa brgyad la nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi gnyen po la dmigs pa lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi nas ci yang
translated: For a while, the vajra like concentration of the base of infinite space has forty aspects.

original: med pa'i skye mched kyi gnyen po la dmigs pa'i bar bzhis bsnan te /
analyzed: med pa'i skye mched kyi gnyen po la dmigs pa'i bar bzhis bsnan te /
translated: It is concomitant with the four aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truth of path that focus on the antidote to the base of infinite space and so on, up to the four aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truth of path that focus on the antidote to the base of nothingness.

original: bcu gnyis kyis bsnan na bzhi bcur 'gyur ro //üîΩde bzhin du nyi shu rtsa bzhi la ni rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi gnyen po la dmigs pa bzhi dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi gnyen po la dmigs pa bzhis bsnan nas sum cu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcu gnyis kyis bsnan na bzhi bcur 'gyur ro // de bzhin du nyi shu rtsa bzhi la ni rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi gnyen po la dmigs pa bzhi dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi gnyen po la dmigs pa bzhis bsnan nas sum cu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: When these twelve are added to the previous twenty eight, there are forty.üîΩSimilarly, the vajra like concentration of the base of infinite consciousness has thirty two aspects.üîΩIt is concomitant with the four aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truth of path that focus on the antidote to the base of infinite consciousness and the four aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truth of path that focus on the antidote to the base of nothingness.üîΩSimilarly, the vajra like concentration of the base of nothingness has twenty four aspects.

original: de bzhin du nyi shu la ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi gnyen po la dmigs pa gnyen po bzhis bsnan nas nyi shu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyi shu la ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi gnyen po la dmigs pa gnyen po bzhis bsnan nas nyi shu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: It is concomitant with the four aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truth of path that focus on the antidote to the base of nothingness.

original: @203a * // smras pa /
analyzed: @203a * // smras pa /
translated: He says:

original: sa 'og ma'i gnyen po la dmigs pa ni yod de /
analyzed: sa 'og ma'i gnyen po la dmigs pa ni yod de /
translated: It is said that the path of meditation focuses on the antidote of lower level,

original: de ni phan tshun rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa yin nam //üîΩyang ci'i phyir nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pas bsdus pa rang gi sa dang sa gong ma'i gnyen po la dmigs pa kho nar bshad kyi /
analyzed: de ni phan tshun rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa yin nam // yang ci'i phyir nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pas bsdus pa rang gi sa dang sa gong ma'i gnyen po la dmigs pa kho nar bshad kyi /
translated: because they are mutually concomitant causes.

original: sa 'og ma'i gnyen po la dmigs pa ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: sa 'og ma'i gnyen po la dmigs pa ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are the formless realm states that focus on the antidote of its level and higher levels alone explained, but not the antidote of lower levels?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: khyad par du ma byas par rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam sa dgu pa ni sa 'og ma'i gnyen po la dmigs pa yin no zhes bshad kyi /
analyzed: khyad par du ma byas par rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam sa dgu pa ni sa 'og ma'i gnyen po la dmigs pa yin no zhes bshad kyi /
translated: The path of seeing that is not differentiated and is compatible with subsequent knowledge focuses on the antidote of lower level.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pas bsdus pa sa 'og ma'i gnyen po la dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pas bsdus pa sa 'og ma'i gnyen po la dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The formless realm states that focus on the antidote of lower level are not explained.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: rang gi sa dang sa gong ma'i gnyen po kho na la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi sa dang sa gong ma'i gnyen po kho na la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: They focus on the antidote of its level and higher levels alone.

original: de la rjes su shes pa'i khyad par med pa'i ngo bor 'og ma la dmigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de la rjes su shes pa'i khyad par med pa'i ngo bor 'og ma la dmigs pa yin gyi /
translated: It focuses on lower levels without the specific state of subsequent knowledge.üîΩ

original: khyad par gyi ngo bor ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par gyi ngo bor ni ma yin no //
translated: It focuses on the lower level in the aspect of subsequent knowledge, not in the aspect of its specific level.üîΩIt focuses on its own level and higher levels in the aspect of its specific level.

original: rang gi sa dang sa gong ma la dmigs pa ni khyad par gyi ngo bor yang yin no zhes bya ba 'dir ni gzhan gyi gzhung lugs kyis bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi sa dang sa gong ma la dmigs pa ni khyad par gyi ngo bor yang yin no zhes bya ba 'dir ni gzhan gyi gzhung lugs kyis bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained according to the system of others.

original: snga ma ste rjes su shes pa ni rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa thams cad la ci'i ngo bo kho nar dmigs so zhes bya ba de ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi gzhag pa'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: snga ma ste rjes su shes pa ni rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa thams cad la ci'i ngo bo kho nar dmigs so zhes bya ba de ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi gzhag pa'i phyogs yin te /
translated: The former, that is, subsequent knowledge, focuses on all states that are compatible with subsequent knowledge in the aspect of subsequent knowledge alone.üîΩThis is the position of the Vaibhasikas.

original: 'di ltar slob dpon 'dus bzangs kyis lam la rjes su shes pa thams cad ni rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pas dgu pa'i dmigs pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar slob dpon 'dus bzangs kyis lam la rjes su shes pa thams cad ni rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pas dgu pa'i dmigs pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus Master Sanghabhadra explains: All subsequent knowledge of the truth of path focuses on the nine states that are compatible with subsequent knowledge.

original: gzhan dag ni 'di skad zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'di skad zer te /
translated: Others say:

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa brgyad dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi 'gog pa la dmigs pa bzhi nas srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i bar bzhi ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa brgyad dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi 'gog pa la dmigs pa bzhi nas srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i bar bzhi ste /
translated: Four are concomitant with the aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation that focus on the cessaüîΩtion of the base of infinite space up to the cessation of the summit of existence.

original: bcu drug dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi gnyen po la dmigs pa bzhi nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po la dmigs pa'i bar bzhi ste bcu drug go //
analyzed: bcu drug dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi gnyen po la dmigs pa bzhi nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po la dmigs pa'i bar bzhi ste bcu drug go //
translated: Sixteen are concomitant with the aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truth of path that focus on the antidote of the base of infinite space up to the antidote of the summit of existence.

original: de dag ni bcu drug phrag gnyis dang / sngar bshad pa'i brgyad nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i rdo rje lta bu bzhi @203b bcur 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni bcu drug phrag gnyis dang / sngar bshad pa'i brgyad nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i rdo rje lta bu bzhi @203b bcur 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: These are two sets of sixteen and the eight previously explained, making twenty four vajra like concentrations subsumed by the base of infinite space.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyis bsdus pa ni sum cu rtsa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyis bsdus pa ni sum cu rtsa gnyis te /
translated: The sphere of infinite consciousness includes thirty two.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi 'gog pa dang gnyen po la dmigs pa brgyad dor ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi 'gog pa dang gnyen po la dmigs pa brgyad dor ro //
translated: Eight are eliminated, since the meditative attainment of cessation and the antidote of the base of infinite space are not objects of the base of infinite consciousness.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi ste /
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi ste /
translated: The sphere of nothingness includes twenty four.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi 'gog pa dang / lam la dmigs pa gzhan brgyad kyang dor ro zhes zer te //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi 'gog pa dang / lam la dmigs pa gzhan brgyad kyang dor ro zhes zer te //
translated: Eight others are eliminated, since the meditative attainment of cessation and the path of the base of infinite consciousness are not objects of the base of nothingness.

original: de dag ni srid pa'i rtse mo la yang /
analyzed: de dag ni srid pa'i rtse mo la yang /
translated: They also say that the summit of existence

original: gnyen po'i lam sa 'og ma pa yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gnyen po'i lam sa 'og ma pa yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: has the path of the lower level as an antidote.

original: yang rigs dang dbang po'i bye brag gis ni ches mang ba yin no zhes bya ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang rigs dang dbang po'i bye brag gis ni ches mang ba yin no zhes bya ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that there are many more by the specific types and faculties?

original: re zhig thams cad kyi dang por brgyad bshad pa de dag las srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i sdug bsngal la dmigs pa mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rdo rje lta bu gang yin pa de rigs drug gi bye brag gis khyad par rnam pa
analyzed: re zhig thams cad kyi dang por brgyad bshad pa de dag las srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i sdug bsngal la dmigs pa mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rdo rje lta bu gang yin pa de rigs drug gi bye brag gis khyad par rnam pa
translated: From among those eight that are explained as the first of all, the vajra like concentration that is concomitant with the aspect of impermanence that focuses on the truth of suffering of the summit of existence has six types that are distinguished by the six types of lineage.

original: drug go // de bzhin du sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa gsum yang so sor khyad par rnam pa drug yin la /
analyzed: drug go // de bzhin du sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa gsum yang so sor khyad par rnam pa drug yin la /
translated: Similarly, the three that are concomitant with the aspects of the truth of suffering and so on are each distinguished by six types.

original: de dag kyang so sor dbang po chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i bye brag gis tha dad do //
analyzed: de dag kyang so sor dbang po chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i bye brag gis tha dad do //
translated: And each of those is differentiated by the specific distinctions of weak, medium and great faculty.

original: ji ltar 'di dag gi so sor rigs dang dbang po'i bye brag gis tha dad pa de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i kun 'byung ba la dmigs pa bzhi yang so sor rigs drug gi bye brag gis khyad par rnam pa drug yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di dag gi so sor rigs dang dbang po'i bye brag gis tha dad pa de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i kun 'byung ba la dmigs pa bzhi yang so sor rigs drug gi bye brag gis khyad par rnam pa drug yin la /
translated: Just as they are differentiated by the specific distinctions of lineage and faculty, so too the four that focus on the truth of origin of the summit of existence are each distinguished by six types that are distinguished by the six types of lineage.

original: dbang po gsum gyi bye brag gis khyad par rnam pa gsum yin no //üîΩji ltar brgyad po 'di dag rigs dang / dbang po'i bye brag gis so sor khyad par rnam pa drug dang / rnam pa gsum yin pa de bzhin du mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa shes pa'i rnam pa dang / dmigs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa dag nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i bar thams cad kyang rigs dang /
analyzed: dbang po gsum gyi bye brag gis khyad par rnam pa gsum yin no // ji ltar brgyad po 'di dag rigs dang / dbang po'i bye brag gis so sor khyad par rnam pa drug dang / rnam pa gsum yin pa de bzhin du mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa shes pa'i rnam pa dang / dmigs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa dag nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i bar thams cad kyang rigs dang /
translated: They are distinguished by the three faculties.üîΩJust as these eight are distinguished by the distinctions of lineage and faculty, so too, all the paths included in the stage of unrestricted access concentration are differentiated by the distinctions of their aspects and objects, and by the distinctions of lineage and faculty.

original: dbang po'i bye brag gis tha dad par lam 'dis sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i bye brag gis tha dad par lam 'dis sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The paths included in the stage of the first absorption are differentiated by the distinctions of lineage and faculty.

original: yang na 'di ltar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na 'di ltar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Or else, they should be applied in the following way.üîΩIn the first case, the paths included in the stage of unrestricted access concentration are differentiated by the distinctions of lineage and faculty.

original: phyogs dang po la mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa lnga bcu rtsa gnyis yin par rigs dang dbang po'i bye brag gis tha dad par lam 'dis sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs dang po la mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa lnga bcu rtsa gnyis yin par rigs dang dbang po'i bye brag gis tha dad par lam 'dis sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the second case, the paths included in the stage of the first absorption are differentiated by the distinctions of lineage and faculty.

original: phyogs dang po la mi lcogs pa med pa med pas bsdus pa lnga bcu rtsa gnyis yin pa ltar ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa nyi shu yin pa'i @204a * //
analyzed: phyogs dang po la mi lcogs pa med pa med pas bsdus pa lnga bcu rtsa gnyis yin pa ltar ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa nyi shu yin pa'i @204a * //
translated: The first possibility is the twenty bases subsumed by the base of infinite space, since the base of nothingness is not subsumed by the base of infinite space.üîΩ

original: bar yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: bar yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as the first case is subsumed by the fifty-two moments of the stage of patience of the path of seeing that is not subsumed by the stage of the supreme mundane state, the second case is subsumed by the twenty moments of the stage of patience of the path of seeing that is not subsumed by the base of nothingness.üîΩThe third case is subsumed by the twenty moments of the stage of patience of the path of seeing that is not subsumed by the base of nothingness.

original: spyir bsdus na rdo rje lta bu sum brgya brgyad cu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //üîΩde dag rigs dang dbang po'i bye brag gis drug 'gyur dang / sum 'gyur du bsgyur na drug stong dgu brgya rtsa bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyir bsdus na rdo rje lta bu sum brgya brgyad cu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro // de dag rigs dang dbang po'i bye brag gis drug 'gyur dang / sum 'gyur du bsgyur na drug stong dgu brgya rtsa bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: In general, the vajra like concentrations are subsumed by the three hundred and eighty four moments of the stage of patience of the path of seeing.üîΩIf they are multiplied by six and three in accordance with the different types and faculties, they become six thousand nine hundred and twelve.

original: phyogs gnyis pa la ni gang la dang po brgyad cu yin pa nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched la nyi shu rtsa bzhi yin pa'i bar gcig tu bsdoms na lnga brgya bdun cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la ni gang la dang po brgyad cu yin pa nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched la nyi shu rtsa bzhi yin pa'i bar gcig tu bsdoms na lnga brgya bdun cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: In the second case, if the first is subsumed by the eighty moments of the stage of patience of the path of seeing and the second is subsumed by the twenty four moments of the stage of patience of the path of seeing that is not subsumed by the base of nothingness, they are subsumed by five hundred and seventy six moments.

original: rigs dang dbang po'i bye brag gis drug 'gyur dang sum 'gyur du bsgyur na rdo rje lta bu khri sum brgya drug cu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs dang dbang po'i bye brag gis drug 'gyur dang sum 'gyur du bsgyur na rdo rje lta bu khri sum brgya drug cu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one multiplies by six or three according to the distinctions of lineage and faculties, the vajra-like concentrations are 13,800.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ni dang po nyid du zhes bya ba gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni dang po nyid du zhes bya ba gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the cognition of exhaustion?

original: dang po nyid du zag pa thams cad zad pa'i thob pa dang lhan cig skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dang po nyid du zag pa thams cad zad pa'i thob pa dang lhan cig skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it arises simultaneously with the attainment of the exhaustion of all contaminants.

original: gang gi phyir shes pa de dang po nyid du zag pa thams cad zad pa'i thob pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir zad pa shes pa zhes bya ste /üîΩbar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes pa de dang po nyid du zag pa thams cad zad pa'i thob pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir zad pa shes pa zhes bya ste / bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Because it arises simultaneously with the attainment of the exhaustion of all contaminants, that cognition is called the cognition of exhaustion.üîΩThe middle term is elided.

original: nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis so //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis so //
translated: Or, it is a case of etymology.

original: dang po nyid du zhes smos pa ni mi skye ba shes pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po nyid du zhes smos pa ni mi skye ba shes pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúfirst‚Äù is used to distinguish it from the cognition of nonarising.

original: thams cad ces smos pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i shes pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: thams cad ces smos pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i shes pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The term all is mentioned in order to distinguish it from the knowledge of stream enterers and so on.

original: sgra 'jug pa ni brda la ltos pas so //
analyzed: sgra 'jug pa ni brda la ltos pas so //
translated: The usage of terms depends on linguistic conventions.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni de rang gi don yongs su rdzogs pa na gzhan gyi don byed par 'os pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni de rang gi don yongs su rdzogs pa na gzhan gyi don byed par 'os pa'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore, because it is suitable to benefit others when one‚Äôs own purpose is fully accomplished,

original: gzhan gyi don byed par bshad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don byed par bshad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: it is explained as benefiting others.üîΩBecause it is worthy of worship by all who possess attachment,

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa thams cad kyis mchod par 'os pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la 'dod chags dang bcas pa ni so so'i skye bo dang slob pa rnams te ;
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa thams cad kyis mchod par 'os pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la 'dod chags dang bcas pa ni so so'i skye bo dang slob pa rnams te ;
translated: those who possess attachment are ordinary beings and those in training.

original: de dag thams cad kyis mchod par 'os pas dgra bcom pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyis mchod par 'os pas dgra bcom pa yin no //
translated: Because it is worthy of worship by all of them, it is arhatship.

original: grub po zhes bya ba ci grub ce na /
analyzed: grub po zhes bya ba ci grub ce na /
translated: What is accomplished?

original: gang zag sngar bshad pa gzhan bdun ni slob pa dag yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang zag sngar bshad pa gzhan bdun ni slob pa dag yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The other seven persons previously explained are learners.

original: 'bras bu la gnas pa gsum dang / zhugs pa bzhi bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu la gnas pa gsum dang / zhugs pa bzhi bshad pa yin te /
translated: The three who abide in the result and the four who enterüîΩare learners.

original: 'di kho na mi slob pa yin no zhes dmigs kyis bstsal ba'i phyir 'di las gzhan pa'i 'phags pa rnams ni slob pa yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: 'di kho na mi slob pa yin no zhes dmigs kyis bstsal ba'i phyir 'di las gzhan pa'i 'phags pa rnams ni slob pa yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Since it is specified that only this one is a nonlearner, it is established that other ƒÅryas are learners.

original: ci'i phyir slob pa yin zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gis na gang zag bdun po de dag slob pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir slob pa yin zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gis na gang zag bdun po de dag slob pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they learners?

original: zag pa zad par bya ba'i phyir rtag tu slob pa'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i @204b phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zag pa zad par bya ba'i phyir rtag tu slob pa'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i @204b phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: They are learners because they are always in the habit of learning to eliminate the contaminants.

original: 'di dag slob pa'i ngang tshul can yin pas na slob pa dag go //
analyzed: 'di dag slob pa'i ngang tshul can yin pas na slob pa dag go //
translated: They are learners since they are in the habit of learning.

original: gang la slob pa'i ngang tshul can yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang la slob pa'i ngang tshul can yin zhe na /
translated: In what are they in the habit of learning?

original: bslab pa gsum po la'o //
analyzed: bslab pa gsum po la'o //
translated: They are in the habit of learning the three trainings.

original: bslab pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: bslab pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are the three trainings?

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: They are higher morality, higher mind and higher wisdom.

original: de dag gi rang bzhin ci zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin ci zhe na /
translated: What is their nature?

original: tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi rang bzhin dag yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi rang bzhin dag yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: They are the nature of morality, meditative absorption, and wisdom.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims la slob pas na lhag pa'i tshul khrims la ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims la slob pas na lhag pa'i tshul khrims la ste /
translated: One trains in superior morality, therefore it is the training in superior morality.

original: de bzhin du lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bar la slob pas na lhag pa'i shes rab slob pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bar la slob pas na lhag pa'i shes rab slob pa'o //
translated: Similarly, one trains in superior wisdom, therefore it is the training in superior wisdom.

original: bslab pa gsum las tha mi dad pa'i phyir tshul khrims la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid bslab pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bslab pa gsum las tha mi dad pa'i phyir tshul khrims la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid bslab pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: The nature of morality, etc. is the training, because it is not distinct from the three trainings.

original: so so'i skye bo yang slob pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo yang ji skad bshad pa dag la slob pas so //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo yang slob pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo yang ji skad bshad pa dag la slob pas so //
translated: An ordinary person would also be a trainee, because an ordinary person also trains in what has been explained.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, because

original: bden pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mi shes pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni de ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: bden pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mi shes pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni de ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: an ordinary person does not know the four truths as they are.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dge slong dag 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis mthong ba gang yin pa de ni zhes 'byung bas sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mi shes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis mthong ba gang yin pa de ni zhes 'byung bas sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mi shes pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúMonks, that which is seen by the arya‚Äôs wisdom is not seen by the wisdom of those who are not aryas.‚ÄùüîΩüîΩThey do not know the truths of suffering and so on just as they are.

original: khong du ma chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khong du ma chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not fully understand the four noble truths, they do not know the four noble truths as they are in reality.

original: 'di ltar mdo las lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa rgya cher bshad nas lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo las lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa rgya cher bshad nas lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: The sutras explain in detail the higher training in ethics and the higher training in mind, and then say, What is the higher training in wisdom?

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa yin no zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes shing /
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa yin no zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes shing /
translated: It is the correct understanding that this is the noble truth of suffering,

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: this is the origin of suffering,

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
translated: this is the cessation of suffering,

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa yin no zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa yin no zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: and this is the noble truth of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.

original: de ltar bden pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar bden pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not know the truth of reality as it is.

original: gzhan yang slob pa gtong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan yang slob pa gtong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Moreover, because they abandon the training.

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yongs su gtong ba dang dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa las yongs su nyams pa'i sgo nas tshul khrims la sogs pa gang la bslab pa de la slob pa gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yongs su gtong ba dang dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa las yongs su nyams pa'i sgo nas tshul khrims la sogs pa gang la bslab pa de la slob pa gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they abandon the pratimoksa vow, and because they abandon the training in whatever morality, etc. they are training in, through the degeneration of the heat stage, etc.

original: 'phags pa ni chung zad gtong du zin kyang thams cad ma @205a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa ni chung zad gtong du zin kyang thams cad ma @205a * //
translated: Even though noble ones abandon some, they do not abandon all,

original: yin te / 'phags pa ni nam yang bslab pa gsum char med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yin te / 'phags pa ni nam yang bslab pa gsum char med pa ma yin no //
translated: because noble ones never lack the three trainings.

original: 'phags pa rang bzhin du gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin ni mnyam bar ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rang bzhin du gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin ni mnyam bar ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs yin te /
translated: The term ‚Äúnoble one abiding in their own nature‚Äù refers to the nature of sentient beings, who are in a state of equipoise.

original: de la gnas pa'i 'phags pa bsod snyoms pa la sogs pa spyod du gshegs pa slob pa'i ngang tshul can ma yin pas slob pa ma yin par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i 'phags pa bsod snyoms pa la sogs pa spyod du gshegs pa slob pa'i ngang tshul can ma yin pas slob pa ma yin par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The noble ones who live in that way, such as the one who lives on alms, are not learners because they are not in the state of learning.

original: bsam pa'i sgo nas te zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: bsam pa'i sgo nas te zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: In terms of thought means in terms of intention.

original: lam du 'gro ba gnas pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lam du 'gro ba gnas pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like one who is going along a path, even when standing.

original: lam du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni gang zhig lam du zhugs te 'gro ba de ni 'dug tu zin kyang 'gro ba'i bsam pa ma bor ba'i phyir lam du 'gro ba zhes bya ba nyid de de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: lam du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni gang zhig lam du zhugs te 'gro ba de ni 'dug tu zin kyang 'gro ba'i bsam pa ma bor ba'i phyir lam du 'gro ba zhes bya ba nyid de de dang 'dra'o //
translated: One who is going along a path is one who has set out on a path and is going. Even when standing, he is still called one who is going along a path because he has not given up the thought of going. It is like that.

original: thob pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: thob pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i yang phyir te /
translated: Also because they are connected with what has been obtained.

original: 'phags pa ni rang bzhin du gnas kyang tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dag gis thob pa dang rjes su 'brel to//
analyzed: 'phags pa ni rang bzhin du gnas kyang tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dag gis thob pa dang rjes su 'brel to//
translated: Even though the noble ones are abiding in their natural state, they are connected with what has been obtained through morality, concentration, and wisdom.

original: de lta bas na rang bzhin la gnas kyang slob pa'i ngang tshul can kho na yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rang bzhin la gnas kyang slob pa'i ngang tshul can kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though he is established in his intrinsic nature, he is only a person in training.

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa'i zhar la yang slob pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di brjod do //
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa'i zhar la yang slob pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di brjod do //
translated: In the context of the person in training and the person beyond training, the root text states, ‚ÄúWhat are the qualities of the person in training?‚Äù

original: slob pa'i chos zag pa med pa 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid dag yin te /
analyzed: slob pa'i chos zag pa med pa 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid dag yin te /
translated: The qualities of the person in training are uncontaminated conditioned entities.

original: mi slob pa'i chos mi slob pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i chos mi slob pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The qualities of the person beyond training are the same as that.

original: ci'i phyir mya ngan las 'da' ba slob pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni slob pas thob pa gang yin pa snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir mya ngan las 'da' ba slob pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni slob pas thob pa gang yin pa snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Why is nirvana not a quality of the person in training? The root text asks this question because it is wondering whether nirvana is attained by the person in training.

original: mi slob pa dang so so'i skye bo gnyi ga yang de dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo yang 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang ldan no //
analyzed: mi slob pa dang so so'i skye bo gnyi ga yang de dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo yang 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang ldan no //
translated: Because both the person beyond training and the ordinary man possess it. The ordinary man possesses nirvana that is attained by the mundane path.

original: zhugs pa dang po zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhugs pa dang po zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa'o //
translated: The first enterer is one who is established in the path of seeing.

original: zhugs pa lhag ma rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni zhugs pa lhag ma lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la zhugs pa rnams ni 'bras bu la gnas pa gsum las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la nas pa dag las tha mi dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhugs pa lhag ma rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni zhugs pa lhag ma lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la zhugs pa rnams ni 'bras bu la gnas pa gsum las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro // rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la nas pa dag las tha mi dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the remaining approachers‚Äîthe once-returner, nonreturner, and arhat‚Äîare not distinct from the three abiders in the result.üîΩBecause the approachers to the once-returner result and so on are not distinct from the abiders in the result of stream entry and so on.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba la zhugs pa la sogs pa ni rgyun cu zhugs pa la sogs pa las tha dad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba la zhugs pa la sogs pa ni rgyun cu zhugs pa la sogs pa las tha dad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The approachers to the once-returner result and so on are not distinct from the abiders in the result of stream entry and so on.üîΩThis is explained because they are obtained serially.

original: mthar @205b gyis 'thob pa'i phyir de skad ces bshad kyi zhes bya ba ni mthar gyis 'bras bu bzhi 'thob pa'i phyir rdzas su ni lnga yin te zhes bshad par zad do //
analyzed: mthar @205b gyis 'thob pa'i phyir de skad ces bshad kyi zhes bya ba ni mthar gyis 'bras bu bzhi 'thob pa'i phyir rdzas su ni lnga yin te zhes bshad par zad do //
translated: This is explained because the four results are obtained serially.

original: phal cher dang 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba dag cig yin na ni zhes bya ba ni phal cher las 'dod chags dang bral ba ni rnam pa drug zad pa'o //
analyzed: phal cher dang 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba dag cig yin na ni zhes bya ba ni phal cher las 'dod chags dang bral ba ni rnam pa drug zad pa'o //
translated: If they are detached from the realm of desire, they are candidates for the fruit of nonreturner.

original: 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba ni rnam pa dgu zad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba ni rnam pa dgu zad pa'o //
translated: If they are detached from the realm of desire, they are candidates for the fruit of nonreturner.

original: mthong ba'i lam la ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la ste /
translated: In the path of insight,üîΩin the state of the path of insight, they are candidates for the fruit of once-returner and for the fruit of nonreturner, respectively.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs na go rims bzhin du lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa dag yin gyi rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs na go rims bzhin du lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa dag yin gyi rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dag ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are not candidates for the fruit of stream-enterer and for the fruit of once-returner.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: de las gzhan pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag yin no //
translated: They are others.

original: de lta yin dang rdzas su rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa gsum dang / 'bras bu la gnas pa bzhi ste bdun du 'gyur gyi dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu la zhugs pa gcig pu phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu las tha mi dad do zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta yin dang rdzas su rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa gsum dang / 'bras bu la gnas pa bzhi ste bdun du 'gyur gyi dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu la zhugs pa gcig pu phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu las tha mi dad do zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: If that were so, then there would be seven who enter the result of stream entry, once-returner, nonreturner, and the four who abide in the result, but there would be no one who enters the result of an arhat, because it would not be different from the result of a nonreturner.üîΩThe path of meditation is explained as being of two types.

original: bsgom pa'i lam rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa la zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa la zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The path of meditation is of two types:

original: mthong ba zhes bya zag pa med //üîΩces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya zag pa med // ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The uncontaminated path is called seeing.üîΩBecause it increases affliction.üîΩBecause it increases affliction.üîΩBecause it increases affliction.

original: de'i nyon mongs pa rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'jig rten pa'i lam de la de'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pa dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur ro //üîΩnyon mongs pa gang zhig ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: de'i nyon mongs pa rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'jig rten pa'i lam de la de'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pa dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur ro //üîΩnyon mongs pa gang zhig ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: Because it increases affliction.

original: chos mthun pa dang chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: chos mthun pa dang chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: It is the example of similarity and dissimilarity.

original: sa gang ba'i lam yin pa de ni sa de'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ma yin te /
analyzed: sa gang ba'i lam yin pa de ni sa de'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ma yin te /
translated: The path of any stage is not the antidote of the affliction of that stage,

original: de'i nyon mongs pa rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir sa de pa'i chos gzhan mnyam par ma bzhag pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i nyon mongs pa rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir sa de pa'i chos gzhan mnyam par ma bzhag pa lta bu'o //
translated: because the affliction of that stage increases, like other nonconcentrated states of that stage.

original: chos mi mthun pa ni gong ma'i nyer bsdogs kyi lam lta bu 'am de'i gnyen po zag pa med pa'i lam lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa ni gong ma'i nyer bsdogs kyi lam lta bu 'am de'i gnyen po zag pa med pa'i lam lta bu'o //
translated: The example of dissimilarity is the path of the access to higher levels or the uncontaminated path that is the antidote of that stage.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni sa gong ma'i nyer bsdogs kyis so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni sa gong ma'i nyer bsdogs kyis so //
translated: One who is free from attachment by the mundane path is one who is free from attachment by the access to higher levels.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pas kyang zhes bya ba ni de'i gnyen po zag pa med pa'i lam rang gi dang sa 'og ma pas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pas kyang zhes bya ba ni de'i gnyen po zag pa med pa'i lam rang gi dang sa 'og ma pas so //
translated: One who is free from attachment by the supramundane path is one who is free from attachment by the uncontaminated path that is the antidote of that stage and by the path of lower level.

original: 'phags pa 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi 'dod chags dang bral bar zhes bya ba ni @206a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi 'dod chags dang bral bar zhes bya ba ni @206a * //
translated: The noble one who is free from attachment by the mundane path is one who is free from attachment by the mundane path of the summit of existence.

original: dper na rgyun du zhugs pa zhi gnas spyad pa zhig 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa rnams rnam pa re re zhing bral ba'i thob pa zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dag skye'o //
analyzed: dper na rgyun du zhugs pa zhi gnas spyad pa zhig 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa rnams rnam pa re re zhing bral ba'i thob pa zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dag skye'o //
translated: For example, when those who enter the stream and practice serenity become free from attachment by the mundane path, they generate both contaminated and uncontaminated obtainment of freedom for each stage.

original: bsam gtan la brten te zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: bsam gtan la brten te zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin dependence on the absorptions‚Äù indicates thatüîΩthose who are learners upgrade their intellectual faculty in dependence on the six levels.üîΩIt is certain that those who are learners upgrade their intellectual faculty in dependence on the six levels and not in dependence on the formless realm, because it is said:

original: mi slob pa dgu la brten te /
analyzed: mi slob pa dgu la brten te /
translated: In dependence on the nine levels of nonlearners,

original: slob pa drug la zhes 'byung ba'i phyir slob pa ni sa drug la brten te dbang po rnams 'pho bar byed kyi gzugs med pa la ni ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: slob pa drug la zhes 'byung ba'i phyir slob pa ni sa drug la brten te dbang po rnams 'pho bar byed kyi gzugs med pa la ni ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: the six levels of learners.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /üîΩbsam gtan la brten te dbang po rnams 'pho bar byed pa gang yin pa de lam snga ma zad par btang ba'i phyir te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa / bsam gtan la brten te dbang po rnams 'pho bar byed pa gang yin pa de lam snga ma zad par btang ba'i phyir te ;
translated: Therefore it is said:üîΩThose who upgrade their intellectual faculty in dependence on the absorptions relinquish the former path in its entirety.

original: gzugs med pa'i lam dbang po rtul pos bsdus pa sngar thob pa rnams btang ba'i phyir dang / 'phel ba 'bras bu khyad par bcas //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i lam dbang po rtul pos bsdus pa sngar thob pa rnams btang ba'i phyir dang / 'phel ba 'bras bu khyad par bcas //
translated: They upgrade their intellectual faculty by relinquishing the former path of the formless realm that is subsumed by the intellectual faculty of dull faculty that was previously obtained and by enhancing the result that is the intellectual faculty of sharp faculty.

original: btang ste 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: btang ste 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur //
translated: and having relinquished it, one attains the result.

original: zhes 'byung bas 'bras bu'i lam 'ba' zhig thob pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas 'bras bu'i lam 'ba' zhig thob pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because one attains only the path of the result.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dbang po rnon po'i ngo bo nyid 'ba' zhig thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dbang po rnon po'i ngo bo nyid 'ba' zhig thob pa'i phyir /
translated: Because one attains only the result of nonreturn that is the nature of sharp faculty.

original: sa gong ma'i nyon mongs pa'i bral ba ste /
analyzed: sa gong ma'i nyon mongs pa'i bral ba ste /
translated: One would not possess freedom from affliction of higher realms.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bral ba dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bral ba dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: One would not possess freedom from affliction of the formless realm.

original: nyes pa gzhan 'di yang yod de /
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan 'di yang yod de /
translated: Another fault would ensue.

original: sa gong ma pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bral ba de btang nas sa gong ma'i nyon mongs pa de dag dang ldan par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa gong ma pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bral ba de btang nas sa gong ma'i nyon mongs pa de dag dang ldan par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Having relinquished freedom from affliction of higher realms, one would possess affliction of higher realms.üîΩOne liberated from half of the summit of existence

original: srid rtse'i phyed las rnam grol dang // gong mar skyes pa bzhin mi ldan //üîΩzhes bya ba ni phyed las rnam par grol ba ni phyed las rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: srid rtse'i phyed las rnam grol dang // gong mar skyes pa bzhin mi ldan // zhes bya ba ni phyed las rnam par grol ba ni phyed las rnam par grol lo //
translated: does not possess the higher.üîΩOne liberated from half is liberated from half.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i phyed las rnam par grol ba ni srid rtse'i phyed las rnam grol lo //
