analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i phyed las rnam par grol ba ni srid rtse'i phyed las rnam grol lo //
translated: One liberated from half of the summit of existence is liberated from half of the summit of existence.

original: gong du skyes pa ni gong du skyes pa'o //üîΩsrid pa'i rtse mo'i phyed las grol ba dang / gong du skyes pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i phyed las grol ba dang / gong du skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: gong du skyes pa ni gong du skyes pa'o // srid pa'i rtse mo'i phyed las grol ba dang / gong du skyes pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i phyed las grol ba dang / gong du skyes pa yin no //
translated: One who is born in a higher level is one who is born in a higher level.üîΩOne who is liberated from half of the summit of existence and one who is born in a higher level are liberated from half of the summit of existence and are born in a higher level.

original: de dang 'dra bas srid rtse'i phyed las rnam grol dang / gong mar skyes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bas srid rtse'i phyed las rnam grol dang / gong mar skyes pa bzhin no //
translated: One who is liberated from half of the summit of existence and one who is born in a higher level are like those who are liberated from half of the summit of existence and are born in a higher level.

original: mi ldan pa ni de dag dang de zhes bya ba tshig lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: mi ldan pa ni de dag dang de zhes bya ba tshig lhag ma yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose who are not endowed with those‚Äù is a remainder.

original: du zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nyes pa snga ma bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nyes pa snga ma bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is used to eliminate the previous fault.

original: don de rnam par grol ba'i phyir de la 'jig rten pa'i bral ba'i thob pa med du zin kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: don de rnam par grol ba'i phyir de la 'jig rten pa'i bral ba'i thob pa med du zin kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: In order to clarify that meaning, it says, ‚ÄúEven though they do not have the acquisition of freedom from attachment that belongs to the mundane sphere.‚Äù

original: gang zag de la 'jig rten pa'i thob pa med du zin kyang nyon mongs pa de dag ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zag de la 'jig rten pa'i thob pa med du zin kyang nyon mongs pa de dag ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though those persons do not have the acquisition of freedom from attachment that belongs to the mundane sphere, they are not endowed with those afflictions.

original: dper na srid pa'i rtse mo'i rnam pa phyed @206b las rnam par grol ba la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni de la ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i rnam pa phyed las bral ba'i thob pa 'jig rten pa med de /
analyzed: dper na srid pa'i rtse mo'i rnam pa phyed @206b las rnam par grol ba la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni de la ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i rnam pa phyed las bral ba'i thob pa 'jig rten pa med de /
translated: There is no mundane obtainment of freedom from half of the aspects of the summit of existence.

original: de'i gnyen po 'jig rten pa'i lam med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i bral ba'i thob pa 'jig rten las 'das pa yang bsam gtan la brten te /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po 'jig rten pa'i lam med pa'i phyir ro // de'i bral ba'i thob pa 'jig rten las 'das pa yang bsam gtan la brten te /
translated: Because there is no mundane path that is an antidote to that.

original: dbang po 'pho bas btang bar 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: dbang po 'pho bas btang bar 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: The transcendent obtainment of freedom from that is relinquished by upgrading one‚Äôs intellectual faculty in dependence on the absorptions.

original: khyed srid pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa de dag dang ldan par mi 'gyur bar khas len pa ltar 'di yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: khyed srid pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa de dag dang ldan par mi 'gyur bar khas len pa ltar 'di yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: But you accept that one does not possess the aspects of affliction of the summit of existence. This is similar to that.

original: yang dper na so so'i skye bo bsam gtan dang po yan chad du skyes pa ste /
analyzed: yang dper na so so'i skye bo bsam gtan dang po yan chad du skyes pa ste /
translated: For example, it is like the case of an ordinary being born in the first absorption and so on.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa de'i bral ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa de'i bral ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he possesses the obtainment of freedom from the first absorption when born in the second absorption and so on.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bral ba'i thob pa gtang bas te /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bral ba'i thob pa gtang bas te /
translated: The virtues of the realm of fine-materiality are lost by changing the stage or by retrogressing.

original: sa 'phos pa dang nyams pa yis //
analyzed: sa 'phos pa dang nyams pa yis //
translated: The virtues of the realm of immateriality are lost by changing the stage or by retrogressing.üîΩThe acquisition of the abandonment of the defilements of the realm of desire is lost by changing the stage or by retrogressing.

original: bsam gtan thob pa'i dge ba gtong //
analyzed: bsam gtan thob pa'i dge ba gtong //
translated: The virtues of the realm of fine-materiality are lost by changing the stage or by retrogressing.

original: de bzhin du gzugs med ces bya bar nges pas gtong ba yin no //üîΩde'i phyir yang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag dang ldan par mi 'gyur bar khas len pa ltar gang zag 'di yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs med ces bya bar nges pas gtong ba yin no // de'i phyir yang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag dang ldan par mi 'gyur bar khas len pa ltar gang zag 'di yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The virtues of the realm of immateriality are lost by changing the stage or by retrogressing.üîΩThe virtues of the realm of fine-materiality are lost by changing the stage or by retrogressing.üîΩThe virtues of the realm of immateriality are lost by changing the stage or by retrogressing.üîΩThe virtues of the realm of fine-materiality are lost by changing the stage or by retrogressing.üîΩThe virtues of the realm of immateriality are lost by changing the stage or by retrogressing.üîΩThe virtues of the realm of fine-materiality are lost by changing the stage or by retrogressing.üîΩThe virtues of the realm of immateriality are lost by changing the stage or by retrogressing.üîΩThe virtues of the realm of fine-materiality are lost by changing the stage or by retrogressing.üîΩThe virtues of the realm of immateriality are lost by changing the stage or by retrogressing.üîΩThe virtues of the realm of fine-materiality are lost by changing the stage or by retrogressing.üîΩThe virtues of the realm of immateriality are lost by changing the stage or by retrogressing.üîΩThe virtues of the realm of fine-materiality are lost by changing the stage or by retrogressing.üîΩThe virtues of the realm of immateriality are lost by changing the stage or by retrogressing.üîΩThe virtues of the realm of fine-materiality are lost by changing the stage or by retrogressing.üîΩThe virtues of the realm of immateriality are lost by changing the stage or by retrogressing.üîΩThe virtues of the realm of fine-materiality are lost by changing the stage or by retrogressing.

original: so so'i skye bo zhes smos pa ni 'di ltar 'phags pa 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa'i khams kyi gong ma las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba la ni nyon mongs pa'i bral ba'i thob pa 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa yang yod
analyzed: so so'i skye bo zhes smos pa ni 'di ltar 'phags pa 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa'i khams kyi gong ma las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba la ni nyon mongs pa'i bral ba'i thob pa 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa yang yod
translated: The virtues of the realm of immateriality are lost by changing the stage or by retrogressing.üîΩThe virtues of the realm of fine-materiality are lost by changing the stage or by

original: do // de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bral ba'i thob pa 'jig rten pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gtan dang po yan chad du skyes pas 'pho bas btang bar 'gyur gyi 'jig rten las 'das pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: do // de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bral ba'i thob pa 'jig rten pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gtan dang po yan chad du skyes pas 'pho bas btang bar 'gyur gyi 'jig rten las 'das pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The mundane obtainment of freedom from affliction that pertains to the desire realm is relinquished by changing level when one is born in the first absorption and above, but it is not relinquished by transcendent obtainment.

original: 'phags pa ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa ni /
translated: Aryas

original: 'bras thob sbyangs dang nyams pa yis //
analyzed: 'bras thob sbyangs dang nyams pa yis //
translated: obtain results, upgrade, or retrogress.

original: zhes bya bar gtong bar nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar gtong bar nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is certain that they relinquish the obtainment of freedom from affliction through obtaining a result, upgrading their intellectual faculty, or retrogressing.

original: 'phags pa ni bsam gtan dang po yan chad du skyes kyang 'jig rten las 'das pa de yod na yang de dag dang ldan pa mi srid kyi so so'i skye bo ni de lta ma yin pas so so'i skye bo smos so //
analyzed: 'phags pa ni bsam gtan dang po yan chad du skyes kyang 'jig rten las 'das pa de yod na yang de dag dang ldan pa mi srid kyi so so'i skye bo ni de lta ma yin pas so so'i skye bo smos so //
translated: Aryas who are born in the first absorption and above do not possess mundane obtainment of freedom from affliction even though it exists, but ordinary beings are not like that.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore the statement

original: btang la nyon mongs mi ldan phyir /
analyzed: btang la nyon mongs mi ldan phyir /
translated: They do not possess affliction that is relinquished

original: zhes smos pa gang yin pa 'di ni shes par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes smos pa gang yin pa 'di ni shes par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: is not a valid proof.

original: thams cad las zhes bya ba ni rang gi sa dang sa gong ma dang 'og ma las te /
analyzed: thams cad las zhes bya ba ni rang gi sa dang sa gong ma dang 'og ma las te /
translated: From all is said to refer to one's own level, higher levels and lower levels.

original: de ni zag pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbtang snyoms kyi dbang po thun mong @207a * //
analyzed: de ni zag pa med pa'i phyir ro // btang snyoms kyi dbang po thun mong @207a * //
translated: Because it is uncontaminated.üîΩBecause equanimity is not shared in common.

original: ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa la sogs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / de'i nyer bsdogs dag btang snyoms kyi dbang po 'dra bas so //
analyzed: ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa la sogs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / de'i nyer bsdogs dag btang snyoms kyi dbang po 'dra bas so //
translated: The meditative attainment of the fourth absorption and so on and its access concentration are similar in having equanimity.

original: la la bsam gtan dngos gzhi la 'jug mi nus te zhes bya ba ni dbang po rtul po'o //üîΩdbang po 'pho ba na dka' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po'i mjug thogs su yid bde ba'i dbang po'am /
analyzed: la la bsam gtan dngos gzhi la 'jug mi nus te zhes bya ba ni dbang po rtul po'o // dbang po 'pho ba na dka' ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po'i mjug thogs su yid bde ba'i dbang po'am /
translated: Some are unable to enter the actual basis of the absorptions.üîΩBecause it is difficult to upgrade faculties.

original: bde ba'i dbang po bskyed dka' ba'i phyir dngos gzhi dang nyer bsdogs dag gis btang snyoms kyi dbang po 'dra bas so //
analyzed: bde ba'i dbang po bskyed dka' ba'i phyir dngos gzhi dang nyer bsdogs dag gis btang snyoms kyi dbang po 'dra bas so //
translated: Because it is difficult to generate the faculty of mental satisfaction or the faculty of pleasure immediately after the faculty of equanimity, they are similar in having the faculty of equanimity in both the actual basis and access concentration.

original: ci'i phyir dngos gzhi kho na las rnam par grol ba'i lam tha ma mngon du byed kyi nyer bsdogs las ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dngos gzhi kho na las rnam par grol ba'i lam tha ma mngon du byed kyi nyer bsdogs las ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why do they manifest the final liberated path from the actual basis alone and not from access concentration?

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa la gus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa la gus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they respect the stage of detachment.

original: 'dod chags dang bral zin pa'i phyir 'og ma la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral zin pa'i phyir 'og ma la ni ma yin te /
translated: They do not focus on the lower stage, because they are already detached from it.

original: de'i nyer bsdogs kho nas 'og ma las 'dod chags dang bral bar byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i nyer bsdogs kho nas 'og ma las 'dod chags dang bral bar byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, by means of the threshold itself, they have already become detached from the lower stage.

original: bden pa'i rnam par zhugs pa dag yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: bden pa'i rnam par zhugs pa dag yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pa dag yin no //
translated: They are engaged in the aspects of the truths, i.e., impermanence, etc.

original: ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni kha cig na re sa 'og ma la rags par lta na gong sa la de las bzlog pa zhi bar blta'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni kha cig na re sa 'og ma la rags par lta na gong sa la de las bzlog pa zhi bar blta'o zhes zer ro //
translated: As is fitting means that some say that when one views the lower stage as coarse, one views the higher stage as peaceful, the opposite of that.

original: gzhan dag na re zhi ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag la res 'ga' ni rnam pa dang po gcig gi rnam par lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re zhi ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag la res 'ga' ni rnam pa dang po gcig gi rnam par lta ste /
translated: Others say that with regard to the aspects of peace, etc., sometimes one views them in one aspect,

original: mtha' dag tu lta bar nges pa ni med do zhes zer ro //üîΩrags pa zhes bya ba la /üîΩrags pa zhes bya ba ni che long yin no //
analyzed: mtha' dag tu lta bar nges pa ni med do zhes zer ro // rags pa zhes bya ba la / rags pa zhes bya ba ni che long yin no //
translated: but it is not definite that one views them in all aspects.üîΩWith regard to coarse,üîΩcoarse means gross.

original: ma zhi ba'i phyir rags pa'o //
analyzed: ma zhi ba'i phyir rags pa'o //
translated: It is coarse because it is not peaceful.

original: ji ltar sa 'og ma zhi ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sa 'og ma zhi ba yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the lower stage peaceful?

original: mngon par 'du byed pa shin tu ches pa nyid kyis te /üîΩgnas 'og ma 'di yang lam dang bcas te mngon par 'du byed pa chen pos 'bad de bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa shin tu ches pa nyid kyis te / gnas 'og ma 'di yang lam dang bcas te mngon par 'du byed pa chen pos 'bad de bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
translated: Because it is extremely coarse due to the great effort of manifest exertion.üîΩThis lower stage is to be accomplished with great effort through the path of manifest exertion.

original: gnas gong ma 'di yang lam dang bcas te mngon par 'du byed pa chen po yin pa las /
analyzed: gnas gong ma 'di yang lam dang bcas te mngon par 'du byed pa chen po yin pa las /
translated: This higher stage is also with the path of great manifest exertion.

original: de gnyis kyi nang na 'di mngon par 'du byed pa shin tu che sa che ba yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi nang na 'di mngon par 'du byed pa shin tu che sa che ba yin no //
translated: But among these two, this one is extremely coarse due to great manifest exertion.

original: de'i ngo bo ni nyid de de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni nyid de de'i phyir ro //
translated: Its nature is that, and therefore it is that.

original: tha ba ni gzhig par dka' ba yin no //üîΩsmad pa'i tha ba ni ngan pa ste /
analyzed: tha ba ni gzhig par dka' ba yin no // smad pa'i tha ba ni ngan pa ste /
translated: Hardness is difficult to destroy.üîΩEvil hardness is bad.

original: tha ba ngan pas na tha ba ngan pa'o //
analyzed: tha ba ngan pas na tha ba ngan pa'o //
translated: Because of bad hardness, it is bad hardness.

original: ji ltar sa 'og ma gya nom pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sa 'og ma gya nom pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the lower stage not sublime?

original: gnas ngan len rab tu mang ba nyid kyis mi mthun par gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnas ngan len rab tu mang ba nyid kyis mi mthun par gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it is incompatible due to the great abundance of negative tendencies.

original: gnas ngan len ni @207b lus dang sems dag las su mi rung ba nyid de /
analyzed: gnas ngan len ni @207b lus dang sems dag las su mi rung ba nyid de /
translated: Negative reflex actions are unserviceability of the body and mind.

original: nyon mongs pa dang mthun pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang mthun pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are called ‚Äúconducive to defilement.‚Äù

original: 'di la gnas ngan len mang po yod pas na gnas ngan len mang po ste /üîΩgnas 'og ma 'di yang lam dang bcas te gnas ngan len mang po yin la /
analyzed: 'di la gnas ngan len mang po yod pas na gnas ngan len mang po ste / gnas 'og ma 'di yang lam dang bcas te gnas ngan len mang po yin la /
translated: This is a place of many negative reflex actions because it has many negative reflex actions.üîΩThis lower stage, together with its path, is a place of many negative reflex actions.

original: gnas gong ma 'di yang lam dang bcas te gnas ngan len mang po yin pa las de dag gnyis kyi nang na 'di gnas ngan len shin tu ches mang ngo //
analyzed: gnas gong ma 'di yang lam dang bcas te gnas ngan len mang po yin pa las de dag gnyis kyi nang na 'di gnas ngan len shin tu ches mang ngo //
translated: This upper stage, together with its path, is a place of many negative reflex actions.

original: de'i ngo bo ni nyid de de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni nyid de de'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of that is just that, and that is why.

original: rtsig pa las nges par mi 'byung ba bzhin te /
analyzed: rtsig pa las nges par mi 'byung ba bzhin te /
translated: It is like space that is not definitely separated from a wall.üîΩFor example, space that is covered by a wall is not definitely separated from that wall.

original: dper na rtsig pa de nyid kyis des non pa'i nam mkha'i phyogs kyi rtsig pa de nyid las nges par mi 'byung ba ltar de nyid kyis sa de las nges par mi 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dper na rtsig pa de nyid kyis des non pa'i nam mkha'i phyogs kyi rtsig pa de nyid las nges par mi 'byung ba ltar de nyid kyis sa de las nges par mi 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: In the same way, that stage is not definitely separated from that stage because it is not definitely separated from that.

original: sa de nyid kyis sa de nyid las nges par mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa de nyid kyis sa de nyid las nges par mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that level does not definitely emerge from that level.

original: rtsig pa stug po lta bur zhes bya ba ni rtsig pa stug po'i ngo bor ro //
analyzed: rtsig pa stug po lta bur zhes bya ba ni rtsig pa stug po'i ngo bor ro //
translated: Like a thick wall means like the essence of a thick wall.

original: de dag las bzlog pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'du byed pa shin tu chung ba nyid kyi phyir dang / gnas ngan len rab tu nyung ba nyid kyis mi mthun pa med par gyur pa'i phyir dang / sa de gnyis las des nges par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du zhi ba dang /
analyzed: de dag las bzlog pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'du byed pa shin tu chung ba nyid kyi phyir dang / gnas ngan len rab tu nyung ba nyid kyis mi mthun pa med par gyur pa'i phyir dang / sa de gnyis las des nges par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du zhi ba dang /
translated: The opposite of those means that because the formation is extremely small, there is no conflict due to the extreme smallness of the negative tendencies, and because that level definitely emerges from those two levels, respectively, they have the aspects of peace,

original: gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa can dag yin no //
analyzed: gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa can dag yin no //
translated: sublime, and definite emergence.

original: zhar la 'ongs pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs pa rdzogs so /
translated: The digression is complete.

original: // / dkyus ma kho na brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni zad pa shes pa'i rjes la 'byung ba brjod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: // / dkyus ma kho na brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni zad pa shes pa'i rjes la 'byung ba brjod par bya ba yin te /
translated: Now, the main point should be stated, which is to be stated after the knowledge of elimination.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi mtshan nyid ni zhar la bstan par zad do //üîΩgal te mi g-yo zad shes las //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi mtshan nyid ni zhar la bstan par zad do // gal te mi g-yo zad shes las //
translated: From the unshakable and from the cognition of exhaustion,üîΩthe cognition of non-arising.

original: mi skyes blo gros zhes bya ba ni yang byar med pa nyid du shes pa ste /
analyzed: mi skyes blo gros zhes bya ba ni yang byar med pa nyid du shes pa ste /
translated: The cognition of non-arising is the cognition that there is no more to be done.

original: de'i tshe de la 'di skye'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe de la 'di skye'o //
translated: It arises at that time.üîΩBecause regression is possible.

original: yongs su nyams pa srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa skye ba'i go skabs yod pas 'di la mi skye ba shes pas mi skye'o //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa skye ba'i go skabs yod pas 'di la mi skye ba shes pas mi skye'o //
translated: Because there is an opportunity for the arising of defilements, the cognition of non-arising does not arise in him.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yongs su nyams pa srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because regression is possible.

original: 'di ltar 'di ni yongs su nyams pa srid la gang la mi skye ba shes pa yod pa de la ni yongs su nyams pa med pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni yongs su nyams pa srid la gang la mi skye ba shes pa yod pa de la ni yongs su nyams pa med pas so //
translated: In fact, regression is possible for him, but not for one in whom the cognition of non-arising has arisen, because he is incapable of regression.üîΩHe is a sramana.

original: des dge sbyong du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong gi tshul dang ldan pas dge sbyong yin te /
analyzed: des dge sbyong du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong gi tshul dang ldan pas dge sbyong yin te /
translated: He is a sramana because he possesses the way of the sramana.

original: dper na dkar po'i tshul dang ldan pas ras yug dkar po zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dkar po'i tshul dang ldan pas ras yug dkar po zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a white cloth is called white because it possesses the quality of whiteness.

original: de'i rgyu mthun pa dang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ci rigs par rnam par grol ba'i @208a * //üîΩlam dang / 'dus ma byas rnams kyang dge sbyong gi tshul bar chad med pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid de'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mthun pa dang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ci rigs par rnam par grol ba'i @208a * // lam dang / 'dus ma byas rnams kyang dge sbyong gi tshul bar chad med pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid de'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are the result of natural outflow and the result of conscious effort.üîΩThe unconditioned states and the liberated paths are the result of natural outflow and the result of conscious effort of the ƒÅrya path that is the path of seeing and the path of meditation, respectively.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams ni de'i rgyu mthun pa dang / skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams ni de'i rgyu mthun pa dang / skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The liberated paths are the result of natural outflow and the result of conscious effort of the ƒÅrya path that is the path of seeing and the path of meditation, respectively.

original: 'dus ma byas rnams ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu kho na yin te /üîΩgang gi stobs kyis gang bskyed de //üîΩskyes bu byed las skyes pa'i 'bras //üîΩgang gi stobs kyis gang thob pa //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas rnams ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu kho na yin te / gang gi stobs kyis gang bskyed de // skyes bu byed las skyes pa'i 'bras // gang gi stobs kyis gang thob pa //
translated: The unconditioned states are the result of conscious effort alone.üîΩThe result generated by the power of that is the result of conscious effort.

original: de ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras //üîΩzhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras //üîΩzhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The result obtained by the power of that is the result of conscious effort.

original: de lta na 'o na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If that is so, then the self would be the object of the view of the self.üîΩ

original: tshig gi don ni ji ltar so so'i skye bo pa ni ni'i tshig la kha bskang ba byed pa ltar sangs rgyas thams cad mkhyen pas gang gsungs pa yang kha bskang par bya dgos par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //üîΩlam snga ma btang ba dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /üîΩlam snga ma btang ba ni zhugs pa'i lam btang ba'i phyir ro //üîΩsngon med pa'i lam thob pa ni 'bras bu'i thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni ji ltar so so'i skye bo pa ni ni'i tshig la kha bskang ba byed pa ltar sangs rgyas thams cad mkhyen pas gang gsungs pa yang kha bskang par bya dgos par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o // lam snga ma btang ba dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la / lam snga ma btang ba ni zhugs pa'i lam btang ba'i phyir ro // sngon med pa'i lam thob pa ni 'bras bu'i thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that is so, then just as the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is added to the word ‚Äúordinary beings‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúordinary beings also,‚Äù the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù must be added to the words ‚Äúall buddhas‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúall buddhas also know.‚Äù

original: thams cad kyi thob pa gcig rnyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa'i dus na mthong bas spang ba thams cad kyi thob pa bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa gcig rnyed la /
analyzed: thams cad kyi thob pa gcig rnyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa'i dus na mthong bas spang ba thams cad kyi thob pa bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa gcig rnyed la /
translated: Abandoning the former path and obtaining a former path that was not previously obtained means that when one obtains the result of stream entry, one obtains the single obtainment of all objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing that is subsumed by the path of meditation.

original: de bzhin du lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob pa'i dus na yang mthong bas spang bar bya ba spangs pa dang / bsgom pas spang pa rnam pa drug po thams cad kyi thob ba gcig rnyed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob pa'i dus na yang mthong bas spang bar bya ba spangs pa dang / bsgom pas spang pa rnam pa drug po thams cad kyi thob ba gcig rnyed de /
translated: Similarly, when one obtains the result of once-returner, one obtains the obtainment of all six types of abandonment that are abandoned by the path of seeing and the path of meditation.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu dag la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu dag la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same applies to the results of nonreturn and arhat.

original: chos dang rjes su shes pa rnam pa bzhi'i zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i bye brag gis chos dang rjes su shes pa rnam pa bzhi po yang de kho na bzhin du rnam pa bzhi bzhi yin pas shes pa brgyad cig car du 'thob bo //
analyzed: chos dang rjes su shes pa rnam pa bzhi'i zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i bye brag gis chos dang rjes su shes pa rnam pa bzhi po yang de kho na bzhin du rnam pa bzhi bzhi yin pas shes pa brgyad cig car du 'thob bo //
translated: The four aspects of Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge are the four aspects of Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge that are distinguished by the four truths. Since they are also fourfold in the same way, one obtains eight knowledges simultaneously.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i 'bras bu gnyis zhes bya ba ni lan cig phyir 'ong pa'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i 'bras bu gnyis zhes bya ba ni lan cig phyir 'ong pa'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: The two results obtained by the mundane path are the results of once-returner and nonreturner.

original: de dag ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis kyang thob par srid na /
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis kyang thob par srid na /
translated: Since it is possible that these two are obtained by the mundane path,

original: de ji ltar dge sbyong gi tshul zag pa med pa'i lam gyis mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bur rung /üîΩmthong ba'i lam kyi 'bras bu spangs pa yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ji ltar dge sbyong gi tshul zag pa med pa'i lam gyis mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bur rung / mthong ba'i lam kyi 'bras bu spangs pa yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: How can that be suitable as the result of the spiritual practitioner‚Äôs way, which is characterized by the uncontaminated path?üîΩThe result of the path of seeing is the abandonment.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu yang gzung @208b ste ;
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu yang gzung @208b ste ;
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúthe result of the path of seeing is the abandonment‚Äù also includes the result of the path of cultivation.

original: spangs pa rnam pa gnyis po de'i thob pa yang lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bur bsdus pa'am phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bur bsdus pa gcig rnyed do //
analyzed: spangs pa rnam pa gnyis po de'i thob pa yang lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bur bsdus pa'am phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bur bsdus pa gcig rnyed do //
translated: One obtains the obtainment of those two types of abandonment either as the result of the once-returner or as the result of the non-returner.

original: de lta bas na mthong ba'i lam gyi 'bras bu spangs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'dus ma byas ni dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na mthong ba'i lam gyi 'bras bu spangs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'dus ma byas ni dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Therefore, because one possesses the abandonment that is the result of the path of seeing, the unconditioned result of the spiritual practitioner‚Äôs way is either the result of the once-returner or the result of the non-returner.

original: kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs pa zhes bya ba la kun du sbyor ba gsum ni mthong ba'i lam gyis spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs pa zhes bya ba la kun du sbyor ba gsum ni mthong ba'i lam gyis spangs pa yin no //
translated: The abandonment of the three fetters is the result of the stream-enterer. The three fetters are abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga'i phyogs gcig po 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom rnams kyang mthong ba'i lam kho nas spangs na /
analyzed: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga'i phyogs gcig po 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom rnams kyang mthong ba'i lam kho nas spangs na /
translated: If these are abandoned by the path of seeing alone, why are they not posited as the result of stream entry or the result of once returning?

original: spangs pa de ci'i phyir lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu nyid dag tu gzhag / de'i phyir spangs pa 'dren mar 'jug pas bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad gsungs so zhes bya bar mngon no //
analyzed: spangs pa de ci'i phyir lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu nyid dag tu gzhag / de'i phyir spangs pa 'dren mar 'jug pas bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad gsungs so zhes bya bar mngon no //
translated: Therefore it is clear that the Bhagavan spoke in that way because the abandonment of those factors is intermittent.

original: de'i stobs kyis yongs su nyams pa mi 'chi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis yongs su nyams pa mi 'chi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they do not die with the power of that,

original: 'bras la nyams pa 'chi ba med //
analyzed: 'bras la nyams pa 'chi ba med //
translated: Obtainment of freedom is uncontaminated.üîΩObtainment of freedom is uncontaminated

original: ces 'byung ba'i phyir thob pa dang ldan pa'i gnas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: ces 'byung ba'i phyir thob pa dang ldan pa'i gnas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said that one who possesses obtainment of the ƒÅrya path is a basis of ƒÅrya Dharmas.

original: de med na 'jig rten pa yongs su nyams pa bzhin du 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med na 'jig rten pa yongs su nyams pa bzhin du 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not possess it, one would die like an ordinary being who has degenerated.

original: de'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba ni bral ba'i thob pa zag pa med pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /üîΩ// / bam po lnga bcu pa /
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba ni bral ba'i thob pa zag pa med pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / // / bam po lnga bcu pa /
translated: By the power of that means by the power of obtaining uncontaminated states.

original: zag pa med pa'i thob pa 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis nye bar skyed pa da ltar yod pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad po 'jig rten pa'i stobs kyis thob par bya ba ma 'ongs pa 'dus byas de la dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu yod par rnam par gzhag na yang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i thob pa 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis nye bar skyed pa da ltar yod pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad po 'jig rten pa'i stobs kyis thob par bya ba ma 'ongs pa 'dus byas de la dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu yod par rnam par gzhag na yang mi 'gal lo //
translated: If the present uncontaminated obtainment generated by the mundane path and the future eightfold noble path to be obtained by the power of the mundane path are posited as the result of the system of training in virtue, there is no contradiction.

original: mdo las ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu 'dus ma byas smos te /
analyzed: mdo las ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu 'dus ma byas smos te /
translated: In the sutras, the unconditioned is stated to be the result of the system of training in virtue because it is primary.

original: der ni 'dus byas kyang 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: der ni 'dus byas kyang 'dod par bya'o //
translated: But conditioned states should also be asserted to be the result of the system of training in virtue.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba'i phyir tshangs pa'i tshul lo zhes bya ba ni 'dis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnam pa du ma spangs pas tshangs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba'i phyir tshangs pa'i tshul lo zhes bya ba ni 'dis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnam pa du ma spangs pas tshangs pa'o //
translated: It is the way of Brahmins because it causes the elimination of many kinds of nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: de'i ngo bo ni tshangs pa'i tshul yin te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni tshangs pa'i tshul yin te /
translated: Its nature is the way of Brahmins.

original: zag pa med pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i lam mo //
translated: It is the uncontaminated path.

original: @209a * // ji ltar tshangs pa'i 'khor lo yin zhe na /
analyzed: @209a * // ji ltar tshangs pa'i 'khor lo yin zhe na /
translated: How is it the wheel of Brahmins?

original: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo ni /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo ni /
translated: It is the wheel of Brahmins

original: tshangs pas bskor phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tshangs pas bskor phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: because it is turned by Brahmins.

original: gang gi phyir tshangs pas bskor ba de'i phyir tshangs pa'i 'khor lo zhes bya 'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshangs pas bskor ba de'i phyir tshangs pa'i 'khor lo zhes bya 'o //
translated: Because it is turned by Brahmins, it is called the wheel of Brahmins.

original: tshangs pa'i tshul bla na med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i lam bla na med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i tshul bla na med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i lam bla na med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is endowed with the unsurpassed way of Brahmins means it is endowed with the unsurpassed uncontaminated path.

original: dper brjod pa ni /
analyzed: dper brjod pa ni /
translated: The example is

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni tshangs pa zhes kyang bya zhes bya ba 'di ni yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni tshangs pa zhes kyang bya zhes bya ba 'di ni yin te /
translated: the Blessed One is also called a Brahmin.

original: 'di ni 'tsho byed kyis smras pa yin no //üîΩmyur bar 'gro sogs rtsibs sogs phyir //
analyzed: 'di ni 'tsho byed kyis smras pa yin no // myur bar 'gro sogs rtsibs sogs phyir //
translated: This is what Jivaka said.üîΩBecause of going quickly, etc., and because of spokes, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni myur bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i phyir dang ; rtsibs la sogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni myur bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i phyir dang ; rtsibs la sogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because of going quickly, etc., and because of spokes, etc.üîΩThis is the meaning of the above verse.üîΩBecause of going quickly, etc.

original: myur du 'gro ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di ni mthong ba'i lam 'khor lo rin po che dang chos mthun par brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: myur du 'gro ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di ni mthong ba'i lam 'khor lo rin po che dang chos mthun par brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is an explanation of the similarity of the path of seeing to the precious wheel.

original: ji ltar 'khor lo rin po che myur du 'gro ba de bzhin du mthong ba'i lam yang sems kyi skad cig bco lngas bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir myur du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'khor lo rin po che myur du 'gro ba de bzhin du mthong ba'i lam yang sems kyi skad cig bco lngas bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir myur du 'gro ba yin no //
translated: Just as the precious wheel goes quickly, so the path of seeing goes quickly, because it realizes the truths in fifteen moments of mind.

original: 'dor ba dang 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ji ltar yul gzhan 'dor zhing yul gzhan du 'jug pa de bzhin du 'dir yang bar chad med pa'i lam ni 'dor la rnam par grol ba'i lam ni mngon du 'gyur ba'i sgo nas 'jug pa 'am bden pa'i
analyzed: 'dor ba dang 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ji ltar yul gzhan 'dor zhing yul gzhan du 'jug pa de bzhin du 'dir yang bar chad med pa'i lam ni 'dor la rnam par grol ba'i lam ni mngon du 'gyur ba'i sgo nas 'jug pa 'am bden pa'i
translated: Because they abandon and engage means that just as one abandons one country and engages in another, so too here the uninterrupted path abandons and the liberated path engages its object through manifesting it.

original: dmigs pa gzhan 'dor ba dang 'jug pa'i phyir ro //üîΩma rgyal ba rgyal bar byed pa dang rgyal ba rnal du dgod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ji ltar de grong dang grong rdal la sogs pa ma rgyal ba las ni rgyal bar byed la rgyal ba dag ni rnal du dgod pa de bzhin du 'di yang
analyzed: dmigs pa gzhan 'dor ba dang 'jug pa'i phyir ro // ma rgyal ba rgyal bar byed pa dang rgyal ba rnal du dgod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ji ltar de grong dang grong rdal la sogs pa ma rgyal ba las ni rgyal bar byed la rgyal ba dag ni rnal du dgod pa de bzhin du 'di yang
translated: Or they abandon and engage the focal object of the truth of suffering.üîΩBecause they conquer the unconquered and stabilize the conquered means that just as one conquers unconquered towns and villages and stabilizes those that are conquered, so too here the uninterrupted path conquers the unconquered afflictions such as the afflicted view of the self through eliminating their obtainment.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam gyis 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa nyon mongs pa ma rgyal ba rnams las ni de dag gis thob pa gcod pa'i sgo nas rgyal bar byed la /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam gyis 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa nyon mongs pa ma rgyal ba rnams las ni de dag gis thob pa gcod pa'i sgo nas rgyal bar byed la /
translated: The liberated path stabilizes the conquered.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis rgyal ba rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i bral ba'i thob pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sgo nas rnal du 'god do //üîΩ'phar ba dang 'bab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ji ltar de la lar 'phar shing la lar 'bab pa de bzhin du 'di yang bar chad med pa'i lam dang rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams yang dang yang mngon du byed pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis rgyal ba rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i bral ba'i thob pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sgo nas rnal du 'god do // 'phar ba dang 'bab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ji ltar de la lar 'phar shing la lar 'bab pa de bzhin du 'di yang bar chad med pa'i lam dang rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams yang dang yang mngon du byed pa'am /
translated: The liberated paths of the aryas establish them in their natural state through simultaneously generating the obtainment of freedom from affliction.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i dmigs pa'i sgo nas ci rigs par 'phar zhing 'bab ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i dmigs pa'i sgo nas ci rigs par 'phar zhing 'bab ste /
translated: Because they rise and fall means that just as one rises in some places and falls in other places, so too they manifest the uninterrupted and liberated paths again and again or they rise and fall in terms of the focal object of suffering and so on of the desire realm and so on, respectively.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams la dmigs @209b pa'i phyir 'phar ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams la dmigs @209b pa'i phyir 'phar ro //
translated: They rise because they focus on the form and formless realms.

original: 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa'i phyir 'bab bo //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa'i phyir 'bab bo //
translated: They fall because they focus on the desire realm.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: The correct view and so on

original: 'di ni tshul khrims la brten nas ting nge 'dzin thob la ting nge 'dzin thob pas shes rab yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu skye'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims la brten nas ting nge 'dzin thob la ting nge 'dzin thob pas shes rab yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu skye'o //
translated: Concentration is obtained on the basis of morality, and wisdom is generated in accordance with reality through obtaining concentration.

original: de'i phyir yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba rnams ni lte ba lta bu yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba rnams ni lte ba lta bu yin te /
translated: Therefore, right speech, right action, and right livelihood are like the hub,

original: tshul khrims ni gzhir gyur pa yin pas yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa de la rag las te 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni gzhir gyur pa yin pas yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa de la rag las te 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because morality is the basis and right view and so on depend on it and engage it.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni mu khyud lta bu yin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni mu khyud lta bu yin te /
translated: Concentration is like the rim,

original: des gzhan dag nye bar 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des gzhan dag nye bar 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it holds the others together.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa ni rtsibs lta bu yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa ni rtsibs lta bu yin te /
translated: Right view and so on are like spokes,

original: 'khor lo'i rtsibs bzhin du phan tshun du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i rtsibs bzhin du phan tshun du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they engage each other like the spokes of a wheel.üîΩWhy is the path of seeing the wheel of Dharma?

original: 'di ga las zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam chos kyi 'khor lo yin no zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi rang dga' zhig yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ga las zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam chos kyi 'khor lo yin no zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi rang dga' zhig yin nam /
translated: This is a personal opinion of the Vaibhasikas.

original: 'on te lung las 'byung zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩde skyes na chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro zhes bya ba ni mdo las mthong ba'i lam skyes na /
analyzed: 'on te lung las 'byung zhes bya ba yin no // de skyes na chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro zhes bya ba ni mdo las mthong ba'i lam skyes na /
translated: Or is it from scripture?üîΩWhen it arises, the wheel of Dharma is set in motion.üîΩThis is because a s≈´tra declares:

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor to zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor to zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When the path of seeing arises, the wheel of Dharma is set in motion.

original: ji skad du zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: bcom ldan 'das yul b'a r'a na s'i na drang srong lhung ba ri dags kyi gnas na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yul b'a r'a na s'i na drang srong lhung ba ri dags kyi gnas na bzhugs so //
translated: The Bhagavat was dwelling in the Deer Park at ·πö·π£ipatana in the region of VƒÅrƒÅ·πáasƒ´.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong lnga sde po rnams la bka' stsal pa /üîΩdge slong dag sngon ma thos pa'i chos rnams la 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa yin no zhes tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa la mig skyes so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong lnga sde po rnams la bka' stsal pa / dge slong dag sngon ma thos pa'i chos rnams la 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa yin no zhes tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa la mig skyes so //
translated: Then the Bhagavat addressed the group of five monks:

original: shes pa dang / rig pa dang / slo skyes so //
analyzed: shes pa dang / rig pa dang / slo skyes so //
translated: Monks, with regard to things that were previously unheard, the eye of Dharma arose, knowledge arose, insight arose, and understanding arose.

original: sngon ma thos pa'i chos rnams la 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sngon ma thos pa'i chos rnams la 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: With regard to things that were previously unheard, this is the noble truth of suffering.üîΩThis is the origin of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //

analyzed: de spang bar bya'o //

analyzed: de spangs so zhes bya ba 'di dag ni lan gsum du bzlas pa yin no // bzlas pa re re la mig skyes so //
