original: lan bcu gnyis su bzlas pa dang rnam pa bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur na /
analyzed: lan bcu gnyis su bzlas pa dang rnam pa bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur na /
translated: If each truth has three revolutions and twelve aspects in the same way, then there would be twelve revolutions and forty-eight aspects.

original: ci'i phyir lan gsum du bzlas te rnam pa bcu gnyis zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lan gsum du bzlas te rnam pa bcu gnyis zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it said there are three revolutions and twelve aspects?

original: de'i phyir gsum tshan dang bcu gnyis su chos mthun pa'i phyir lan gsum du bzlas te rnam pa bcu gnyis zhes bshad ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsum tshan dang bcu gnyis su chos mthun pa'i phyir lan gsum du bzlas te rnam pa bcu gnyis zhes bshad ces bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, Because of similarity in sets of three and twelve, it is explained as three revolutions and twelve aspects.

original: gnyis dang / gnas bdun la mkhas pa bstan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis bstan pa lta bu dang / gnas bdun la mkhas pa bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnyis dang / gnas bdun la mkhas pa bstan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis bstan pa lta bu dang / gnas bdun la mkhas pa bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: The two and the seven stations are like the two and the seven stations.

original: dper na mang po zhig bshad pa'i rjes la /
analyzed: dper na mang po zhig bshad pa'i rjes la /
translated: For example, after explaining many things,

original: dge slong dag de'i @211b phyir khyed la gnyis shig bstan par byas te de legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zung shig dang bshad do //
analyzed: dge slong dag de'i @211b phyir khyed la gnyis shig bstan par byas te de legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zung shig dang bshad do //
translated: the Buddha said: Therefore, monks, I will teach you two things. Listen well and pay attention, I will explain.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: mig dang / gzugs rnams zhes bya ba nas yid dang chos rnams so zhes bya ba'i bar lta bu ste /
analyzed: mig dang / gzugs rnams zhes bya ba nas yid dang chos rnams so zhes bya ba'i bar lta bu ste /
translated: The eye and forms, up to the mind and mental objects.

original: ji ltar 'di la gnyis su chos mthun pa'i phyir gnyis zhes bshad pa de bzhin du sum tshan dang bcu gnyis su chos mthun pa'i phyir lan gsum du bzlas te rnam pa bcu gnyis zhes bshad do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di la gnyis su chos mthun pa'i phyir gnyis zhes bshad pa de bzhin du sum tshan dang bcu gnyis su chos mthun pa'i phyir lan gsum du bzlas te rnam pa bcu gnyis zhes bshad do //
translated: Just as it is explained that there are two because of similarity in two things, in the same way, it is explained that there are three repetitions and twelve aspects because of similarity in three groups and twelve.

original: yang dper na dge slong gnas bdun la mkhas pa ni gzugs yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: yang dper na dge slong gnas bdun la mkhas pa ni gzugs yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: For example, a monk who is skilled in the seven stations knows form as it really is.

original: gzugs kun 'byung ba dang / gzugs 'gog pa dang / gzugs 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam dang / gzugs kyi ro myang ba dang / nges par 'byung ba dang / nyes dmigs kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gzugs kun 'byung ba dang / gzugs 'gog pa dang / gzugs 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam dang / gzugs kyi ro myang ba dang / nges par 'byung ba dang / nyes dmigs kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows form as it really is, the source of form, the cessation of form, the path leading to the cessation of form, the enjoyment of form, the danger in form, and the escape from form.

original: gnas bdun la mkhas pa'i dge slong don rnam pa gsum la nye bar rtog pa ni myur ba kho nar chos 'dul ba 'di la sdug bsngal gyi mtha' rab tu shes so zhes 'byung ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: gnas bdun la mkhas pa'i dge slong don rnam pa gsum la nye bar rtog pa ni myur ba kho nar chos 'dul ba 'di la sdug bsngal gyi mtha' rab tu shes so zhes 'byung ba lta bu ste /
translated: A monk who is skilled in the seven stations and who investigates the three meanings will quickly come to know the end of suffering in this Dharma and Vinaya.

original: phung po re re la gnas bdun la mkhas par chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po re re la gnas bdun la mkhas par chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because each of the aggregates is similar to the seven stations.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang sum tshan dang bcu gnyis su chos mthun pa'i phyir lan gsum du bzlas te rnam pa bcu gnyis zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang sum tshan dang bcu gnyis su chos mthun pa'i phyir lan gsum du bzlas te rnam pa bcu gnyis zhes bshad do //
translated: In the same way, here, because of the similarity of the twelve sets of three, it is explained that there are three repetitions and twelve aspects.

original: bzlas pa 'di dag gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mdo las ji skad du bstan pa'i bzlas pa 'di dag gis ni grangs bzhin du mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam rnams bstan te /
analyzed: bzlas pa 'di dag gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mdo las ji skad du bstan pa'i bzlas pa 'di dag gis ni grangs bzhin du mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam rnams bstan te /
translated: The path of seeing is indicated by the passage beginning with:

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: This is the noble truth of suffering and ending with:üîΩThis is the noble truth of the path leading to the cessation of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni mthong ba'i lam bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni mthong ba'i lam bstan to //
translated: The path of meditation is indicated by the passage beginning with:

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa de mngon par shes pas yongs su shes par bya'o zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa de mngon par shes pas yongs su shes par bya'o zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: The noble truth of suffering is to be fully known by direct perception and ending with:üîΩThe noble truth of the path leading to the cessation of suffering is to be cultivated by direct perception.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa de mngon par shes pas bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bsgom pa'i lam bstan to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa de mngon par shes pas bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bsgom pa'i lam bstan to //
translated: The path of no more learning is indicated by the passage beginning with:üîΩThe noble truth of suffering has been fully known and ending with:üîΩThe noble truth of the path leading to the cessation of suffering has been cultivated.

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa de mngon par shes pas yongs su shes so zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa de mngon par shes pas yongs su shes so zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: The noble truth of suffering is fully known by direct knowledge.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa de mngon par shes pas bsgoms so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni @212a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa de mngon par shes pas bsgoms so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni @212a * //
translated: The noble truth of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering is cultivated by direct knowledge.

original: mi slob pa'i lam bstan to //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lam bstan to //
translated: This passage teaches the path of no learning.

original: 'dir slob dpon gyis /üîΩgal te de lta na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon gyis / gal te de lta na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Here the master says:üîΩIf that is so, then the path of seeing would not be the first path,üîΩbecause it is not the first to fully know suffering.

original: gal te de ltar bzlas pa de dag gi grangs bzhin du mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam bstan na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar bzlas pa de dag gi grangs bzhin du mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam bstan na /
translated: If the path of seeing is not the first path, then the path of cultivation would not be the second path,üîΩbecause it is not the second to fully know suffering.üîΩIf the path of cultivation is not the second path, then the path of no more learning would not be the third path,üîΩbecause it is not the third to fully know suffering.üîΩIf the path of no more learning is not the third path, then the path of seeing would not be the first path,üîΩbecause it is not the first to fully know suffering.üîΩIf the path of seeing is not the first path, then the path of cultivation would not be the second path,üîΩbecause it is not the second to fully know suffering.üîΩIf the path of cultivation is not the second path, then the path of no more learning would not be the third path,üîΩbecause it is not the third to fully know suffering.

original: 'o na ni mthong ba'i lam kho na lan gsum du bzlas pa yang ma yin la rnam pa bcu gnyis kyang ma yin no //üîΩ'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni mthong ba'i lam kho na lan gsum du bzlas pa yang ma yin la rnam pa bcu gnyis kyang ma yin no // 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If the path of no more learning is not the third path, then the path of seeing would not be the first path,üîΩbecause it is not the first to fully know suffering.üîΩIf the path of seeing is not the first path, then the path of cultivation would not be the second path,üîΩbecause it is not the second to fully know suffering.üîΩIf the path of cultivation is not the second path, then the path of no more learning would not be the third path,üîΩbecause it is not the third to fully know suffering.

original: lan cig bzlas pa dang rnam pa bzhi yin na /
analyzed: lan cig bzlas pa dang rnam pa bzhi yin na /
translated: If the path of no more learning is not the third path, then the path of seeing would not be the first path,üîΩbecause it is not the first to fully know suffering.üîΩIf the path of seeing is not the first path, then the path of cultivation would not be the second path,üîΩbecause it is not the second to fully know suffering.üîΩIf the path of cultivation is not the second path, then the path of no more learning would not be the third path,üîΩbecause it is not the third to fully know suffering.üîΩIf the path of no more learning is not the third path, then the path of seeing would not be the

original: ji ltar mthong ba'i lam 'di chos kyi 'khor lor rnam par gzhag / bzlas pa med pas 'khor lo dang chos mthun pa med pa'i phyir 'khor lo mi rung ngo snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba'i lam 'di chos kyi 'khor lor rnam par gzhag / bzlas pa med pas 'khor lo dang chos mthun pa med pa'i phyir 'khor lo mi rung ngo snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: He thinks that it is not suitable to be a wheel because it does not have the similarity to a wheel of having no repetition.

original: de lta bas na chos kyi rnam grangs de nyid chos kyi 'khor lo yang yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na chos kyi rnam grangs de nyid chos kyi 'khor lo yang yin te /
translated: Therefore, that enumeration of Dharma is also the wheel of the Dharma,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it teaches the wheel of the Dharma.

original: lan gsum du bzlas pa dang rnam pa bcu gnyis kyang yin par rung ste de dag gi don rab tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lan gsum du bzlas pa dang rnam pa bcu gnyis kyang yin par rung ste de dag gi don rab tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also suitable to have three repetitions and twelve aspects, because it teaches the meaning of those.

original: lan gsum du bzlas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal zhes bya ba nas lam zhes bya ba'i bar ni bzlas pa gcig yin no //
analyzed: lan gsum du bzlas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal zhes bya ba nas lam zhes bya ba'i bar ni bzlas pa gcig yin no //
translated: It has three repetitions because the first repetition is from ‚Äúsuffering‚Äù to ‚Äúpath.‚Äù

original: yongs su shes par bya zhes bya ba nas bsgom par bya zhes bya ba'i bar ni gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya zhes bya ba nas bsgom par bya zhes bya ba'i bar ni gnyis pa yin no //
translated: The second repetition is from ‚Äúshould be fully known‚Äù to ‚Äúshould be cultivated.‚Äù

original: yongs su shes so zhes bya ba nas bsgoms so zhes bya ba'i bar ni gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su shes so zhes bya ba nas bsgoms so zhes bya ba'i bar ni gsum pa yin no //
translated: The third repetition is from ‚Äúis fully known‚Äù to ‚Äúis cultivated.‚Äù

original: bden pa rnams la rnam pa gsum du byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: bden pa rnams la rnam pa gsum du byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: this is the truth of suffering,

original: kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: this is the origin of suffering,üîΩthis is the cessation of suffering,üîΩthis is the path.

original: 'gog pa'o // lam mo zhes bya bar bden pa'i rang gi ngo bo la dmigs pa'i rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'o // lam mo zhes bya bar bden pa'i rang gi ngo bo la dmigs pa'i rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four aspects that have the nature of the activity of complete knowledge, etc., are:

original: yongs su shes par bya /
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya /
translated: this is to be completely known,

original: spang bar bya /
analyzed: spang bar bya /
translated: this is to be abandoned,

original: mngon sum du bya /
analyzed: mngon sum du bya /
translated: this is to be manifested,üîΩthis is to be cultivated.

original: bsgom par bya zhes bya ba yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i tshul bya ba'i ngo bor dmigs pa'i rnam pa gnyis pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: bsgom par bya zhes bya ba yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i tshul bya ba'i ngo bor dmigs pa'i rnam pa gnyis pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four aspects that have the nature of the culmination of complete knowledge, etc., are:

original: yongs su shes so //
analyzed: yongs su shes so //
translated: this is completely known,üîΩthis is abandoned,

original: spangs so // mngon sum du byas so //üîΩbsgoms so zhes bya ba yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i tshul mthar thug par dmigs pa'i rnam pa gsum pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: spangs so // mngon sum du byas so // bsgoms so zhes bya ba yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i tshul mthar thug par dmigs pa'i rnam pa gsum pa bzhi ste /
translated: this is manifested,üîΩthis is cultivated.

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus there are twelve aspects.

original: de bskor ba zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rnam grangs de bskor ba ni gzhan gyi rgyud la go bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: de bskor ba zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rnam grangs de bskor ba ni gzhan gyi rgyud la go bar byed pa ste /
translated: The wheel of the Dharma is the teaching of that doctrine to others.

original: gdul ba'i skye bo'i rgyud la gtong bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gdul ba'i skye bo'i rgyud la gtong bar byed pa yin no //
translated: It is set in motion in the mental continuum of the person to be disciplined.

original: ji ltar go bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar go bar byed ce na /
translated: How is it set in motion?

original: don shes par byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang na 'phags pa'i lam thams cad de /
analyzed: don shes par byed pa'i phyir ro // yang na 'phags pa'i lam thams cad de /
translated: Because it causes the meaning to be understood.üîΩOr else, the wheel of the Dharma is all the noble paths,

original: mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam yang chos kyi @212b 'khor lo yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam yang chos kyi @212b 'khor lo yin te /
translated: the paths of insight, cultivation, and the adept.

original: 'dul ba'i skye bo'i rgyud la 'jug pas 'khor lo zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dul ba'i skye bo'i rgyud la 'jug pas 'khor lo zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called a wheel because it is set in motion in the mental continuum of the person to be disciplined.

original: gal te 'phags pa'i lam thams cad chos kyi 'khor lo yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'phags pa'i lam thams cad chos kyi 'khor lo yin na /
translated: If all the noble paths are the wheel of the Dharma,

original: ji ltar 'phags pa koo ndi n+ya la mthong ba'i lam skyes pa tsam gyis de bskor to zhes smras she na de'i phyir smras pa /üîΩde ni gzhan gyi rgyud la ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa koo ndi n+ya la mthong ba'i lam skyes pa tsam gyis de bskor to zhes smras she na de'i phyir smras pa / de ni gzhan gyi rgyud la ste /
translated: why is it said that the wheel was set in motion for Kau·πá·∏çinya when the path of insight was produced in him?üîΩIt is said that the wheel was set in motion in the mental continuum of Kau·πá·∏çinya,

original: 'phags pa koo ndi n+ya'i rgyud la mthong ba'i lam bskyed pa'i phyir bskor bar brtsams pa yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa koo ndi n+ya'i rgyud la mthong ba'i lam bskyed pa'i phyir bskor bar brtsams pa yin te /
translated: because the path of insight was produced in his mental continuum.

original: dang por bskor ba yin pas de'i phyir bskor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang por bskor ba yin pas de'i phyir bskor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the wheel because it was set in motion for the first time.

original: las dang po pa la yang rab tu zhes pa'i sgra yod de /
analyzed: las dang po pa la yang rab tu zhes pa'i sgra yod de /
translated: The word ‚Äúsupreme‚Äù exists for beginners.

original: dper na 'bras chan rab tu zos so zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'bras chan rab tu zos so zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like saying ‚ÄúI ate rice very well.‚Äù

original: gsum pa go ci'i phyir mi thob ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsum pa go ci'i phyir mi thob ces bya ba ni /
translated: Why don‚Äôt they obtain it?

original: gal te gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa zhig nges pa la 'jug na sems kyi skad cig bcu drug la ci'i phyir phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mi thob snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa zhig nges pa la 'jug na sems kyi skad cig bcu drug la ci'i phyir phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mi thob snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: If one born in the form realm enters the state of absorption, why don‚Äôt they obtain the result of nonreturn in sixteen moments of mind?

original: lan du gong na mthong lam med ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du gong na mthong lam med ces bya ba smos te /
translated: The reply is: Because the path of seeing does not exist above it.

original: nyan pa med ces bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i khams na yod na yang rang byung gi byang chub ni mi srid pa'i phyir nyan thos kyi byang chub kho na yod par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: nyan pa med ces bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i khams na yod na yang rang byung gi byang chub ni mi srid pa'i phyir nyan thos kyi byang chub kho na yod par 'gyur grang na /
translated: If it exists in the formless realm, then only the enlightenment of ≈õrƒÅvakas would exist there, because the enlightenment of pratyekabuddhas and the enlightenment of buddhas are impossible.

original: nyan thos kyi mngon par rtogs pa yang gzhan las ma thos par mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi mngon par rtogs pa yang gzhan las ma thos par mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Also, the realization of ≈õrƒÅvakas does not occur without hearing from another.

original: gzhan yang khams 'og ma la mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan yang khams 'og ma la mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Moreover, it does not focus on lower realms.

original: gzugs med dngos gzhi dge rnams kyi //
analyzed: gzugs med dngos gzhi dge rnams kyi //
translated: The actual basis of the formless realm is virtuous.

original: spyod yul zag bcas 'og ma min //
analyzed: spyod yul zag bcas 'og ma min //
translated: The path of insight does not exist in the realm of desire, because its domain is not defiled, and because it is not of the lower stage.

original: zhes 'byung ba la mthong ba'i lam ni khams gsum char la dmigs dgos pas de'i phyir de na de med do //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba la mthong ba'i lam ni khams gsum char la dmigs dgos pas de'i phyir de na de med do //
translated: The path of insight must have as its object all three realms.

original: rtsom pa ni mgo 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: rtsom pa ni mgo 'jug pa ste /
translated: The beginning is the commencement of the path of insight.

original: thabs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thabs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The method is the meaning of the word ‚Äúpath.‚Äù

original: 'di la yongs su nyams pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin yod pas na yongs su nyams pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: 'di la yongs su nyams pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin yod pas na yongs su nyams pa'i chos can no //
translated: One who has the nature of falling away is one who has the nature of falling away.

original: 'che bar sems pa'i chos can ni bdag nyid 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: 'che bar sems pa'i chos can ni bdag nyid 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can no //
translated: One who has the nature of resolving is one who has the nature of resolving to die.

original: rjes su srung ba'i chos can ni rnam par grol ba de rjes su srung nus pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su srung ba'i chos can ni rnam par grol ba de rjes su srung nus pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: One who has the nature of guarding is one who is able to guard the liberation.

original: gnas pa las mi bskyod pa ni rnam par grol ba gang la gnas pa de las mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pa las mi bskyod pa ni rnam par grol ba gang la gnas pa de las mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: One who is unshakable from abiding is one who does not move from the liberation in which he abides.

original: rtogs pa'i skal ba can ni dbang po 'pho ba'i skal ba can no //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i skal ba can ni dbang po 'pho ba'i skal ba can no //
translated: One who has the nature of penetrating is one who has the nature of penetrating the faculties.

original: mi g-yo pa'i chos can ni 'di la mi g-yo zhing mi 'gyur ba'i chos yod pas na mi g-yo ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: mi g-yo pa'i chos can ni 'di la mi g-yo zhing mi 'gyur ba'i chos yod pas na mi g-yo ba'i chos can no //
translated: One who has the nature of immovability is one who has the nature of being immovable and unchangeable.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This is twofold:üîΩ

original: rang bzhin gyis dbang po rnon po dang / dbang po 'phos pas dbang po rnon bo'o //üîΩlnga ni dad pas @213a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dbang po rnon po dang / dbang po 'phos pas dbang po rnon bo'o // lnga ni dad pas @213a * //
translated: There are two types of those who are sharp by nature and those who are sharp by the transmutation of faculties.

original: mos las skyes //
analyzed: mos las skyes //
translated: The five are born from those resolute in faith.üîΩThe five are born from those resolute in faith.

original: zhes bya ba ni dad pas mos pa las skyes pa kho na yin no zhes nges par bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dad pas mos pa las skyes pa kho na yin no zhes nges par bzung ba yin no //
translated: This is a restrictive rule.

original: de dag ni dad pas mos par gyur pa las skyes ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste //
analyzed: de dag ni dad pas mos par gyur pa las skyes ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste //
translated: They are born from those who are resolute in faith.

original: dad pas mos pa sngon du 'gro ba dag yin no zhes bshad pa'i don to //
analyzed: dad pas mos pa sngon du 'gro ba dag yin no zhes bshad pa'i don to //
translated: They are preceded by faith and resolution.

original: drug pa ni gzhan du yang 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: drug pa ni gzhan du yang 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: The sixth is also born from those who are resolute in faith, but it is also born from others.

original: dus dang sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni yo byad dang / nad med pa dang / yul gyi khyad par la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dus las byung bas na dus dang sbyor ba pa'o //
analyzed: dus dang sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni yo byad dang / nad med pa dang / yul gyi khyad par la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dus las byung bas na dus dang sbyor ba pa'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúin accordance with circumstances‚Äù means that it arises from circumstances that are favorable conditions, such as the possession of requisites, good health, and a good location.

original: 'phangs pa yin zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'phangs pa yin zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by ‚Äúprojected‚Äù?

original: sems kyi rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: It is the liberation of the mind.

original: ci'i phyir 'phangs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'phangs she na /
translated: Why is it projected?

original: rtag tu rjes su bsrung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtag tu rjes su bsrung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because they are always to be protected.

original: 'jig rten na yang 'phangs pa ni rtag tu rjes su bsrung bar bya ba yin no zhes bya bar snang ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang 'phangs pa ni rtag tu rjes su bsrung bar bya ba yin no zhes bya bar snang ngo //
translated: In the world, those who are dear are always to be protected.

original: mdo las kyang 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu mig gcig yod pa la nye du rnams 'di'i mig gcig ma zhar ba gang yin pa nga yang zhar bar gyur na mi rung ngo zhes de'i mig la grong ba dang / tsha ba dang / rdal rdul gyis mi phog par bya ba'i phyir mig ya gcig la legs par rab tu rjes su bsrung bar bya'o snyam du sems pa ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo las kyang 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu mig gcig yod pa la nye du rnams 'di'i mig gcig ma zhar ba gang yin pa nga yang zhar bar gyur na mi rung ngo zhes de'i mig la grong ba dang / tsha ba dang / rdal rdul gyis mi phog par bya ba'i phyir mig ya gcig la legs par rab tu rjes su bsrung bar bya'o snyam du sems pa ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: A sutra also says, For example, a person has one eye. His relatives think, ‚ÄúIt would not be right for his one eye to be damaged. We must protect his one eye well so that it is not damaged by dust or smoke.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du dgra bcom pa dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i chos 'di yang rjes su bsrung bar bya ba dang / brtse bar bya ba dang / rjes su gzung bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dgra bcom pa dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i chos 'di yang rjes su bsrung bar bya ba dang / brtse bar bya ba dang / rjes su gzung bar bya ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, this Dharma of arhats liberated according to circumstances is to be protected, loved, and cared for.

original: de'i phyir dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i dgra bcom pa yang de bzhin du ci nas kyang bdag chos 'di las yongs su mi nyams par bya'o zhes legs par rab tu rjes su srung zar sems pas de las yongs su nyams par ma 'gyur ro //üîΩmar gyi bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na mar gyis gang ba'i bum pa la bar gyi tshig gang ba zhes bya ba'i sgra mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir mar gyi bum pa zhes bya ba lta bu'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i dgra bcom pa yang de bzhin du ci nas kyang bdag chos 'di las yongs su mi nyams par bya'o zhes legs par rab tu rjes su srung zar sems pas de las yongs su nyams par ma 'gyur ro // mar gyi bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na mar gyis gang ba'i bum pa la bar gyi tshig gang ba zhes bya ba'i sgra mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir mar gyi bum pa zhes bya ba lta bu'am /
translated: Therefore, the arhat liberated according to circumstances also thinks, I will guard well so that I do not fall away from this state, and he does not fall away.üîΩLike a pot of butterüîΩFor example, a pot filled with butter is called a pot of butter, because the word filled is elided.

original: dper na mar la ltos pa'i bum pa ni mar gyi bum pa ste /
analyzed: dper na mar la ltos pa'i bum pa ni mar gyi bum pa ste /
translated: Or, a pot that is related to butter is a pot of butter,

original: gang du mar ldugs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang du mar ldugs pa yin no //
translated: because it is a container for butter.üîΩThe word related is elided, and it is called a pot of butter.

original: ltos pa zhes bya ba'i sgra mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir mar gyi bum pa zhes bya ba de bzhin du 'dir yang bar gyi tshig ltos pa zhes bya ba'i sgra mi mngon par byas ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltos pa zhes bya ba'i sgra mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir mar gyi bum pa zhes bya ba de bzhin du 'dir yang bar gyi tshig ltos pa zhes bya ba'i sgra mi mngon par byas ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, the word related is elided here.

original: 'di dag ni dus la ltos pa yang yin la rnam par grol pa yang yin pas dus kyis rnam par grol ba zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'di dag ni dus la ltos pa yang yin la rnam par grol pa yang yin pas dus kyis rnam par grol ba zhes bshad do //
translated: They are called ‚Äútemporarily liberated‚Äù because they are liberated for a time, and because they depend on time.

original: dus ni yo byad la sogs pa yin par bshad zin to //
analyzed: dus ni yo byad la sogs pa yin par bshad zin to //
translated: Time has already been explained as referring to requisites, etc.

original: ji @213b ltar g-yo bar mi nus pa'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ji @213b ltar g-yo bar mi nus pa'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why are they not able to move?

original: yongs su mi nyams pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩyang na dus gzhan gyi bar dang / gtan du rnam par grol ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan gyi bar du rnam par grol ba'i phyir dus kyis rnam par grol ba nyid yin la gtan du rnam par grol ba'i phyir dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba nyid yin no zhes bya
analyzed: yongs su mi nyams pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba smos so // yang na dus gzhan gyi bar dang / gtan du rnam par grol ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan gyi bar du rnam par grol ba'i phyir dus kyis rnam par grol ba nyid yin la gtan du rnam par grol ba'i phyir dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba nyid yin no zhes bya
translated: The text says, ‚Äúbecause of the possibility of complete degeneration.‚ÄùüîΩOr else, because of liberation for a time and because of permanent liberation.

original: ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they are temporarily liberated because of liberation for a time, and they are liberated not in time because of permanent liberation.

original: ji ltar de lta yin zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: ji ltar de lta yin zhe na smras pa /
translated: How is this so?

original: yongs su nyams pa srid pa dang / mi srid pa'i sgo nas te /
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa srid pa dang / mi srid pa'i sgo nas te /
translated: It is said: because of the possibility and impossibility of complete degeneration.

original: yongs su nyams pa srid pa'i sgo nas dus gzhan gyi bar du rnam par grol ba'i phyir dus kyis rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba la yongs su nyams pa mi srid pa'i sgo nas gtan du rnam par grol ba'i phyir dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa srid pa'i sgo nas dus gzhan gyi bar du rnam par grol ba'i phyir dus kyis rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba la yongs su nyams pa mi srid pa'i sgo nas gtan du rnam par grol ba'i phyir dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par
translated: One who is liberated temporarily by the door of complete degeneration is called ‚Äúliberated according to circumstances.‚Äù

original: grol ba zhes bya'o //üîΩde ni mthong thob rgyu las byung //
analyzed: grol ba zhes bya'o // de ni mthong thob rgyu las byung //
translated: One who is liberated by the door of nondegeneration is called ‚Äúnoncircumstantially liberated.‚ÄùüîΩIf one who obtains results by insightüîΩtransforms faculties, he becomes one obtaining results by insight.üîΩIf one who obtains results by insight transforms his intellectual faculty, he becomes one who obtains results by insight and one who obtains results by insight and transforms his intellectual faculty.

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te de slob par gyur pa las dbang po dag 'pho bar byed na yang mthong bas thob pa nyid du 'gyur la /üîΩ'on te rang bzhin gyis dbang po rnon po zhig yin na yang sems kyi skad cig bcu drug la mthong bas thob pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te de slob par gyur pa las dbang po dag 'pho bar byed na yang mthong bas thob pa nyid du 'gyur la / 'on te rang bzhin gyis dbang po rnon po zhig yin na yang sems kyi skad cig bcu drug la mthong bas thob pa kho na yin te /
translated: If one who obtains results by insight transforms his intellectual faculty, he becomes one who obtains results by insight and one who obtains results by insight and transforms his original: de lta bas na mi g-yo ba'i chos can 'di ni mthong bas thob pa sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya'i /
analyzed: de lta bas na mi g-yo ba'i chos can 'di ni mthong bas thob pa sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya'i /
translated: If one who obtains results by insight

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can dgra bcom pa nyid kyi gnas skabs na dbang po dag 'pho bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni mthong bas thob pa sngon du 'gro ba ma yin zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can dgra bcom pa nyid kyi gnas skabs na dbang po dag 'pho bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni mthong bas thob pa sngon du 'gro ba ma yin zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One who upgrades faculties while an arhat with immutable liberation should be understood as not preceded by the state of one obtaining results by insight.

original: kha cig ni dang po nyid nas 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can gyi rigs can yin la zhes bya bar brjod kyi yongs su nyams pa'i chos can yin no zhes ni mi brjod do //
analyzed: kha cig ni dang po nyid nas 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can gyi rigs can yin la zhes bya bar brjod kyi yongs su nyams pa'i chos can yin no zhes ni mi brjod do //
translated: Some are by nature those who die in the intermediate state from the very beginning, but it is not said they are by nature those who fully degenerate.

original: 'di ltar de ni sbyangs pa las gyur pa ma yin pas kha cig ni dang po nas de'i rigs can yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni sbyangs pa las gyur pa ma yin pas kha cig ni dang po nas de'i rigs can yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus it is said that some are by nature those who die in the intermediate state from the very beginning because they are not those who fully degenerate through degeneration.

original: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can gyi rigs can zhes bya ba nas mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyi rigs can zhes bya ba'i bar 'di ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can gyi rigs can zhes bya ba nas mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyi rigs can zhes bya ba'i bar 'di ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of those who fully degenerate and so on up to those who are immutable?

original: des ni yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa'i rigs ma bstan to //
analyzed: des ni yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa'i rigs ma bstan to //
translated: It does not teach the nature of those who fully degenerate and so on.

original: de la kha cig ni 'di skad du rigs zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dag yin te /
analyzed: de la kha cig ni 'di skad du rigs zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dag yin te /
translated: Some say: The term gotra means roots of virtue.

original: 'ga' zhig la yongs su nyams pa'i chos can nas mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyi bar du 'gyur ba gang yin pa de lta bu de dag yod do zhes brjod do //üîΩgzhan dag na re rigs zhes bya ba ni so so'i @214a * //üîΩskye bo'i gnas skabs nas bzung ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la yongs su nyams pa'i chos can nas mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyi bar du 'gyur ba gang yin pa de lta bu de dag yod do zhes brjod do // gzhan dag na re rigs zhes bya ba ni so so'i @214a * // skye bo'i gnas skabs nas bzung ste /
translated: There are those who degenerate from the state of an arhat and so on up to one who is immutable.

original: dbang po'i khyad par yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i khyad par yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The term gotra means the specific states of the faculties from the state of an ordinary being up to an arhat.üîΩSautrantikas say: The term gotra means the potency of the seed of mind.

original: mdo sde bdag na re rigs zhes bya ba ni sems kyi sa bon nus ba yin te so so'i skye bo dang slob pa'i gnas skabs na yang yongs su nyams pa'i chos kyi sa bon rgyu yod na yongs su nyams pa'i chos can gyi rigs can zhes bya
analyzed: mdo sde bdag na re rigs zhes bya ba ni sems kyi sa bon nus ba yin te so so'i skye bo dang slob pa'i gnas skabs na yang yongs su nyams pa'i chos kyi sa bon rgyu yod na yongs su nyams pa'i chos can gyi rigs can zhes bya
translated: Even in the states of an ordinary being and a learner, if the seed of complete degeneration exists, one is said to possess the gotra of one who fully degenerates.

original: ba la / de bzhin du mi slob pa'i gnas skabs na yang de'i sa bon 'jug pa rnyed nas yongs su nyams pa'i chos can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ba la / de bzhin du mi slob pa'i gnas skabs na yang de'i sa bon 'jug pa rnyed nas yongs su nyams pa'i chos can zhes bya ste /
translated: Similarly, even in the state of a nonlearner, if the seed of complete degeneration is activated, one is said to be one who fully degenerates.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyi bar du yang de dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyi bar du yang de dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
translated: So too, up to one who is immutable.

original: de la yongs su nyams pa'i chos can zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de la yongs su nyams pa'i chos can zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: One who is subject to complete degenerationüîΩand so on are the five types of arhat.

original: gal te yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i skal ba dang ldan zhes bya ba de tsam kho na zhig brjod kyi /
analyzed: gal te yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i skal ba dang ldan zhes bya ba de tsam kho na zhig brjod kyi /
translated: If it is said that one who is subject to complete degeneration is one who possesses the fortune of complete degeneration,

original: 'di 'chi bar sems pa la sogs pa'i chos can ni ma yin pa zhes bya ba de ma brjod na /
analyzed: 'di 'chi bar sems pa la sogs pa'i chos can ni ma yin pa zhes bya ba de ma brjod na /
translated: but it is not said that he is one who contemplates death and so on,

original: 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can la sogs pa bzhi po de dag thams cad kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i skal ba dang ldan pas yongs su nyams pa'i chos can de dag kho na gang yang rung ba zhig yin bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can la sogs pa bzhi po de dag thams cad kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i skal ba dang ldan pas yongs su nyams pa'i chos can de dag kho na gang yang rung ba zhig yin bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: then all four, such as one who contemplates death and so on, would be one who is subject to complete degeneration since they possess the fortune of complete degeneration.

original: de dag las gzhan lnga pa ni med do //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan lnga pa ni med do //
translated: But it would not be the fifth type other than those.

original: de'i phyir lnga pa 'di ni de dag las gzhan pa kho na zhes khyad par du bya ba'i phyir 'chi bar sems pa la sogs pa'i chos can ma yin pa'o zhes smos so //üîΩ'chi bar sems pa'i chos can la sogs pa bzhi ni yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ma yin pa las re re'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bstan pa kho nas 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can ni 'chi bar sems par 'gyur ba'i skal ba dang ldan gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir lnga pa 'di ni de dag las gzhan pa kho na zhes khyad par du bya ba'i phyir 'chi bar sems pa la sogs pa'i chos can ma yin pa'o zhes smos so // 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can la sogs pa bzhi ni yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ma yin pa las re re'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bstan pa kho nas 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can ni 'chi bar sems par 'gyur ba'i skal ba dang ldan gyi /
translated: Therefore, since the fifth is different from those, it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not one who is resolute in faith, etc.‚ÄùüîΩThe four, such as one resolute in faith, are not those who fully degenerate. Since the defining characteristics of each are taught, it is unnecessary to state, ‚ÄúOne who is resolute in faith is one who possesses the fortune to become resolute in faith,

original: rjes su srung ba'i chos can ma yin pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni brjod mi dgos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rjes su srung ba'i chos can ma yin pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni brjod mi dgos par 'gyur te /
translated: but is not one who guards.‚Äù

original: rjes su srung ba'i chos can yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rjes su srung ba'i chos can yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same applies to one who is resolute in guarding.

original: yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i rkyen stobs dang ldan pa med na zhes bya ba ni gal te yongs su nyams bar 'gyur ba'i rkyen stobs dang ldan par gyur na de yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i rkyen stobs dang ldan pa med na zhes bya ba ni gal te yongs su nyams bar 'gyur ba'i rkyen stobs dang ldan par gyur na de yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: This means that if there is a powerful condition for complete degeneration, then he completely degenerates.

original: rkyen stobs dang ldan pa smos pa 'dis ni sngar bshad pa yongs su nyams pa'i chos can las khyad par du byed de /
analyzed: rkyen stobs dang ldan pa smos pa 'dis ni sngar bshad pa yongs su nyams pa'i chos can las khyad par du byed de /
translated: This mention of powerful conditions distinguishes this from the previously explained subject of complete degeneration.

original: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i rkyen stobs dang mi ldan pas kyang yongs su nyams @214b bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i rkyen stobs dang mi ldan pas kyang yongs su nyams @214b bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The subject of complete degeneration completely degenerates even without a powerful condition for complete degeneration.üîΩThe conditions for complete degeneration are as they appear in the sutras.

original: yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i rkyen rnams ni mdo las ji skad du 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i rkyen rnams ni mdo las ji skad du 'byung ba ste /
translated: The sutras state:

original: rkyen lnga dang / rgyu lngas dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i dgra bcom pa yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkyen lnga dang / rgyu lngas dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i dgra bcom pa yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Arhats liberated according to circumstances completely degenerate through five conditions and five causes.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: las kyi mtha' la zhugs pa yin /
analyzed: las kyi mtha' la zhugs pa yin /
translated: They engage in the limits of action.

original: smra ba la zhugs pa yin /
analyzed: smra ba la zhugs pa yin /
translated: They engage in speech.

original: rtsod pa la zhugs pa yin /üîΩring du rgyu ba'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: rtsod pa la zhugs pa yin / ring du rgyu ba'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa yin /
translated: They are engaged in debate.üîΩThey are engaged in the practice of traveling long distances.

original: nad kyi rnam pa yun ring pos thebs pa yin zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nad kyi rnam pa yun ring pos thebs pa yin zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: They are afflicted by a long illness.

original: rjes su ma bsrungs kyang zhes bya ba 'dis ni rjes su srung ba'i chos can las khyad par du byed de /
analyzed: rjes su ma bsrungs kyang zhes bya ba 'dis ni rjes su srung ba'i chos can las khyad par du byed de /
translated: Even though they do not guard it means that they are distinguished from those who guard their result.üîΩEven though they do not guard it, they do not retrogress from their result.

original: 'di ni rjes sum bsrungs kyang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur la de ni bsrungs kyang nyams par 'gyur bas 'bras bu de rjes sum bsrungs kyang 'bras bu de la gnas par 'gyur ba'i skal ba can yin zhing 'bras bu de las nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang
analyzed: 'di ni rjes sum bsrungs kyang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur la de ni bsrungs kyang nyams par 'gyur bas 'bras bu de rjes sum bsrungs kyang 'bras bu de la gnas par 'gyur ba'i skal ba can yin zhing 'bras bu de las nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang
translated: They are fortunate to remain in their result even though they do not guard it and they do not retrogress from their result.

original: / mngon par brtson pa med na ste /
analyzed: / mngon par brtson pa med na ste /
translated: If they are not striving,

original: brtson 'grus med na rtogs pa'i skal ba can thob bar 'phel bar yang mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus med na rtogs pa'i skal ba can thob bar 'phel bar yang mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: if they are not making effort, they do not obtain the fortune of realization and their progress does not increase.

original: shugs kyis na gal te brtson par byed na skal ba can du 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: shugs kyis na gal te brtson par byed na skal ba can du 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This implicitly explains that if they strive, they obtain the fortune of realization.

original: de ltar na 'di rtogs pa'i skal ba can las kyang bye brag tu byas pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di rtogs pa'i skal ba can las kyang bye brag tu byas pa yin te /
translated: Thus, those who are fortunate to realize this are distinguished from those who are not.

original: de ni mngon par brtson pa med kyang rtogs par 'gyur ba'i skal ba can yin no //
analyzed: de ni mngon par brtson pa med kyang rtogs par 'gyur ba'i skal ba can yin no //
translated: Those who are fortunate to realize this are not diligent, but they are fortunate to realize this.

original: dang po gnyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni rgyun du sbyor ba dang gus par sbyor ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: dang po gnyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni rgyun du sbyor ba dang gus par sbyor ba med pa yin no //
translated: Those who are subject to complete degeneration are not always and devotedly engaged.

original: 'chi bar sems pa yang rgyun du sbyor ba med pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'chi bar sems pa yang rgyun du sbyor ba med pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Those who are subject to death are not always engaged,

original: khyad par du gus par sbyor ba med pa yin pas 'di gnyis bye brag yin no //
analyzed: khyad par du gus par sbyor ba med pa yin pas 'di gnyis bye brag yin no //
translated: but they are distinguished from the former by being devotedly engaged.üîΩThose who are subject to degeneration are of dull faculty,

original: dbang po rtul po yin no zhes bya ba ni drug pa las khyad par du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rtul po yin no zhes bya ba ni drug pa las khyad par du byed pa yin no //
translated: distinguished from the sixth.

original: drug pa ni dbang po rnon po yin te /
analyzed: drug pa ni dbang po rnon po yin te /
translated: The sixth is of sharp faculty.

original: 'di gnyis dbang pos byas pa'i bye brag yod kyi sbyor bas byas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis dbang pos byas pa'i bye brag yod kyi sbyor bas byas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: These two are distinguished by faculty, not by application.üîΩThose who are not subject to degeneration are of sharp faculty.

original: de ltar byas na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang gi phyir de ltar nges pa med pa de'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na yang dgra bcom pa drug yod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar byas na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang gi phyir de ltar nges pa med pa de'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na yang dgra bcom pa drug yod kyi /
translated: Thus, the six types of arhat exist in the form and formless realms.

original: 'dod pa'i mas 'ba' zhig na drug yod pa ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i mas 'ba' zhig na drug yod pa ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: They do not exist only in the desire realm.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na ni gnas pa las mi bskyod pa dang mi g-yo ba'i chos can dang gnyis zhes bya ba la /üîΩgnas pa las mi bskyod ba ni gnas pa las mi bskyod @215a * //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na ni gnas pa las mi bskyod pa dang mi g-yo ba'i chos can dang gnyis zhes bya ba la / gnas pa las mi bskyod ba ni gnas pa las mi bskyod @215a * //
translated: In the form and formless realms, there are two types: those resolute in faith and those obtaining results by insight.üîΩThose resolute in faith are resolute in faith in the state of nonregression, but they are not resolute in faith in the state of being destined for realization.

original: pa nyid du dad par 'gyur ba yin gyi rtogs pa'i skal ba can nyid du bya bar gus pa ni ma yin pas 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnas pa las mi g-yo ba ni rtogs pa'i skal ba can nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: pa nyid du dad par 'gyur ba yin gyi rtogs pa'i skal ba can nyid du bya bar gus pa ni ma yin pas 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnas pa las mi g-yo ba ni rtogs pa'i skal ba can nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, those resolute in faith in the desire realm do not regress from their state, but they do regress from being destined for realization.

original: de gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na ni yongs su nyams pa'i rkyen stobs dang ldan pa med pas de yongs su nyams par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na ni yongs su nyams pa'i rkyen stobs dang ldan pa med pas de yongs su nyams par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: In the form and formless realms, there is no powerful condition for complete degeneration, so complete degeneration does not occur.

original: dbang po dag 'pho ba yang med pas de na gnas pa las mi g-yo ba'i rigs kho nar 'dug go //
analyzed: dbang po dag 'pho ba yang med pas de na gnas pa las mi g-yo ba'i rigs kho nar 'dug go //
translated: Also, since there is no upgrading of intellectual faculty, those who are born there remain as those who do not upgrade.

original: mi g-yo ba'i rnam bar grol ba dang ldan pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba'i chos can yang yod pa nyid pas de gnyis kho na yod kyi de las gzhan pa dag ni med do //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i rnam bar grol ba dang ldan pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba'i chos can yang yod pa nyid pas de gnyis kho na yod kyi de las gzhan pa dag ni med do //
translated: But those who possess immutable liberation are immutable arhats, so only those two exist and others do not.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams de gnyis na yongs su nyams pa dang 'chi bar sems pa dang dbang po 'pho ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams de gnyis na yongs su nyams pa dang 'chi bar sems pa dang dbang po 'pho ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because complete degeneration, death and the upgrading of intellectual faculty do not exist in those two realms.

original: re zhig de na yongs su nyams pa med pa'i phyir yongs su nyams pa'i chos can med do //
analyzed: re zhig de na yongs su nyams pa med pa'i phyir yongs su nyams pa'i chos can med do //
translated: First, those who completely degenerate do not exist there because complete degeneration does not occur there.

original: rjes su srung ba'i chos can yang yongs su nyams pa med pa nyid kyis rjes su bsrung bar bya ba nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir med do //
analyzed: rjes su srung ba'i chos can yang yongs su nyams pa med pa nyid kyis rjes su bsrung bar bya ba nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir med do //
translated: One who is an arhat who does not fall away is also not a candidate for arhatship, because it is untenable that one who does not fall away is a candidate for arhatship.

original: dbang po 'pho ba med pa de nyid kyi phyir rtogs pa'i skal ba can yang med de /
analyzed: dbang po 'pho ba med pa de nyid kyi phyir rtogs pa'i skal ba can yang med de /
translated: One who does not upgrade his intellectual faculty is also not a candidate for arhatship,

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: because it is said:

original: de dang gong du skyes pa ni //
analyzed: de dang gong du skyes pa ni //
translated: One born in a higher level

original: yongs nyams dbang po 'pho mi bsten //üîΩzhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: yongs nyams dbang po 'pho mi bsten // zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: does not upgrade his intellectual faculty or fall away.

original: de na ni bdag nyid 'chi bar sems pa yang med la gzhan gyis gsod pa yang med pas 'chi bar sems pa yang med do //
analyzed: de na ni bdag nyid 'chi bar sems pa yang med la gzhan gyis gsod pa yang med pas 'chi bar sems pa yang med do //
translated: One who is an arhat who does not fall away is also not one who contemplates death, because it is untenable that one who does not fall away contemplates death.

original: 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'chi bar sems pa dang / rjes su srung ba'i chos can dang / gnas pa las mi bskyod pa dang / rtogs pa'i skal ba can dag go //
analyzed: 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'chi bar sems pa dang / rjes su srung ba'i chos can dang / gnas pa las mi bskyod pa dang / rtogs pa'i skal ba can dag go //
translated: One who contemplates death and so on refers to one who contemplates death, one who guards the path, one who is steadfast and one who is a candidate for the result of a nonreturner.

original: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni rang gi rigs las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rigs de bcos ma ma yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni rang gi rigs las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rigs de bcos ma ma yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One who is subject to complete degeneration does not completely degenerate from his or her type, because that type is not fabricated.

original: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa lnga zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'bras bu ni glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir yongs su nyams pa'i chos can yang 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa srid do //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa lnga zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'bras bu ni glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir yongs su nyams pa'i chos can yang 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa srid do //
translated: The five beginning with one who is subject to complete degeneration are so called because it is possible that one who is subject to complete degeneration will completely degenerate from his or her result, since the result is adventitious.

original: dang po las ni zhes bya ba ni rigs dang 'bras bu las so //
analyzed: dang po las ni zhes bya ba ni rigs dang 'bras bu las so //
translated: From what? From his or her type and result.

original: de yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: de yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: He or she does not completely degenerate from that, that is, from the state of an arhat.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam dag gis brten por byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam dag gis brten por byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because the path of the learner and the path of no more learning make it firm.

original: slob pa'i @215b gnas skabs na yod pa'i rigs gang yin pa de ni slob pa'i lam gyis kyang bsgoms la mi slob pa'i gnas skabs na yang bsgoms pas lam de dag gis brtan por byas pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa de de las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur
analyzed: slob pa'i @215b gnas skabs na yod pa'i rigs gang yin pa de ni slob pa'i lam gyis kyang bsgoms la mi slob pa'i gnas skabs na yang bsgoms pas lam de dag gis brtan por byas pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa de de las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur
translated: The lineage that exists in the state of training is cultivated by the path of training and also cultivated in the state of no more training. Since those paths stabilize it, arhats do not fully degenerate from it.

original: ro // slob pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ro // slob pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is training?

original: smras pa / slob pa ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dag gis brtan por byas pa'i phyir rigs dang po las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: smras pa / slob pa ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dag gis brtan por byas pa'i phyir rigs dang po las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is said that training does not fully degenerate from the first lineage because it is stabilized by both mundane and transcendent paths.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi rigs dang po gang yin pa de ni sngon 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis kyang bsgoms la phyis slob pa'i lam gyis kyang bsgoms pas de de las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi rigs dang po gang yin pa de ni sngon 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis kyang bsgoms la phyis slob pa'i lam gyis kyang bsgoms pas de de las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The first lineage that is its nature is cultivated by the mundane path and later cultivated by the path of training. Since it is cultivated by those paths, one does not fully degenerate from it.

original: 'dir la la na re gang gi rigs dang po gang yin pa de las ni de yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir la la na re gang gi rigs dang po gang yin pa de las ni de yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Here some say: One does not fully degenerate from the first lineage that is its nature.

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lam dag gis brten por byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de ni gtan tshigs ma yin te /
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lam dag gis brten por byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de ni gtan tshigs ma yin te /
translated: Because they are stabilized by the paths of training and no longer training.

original: 'di ltar 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can sbyangs pa las gyur ba'i rigs gang yin pa de las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i rigs de yang slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lam dag gis brtan por byas pas yongs su mi nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can sbyangs pa las gyur ba'i rigs gang yin pa de las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i rigs de yang slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lam dag gis brtan por byas pas yongs su mi nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is not a reason, because the lineage of those who are resolute in faith who have attained through purification can retrogress from that, but they do not retrogress from the lineage that is stabilized by the paths of training and no longer training.

original: de lta bas na rigs de nyid 'di ltar dang po las ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur la sbyangs te thob pa las ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rigs de nyid 'di ltar dang po las ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur la sbyangs te thob pa las ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba de lta bu yin no //
translated: Therefore, that lineage is such that one does not retrogress from the first, but one can retrogress from that attained through purification.

original: gang yang slob pa ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dag gis brtan por byas pa'i phyir yongs su nyams bar mi 'gyur ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang gtan tshigs ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang slob pa ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dag gis brtan por byas pa'i phyir yongs su nyams bar mi 'gyur ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang gtan tshigs ma yin te /
translated: Also, that is not a reason for the statement, ‚ÄúOne who is in training does not retrogress because he is stabilized by the mundane and supramundane paths.‚Äù

original: rgyun du zhugs pa yang yongs su nyams par thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa yang yongs su nyams par thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: It would follow that even stream enterers would fully degenerate,üîΩbecause the result of stream enterer is not stabilized by the mundane path.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis brtan por byas pa ma yin pas 'di la 'bad par bya'o zhes zer ro //üîΩ'dir bdag gis gang gi phyir de skad du bshad pa /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis brtan por byas pa ma yin pas 'di la 'bad par bya'o zhes zer ro // 'dir bdag gis gang gi phyir de skad du bshad pa /
translated: Therefore one should strive in this.

original: slob dpon gyi dgongs pa bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi dgongs pa bstan par bya'o //
translated: Here I will explain the intention of the master.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: re zhig 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can sbyangs pa las gyur ba'i rigs gang yin pa de las yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ni rigs pa ma yin te /üîΩ'chi bar sems pa'i chos can gyi rigs gang @216a * //
analyzed: re zhig 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can sbyangs pa las gyur ba'i rigs gang yin pa de las yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ni rigs pa ma yin te / 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can gyi rigs gang @216a * //
translated: First, it is illogical to say that the type of arhats who die with the intention to be reborn in cyclic existence fully degenerate.

original: yin pa ni slob pa'i gnas skabs na yang bsgoms la /
analyzed: yin pa ni slob pa'i gnas skabs na yang bsgoms la /
translated: The type of arhat who dies with the intention to be reborn in cyclic existence is cultivated in the state of training and

original: phyis mi slob pa'i gnas skabs na yang bsgoms te brten por byas pas dgra bcom pa nyid las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyis mi slob pa'i gnas skabs na yang bsgoms te brten por byas pas dgra bcom pa nyid las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te /
translated: later cultivated in the state of no more training and stabilized. Therefore they do not fully degenerate from the state of an arhat.

original: slob pa'i gnas skabs na dang por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob pa'i gnas skabs na dang por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the first of the learner‚Äôs stages.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzangs gis kyang slob pa'i gnas skabs na rigs gzhan thob nas dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa gang yin pa de yang lam de yongs su mi 'dor te /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzangs gis kyang slob pa'i gnas skabs na rigs gzhan thob nas dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa gang yin pa de yang lam de yongs su mi 'dor te /
translated: Master Sa·πÖghabhadra also explains: ‚ÄúWhen one obtains the state of an arhat after obtaining a different lineage in the learner‚Äôs stage, one does not abandon that path.

original: sbyangs pa las gyur pa'i rigs kho na las mi gnas pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sbyangs pa las gyur pa'i rigs kho na las mi gnas pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: It is not that one does not remain in the lineage that is the result of training alone.‚Äù

original: 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can gyi rigs mi slob pa'i gnas skabs na 'phral kho na la thob kyi slob pa'i gnas skabs na thob pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de las ni de yongs su nyams pas na nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can gyi rigs mi slob pa'i gnas skabs na 'phral kho na la thob kyi slob pa'i gnas skabs na thob pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de las ni de yongs su nyams pas na nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: One who obtains the lineage of one who contemplates death only temporarily in the nonlearner‚Äôs stage, but not in the learner‚Äôs stage, regresses from that lineage due to regression.

original: de ni gnas skabs gnyis kyis brtan por ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gnas skabs gnyis kyis brtan por ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not stabilized by two stages.

original: de bas na 'di ni gtan tshigs su mi rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni gtan tshigs su mi rung ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore this is not a valid reason.

original: gang yang slob pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dag gis brtan por byas pa'i phyir yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang gtan tshigs ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang slob pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dag gis brtan por byas pa'i phyir yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang gtan tshigs ma yin te /
translated: Also, it is not logical to say that those who are learners do not fully degenerate because they stabilize their mind through both mundane and supramundane paths.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa yang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa yang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because even stream enterers fully degenerate.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis brtan por ma byas pas zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang khong du ma chud par smras pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis brtan por ma byas pas zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang khong du ma chud par smras pa yin no //
translated: Also, it is illogical to say that the result of stream entry is not stabilized by the mundane and supramundane paths.

original: gtan tshigs de ni rigs kyi phyir bshad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de ni rigs kyi phyir bshad pa yin gyi /
translated: This is explained because it is a reason of type,

original: 'bras bu'i phyir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i phyir ni ma yin te /
translated: but not because it is a reason of result.

original: de la ni gang gis na 'bras bu dang po las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la ni gang gis na 'bras bu dang po las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The reason why one does not fully degenerate from the first result will be explained.

original: 'bras bu gang zhig cig car du 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dag gis 'thob pa ni chung zad kyang med kyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu gang zhig cig car du 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dag gis 'thob pa ni chung zad kyang med kyi /
translated: There is not the slightest result that is obtained simultaneously by both the mundane and supramundane paths.

original: rigs ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dag gis brtan por byas pa srid de /
analyzed: rigs ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dag gis brtan por byas pa srid de /
translated: However, it is possible that the lineage is stabilized by both the mundane and supramundane paths.

original: tshe 'di pa'i dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa'am tshe pha rol po'i spong ba'i lam mam /
analyzed: tshe 'di pa'i dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa'am tshe pha rol po'i spong ba'i lam mam /
translated: Because the heat stage of the present life and so on, or the path of abandonment of the next life,üîΩor the other mundane and supramundane paths are cultivated in the state of training.üîΩOne who obtains it later through training can retrogress from that.üîΩOne who obtains it later through training can retrogress from that.üîΩOne who obtains it later through training can retrogress from that.

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gzhan gyis slob pa'i gnas skabs na bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //üîΩphyis sbyangs pas thob pa gang yin pa de las ni zhes bya ba ni phyis thob pa'i rigs slo bur ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gzhan gyis slob pa'i gnas skabs na bsgoms pa'i phyir ro // phyis sbyangs pas thob pa gang yin pa de las ni zhes bya ba ni phyis thob pa'i rigs slo bur ba gang yin pa ste /
