analyzed: @216b gnas skabs gnyis su thob pa ma yin pa de las ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro // rigs bstan nas 'bras bu bstan par bya ste /
translated: One who obtains it later through training can retrogress from that.

original: gang gi 'bras bu dang po gang yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: gang gi 'bras bu dang po gang yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: One who obtains it later through

original: de nyid kyi phyir rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni gal te 'thob na gdon mi za bar dang po yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni gal te 'thob na gdon mi za bar dang po yin no //
translated: For this reason, the S≈´tra says, ‚ÄúThere is no retrogressing from the fruit of stream-enterer.‚Äù

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang // phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dag ni res 'ga' dang po yin te /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang // phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dag ni res 'ga' dang po yin te /
translated: The fruit of once-returner and the fruit of non-returner are sometimes the first.

original: gal te phal cher 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba dag yin na'o ;
analyzed: gal te phal cher 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba dag yin na'o ;
translated: If the noble ones obtain these fruits after having been, respectively, detached from the third or fourth category of defilements of the realm of desire.

original: ; res 'ga' ni dang po ma yin te /üîΩgal te mthar gyis pa'i yin na'o //
analyzed: ; res 'ga' ni dang po ma yin te / gal te mthar gyis pa'i yin na'o //
translated: They are sometimes not the first.

original: de la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'am /
analyzed: de la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'am /
translated: If the noble ones obtain these fruits after having been detached from the defilements through the mundane path.üîΩThe fruit of stream-enterer,

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the fruit of once-returner,üîΩthe fruit of non-returner, whatever it may be, is never the first.

original: phyir mi 'ong pa'i 'bras bu yang rung 'bras bu dang po gang dang gang yin pa de las ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur gyi /üîΩlan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong pa'i 'bras bu yang rung 'bras bu dang po gang dang gang yin pa de las ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur gyi /üîΩlan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: The fruit of stream-enterer is never the first.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the fruit of non-returning,üîΩüîΩ

original: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu'ang rung phyis thob pa gang yin pa de las ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu'ang rung phyis thob pa gang yin pa de las ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: One can also retrogress from the fruit of non-returner or from the fruit of arhatship.

original: de ltar byas na zhes bya ba ni gang gi rigs dang 'bras bu dang po gang yin pa de las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes byas na'o //
analyzed: de ltar byas na zhes bya ba ni gang gi rigs dang 'bras bu dang po gang yin pa de las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes byas na'o //
translated: Thus, one does not retrogress from the first type or the first fruit.üîΩThe steadfast one is of five types, the unshakable one is of six types, the one who contemplates is of seven types.

original: go rims bzhin du rnam pa lnga dang drug dang bdun yin zhes bya ba ni rjes su srung ba'i chos can ni rnam pa lnga yin te /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du rnam pa lnga dang drug dang bdun yin zhes bya ba ni rjes su srung ba'i chos can ni rnam pa lnga yin te /
translated: The steadfast one is of five types:

original: de'i so na gnas bzhin du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dbang po 'pho ba dang / yongs su nyams nas slo ba pa nyid du 'gyur ba dang / yongs su nyams pa dang ; 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can gyi rigs su slar 'ong ba dang /
analyzed: de'i so na gnas bzhin du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dbang po 'pho ba dang / yongs su nyams nas slo ba pa nyid du 'gyur ba dang / yongs su nyams pa dang ; 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can gyi rigs su slar 'ong ba dang /
translated: 1. the one who obtains nirvƒÅ·πáa in the interval; 2. the one who obtains nirvƒÅ·πáa by being born; 3. the one who goes upstream; 4. the one who goes upstream quickly; 5. the one who goes upstream with difficulty.

original: gnas pa las mi bskyod pa ni rnam pa drug yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa las mi bskyod pa ni rnam pa drug yin te /
translated: The unshakable one is of six types:üîΩ1. the one who is steadfast; 2. the one who contemplates; 3. the one who is liberated through understanding; 4. the one who is liberated through both parts; 5. the one who is liberated through the end of the contaminant of desire; 6. the one who is liberated through the end of the contaminant of existence.

original: lnga po de dag nyid dang / drug pa rjes su srung ba'i chos can gyi rigs su slar 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: lnga po de dag nyid dang / drug pa rjes su srung ba'i chos can gyi rigs su slar 'ong ba'o //
translated: and the sixth is the type who returns to the family of the faith-liberated.

original: rtogs pa'i skal ba can ni rnam pa bdun yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i skal ba can ni rnam pa bdun yin te /
translated: The one who is capable of penetrating is of seven types:

original: drug po de dag nyid dang / bdun pa gnas pa las mi bskyod pa'i rigs can du slar 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: drug po de dag nyid dang / bdun pa gnas pa las mi bskyod pa'i rigs can du slar 'ong ba'o //
translated: the first five, the sixth is the type who returns to the family of the unshakable one.

original: de slob par gyur na phyis zhes bya ba'i tshig gcig khong nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: de slob par gyur na phyis zhes bya ba'i tshig gcig khong nas dbyung ngo //
translated: When he becomes a learner, the word ‚Äúlater‚Äù is supplied.

original: gang gi rigs dang po gang yin pa slob pa'i gnas skabs na yod pa de kho na la gnas kyi gzhan la ni ma yin no //üîΩde lta ma yin na rigs khyad @217a * //
analyzed: gang gi rigs dang po gang yin pa slob pa'i gnas skabs na yod pa de kho na la gnas kyi gzhan la ni ma yin no // de lta ma yin na rigs khyad @217a * //
translated: He remains in the family that he had in the stage of the learner, and not in another.

original: bar can rnyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bar can rnyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Otherwise, he would acquire a superior family.

original: slob pa'i gnas skabs kyi rigs las khyad par can rnyed pa'i phyir gang zag de 'phel ba kho nar 'gyur gyi yongs su nyams par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slob pa'i gnas skabs kyi rigs las khyad par can rnyed pa'i phyir gang zag de 'phel ba kho nar 'gyur gyi yongs su nyams par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because he would acquire a superior family in the stage of the learner, that person would only progress and not retrogress.

original: ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: How is this so?

original: re zhig dper na yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dgra bcom pa nyid kyi gnas na dbang po sbyangs pas rtogs pa'i skal ba can nyid du gyur pa de dgra bcom pa nyid las yongs su nyams te /
analyzed: re zhig dper na yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dgra bcom pa nyid kyi gnas na dbang po sbyangs pas rtogs pa'i skal ba can nyid du gyur pa de dgra bcom pa nyid las yongs su nyams te /
translated: For example, a certain arhat who is subject to complete degeneration and who is capable of penetrating insight while abiding in the state of an arhat, degenerates from the state of an arhat.

original: slob par gyur pa de 'i rigs pas kyang yongs su nyams na lugs las bzlog pa gnas pa las mi bskyod pa'i rigs nas 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can gyi rigs kyi bar la mi gnas so //
analyzed: slob par gyur pa de 'i rigs pas kyang yongs su nyams na lugs las bzlog pa gnas pa las mi bskyod pa'i rigs nas 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can gyi rigs kyi bar la mi gnas so //
translated: Through the power of that degeneration, he does not remain in the lineage of the unshakable one, nor does he remain in the lineage of the one who attains nirvana in the intermediate state, and so on, up to the lineage of the one who attains nirvana upon being born.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te rigs gzhan la gnas par gyur na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te rigs gzhan la gnas par gyur na'o //
translated: If that were not so, if he were to remain in another lineage,

original: rigs khyad par can rnyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rigs de ni yongs su nyams pa'i rigs las khyad zhugs pa yin pas so //
analyzed: rigs khyad par can rnyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rigs de ni yongs su nyams pa'i rigs las khyad zhugs pa yin pas so //
translated: he would obtain a special lineage, because that lineage is superior to the lineage of complete degeneration.

original: de lta bas na dgra bcom pa nyid las yongs su nyams na dbang po sbyangs pas thob pa las kyang gdon mi za bar yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na dgra bcom pa nyid las yongs su nyams na dbang po sbyangs pas thob pa las kyang gdon mi za bar yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if one degenerates from the state of an arhat, one necessarily degenerates from the state obtained through the refinement of faculties.

original: ci'i phyir 'bras bu dang po las yongs su nyams pa med ces bya ba ni gang gi 'bras bu dang po gang yin pa de ste /üîΩrgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'bras bu dang po las yongs su nyams pa med ces bya ba ni gang gi 'bras bu dang po gang yin pa de ste / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: The first fruit is the fruit of stream entry,

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the fruit of once-returning,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: and the fruit of non-returning.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams gzhi med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams gzhi med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because those to be abandoned by the path of seeing are groundless,

original: rten med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rten med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because they are without support.

original: de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni /
translated: They are

original: bdag gi gzhi la 'jug pa yin //
analyzed: bdag gi gzhi la 'jug pa yin //
translated: the entry to the basis of the self.

original: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba de dag la brten nas zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba de dag la brten nas zhugs pa yin no //
translated: They are entered on the basis of those to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are rooted in the view of the transitory collection.

original: 'di ltar mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ni bdag tu lta ba'i dbang gis kun du 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ni bdag tu lta ba'i dbang gis kun du 'byung ste /
translated: In this way, those to be abandoned by the path of seeing arise through the power of the view of the transitory collection as a self.

original: mdo las kyang /
analyzed: mdo las kyang /
translated: A sutra states:

original: 'jig rten na lta ba tha dad par gyur pa gang yin pa de dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i gzhi can yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na lta ba tha dad par gyur pa gang yin pa de dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i gzhi can yin te /
translated: Whatever views there are in the world, all arise from the perishable collection view.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba las kun du 'byung ba /üîΩ'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rigs can /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba las kun du 'byung ba / 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rigs can /
translated: They originate from the perishable collection view.üîΩThey belong to the class of the perishable collection view.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba las rab tu skye ba yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba las rab tu skye ba yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: They are produced from the perishable collection view.üîΩAnd that self does not exist.

original: bdag de yang med do zhes bya ba ni gzhi med pa'i phyir yongs su nyams pa med do //
analyzed: bdag de yang med do zhes bya ba ni gzhi med pa'i phyir yongs su nyams pa med do //
translated: Since there is no basis, there is no regression.

original: bden pa la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la @217b sogs pa'i bden pa dag la rtag pa la sogs par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la @217b sogs pa'i bden pa dag la rtag pa la sogs par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they focus on the truths, because they grasp the truths of suffering, etc. as permanent, etc.

original: de lta ma yin pa'i nyon mongs pa gang zhig yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin pa'i nyon mongs pa gang zhig yin te /
translated: What other afflictions are there that are not like this?

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i dngos po la gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang / rtag pa dang bdag gi rnam pa dag tu dmigs pa'i phyir phyin ci log tu dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i dngos po la gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang / rtag pa dang bdag gi rnam pa dag tu dmigs pa'i phyir phyin ci log tu dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Attachment and so on that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation are also misapprehensions because they focus on the aspect of the self, such as the aspect of purity, happiness, permanence, and the self in regard to the body, which is impure and so on.üîΩThe self is a superimposition that does not exist.üîΩThe sutras say:

original: bdag yang dag pa ma yin pa sgro 'dogs par byed la zhes bya ba ni ji skad du dge slong dag gang la la bdag go zhes yang dag pa rjes su lta ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di kho na la bdag dang bdagüîΩgir yang dag par rjes su lta bar zad do zhes gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: bdag yang dag pa ma yin pa sgro 'dogs par byed la zhes bya ba ni ji skad du dge slong dag gang la la bdag go zhes yang dag pa rjes su lta ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di kho na la bdag dang bdag gir yang dag par rjes su lta bar zad do zhes gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
translated: Monks, those who view the self as real view only these five appropriated aggregates as the self and mine.üîΩSince the views grasping an extreme and so on engage that as their object,

original: mthar 'dzin pa la sogs pa yang de'i gzhi la zhugs pa yin pas zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyang bdag gi gzhi'i rjes su zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: mthar 'dzin pa la sogs pa yang de'i gzhi la zhugs pa yin pas zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyang bdag gi gzhi'i rjes su zhugs pa yin te /
translated: those other objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing also engage the basis of the self.

original: bdag rtag go //
analyzed: bdag rtag go //
translated: The self is permanent.

original: chad do zhes bya ba'am /üîΩbdag med do zhes bya ba'am /üîΩ'di kho na mchog yin no //üîΩ'di ni dag pa yin no //üîΩci 'di yod dam med ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pas gzhi med pa dag ces bya ste /üîΩrten dag med ces bya ba'i don to //üîΩbdag la sogs pa ni bdag kyang med do zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir dngos por brjod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: chad do zhes bya ba'am / bdag med do zhes bya ba'am / 'di kho na mchog yin no // 'di ni dag pa yin no // ci 'di yod dam med ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pas gzhi med pa dag ces bya ste / rten dag med ces bya ba'i don to // bdag la sogs pa ni bdag kyang med do zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir dngos por brjod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The view that it is annihilatedüîΩor there is no selfüîΩor this alone is the truth,üîΩor this is pureüîΩor does this exist or not? and so on, is called groundless,üîΩbecause it is without a basis.üîΩ The meaning is that it is without a support.üîΩThe self and so on do not exist means that the self and so on are not described as entities.

original: stsogs pa smos pa ni bdag gi bsdu ba 'am /üîΩdbang phyug la sogs pa bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: stsogs pa smos pa ni bdag gi bsdu ba 'am / dbang phyug la sogs pa bsdu ba yin no //
translated: The expression without ground means that the mind is not grounded in the notion of existence or nonexistence, such as it is cut off, it is not cut off, it exists, it does not exist, it is real, it is not real, it is permanent, it is impermanent, it is suffering, it is not suffering, it is empty, it is not empty, it is without self, it is with self, it is pure, it is impure, this is the highest, this is not the highest, this is pure, this is impure, what is this?

original: gzhi yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i mtshan nyid so sor nges pa zhes bya ba ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags kyi gzhi ni skra dang so sdug pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yid du 'ong ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhi yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i mtshan nyid so sor nges pa zhes bya ba ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags kyi gzhi ni skra dang so sdug pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yid du 'ong ba yin no //
translated: What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this? What is this?

original: khong khro ba'i ni de dag mi sdug pa yid du mi 'ong ba yin te /
analyzed: khong khro ba'i ni de dag mi sdug pa yid du mi 'ong ba yin te /
translated: Those that are the objects of anger are unpleasant and not beautiful.

original: nga rgyal gyi yang yid du 'ong ba yin no //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi yang yid du 'ong ba yin no //
translated: Those that are the objects of pride are beautiful.

original: ma rig pa'i yang gnyis po de nyid chung zad kun du rmongs par 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i yang gnyis po de nyid chung zad kun du rmongs par 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: Those that are the objects of ignorance are both, and one becomes slightly confused about them.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams la ni /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams la ni /
translated: Those that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing

original: bdag la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid med /
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid med /
translated: do not have the characteristics of a self, etc.üîΩThose that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing do not have the slightest distinct characteristic of a self, etc.,

original: ces bya ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba de la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa la ma gtogs pa rnams la ni bzhi po bdag gi mtshan nyid so sor nges pa cung zad kyang med pas /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba de la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa la ma gtogs pa rnams la ni bzhi po bdag gi mtshan nyid so sor nges pa cung zad kyang med pas /
translated: except for attachment, etc., that focus on them.

original: de lta bas na gzhi med pa dag ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhi med pa dag ces bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, they are said to be groundless.

original: de lta bas na gzhi so sor nges pa med pa dag @218a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhi so sor nges pa med pa dag @218a * //
translated: Therefore, they are said to be without a distinct, individual ground.

original: ces bya ba'o zhes bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o zhes bya ba'i don te //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: slob dpon gyis gzhan yang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis gzhan yang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: The Master says, Moreover, etc.

original: 'phags pa slob pa nges par mi rtog cing mi sems pa la dran pa nyams pas te /
analyzed: 'phags pa slob pa nges par mi rtog cing mi sems pa la dran pa nyams pas te /
translated: The noble one who is a learner does not generate the afflictions such as attachment, etc., through the degeneration of mindfulness when he is not ascertaining and reflecting.

original: dran pa nyon mongs pa can dang ldan pas 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams skye bar 'gyur gyi nges par rtog pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dran pa nyon mongs pa can dang ldan pas 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams skye bar 'gyur gyi nges par rtog pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: But he does generate the afflictions such as attachment, etc., through the degeneration of mindfulness when he is not ascertaining, because he possesses afflicted mindfulness.

original: nges par mi rtog pa 'ga' zhig la dran pa nyams pas thag pa la sprul gyi 'du shes skye'i nges par rtog pa la ni ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: nges par mi rtog pa 'ga' zhig la dran pa nyams pas thag pa la sprul gyi 'du shes skye'i nges par rtog pa la ni ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like the case of the generation of the perception of a snake in regard to a rope when there is the degeneration of mindfulness in regard to something that is not ascertained, but not in regard to something that is ascertained.

original: bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bya ba'i sgras ni mthar 'dzin par lta ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bya ba'i sgras ni mthar 'dzin par lta ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe afflicted view of self, etc.‚Äù includes the extreme view, etc.

original: yang ci'i phyir nges par mi rtog pa la bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa 'byung bar mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir nges par mi rtog pa la bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa 'byung bar mi rung zhe na /
translated: Why is it not possible for the afflicted view of self, etc., to arise when there is no ascertainment?

original: kun du rtog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: kun du rtog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is conceptualization.

original: gang dag ce na bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: gang dag ce na bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: What is that? It is the afflictions such as the afflicted view of self, etc.

original: de bas na 'phags pa la nges par mi rtog pa'i sgo nas bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa 'byung bar mi rung bas yongs su nyams pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba spangs pas yongs su nyams pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa la nges par mi rtog pa'i sgo nas bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa 'byung bar mi rung bas yongs su nyams pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba spangs pas yongs su nyams pa med do //
translated: There is no complete degeneration from the abandonment of objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid las kyang yongs su nyams pa med do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid las kyang yongs su nyams pa med do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The word also in the line ‚Äúthere is no complete degeneration from the state of an arhat‚Äù

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba spangs pas yongs su nyams pa med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba spangs pas yongs su nyams pa med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: indicates that not only is there no complete degeneration from the abandonment of objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid las kyang yongs su nyams pa med do zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid las kyang yongs su nyams pa med do zhes ston par byed do //
translated: but there is also no complete degeneration from the state of an arhat.

original: dang po ma yin pa la lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dag las ni yongs su nyams pa srid de /
analyzed: dang po ma yin pa la lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dag las ni yongs su nyams pa srid de /
translated: It is possible to completely degenerate from the state of a once returner and nonreturner,

original: de ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob pa srid pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob pa srid pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: but it is not possible to completely degenerate from the state of an arhat, because it is possible to obtain that state by the mundane path.

original: de nyid rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gzhung 'dzugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gzhung 'dzugs pa yin no //
translated: This is the reasoning.üîΩMonks, that which is abandoned by the arya‚Äôs wisdom is abandoned.

original: dge slong dag 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis spangs pa gang yin pa de ni spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis spangs pa gang yin pa de kho na spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis spangs pa gang yin pa de ni spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis spangs pa gang yin pa de kho na spangs pa yin te /
translated: That which is abandoned by the arya‚Äôs wisdom is abandoned.

original: de ni yang mi skye'i 'jig rten pas spangs pa gang yin pa de ni yang skye'o snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni yang mi skye'i 'jig rten pas spangs pa gang yin pa de ni yang skye'o snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: That which is abandoned by mundane wisdom can arise again.

original: slob pa la bag yod pa la zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid las yongs su nyams pa med do zhes bya ba'i khungs mdo'i tshig @218b gnyis pa yin te /
analyzed: slob pa la bag yod pa la zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid las yongs su nyams pa med do zhes bya ba'i khungs mdo'i tshig @218b gnyis pa yin te /
translated: The second citation from sutra is, ‚ÄúOne in training should be heedful.‚Äù

original: 'di'i don ni slob pa la bag yod par bya ba'i phyir slob pas bag yod par bya'o zhes bag yod pa'i las ston par mdzad pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni slob pa la bag yod par bya ba'i phyir slob pas bag yod par bya'o zhes bag yod pa'i las ston par mdzad pa 'di yin no //
translated: The meaning of this is that the Buddha taught heedfulness to those in training so that they would be heedful.

original: slob pa la yang 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis spangs pa yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: slob pa la yang 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis spangs pa yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Also, isn't there abandonment by the wisdom of ƒÅryas who are learners?

original: ji ltar na de la bag yod pa la bag yod par byar yod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de la bag yod pa la bag yod par byar yod ce na /
translated: How could they be called heedful?

original: 'di ltar 'dis ni 'bras bu'i khyad par ba yang thob par bya dgos la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dis ni 'bras bu'i khyad par ba yang thob par bya dgos la /
translated: Because they must obtain the result of a nonreturner and

original: de la spangs pa 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis byas ba yang yod pas so //
analyzed: de la spangs pa 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis byas ba yang yod pas so //
translated: they have abandoned objects to be abandoned by the mundane path.üîΩHere Vaibhasikas say:

original: 'dir bye brag tu smra ba dag na re mdo las /
analyzed: 'dir bye brag tu smra ba dag na re mdo las /
translated: Because a sutra states:üîΩI say, Ananda, even arhats are obstructed by gain and honor,

original: kun dga' bo dgra bcom pa la yang rnyed pa dang bkur stis bar chad byed pa yin par nga smra'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dgra bcom pa la yang yongs su nyams pa yod do zhes zer na de'i phyir /
analyzed: kun dga' bo dgra bcom pa la yang rnyed pa dang bkur stis bar chad byed pa yin par nga smra'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dgra bcom pa la yang yongs su nyams pa yod do zhes zer na de'i phyir /
translated: they say that arhats also have complete degeneration.üîΩTo respond to that, this sutra passage is stated:üîΩAnanda, I say that even arhatsüîΩ...

original: kun dga' bo dgra bcom pa la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par mdo 'di las mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa tsam kho na las yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar gsungs par zad de /üîΩzhes 'byung ba'i bar 'di smos so /
analyzed: kun dga' bo dgra bcom pa la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par mdo 'di las mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa tsam kho na las yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar gsungs par zad de /üîΩzhes 'byung ba'i bar 'di smos so /
translated: ... completely degenerate from mere abiding in comfort in this life.

original: // / bam po lnga bcu gcig pa /
analyzed: // / bam po lnga bcu gcig pa /
translated: 11.üîΩ

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is it so?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable ƒÄnanda:

original: kun dga' bo dgra bcom pa la yang rnyed pa dang bkur stis bar chad byed pa yin par nga smra'o //
analyzed: kun dga' bo dgra bcom pa la yang rnyed pa dang bkur stis bar chad byed pa yin par nga smra'o //
translated: ‚ÄúƒÄnanda, I say that even for an arhat, gain and honor are an obstacle.‚Äù

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos gsol pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos gsol pa /
translated: The venerable ƒÄnanda said:

original: bcom ldan 'das de ci'i slad du 'di skad ces kun dga' bo dgra bcom pa la yang rnyed pa dang bkur stis par chad byed pa yin par nga smra'o zhes gsungs /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ci'i slad du 'di skad ces kun dga' bo dgra bcom pa la yang rnyed pa dang bkur stis par chad byed pa yin par nga smra'o zhes gsungs /
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, why is it that you say this: ‚ÄòƒÄnanda, I say that even for an arhat, gain and honor are an obstacle‚Äô?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: kun dga' bo ma thob pa thob par bya ba dang / ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba dang / mngon sum du ma byas pa mngon sum du bya ba la bar chad byed pa ni ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: kun dga' bo ma thob pa thob par bya ba dang / ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba dang / mngon sum du ma byas pa mngon sum du bya ba la bar chad byed pa ni ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúƒÄnanda, they are not an obstacle to attaining what has not been attained, realizing what has not been realized, and manifesting what has not been manifested.

original: 'on kyang 'dis lhag pa'i sems las byung ba mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas ba bzhi po thob pa gang dag yin pa de gang yang rung ba zhig las 'di yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar nga smra ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dis lhag pa'i sems las byung ba mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas ba bzhi po thob pa gang dag yin pa de gang yang rung ba zhig las 'di yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar nga smra ste /
translated: But I do say that this one will fall away from any of the four types of abiding in bliss in this life that are higher mental states.

original: de yang 'dres par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'dres par gnas pa yin no //
translated: And that one is a mixed abider.

original: gcig pu ma 'dres pa bag yod pa brtun par gnas pa 'dis sems kyi rnam par grol ba lus kyis mngon du byas pa gang yin pa de las ni rnam grangs gang gis kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar nga mi smra'o //
analyzed: gcig pu ma 'dres pa bag yod pa brtun par gnas pa 'dis sems kyi rnam par grol ba lus kyis mngon du byas pa gang yin pa de las ni rnam grangs gang gis kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar nga mi smra'o //
translated: But I do not say that this one who is alone, unmixed, heedful, and abiding with effort, who has manifested physical liberation of mind, will fall away from that by any means.

original: @219a * // kun dga' bo de lta bas na khyod kyis 'di ltar slob par bya ste /
analyzed: @219a * // kun dga' bo de lta bas na khyod kyis 'di ltar slob par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, Ananda, you should train thinking thus:

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti gang yin pa de zil gyis gnon par bya'i /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti gang yin pa de zil gyis gnon par bya'i /
translated: I will overcome any gain and honor.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti byung ba la sems kun nas dkris te mi 'dug pa de ltar kun dga' bo khyod kyis bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti byung ba la sems kun nas dkris te mi 'dug pa de ltar kun dga' bo khyod kyis bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Ananda, you should train thinking, I will not abide with my mind completely bound to the occurrence of gain and honor.

original: gal te bye brag tu smra ba na re mi g-yo ba zhes khyad par du byas pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba la yongs su nyams pa yod do zhes zer na de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gal te bye brag tu smra ba na re mi g-yo ba zhes khyad par du byas pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba la yongs su nyams pa yod do zhes zer na de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: If the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say that there is complete degeneration from the timely liberation of those called ‚Äúimmovable‚Äù because they are distinguished as ‚Äúimmovable,‚Äù then we say:

original: gal te dus dang sbyor ba la yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dus dang sbyor ba la yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say there is degeneration from the timely,

original: kho bo cag kyang de skad du dus dang sbyor ba la yongs su nyams pa yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kho bo cag kyang de skad du dus dang sbyor ba la yongs su nyams pa yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: we also say there is complete degeneration from the timely.

original: de dpyad par bya ste ;
analyzed: de dpyad par bya ste ;
translated: This should be analyzed.

original: rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba de ni dpyad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba de ni dpyad par bya ba yin no //
translated: The timely liberation should be analyzed.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How?

original: smras pa ci rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba dgra bcom pa nyid yin nam /
analyzed: smras pa ci rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba dgra bcom pa nyid yin nam /
translated: We ask: Is the timely liberation the state of an arhat?

original: 'on te rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dag kho na yin zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on te rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dag kho na yin zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Or are the timely liberations only mundane meditative concentrations?

original: ci'i phyir de ltar dogs par byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar dogs par byed ce na /
translated: Why is this doubted?

original: bsam gtan dngos gzhi'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dngos gzhi'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThe concentration of the actual basis of absorption and so on.‚Äù

original: bsam gtan nyid ting nge 'dzin yin pas bsam gtan gyi ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan nyid ting nge 'dzin yin pas bsam gtan gyi ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: Concentration is meditative stabilization, thus it is concentration as meditative stabilization.

original: dngos gzhi smos pa ni lam sla ba rnams kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdus su mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sgra med pa la sogs pa'i dus la lar mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos gzhi smos pa ni lam sla ba rnams kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir ro // dus su mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sgra med pa la sogs pa'i dus la lar mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: The term ‚Äúmain‚Äù is used because it is the best of the easy paths.üîΩIt is called ‚Äúliberation that is time-related‚Äù because it occurs at a specific time, such as the time when sound is absent.

original: dus las byung bas na rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: dus las byung bas na rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äútime-related‚Äù because it occurs at a specific time.

original: yang dang yang du btsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir phangs pa zhes bya ba ni nyams shing nyams na 'dod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang dang yang du btsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir phangs pa zhes bya ba ni nyams shing nyams na 'dod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is called ‚Äúdear‚Äù because it is sought again and again, that is, because it is desired when it is lost and when it is not lost.

original: don du gnyer bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don du gnyer bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is called ‚Äúdear‚Äù because it is sought, that is, because it is desired.üîΩOthers say: It is called ‚Äúdear‚Äù because it is relished.

original: gzhan dag na re ro myang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dga' ldan yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ro myang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dga' ldan yin te /
translated: This is the opinion of Bhadanta Gho·π£aka.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bsam gtan dang ldan pa'i phyir phangs pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bsam gtan dang ldan pa'i phyir phangs pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: and it is cherished because it possesses the meditative stabilization that is concomitant with relishing due to being contaminated.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe liberation of the state of an arhat‚Äù is explained in the commentary as follows:

original: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid rnam par grol ba yin pas na dgra bcom pa nyid kyi rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid rnam par grol ba yin pas na dgra bcom pa nyid kyi rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: The liberation of the state of an arhat is the liberation of an arhat.

original: thob pa'i tshul gyis rtag tu rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdus dang sbyor ba yin par yang mi rung zhes bya ba 'dis ni rnam @219b par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba las dgra bcom pa nyid kyi rnam par grol ba bzlog ste ston to //
analyzed: thob pa'i tshul gyis rtag tu rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir ro // dus dang sbyor ba yin par yang mi rung zhes bya ba 'dis ni rnam @219b par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba las dgra bcom pa nyid kyi rnam par grol ba bzlog ste ston to //
translated: It is always connected to the state of an arhat through the mode of obtaining it.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúit is not suitable to be connected with time‚Äù refutes the liberation of the state of an arhat being the liberation that is connected with time.

original: yang don du gnyer bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir phangs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni phangs pa las bzlog ste /
analyzed: yang don du gnyer bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir phangs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni phangs pa las bzlog ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is not cherished because it is not something to be pursued‚Äù refutes the liberation of the state of an arhat being cherished.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi rnam par grol ba phangs pa ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi rnam par grol ba phangs pa ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: It is not the case that the arhat‚Äôs liberation is precious.

original: rtag tu rjes su 'brel pa nyid du yod pas don du gnyer bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir phangs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtag tu rjes su 'brel pa nyid du yod pas don du gnyer bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir phangs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not precious because it is not something to be sought, since it always exists.

original: lhag ba'i sems las byung ba dag kho na las zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i sems la yod pas na lhag pa'i sems las byung ba ste /
analyzed: lhag ba'i sems las byung ba dag kho na las zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i sems la yod pas na lhag pa'i sems las byung ba ste /
translated: They are called ‚Äúmental factors of superior mind‚Äù because they exist in the superior mind.

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dag yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dag yin no //
translated: They are the four mental factors of superior mind that are abodes of happiness in this life.

original: ci'i phyir de dag kho na las yongs su nyams par gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag kho na las yongs su nyams par gsungs she na /
translated: Why are they called ‚Äúmental factors of superior mind‚Äù?

original: lhag pa'i sems las byung ba mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa bzhi po thob pa gang dag yin pa de gang yang rung ba zhig las 'di yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar nga smra'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems las byung ba mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa bzhi po thob pa gang dag yin pa de gang yang rung ba zhig las 'di yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar nga smra'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúI say that one falls from any one of the four mental factors of superior mind that are abodes of happiness in this life, which are obtained through seeing.‚Äù

original: gal te rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dgra bcom pa nyid las yongs su nyams pa zhig srid par gyur na /üîΩde ci'i phyir de dag kho na las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dgra bcom pa nyid las yongs su nyams pa zhig srid par gyur na / de ci'i phyir de dag kho na las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were possible to fully degenerate from the state of an arhat whose liberation is characterized by time,üîΩwhy would the Abhidharma say, ‚ÄúWhy is it that they do not fully degenerate from those?‚Äù

original: de dag kho na las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag kho na las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It would not say, ‚ÄúWhy is it that they do not fully degenerate from those?‚Äù

original: dbang nyams pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin mngon du 'gyur ba'i dbang nyams pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang nyams pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin mngon du 'gyur ba'i dbang nyams pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because their power has declined means because their power to manifest concentration has declined.

original: de ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i chos can yin zhes bya ba ni mdo las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i chos can las gzhan yin par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i chos can yin zhes bya ba ni mdo las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i chos can las gzhan yin par 'byung ste /
translated: He is one who does not fully degenerate means that in a sutra it says, ‚ÄúOne who does not fully degenerate is different from the others.‚Äù

original: slob pa bco brgyad cher bshad nas /
analyzed: slob pa bco brgyad cher bshad nas /
translated: Having extensively explained the eighteen learners,

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: the Bhagavan said:

original: mi slob pa dgu gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi slob pa dgu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the nine nonlearners?

original: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dang / yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i chos can dang / 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can dang / rjes su bsrung ba'i chos can dang / gnas pa las mi bskyod ba dang / rtogs pa'i skal ba can dang /
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dang / yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i chos can dang / 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can dang / rjes su bsrung ba'i chos can dang / gnas pa las mi bskyod ba dang / rtogs pa'i skal ba can dang /
translated: One who regresses, one who does not regress, one who contemplates death, one who guards the path, one who is unshakable, one who is capable of penetrating insight,

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can dang / shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba dang / gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can dang / shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba dang / gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: one who is immovable, one who is liberated by wisdom, and one who is liberated by both means.

original: 'di dag ni mi slob pa dgu zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni mi slob pa dgu zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: These are called the nine types of nonlearner.

original: de la gang zhig mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dag las yongs su @220a * //
analyzed: de la gang zhig mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dag las yongs su @220a * //
translated: Among those who abide in comfort in this life,

original: nyams par 'gyur ba de ni yongs su nyams pa'i chos can yin no //
analyzed: nyams par 'gyur ba de ni yongs su nyams pa'i chos can yin no //
translated: one who regresses is one who regresses.

original: gang zhig de dag nyid las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba de ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i chos can yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig de dag nyid las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba de ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i chos can yin no //
translated: One who does not regress is one who does not regress.

original: de bzhin du 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same applies to those who are intent on death, etc.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gang zhig ting nge 'dzin nyams pa'i 'jigs pas bdag nyid 'chi bar sems pa de ni 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: gang zhig ting nge 'dzin nyams pa'i 'jigs pas bdag nyid 'chi bar sems pa de ni 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can no //
translated: Those who are intent on death are those who think of death because they fear the loss of concentration.

original: gang zhig yon tan gyi khyad par cung zad cig rjes su bsrung ba de ni rjes su bsrung ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: gang zhig yon tan gyi khyad par cung zad cig rjes su bsrung ba de ni rjes su bsrung ba'i chos can no //
translated: Those who are intent on guarding are those who guard a certain special quality.

original: gang zhig yon tan gang kho na la gnas pa de las rjes su ma bsrungs kyang mi g-yo ba de ni gnas pa las mi bskyod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig yon tan gang kho na la gnas pa de las rjes su ma bsrungs kyang mi g-yo ba de ni gnas pa las mi bskyod pa yin no //
translated: Those who are intent on abiding are those who do not lose the special quality in which they abide, even if they do not guard it.

original: gang zhig gang du rtogs par byed cing yon tan gyi khyad par skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /üîΩde ni rtogs pa'i skal ba can no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang du rtogs par byed cing yon tan gyi khyad par skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste / de ni rtogs pa'i skal ba can no //
translated: Those who are intent on realization are those who realize and generate a special quality.

original: gang zhig byung ba dag las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba de ni mi g-yo ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: gang zhig byung ba dag las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba de ni mi g-yo ba'i chos can no //
translated: Those who are intent on the occasion are those who do not retrogress from the occasion in which they are situated.üîΩThose who are intent on nondeprivation are those who do not retrogress from the special quality that they have obtained.

original: khyad par ci yod ce na zhes bya ba ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i chos can la sogs pa gsum char yang yongs su mi nyams pa dang ldan pa'i phyir khyad par ma mthong nas 'dri ba yin no //
analyzed: khyad par ci yod ce na zhes bya ba ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i chos can la sogs pa gsum char yang yongs su mi nyams pa dang ldan pa'i phyir khyad par ma mthong nas 'dri ba yin no //
translated: They ask this because they do not see any difference between the three types of arhats, the non-decayer and so on, since all are endowed with non-decay.üîΩThey are not purified by training.

original: sbyangs pa las gyur pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis dbang po rnon po yin gyi /
analyzed: sbyangs pa las gyur pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis dbang po rnon po yin gyi /
translated: They are naturally sharp-facultied,

original: dbang po sbyangs pas thob pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dbang po sbyangs pas thob pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: but they do not obtain their faculties through training.üîΩThey can move from that.

original: de las g-yo bar 'gyur pa yin zhes bya ba ni yon tan gyi khyad par de las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las g-yo bar 'gyur pa yin zhes bya ba ni yon tan gyi khyad par de las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That means they can move from that special quality.üîΩThis is the difference.

original: 'di ni khyad par yin par mngon no zhes bya ba ni slob dpon rang gi gzhung lugs ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni khyad par yin par mngon no zhes bya ba ni slob dpon rang gi gzhung lugs ston pa yin no //
translated: This is the master‚Äôs own position.

original: gal te bye brag tu smra ba na re tshe dang ldan pa gnag tshogs can dgra bcom pa nyid las yongs su nyams pa ma yin nam zhes de skad du smra bar 'gyur bas de'i lan brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te bye brag tu smra ba na re tshe dang ldan pa gnag tshogs can dgra bcom pa nyid las yongs su nyams pa ma yin nam zhes de skad du smra bar 'gyur bas de'i lan brtsam par bya ste /
translated: If the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say, ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt it said that the venerable Sa·πÖgharak·π£ita fell from the state of an arhat?‚Äù then we would reply:üîΩThe venerable Sa·πÖgharak·π£ita,

original: tshe dang ldan pa gnag tshogs can zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gnag tshogs can zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: as long as he was a learner,üîΩdid not fall from the state of an arhat.

original: slob par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni re zhig dgra bcom pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: slob par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni re zhig dgra bcom pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: He was not an arhat, but a learner.

original: lus dang srog la mi lta ba'i rgyus mtshon gyis 'debs par byed ces bya ba ni mtshon gyis snun par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang srog la mi lta ba'i rgyus mtshon gyis 'debs par byed ces bya ba ni mtshon gyis snun par byed pa'o //
translated: Because he did not value his body and life, he was stabbed with a knife.üîΩHe attained the state of an arhat at the very time of his death.

original: 'chi ba'i dus kho nar dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa ni mtshon gyis btab pa'i 'og tu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus kho nar dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa ni mtshon gyis btab pa'i 'og tu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: He attained the state of an arhat after he was stabbed with a knife.

original: mtshon gyis btab pa de nyid kyis @220b yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur to //
analyzed: mtshon gyis btab pa de nyid kyis @220b yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur to //
translated: He attained nirvana through that very stabbing.

original: bcu las 'phros pa las kyang zhes bya ba ni bcu las 'phros pa zhes bya ba'i mdo las so //
analyzed: bcu las 'phros pa las kyang zhes bya ba ni bcu las 'phros pa zhes bya ba'i mdo las so //
translated: The EkottarƒÅgama also says,

original: ci zhig gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci zhig gsungs she na /
translated: What is it?

original: bskyed par bya ba'i chos ni gcig ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba'i chos ni gcig ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says: The Dharma that is to be generated is one.

original: gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: sems rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor bas yid du 'ong ba yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor bas yid du 'ong ba yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says: It is the pleasant liberation of mind that is timely.

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'o snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'o snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The intended meaning is: it is abiding in comfort in this life.

original: mngon sum du bya ba'i chos ni gcig ste /
analyzed: mngon sum du bya ba'i chos ni gcig ste /
translated: He says: The Dharma that is to be actualized is one.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: sems rnam par grol ba mi g-yo ba yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems rnam par grol ba mi g-yo ba yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says: It is the unshakable liberation of mind.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid do snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid do snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The intended meaning is: it is the state of an arhat.

original: rnam par grol ba mi g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dgra bcom pa nyid logs shig tu smos pa'i phyir sems rnam par grol ba yid du 'ong ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin par gsungs so snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba mi g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dgra bcom pa nyid logs shig tu smos pa'i phyir sems rnam par grol ba yid du 'ong ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin par gsungs so snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Since the state of an arhat, which is characterized by unshakable liberation, is mentioned separately, he thinks that the pleasant liberation of mind is not the essence of the state of an arhat.

original: bye brag tu smra ba dag dgra bcom pa rnam pa gnyis yod pa'i phyir logs shig tu smos par zad do zhes smra bar 'gyur ba'i go skabs mthong nas yang /üîΩgal te zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dag dgra bcom pa rnam pa gnyis yod pa'i phyir logs shig tu smos par zad do zhes smra bar 'gyur ba'i go skabs mthong nas yang / gal te zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Seeing an opportunity to say this, the Autocommentary states:

original: gal te sems rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba pa yid du 'ong ba dgra bcom pa nyid kho na yin par gyur na ci'i phyir mdo gzhan las ma yin gyi /üîΩbcu tshan de kho na las mngon sum du bya ba'i chos ni gcig ste /üîΩsems rnam par grol ba ni mi g-yo ba'o zhes dgra bcom pa nyid las gnyis su smos par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te sems rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba pa yid du 'ong ba dgra bcom pa nyid kho na yin par gyur na ci'i phyir mdo gzhan las ma yin gyi / bcu tshan de kho na las mngon sum du bya ba'i chos ni gcig ste / sems rnam par grol ba ni mi g-yo ba'o zhes dgra bcom pa nyid las gnyis su smos par 'gyur /
translated: If the arhat who is liberated according to circumstances were only the liberated being of the present, why would a different arhat be mentioned in another s≈´tra?üîΩIn the s≈´tra it says:üîΩThe one phenomenon to be directly perceived is the unshakable liberation of mind.

original: rmi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: rmi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This would be a repetition of the two types of arhat.üîΩIt would be a repetition of the two types of arhat.

original: 'di skad du mngon sum du bya ba'i chos ni gcig ste /üîΩsems rnam par grol ba yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di skad du mngon sum du bya ba'i chos ni gcig ste /üîΩsems rnam par grol ba yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This would be a repetition of the two types of arhat.üîΩThis would be a repetition of the two types of arhat.üîΩThis would be a repetition of the two types of arhat.

original: gal te khyod dgra bcom pa nyid rnam pa gnyis yod pas de'i phyir gcig ni bskyed par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te khyod dgra bcom pa nyid rnam pa gnyis yod pas de'i phyir gcig ni bskyed par bya ba yin no //
translated: If you say that the state of an arhat is twofold, and therefore one is to be generated and the other is to be manifested,

original: gnyis pa ni mngon sum du bya ba yin no zhes tshig gi bye brag tu bshad pa yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mngon sum du bya ba yin no zhes tshig gi bye brag tu bshad pa yin no zhes zer na /
translated: then you are merely splitting hairs.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: dgra bcom pa nyid bskyed par bya ba yin par ni gang du yang ma gsungs so //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid bskyed par bya ba yin par ni gang du yang ma gsungs so //
translated: Nowhere is it said that the state of an arhat is to be generated.

original: 'o na ci zhe na mdo de dang de las mngon sum du bya ba yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na mdo de dang de las mngon sum du bya ba yin par gsungs so //
translated: But it is said in this and that sutra that it is to be manifested.

original: khas blangs te yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: khas blangs te yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: We will accept that and say this:

original: dbang po rtul pos bsdus pa'i dgra bcom pa nyid bskyed par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po rtul pos bsdus pa'i dgra bcom pa nyid bskyed par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If the state of an arhat subsumed by dull faculties is to be generated,

original: yang 'dis ci zhig shes par byas shing bstan pa yin /
analyzed: yang 'dis ci zhig shes par byas shing bstan pa yin /
translated: then what has this been taught to mean?

original: @221a * // re zhig gal te bskyed par bya bar nus pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di shes par byas pa yin no zhe na ni gzhan dbang po rnon pos bsdus pa'i dgra bcom pa nyid kyang nus so //
analyzed: @221a * // re zhig gal te bskyed par bya bar nus pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di shes par byas pa yin no zhe na ni gzhan dbang po rnon pos bsdus pa'i dgra bcom pa nyid kyang nus so //
translated: If you understand the phrase ‚Äúthat which is to be generated‚Äù to mean ‚Äúthat which is capable of being generated,‚Äù then even the state of an arhat who is classified as having sharp faculties is capable of being generated.

original: de lta yin na ni mdo las 'di skad du /
analyzed: de lta yin na ni mdo las 'di skad du /
translated: If that were so, then the sutra would have to say:

original: bskyed par bya ba'i chos ni gcig ste /
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba'i chos ni gcig ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThere is one phenomenon that is to be generated,

original: sems rnam par grol ba'o zhes brjod dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems rnam par grol ba'o zhes brjod dgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: namely, the liberation of the mind.‚Äù

original: 'on te bskyed par 'os pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di shes par byas pa yin no zhe na ni gzhan dbang po rnon pos bsdus pa'i dgra bcom pa nyid ches shin tu 'os pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te bskyed par 'os pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di shes par byas pa yin no zhe na ni gzhan dbang po rnon pos bsdus pa'i dgra bcom pa nyid ches shin tu 'os pa yin te /
translated: If you understand the phrase ‚Äúthat which is to be generated‚Äù to mean ‚Äúthat which is worthy of being generated,‚Äù then the state of an arhat who is classified as having sharp faculties is even more worthy of being generated.

original: de ni mi g-yo ba'i phyir shin tu bskyed par bya bar 'os so snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni mi g-yo ba'i phyir shin tu bskyed par bya bar 'os so snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that it is worthy of being generated because it is unshakable.

original: 'o na dus kyis rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba dgra bcom pa nyid yin na ni de lta na de dang ldan ba'i phyir dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i dgra bcom pa zhesüîΩbyar rung ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na dus kyis rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba dgra bcom pa nyid yin na ni de lta na de dang ldan ba'i phyir dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i dgra bcom pa zhes byar rung ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: If the state of an arhat who is liberated according to circumstances is the state of an arhat who is liberated from time to time, then it is suitable to call him an arhat liberated from time to time because he possesses that.

original: ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du 'gyur ba dus la ltos pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'di'i ting nge 'dzin ni zag pa ngang bcas pa'am zag pa med pa yang rung nad med pa dang / yul gyi khyad par la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dus la ltos so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du 'gyur ba dus la ltos pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'di'i ting nge 'dzin ni zag pa ngang bcas pa'am zag pa med pa yang rung nad med pa dang / yul gyi khyad par la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dus la ltos so //
translated: The state of an arhat who is liberated from time to time is called a state of an arhat who is liberated according to circumstances because the manifestation of concentration depends on time.

original: chos mngon pa las kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung la /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung la /
translated: In the Abhidharma, it is said:

original: 'dir dper brjod pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas ma spangs zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'dir dper brjod pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas ma spangs zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: The example here is the nonabandonment of the negative tendencies of desire realm attachment.

original: de la yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya ba 'di yang dper brjod pa yin no //üîΩgal te de lta bu ni yongs su tshang ba las skyes pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te de lta bu ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yongs su tshang ba las skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de la yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya ba 'di yang dper brjod pa yin no // gal te de lta bu ni yongs su tshang ba las skyes pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te de lta bu ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yongs su tshang ba las skye ba yin no //
translated: This is also an example of what is called ‚Äúincorrect mental activity.‚ÄùüîΩIf you think that such mental activity arises from the complete assemblage of causes,

original: yul gyi stobs kho na las skye ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yongs su ma tshang pa yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: yul gyi stobs kho na las skye ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yongs su ma tshang pa yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: and that mental activity arising from the power of an object alone arises from an incomplete assemblage of causes,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: that is not reasonable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu yongs su ma tshang bar go gang zhig skye zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyu yongs su ma tshang bar go gang zhig skye zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúWhat arises when the cause is incomplete?‚Äù

original: skye ba dang ldan pa gang zhig rgyu yongs su ma tshang bar skye /
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan pa gang zhig rgyu yongs su ma tshang bar skye /
translated: What has arising arises when the cause is complete.

original: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa ji snyed cig gis 'bras bu skyed par grags pa de ni de'i phyogs gcig ma tshang na de skyed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa ji snyed cig gis 'bras bu skyed par grags pa de ni de'i phyogs gcig ma tshang na de skyed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Whatever the assemblage of causes and conditions that is known to produce a result, if even one of those is missing, the result will not be produced.

original: dper na mig dang gzugs la sogs pa dang yid la byed pa tshogs pas mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par grags pa de ni de las gang @221b yang rung ba zhig ma tshang na de skyed par mi 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mig dang gzugs la sogs pa dang yid la byed pa tshogs pas mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par grags pa de ni de las gang @221b yang rung ba zhig ma tshang na de skyed par mi 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is well known that visual consciousness is produced by the assembly of eye, form, etc., and attention, and if any one of them is missing, it is not produced.

original: de lta bas na de ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de ni gyi na'o //
translated: Therefore, this is a mere quibble.

original: de lta bu zhes bya ba ni de'i rnam pa 'am de'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bu zhes bya ba ni de'i rnam pa 'am de'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch‚Äù means that kind or that nature.

original: 'on te ma skyes zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'o //
analyzed: 'on te ma skyes zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it has not arisen‚Äù is the antidote.

original: de'i sa bon gyi chos nyid ces bya ba ni sa bon gyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de'i sa bon gyi chos nyid ces bya ba ni sa bon gyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe reality of its seed‚Äù means the nature of the seed.

original: de rtsa nas ma bton cing drungs ma phyung na ji ltar zag pa zad pa yin /
analyzed: de rtsa nas ma bton cing drungs ma phyung na ji ltar zag pa zad pa yin /

original: khyod de lta yin du zad mod ces zer na /

original: de'i phyir zag pa ma zad na yang ji ltar dgra bcom pa nyid yin zhes bya ba smos te /

original: de ni slob pa yin no zhes zer ba 'di yongs su spang ba'i phyir yongs su nyams par sma ba de nyid kyis de ni de las dgra bcom pa kho na yin par bstan zhes bya ba smos so //

original: ji ltar bstan pa yin zhe na /

analyzed: zag pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos 'dod pa na spyod pa las bsil bar gyur pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called ‚Äúthat which has become cool‚Äù because it is cool in comparison to the desire realm, which is like a place of defilement.

analyzed: slob dpon ni dgra bcom pa nyid kyi gnas skabs kyi dbang du mdzad nas de skad du gsungs kyang nyes pa med do snyam du dgongs so //
translated: The Master thinks that there is no fault in saying this from the perspective of the state of an arhat.üîΩIt is not on the path of seeing because the preparation is not possible.

analyzed: sbyor ba mi srid pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam ni skad cig bco lnga yin te /
translated: The path of seeing is fifteen moments,

original: de la dbang po 'pho bar sbyor ba'i go skabs med do //üîΩla la ni so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na dbang po rnams 'pho'o zhes bya ba ci rigs pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i lam gyis dbang po rnams 'pho'am /
