translated: and there is no opportunity to prepare for the upgrading of intellectual faculty.üîΩSome say: One upgrades one‚Äôs intellectual faculty in the state of an ordinary being.

original: 'on te zhi ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pas yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te zhi ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pas yin zhe na /
translated: Does one upgrade one‚Äôs intellectual faculty by means of a path possessing the aspects of impermanence and so on or by means of a path possessing the aspects of peace and so on?

original: khyad par du ma byas pa'i phyir gnyi gar yang srid do snyam byed de /
analyzed: khyad par du ma byas pa'i phyir gnyi gar yang srid do snyam byed de /
translated: Both are possible because it is not specified.

original: 'di ltar don 'di ni slob dpon gyis 'phags pa rnams kyi dbang po ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i lam gyis 'pho ba med do zhes 'chad par 'gyur bas 'bags pa rnams kyi zhes khyad par du mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar don 'di ni slob dpon gyis 'phags pa rnams kyi dbang po ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i lam gyis 'pho ba med do zhes 'chad par 'gyur bas 'bags pa rnams kyi zhes khyad par du mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For this is the meaning: the Master will explain that the faculties of the noble ones do not change through the contaminated path, and he specifies ‚Äúthe noble ones‚Äù in order to exclude the faculties of the ordinary person.

original: ci nas kyang bdag gi dbang po dag rnon por 'gyur bar bya'o zhes sbyor bar bsams nas /
analyzed: ci nas kyang bdag gi dbang po dag rnon por 'gyur bar bya'o zhes sbyor bar bsams nas /
translated: ‚ÄúI will make my faculties sharp in every way.‚Äù

original: 'jig @222b rten pa'am 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam goms par byed pa na bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rim gyis dbang po dag 'pho'o zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig @222b rten pa'am 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam goms par byed pa na bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rim gyis dbang po dag 'pho'o zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that when one cultivates the mundane or supramundane path, one changes one‚Äôs faculties through the stages of the uninterrupted and liberated paths.

original: la la ni dad pas mos pa'i gnas skabs na'o zhes bya ba 'dir mi slob pa ma smos pa ni slob pa dang so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: la la ni dad pas mos pa'i gnas skabs na'o zhes bya ba 'dir mi slob pa ma smos pa ni slob pa dang so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Some change their faculties in the stage of faith-follower. Here, the non-learner is not mentioned because it is the stage of the learner and the ordinary person.

original: mi slob pa yang dbang po dag 'pho'o zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa yang dbang po dag 'pho'o zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the non-learner also changes their faculties.

original: ji ltar na mi g-yo ba'i chos can mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dag las yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'di dbang po rno ba'i phyir mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dag las kyang yongs su nyams pa mi srid na
analyzed: ji ltar na mi g-yo ba'i chos can mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dag las yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'di dbang po rno ba'i phyir mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dag las kyang yongs su nyams pa mi srid na
translated: How does one who is immutable fall from abiding happily in this life?üîΩOne asks this because it is impossible for one who is immutable to fall from abiding happily in this life, since one possesses sharp faculty.

original: rnam par grol ba mi g-yo ba las lta smos kyang ci dgos te mi srid do snyam nas 'dri ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba mi g-yo ba las lta smos kyang ci dgos te mi srid do snyam nas 'dri ba yin no //
translated: How much more so is it impossible to fall from immutable liberation?üîΩThe Buddha alone possesses the degeneration of enjoyment,

original: sangs rgyas la ni nye bar spyad pa las yongs su nyams pa kho na mnga' zhes bya ba ni gdul ba'i don la zhugs pa'i phyir mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dag nye bar mi spyod de mngon du mi mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to
analyzed: sangs rgyas la ni nye bar spyad pa las yongs su nyams pa kho na mnga' zhes bya ba ni gdul ba'i don la zhugs pa'i phyir mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dag nye bar mi spyod de mngon du mi mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to
translated: because he does not enjoy abiding happily in this life for the sake of disciples.

original: // de dang ma thob pa las yongs su nyams pa yang yod ces bya ba ni mi g-yo ba'i chos can la ni ji zhig gis brtsal bas nye bar spyad pa la yongs su nyams pa de dang / gang zag khyad par can gyi chos ma thob pa'i phyir ma thob pa las yongs su nyams pa yang yod de /
analyzed: // de dang ma thob pa las yongs su nyams pa yang yod ces bya ba ni mi g-yo ba'i chos can la ni ji zhig gis brtsal bas nye bar spyad pa la yongs su nyams pa de dang / gang zag khyad par can gyi chos ma thob pa'i phyir ma thob pa las yongs su nyams pa yang yod de /
translated: The immutable arhat possesses degeneration of enjoyment through striving for that, and also degeneration of nonobtainment, since he does not obtain the qualities of a special person.

original: 'di ltar mi g-yo ba'i chos can la yang la las nyan thos chen po 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal la sogs pa'i rab kyi mtha' pa la sogs pa'i chos dang / rang byung gi chos kyang kha cig ma thob la nyan thos chen pos kyang rung byung gi chos khyad par can kha cig thob pa dang mi ldan no zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mi g-yo ba'i chos can la yang la las nyan thos chen po 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal la sogs pa'i rab kyi mtha' pa la sogs pa'i chos dang / rang byung gi chos kyang kha cig ma thob la nyan thos chen pos kyang rung byung gi chos khyad par can kha cig thob pa dang mi ldan no zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, even the immutable arhat does not obtain the qualities of the peak of the mundane existence and so on of the great sravakas, such as the noble Sariputra and Maudgalyayana, and so on, and he does not possess the qualities of selfentity.

original: dgra bcom pa gzhan la zhes bya ba ni yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa dbang po rtul po la'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa gzhan la zhes bya ba ni yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa dbang po rtul po la'o //
translated: Other arhats refers to those of dull faculty, such as the one who degenerates.

original: thob pa las yongs su nyams pa yang yod do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thob pa las yongs su nyams pa yang yod do zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is also possible to fully degenerate from obtainment.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sngar bshad pa'i yongs su nyams pa yang yod do //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sngar bshad pa'i yongs su nyams pa yang yod do //
translated: The word also indicates that it is also possible to fully degenerate from the previously explained state of an arhat.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can nye bar spyad pa las yongs su nyams par 'byung ba'i phyir mdo dang mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni /üîΩ'dis mthong ba'i chos la zhes bya ba nas gang @223a * //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can nye bar spyad pa las yongs su nyams par 'byung ba'i phyir mdo dang mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni / 'dis mthong ba'i chos la zhes bya ba nas gang @223a * //
translated: It is not contradictory to the sutras because it is possible for an arhat of immutable nature to fully degenerate from enjoyment.üîΩThis does not contradict the sutra that states:

original: yang rung ba zhig las 'di yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar ning smra zhes bya ba'i bar 'byung ba gang yin pa'i mdo de dang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: yang rung ba zhig las 'di yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar ning smra zhes bya ba'i bar 'byung ba gang yin pa'i mdo de dang mi 'gal lo //
translated: It is said that it is possible for an arhat to fully degenerate from any of the five.üîΩThe Abhidharmako≈õa declares, The liberation of all six types of arhat is immutable.

original: dgra bcom pa drug car gyi rnam par grol ba yang mi g-yo ba yin no zhes bshad pa dang bye brag tu smra ba na re gal te dgra bcom pa thams cad kyi rnam par grol ba zag pa med pa mi g-yo ba nyid yin na /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa drug car gyi rnam par grol ba yang mi g-yo ba yin no zhes bshad pa dang bye brag tu smra ba na re gal te dgra bcom pa thams cad kyi rnam par grol ba zag pa med pa mi g-yo ba nyid yin na /
translated: If the uncontaminated liberation of all arhats is immutable, then why does the Abhidharmako≈õa declare,

original: ci'i phyir dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba kho na mi g-yo ba'i chos can du rnam par 'jog la gzhan dag ni ma yin zhes smra bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba kho na mi g-yo ba'i chos can du rnam par 'jog la gzhan dag ni ma yin zhes smra bar 'gyur te /
translated: Why do you say that only those liberated regardless of circumstances are immutable, but not others?üîΩTherefore, those who assert that arhats do not fully degenerate say:

original: de'i phyir yongs su mi nyams par smra ba na re thams cad kyi rnam par grol ba zag pa med pa mi g-yo ba yin la zhes bya ba 'di smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yongs su mi nyams par smra ba na re thams cad kyi rnam par grol ba zag pa med pa mi g-yo ba yin la zhes bya ba 'di smos te /
translated: The uncontaminated liberation of all arhats is immutable.

original: de yang bden na /
analyzed: de yang bden na /
translated: That is true,üîΩbut how they are posited as immutable has already been explained.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can du ji ltar rnam par bzhag pa ni de bzhin du bshad zin ces bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dag las ni la la rnyed pa dang bkur stis g-yen spyo ba'i nyes pas dbang nyams pa'i phyir yongs suüîΩnyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can du ji ltar rnam par bzhag pa ni de bzhin du bshad zin ces bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dag las ni la la rnyed pa dang bkur stis g-yen spyo ba'i nyes pas dbang nyams pa'i phyir yongs su nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: Some fully degenerate from the state of abiding in comfort in this life due to the fault of being distracted by gain and respect and their faculty declines.

original: dbang po rtul po gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po rtul po gang yin pa'o //
translated: Those of dull faculty fully degenerate.

original: la la yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te /üîΩdbang po rnon po gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: la la yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te /üîΩdbang po rnon po gang yin pa ste /
translated: Some do not fully degenerate.üîΩThose of sharp faculty do not fully degenerate.

original: de nyid mi g-yo ba'i chos can du gzhag go zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩgang gi phyir dbang po rtul po mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dag las rnyed pa dang bkur stis g-yen spyo ba'i nyes pas yongs su nyams par 'gyur gyi dbang po rnon po ni ma yin pa de'i phyir ji ltar na mi g-yo ba'i chos can
analyzed: de nyid mi g-yo ba'i chos can du gzhag go zhes bya ba yin no // gang gi phyir dbang po rtul po mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dag las rnyed pa dang bkur stis g-yen spyo ba'i nyes pas yongs su nyams par 'gyur gyi dbang po rnon po ni ma yin pa de'i phyir ji ltar na mi g-yo ba'i chos can
translated: ‚ÄùüîΩBecause those of dull faculty, who abide in comfort in this life, can retrogress due to the fault of being seduced by gain and honor, but those of sharp faculty cannot.

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dag las yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni klan kar mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dag las yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni klan kar mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not proper to ask, ‚ÄúHow can one who is not subject to destruction retrogress from abiding in comfort in this life?‚Äù

original: yang na 'di ni sbyar ba gzhan yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'di ni sbyar ba gzhan yin te /
translated: Or else, this is another interpretation:

original: gong du ni mi g-yo ba'i chos can mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dag las yongs su nyams pa med do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gong du ni mi g-yo ba'i chos can mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dag las yongs su nyams pa med do zhes bshad do //
translated: Above, it was explained that one who is not subject to destruction does not retrogress from abiding in comfort in this life.

original: mdo las ni khyad par du ma smos pas gang la rnam par grol ba mi g-yo ba yod pa de yang mthong pa'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dag las yongs su nyams pa skad du 'byung bas de'i phyir /
analyzed: mdo las ni khyad par du ma smos pas gang la rnam par grol ba mi g-yo ba yod pa de yang mthong pa'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dag las yongs su nyams pa skad du 'byung bas de'i phyir /
translated: retrogression from the state of abiding in bliss in this life.

original: thams cad kyi rnam par grol ba zag pa med pa ni mi g-yo ba yin zhes bya ba 'di brjod de /
analyzed: thams cad kyi rnam par grol ba zag pa med pa ni mi g-yo ba yin zhes bya ba 'di brjod de /
translated: Therefore it is said that the immutable liberation of all is uncontaminated.üîΩBut it is not thought that they are established as having immutable liberation

original: de kho nas mi g-yo ba'i chos can du rnam par gzhag pa ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir mi g-yo ba'i chos @223b can du ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa ni de bzhin du bshad zin pas de'i phyir mdo sde la brten nas ji ltar mi g-yo ba'i chos can mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dag las yongs su nyams
analyzed: de kho nas mi g-yo ba'i chos can du rnam par gzhag pa ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no // de nyid kyi phyir mi g-yo ba'i chos @223b can du ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa ni de bzhin du bshad zin pas de'i phyir mdo sde la brten nas ji ltar mi g-yo ba'i chos can mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dag las yongs su nyams
translated: by that alone.üîΩTherefore, since it has been explained how they are established as havingüîΩimmutable liberation, it is said that it is not a fault to say that the sutra is theüîΩbasis for the statement that those who have immutable liberation can

original: par 'gyur zhes smras pa gang yin pa 'di ni klan kar mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: par 'gyur zhes smras pa gang yin pa 'di ni klan kar mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: retrogress from the state of abiding in bliss in this life.üîΩ‚Äú

original: chung du zhes bya ba ni zhan pa'o //
analyzed: chung du zhes bya ba ni zhan pa'o //
translated: Small‚Äù means weak.

original: de lta ma yin na tshangs par spyad pa yid brtan du mi rung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gal te dgra bcom pa nyid las yongs su nyams pa yang skye bar 'gyur na /üîΩtshangs spyod 'di la legs spyad cing //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tshangs par spyad pa yid brtan du mi rung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gal te dgra bcom pa nyid las yongs su nyams pa yang skye bar 'gyur na / tshangs spyod 'di la legs spyad cing //
translated: then the pure life would not be reliable in the way that is said:üîΩ‚ÄúHaving well practiced this pure life,

original: rnam la 'ang legs par bsgoms pa ni //üîΩji ltar nad dang bral ba bzhin//
analyzed: rnam la 'ang legs par bsgoms pa ni // ji ltar nad dang bral ba bzhin//
translated: and well cultivated it in all ways,

original: che zad pa las dga' bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba yid brtan du rung ba de lta bur mi 'gyur ro //üîΩbya ba ma yin de mi byed //
analyzed: che zad pa las dga' bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba yid brtan du rung ba de lta bur mi 'gyur ro // bya ba ma yin de mi byed //
translated: one is delighted like one who is cured of a disease,üîΩor like one who is freed from debt or danger.‚Äù

original: ces bya ba ni mi tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni mi tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúHe does not do what should not be done‚Äù refers to sexual misconduct and so on.üîΩFor example, a strong person who stumbles does not fall down because of his strength.

original: rtsal po che 'gred pa rdeg mi 'cha' pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na rtsal po che 'gred na mthus bdag nyid gzung ba'i phyir rdeg 'cha' bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'phags pa 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa yang 'bras bu de ma
analyzed: rtsal po che 'gred pa rdeg mi 'cha' pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na rtsal po che 'gred na mthus bdag nyid gzung ba'i phyir rdeg 'cha' bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'phags pa 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa yang 'bras bu de ma
translated: In the same way, an arya who regresses from his result does not fall to a lower stage because of the strength of his root of virtue.

original: thob par mi 'chi 'o //
analyzed: thob par mi 'chi 'o //
translated: One does not die while in the process of obtaining it.

original: rtsal po che zhes smos pa ni rtsal zhan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsal po che zhes smos pa ni rtsal zhan pa ma yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúathlete‚Äù is used because it is not a weak person who obtains it.

original: gzhan dag na re rtsal po che ni stobs dang ldan pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rtsal po che ni stobs dang ldan pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: An athlete is one who possesses strength.

original: ji ltar goms par byas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar goms par byas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it cultivated?

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lam dag gis brten por byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lam dag gis brten por byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is cultivated by the paths of learning and no-more-learning, because it is made firm by them.

original: sbyor pa'i lam ni thams cad du gcig kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni mi g-yo ba rtogs par bya ba dang / mthong pas thob par byed pa la'o //
analyzed: sbyor pa'i lam ni thams cad du gcig kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni mi g-yo ba rtogs par bya ba dang / mthong pas thob par byed pa la'o //
translated: The path of preparation is the only one that is always of the learner.üîΩThe faculties of the noble ones do not change through a path that is contaminated.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi dbang po ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i lam gyis 'pho pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i dbang po 'pho par brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi dbang po ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i lam gyis 'pho pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i dbang po 'pho par brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the faculties of the noble ones that are said to change.

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: If it were otherwise,

original: la la ni so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na dbang po rnams 'pho'o zhes bya ba de 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la la ni so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na dbang po rnams 'pho'o zhes bya ba de 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would contradict the statement that some change their faculties while in the state of an ordinary being.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not otherwise,üîΩbecause regression is impossible.

original: yongs su nyams pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yongs su nyams pas 'jigs pa'i phyir dbang po 'pho bar 'dod na gzhan 'dod pa na spyod ba'i lha'i ris drug dang / gzugs dang gzugs med ba'i khams dag na ni yongs su nyams pa med do //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yongs su nyams pas 'jigs pa'i phyir dbang po 'pho bar 'dod na gzhan 'dod pa na spyod ba'i lha'i ris drug dang / gzugs dang gzugs med ba'i khams dag na ni yongs su nyams pa med do //
translated: If one wishes to upgrade one's intellectual capacity, one does so in the six heavens of the realm of desire, or in the realm of fine-materiality or the realm of immateriality, because regression is impossible there.

original: 'phags pa / @224a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa / @224a * //
translated: The noble ones

original: khams gong mar skyes pa ni dbang po dag kyang mi 'pho la /
analyzed: khams gong mar skyes pa ni dbang po dag kyang mi 'pho la /
translated: who are born in the higher realms do not upgrade their intellectual capacity.

original: ji ltar yang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar yang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin te /
translated: But they do not regress, as has been said.

original: 'di la gtan tshigs ni dus gzhan gyi bar du yongs su bsgoms pas dbang po rnams ches yongs su smin pa'i phyir dang / rten khyad par can rnyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la gtan tshigs ni dus gzhan gyi bar du yongs su bsgoms pas dbang po rnams ches yongs su smin pa'i phyir dang / rten khyad par can rnyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The reason is that their intellectual capacity is very ripe, because it has been cultivated for a long time, and they have obtained a special support.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha dag gi nang na yongs su nyams pa med ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha dag gi nang na yongs su nyams pa med ce na /
translated: Why is there no regression among the gods of the realm of desire?

original: sngon yul shin tu rgya chen po dag las yid byung ste /
analyzed: sngon yul shin tu rgya chen po dag las yid byung ste /
translated: Previously, they were disgusted with the vast domain of objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: des na bden pa rnams mthong bar gyur pa gang yin pa de dag ji ltar de dag nyid la dmigs nas yongs su nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na bden pa rnams mthong bar gyur pa gang yin pa de dag ji ltar de dag nyid la dmigs nas yongs su nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, how could they retrogress from those truths that they have seen, having taken them as their object?

original: gdon mi za bar dbang po rnon po dag yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar dbang po rnon po dag yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: They are definitely of sharp faculty.

original: mi slob pa dgu dag la brten te zhes bya ba ni de'i 'bras bu sa dgus bsdus pa nyid srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi slob pa dgu dag la brten te zhes bya ba ni de'i 'bras bu sa dgus bsdus pa nyid srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are based on nine, because their result is subsumed by the nine levels.

original: 'bras bu dang 'bras bu khyad par can zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang 'bras bu khyad par can zhes bya ba la /
translated: Result and special result.

original: 'bras bu ni lan cig phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni lan cig phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: Result is the result of once-returner.

original: 'bras bu khyad par can ni spong ba'i sbyor ba dang / bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba dang / khyad par gyi lam gyi mtshan nyid bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu khyad par can ni spong ba'i sbyor ba dang / bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba dang / khyad par gyi lam gyi mtshan nyid bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Special result is the first absorption and so on, characterized by the path of preparation, the uninterrupted path, the liberated path and the special path that abandons objects to be abandoned.

original: lam gyi 'bras bu kho na 'thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba tsam gyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: lam gyi 'bras bu kho na 'thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba tsam gyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: The result of the path alone is obtained means that it is subsumed by mere freedom from attachment to the desire realm.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu gzugs med pas bsdus pa ni med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu gzugs med pas bsdus pa ni med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The result of nonreturn is not subsumed by the formless realm.üîΩA s≈´tra states:üîΩBecause he abandons the five factors associated with the final end, he is a nonreturner.

original: mdo las / tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga spangs pa'i phyir phyir mi 'ong ba yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyi dang / de na yang mthong ba'i lam med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mdo las / tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga spangs pa'i phyir phyir mi 'ong ba yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyi dang / de na yang mthong ba'i lam med pa'i phyir te /
translated: And because the path of seeing does not exist there.

original: de med pa ni 'dod pa'i khams la mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes de ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de med pa ni 'dod pa'i khams la mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes de ni bshad zin to //
translated: That it does not exist there has already been explained because it does not focus on the desire realm.üîΩImmovable arhats are of two types.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba ni mdo las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba ni mdo las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is stated in a s≈´tra.

original: sangs rgyas gnyis ni mi g-yo ba'i bye brag kho na yin zhes bya ba ni mi g-yo ba'i chos can dbang po chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas gnyis ni mi g-yo ba'i bye brag kho na yin zhes bya ba ni mi g-yo ba'i chos can dbang po chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: The immutable type is divided into three types by the distinction of small, medium, and great faculties.

original: nyan thos kyis mi g-yo ba'i chos can ni dbang po chen po'i chud ngu yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyis mi g-yo ba'i chos can ni dbang po chen po'i chud ngu yin no //
translated: The immutable type of sravaka is of small faculties.

original: rang sangs rgyas ni dbang po chen po'i 'bring yin no //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas ni dbang po chen po'i 'bring yin no //
translated: The pratyekabuddha is of medium faculties.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni chen po'i chen po yin no//
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni chen po'i chen po yin no//
translated: The perfect buddha is of great faculties.üîΩThe nine types of faculties, such as small-small, etc.,

original: @224b chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs po dbang po rnam pa dgu'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba ni yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dbang po chung ngu'i chung ngu yin pa nas bcom ldan 'das dbang po chen po'i chen po yin pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: @224b chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs po dbang po rnam pa dgu'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba ni yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dbang po chung ngu'i chung ngu yin pa nas bcom ldan 'das dbang po chen po'i chen po yin pa'i bar ro //
translated: are the nine types of faculties of the arhat who fully degenerates, who is of small-small faculties, up to the Bhagavan, who is of great-great faculties.

original: bdun yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdun yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There are seven types.

original: rang sangs rgyas dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dag ni gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba kho nas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dag ni gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba kho nas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because pratyekabuddhas and perfect buddhas are subsumed only by the liberated by both parts.

original: dang po nyid nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dang po so so'i skyo bo'i gnas skabs nyid na gzhan gyi dring 'jog pas gzhan las dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'i chos thos nas phyis don rnams la sbyor ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dang po nyid nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dang po so so'i skyo bo'i gnas skabs nyid na gzhan gyi dring 'jog pas gzhan las dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'i chos thos nas phyis don rnams la sbyor ba'i phyir te /
translated: From the very beginning means that from the very beginning, when one is an ordinary being, one is dependent on others, one hears the Dharma of the foundations of mindfulness and so on from others and later one applies oneself to the meaning.

original: bsam pa dang bsgom pa ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsam pa dang bsgom pa ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is because one is taught contemplation and meditation.

original: de bzhin du sngon so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs nyid na shes rab kyis gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'brang bas bdag nyid kyis byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'brang zhing don rnams la sbyor
analyzed: de bzhin du sngon so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs nyid na shes rab kyis gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'brang bas bdag nyid kyis byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'brang zhing don rnams la sbyor
translated: Similarly, from the very beginning, when one is an ordinary being, one is a follower of the Dharma who follows the scriptures through wisdom, one is a follower of the Dharma of the factors conducive to enlightenment and so on and one applies oneself to the meaning.

original: ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ba'i phyir te /
translated: This is because one is a follower of the Dharma who follows the meaning.

original: bsam pa dang bsgom pa bsten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa dang bsgom pa bsten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they rely on faith and meditation, respectively.

original: de ltar na sbyor ba las ni dad pa dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dag yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sbyor ba las ni dad pa dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dag yin no //
translated: Thus, in terms of practice, there are those who follow faith and those who follow the teachings.üîΩIn terms of predominance of faith and predominance of wisdom, respectively.

original: dad pas mos pa dang shes rab lhag pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni dad pas mos pa lhag pa dang / shes rab lhag pa'i sgo nas so //üîΩdad pas mos pa ni dad pas mos pa ste /
analyzed: dad pas mos pa dang shes rab lhag pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni dad pas mos pa lhag pa dang / shes rab lhag pa'i sgo nas so // dad pas mos pa ni dad pas mos pa ste /
translated: Predominance of faith means predominance of aspiration due to faith.üîΩPredominance of wisdom means predominance of understanding.

original: de lhag pa'i phyir /üîΩdbang po rtul po nyid yin la /
analyzed: de lhag pa'i phyir / dbang po rtul po nyid yin la /
translated: Those who follow faith are those who are predominant in faith.

original: shes rab lhag pa'i phyir dbang po rnon po nyid yin no //
analyzed: shes rab lhag pa'i phyir dbang po rnon po nyid yin no //
translated: Those who follow the teachings are those who are predominant in wisdom.

original: rnam par grol ba las ni zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba las so //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba las ni zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba las so //
translated: In terms of liberation, means in terms of liberation from the afflictions.

original: shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyis nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyis nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those liberated by wisdom are those who are liberated from the afflictions by wisdom.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa dang rnam par grol ba las ni zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa dang rnam par grol ba las so //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa dang rnam par grol ba las ni zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa dang rnam par grol ba las so //
translated: In terms of meditative attainment and liberation, means in terms of meditative attainment and liberation.

original: de la dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba la dbang po'i sgo nas ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de la dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba la dbang po'i sgo nas ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Those who follow trust are classified as three by way of faculty,üîΩas small, middling, and great.

original: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba 'di dag ji ltar bgrang ba de bzhin du gzhung ji lta ba rab tu bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba 'di dag ji ltar bgrang ba de bzhin du gzhung ji lta ba rab tu bstan par bya ste /
translated: Just as they are counted, so they are taught in the treatise.

original: dbang po chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po phyir dbang po'i sgo nas ni gsum mo //
analyzed: dbang po chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po phyir dbang po'i sgo nas ni gsum mo //
translated: They are three by way of faculty, because of small, middling, and great faculties.

original: 'dir yang 'di ltar khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang 'di ltar khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: Here, this should be understood:

original: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba thams cad dbang po rtul po kho @225a * //üîΩna yin mod kyi /
analyzed: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba thams cad dbang po rtul po kho @225a * // na yin mod kyi /
translated: All those who follow trust are dull-facultied.

original: 'on kyang shin tu rtul ba dang ches shin tu rtul bar gnas pa'i phyir 'di dag la dbang po chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po zhes bya ba khyad par rnam pa gsum yod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang shin tu rtul ba dang ches shin tu rtul bar gnas pa'i phyir 'di dag la dbang po chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po zhes bya ba khyad par rnam pa gsum yod do //
translated: However, they are distinguished as three types, small, middling, and great, because they abide as very dull and extremely dull.

original: rigs kyi sgo nas ni lnga'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi sgo nas ni lnga'o //
translated: They are five by way of lineage.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can gyi rigs nas rtogs pa'i skal ba can gyi rigs zhes bya ba'i bar lnga yin no //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can gyi rigs nas rtogs pa'i skal ba can gyi rigs zhes bya ba'i bar lnga yin no //
translated: There are five types of persons, from the type subject to retrogressing up to the type destined for penetration.üîΩThese five types are each divided into three categories according to the difference of their faculties, weak, medium, strong.

original: yang rigs dang dbang po'i bye brag gis brgyad du gyur pa da dag ra zhing lam gyi sgo nas ni bco lnga yin no //üîΩji lta zhe na bzod pa brgyad dang shes pa bdun la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yang rigs dang dbang po'i bye brag gis brgyad du gyur pa da dag ra zhing lam gyi sgo nas ni bco lnga yin no // ji lta zhe na bzod pa brgyad dang shes pa bdun la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: These fifteen types of persons are established in the path of insight, in the fifteen moments of the cognition of the doctrine with regard to the four noble truths.

original: mthong ba'i lam la skad cig bco lnga ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la skad cig bco lnga ste /
translated: The path of insight has fifteen moments:üîΩeight moments of acquiescence in the cognition of the doctrine, from acquiescence in the cognition of the doctrine with regard to unsatisfactoriness up to acquiescence in the subsequent cognition with regard to the path;

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa nas lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i bar bzod pa brgyad dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa nas 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i phyir shes pa bdun no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa nas lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i bar bzod pa brgyad dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa nas 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i phyir shes pa bdun no //
translated: seven moments of cognition of the doctrine, from the cognition of the doctrine with regard to unsatisfactoriness up to the subsequent cognition with regard to cessation;

original: lam la rjes su shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbrgyad dang bdun ni bco lngar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro // brgyad dang bdun ni bco lngar 'gyur te /
translated: the subsequent cognition with regard to the path is included in the path of cultivation.üîΩEight and seven make fifteen.

original: de lta bu de la gnas pa bco lnga yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu de la gnas pa bco lnga yin no //
translated: The fifteen moments are the fifteen types of persons.

original: de ltar lam gyi sgo nas rnam pa bco lngar tha dad pa 'di dag yang re re bzhin 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sgo nas ni bdun cu rtsa gsum ste /
analyzed: de ltar lam gyi sgo nas rnam pa bco lngar tha dad pa 'di dag yang re re bzhin 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sgo nas ni bdun cu rtsa gsum ste /
translated: Each of them is also classified as seventy-three types by means of freedom from attachment.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this so?

original: re zhig 'dod pa'i khams la 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa gcig dang / 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnam pa gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba nas rnam pa dgu las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched las 'dod chags dang bral ba dgu'i bar yin no //
analyzed: re zhig 'dod pa'i khams la 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa gcig dang / 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnam pa gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba nas rnam pa dgu las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched las 'dod chags dang bral ba dgu'i bar yin no //
translated: One who possesses all the bonds in the desire realm, one who is free from attachment to one type of object to be abandoned in the desire realm, up to one who is free from attachment to nine types of objects to be abandoned, and one who is free from attachment to the nine types of objects to be abandoned in the base of nothingness.

original: gong na ni mi srid de ;
analyzed: gong na ni mi srid de ;
translated: They are not possible in the higher realms,

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mundane path is not an antidote to the summit of existence.

original: de dag ni dgu brgyad ni bdun cu gnyis yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni dgu brgyad ni bdun cu gnyis yin te /
translated: These are the seventy-two,

original: sngar bshad pa 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pas bsnan na bdun cu rtsa gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pas bsnan na bdun cu rtsa gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: adding the one who possesses all the bonds explained previously, there are seventy-three.

original: yang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sgo nas bdun cu rtsa gsum du so sor tha dad pa 'di dag re re zhing rten gyi sgo nas ni dgu'o //
analyzed: yang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sgo nas bdun cu rtsa gsum du so sor tha dad pa 'di dag re re zhing rten gyi sgo nas ni dgu'o //
translated: Furthermore, they are distinguished as seventy-three by way of freedom from passion. Each of these is ninefold by way of basis.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gling gsum dang / lha'i ris drug tu skyes pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gling gsum dang / lha'i ris drug tu skyes pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says: born in the three continents and the six divine realms.

original: gling gsum ni byang gi sgra mi snyan ma gtogs pa dag ste /
analyzed: gling gsum ni byang gi sgra mi snyan ma gtogs pa dag ste /
translated: The three continents are except for Uttarakuru,

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan na ni lam med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan na ni lam med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no path there.

original: lha'i ris drug ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dag ste /
analyzed: lha'i ris drug ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dag ste /
translated: The six divine realms are the desire realm.

original: @225b de'i gong na mthong ba'i lam med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @225b de'i gong na mthong ba'i lam med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no path of seeing above that.

original: de rnams su skyes pas na 'di dag re re zhing dgu 'gyur du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams su skyes pas na 'di dag re re zhing dgu 'gyur du 'gyur ro //
translated: They are ninefold by way of being born in those.üîΩWhen they are combined by way of faculty, type, path, freedom from passion, and basis, there is one.

original: dbang po dang rigs dang / lam dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rten gyi sgo nas bsdoms na ni zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud par smos pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po dang rigs dang / lam dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rten gyi sgo nas bsdoms na ni zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud par smos pa ste /
translated: This is the final summary.

original: 'di nyid gcig go zhes bya ba ni 'grel ba'i nang du bris par zad do //
analyzed: 'di nyid gcig go zhes bya ba ni 'grel ba'i nang du bris par zad do //
translated: This is the only one. This is written in the commentary.

original: gang zag gzhan dag kyang ci rigs par de bzhin du brtsi bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang zag gzhan dag kyang ci rigs par de bzhin du brtsi bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Other persons should be considered in the same way, as appropriate.

original: ji ltar dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dbang po dang / rigs dang lam dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang rten gyi sgo nas brtsis pa de kho na bzhin du brtsi bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dbang po dang / rigs dang lam dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang rten gyi sgo nas brtsis pa de kho na bzhin du brtsi bar bya'o //
translated: Just as the faith-follower is considered in terms of faculties, lineage, path, freedom from attachment, and basis, so too should the Dharma-follower and so on be considered.

original: ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / mthong bas thob pa dang / dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba rnams la ni rigs kyi khyad par med la /
analyzed: ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / mthong bas thob pa dang / dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba rnams la ni rigs kyi khyad par med la /
translated: As appropriate means that the Dharma-follower, the view-attainer and the noncircumstantially liberated arya have no distinction of lineage.

original: dad pas mos pa dang / dus kyis rnam par grol ba dag la ni /
analyzed: dad pas mos pa dang / dus kyis rnam par grol ba dag la ni /
translated: But the faith devotee and the circumstantially liberated arya have a distinction of lineage.

original: rigs kyi khyad par yang yod pas ci rigs par zhes smos so//
analyzed: rigs kyi khyad par yang yod pas ci rigs par zhes smos so//
translated: Therefore it is said, as appropriate.

original: de la chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dbang po'i sgo nas ni gsum mo //
analyzed: de la chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dbang po'i sgo nas ni gsum mo //
translated: The Dharma-follower is threefold in terms of faculties.

original: rigs kyi sgo nas ni gcig kho na ste khyad par med do //
analyzed: rigs kyi sgo nas ni gcig kho na ste khyad par med do //
translated: But there is no distinction of lineage, for there is only one lineage.

original: lam gyi sgo nas ni bco lnga ste /
analyzed: lam gyi sgo nas ni bco lnga ste /
translated: From the point of view of the path, there are fifteen.

original: bzod pa brgyad dang shes pa bdun la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa brgyad dang shes pa bdun la gnas pa'o //
translated: They are those who are established in the eight receptivities and the seven subsequent cognitions.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sgo nas ni bdun cu rtsa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sgo nas ni bdun cu rtsa gsum ste /
translated: From the point of view of freedom from attachment, there are seventy-three.

original: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa dang / 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir dgu nas de bzhin du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa dang / 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir dgu nas de bzhin du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir gyi bar du'o //
translated: They are those who possess all the bonds, those who are free from attachment to the desire realm, and so on up to those who are free from attachment to the sphere of nothingness.

original: rten gyi sgo nas ni dgu ste /
analyzed: rten gyi sgo nas ni dgu ste /
translated: From the point of view of basis, there are nine.

original: gling gsum dang / lha'i ris drug tu skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gling gsum dang / lha'i ris drug tu skyes pa'o //
translated: They are those who are born in the three continents and the six divine realms.

original: de bzhin du dbang po dang / rigs dang / lam dang ; 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rten gyi sgo nas bsdoms na ni nyi khri dgu stong lnga brgya drug cu rtsa lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po dang / rigs dang / lam dang ; 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rten gyi sgo nas bsdoms na ni nyi khri dgu stong lnga brgya drug cu rtsa lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, if one combines from the point of view of faculty, lineage, path, freedom from attachment and basis, there are 29,565.

original: de bzhin du dad pas mos pa dbang po'i sgo nas ni gsum mo //
analyzed: de bzhin du dad pas mos pa dbang po'i sgo nas ni gsum mo //
translated: Similarly, from the point of view of faculty, those resolute in faith are three.

original: rigs kyi sgo nas ni so sor lnga'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi sgo nas ni so sor lnga'o //
translated: From the point of view of lineage, there are five each.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sgo nas ni so sor bdun cu rtsa gsum kho na ste snga ma bzhin no //üîΩrten gyi sgo nas ni dgu ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sgo nas ni so sor bdun cu rtsa gsum kho na ste snga ma bzhin no // rten gyi sgo nas ni dgu ste /
translated: Those who are detached by means of the formless realm are only seventy-three, as before.üîΩThose who are detached by means of the form realm are only seventy-three, as before.üîΩThose who are detached by means of the desire realm are only seventy-three, as before.üîΩThose who are detached by means of the formless realm are only seventy-three, as before.üîΩThose who are detached by means of the form realm are only seventy-three, as before.üîΩThose who are detached by means of the desire realm are only seventy-three, as before.üîΩThose who are detached by means of the formless realm are only seventy-three, as before.

original: gling gsum dang / lha'i ris drug tu skye pa'o //
analyzed: gling gsum dang / lha'i ris drug tu skye pa'o //
translated: Those who are detached by means of the form realm are only seventy-three, as before.üîΩThose who are detached by means of the desire realm are only seventy-three, as before.üîΩThose who are detached by means of the formless realm are only seventy-three, as before.üîΩThose who are detached by means of the form realm are only seventy-three, as before.üîΩThose who are detached by means of the desire realm are only seventy-three, as before.

original: de bzhin du dbang po dang / rigs dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rten gyi sgo nas bsdoms na ni dgu stong brgyad brgya lnga bcu rtsa lngar 'gyur ro //üîΩ'dir ni 'bras bu la gnas pa sems @226a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po dang / rigs dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rten gyi sgo nas bsdoms na ni dgu stong brgyad brgya lnga bcu rtsa lngar 'gyur ro // 'dir ni 'bras bu la gnas pa sems @226a * //
translated: Those who are detached by means of the formless realm are only seventy-three, as before.üîΩThose who are detached by means of the form realm are only seventy-three, as before.

original: bcu drug thob pa 'ba' zhig gi dbang du byas pa yin te /üîΩde'i tshe dbang po rtul po dang / rnon po dag dad pas mos pa dang / mthong bas thob pa dag yin pas 'dir de gnyis brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩskal ldan khyad par can na re lam gyi sgo nas ni dgu yin te /
analyzed: bcu drug thob pa 'ba' zhig gi dbang du byas pa yin te / de'i tshe dbang po rtul po dang / rnon po dag dad pas mos pa dang / mthong bas thob pa dag yin pas 'dir de gnyis brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro // skal ldan khyad par can na re lam gyi sgo nas ni dgu yin te /
translated: Those who are detached by means of the desire realm are only seventy-three, as before.üîΩThose who are detached by means of the formless realm are only seventy-three, as before.üîΩThose who are detached by means of the form realm are only seventy-three, as before.üîΩThose who are detached by means of the desire realm are only seventy-three, as before.üîΩThose who are detached by means of the formless realm are only seventy-three, as before.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Those who are detached by means of the form realm are only seventy-three, as before.üîΩThose who are

original: de ni bsam pa gang gis de skad du smras pa khong du ma chud do //
analyzed: de ni bsam pa gang gis de skad du smras pa khong du ma chud do //
translated: But you have not understood the intention with which it is said that way.

original: gal te 'di skad du lam gyi sgo nas ni sa dang sa na dgur 'gyur ro snyam du sems par 'gyur na ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sgo nas ni bdun cu rtsa gsum ste zhes bya ba de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir de kho na bstan
analyzed: gal te 'di skad du lam gyi sgo nas ni sa dang sa na dgur 'gyur ro snyam du sems par 'gyur na ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sgo nas ni bdun cu rtsa gsum ste zhes bya ba de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir de kho na bstan
translated: If you think that from the perspective of the path, there are nine for each stage, then since that is not different from the statement, ‚ÄúFrom the perspective of freedom from attachment, there are seventy-three,‚Äù

original: par gyur pas rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: par gyur pas rigs pa yin te /
translated: it is reasonable to teach just that,

original: tshad kyang de kho nar zad do //
analyzed: tshad kyang de kho nar zad do //
translated: and the number would be just that.

original: 'on te bsgom pa'i lam zag pa med pa sa dgu pa la gnas pa'i phyir 'di dag dgu nyid du rnam par 'jog na ni /
analyzed: 'on te bsgom pa'i lam zag pa med pa sa dgu pa la gnas pa'i phyir 'di dag dgu nyid du rnam par 'jog na ni /
translated: But if they are posited as nine from the perspective of abiding on the ninth stage of the uncontaminated path of meditation,

original: de lta yin na tshad de yang dgur bsgyur ba byas na de dag 'di snyed du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin na tshad de yang dgur bsgyur ba byas na de dag 'di snyed du 'gyur te /
translated: then if the number is multiplied by nine, they would be that many.

original: brgyad khri brgyad stong drug brgya dgu bcu rtsa lngar 'gyur te /
analyzed: brgyad khri brgyad stong drug brgya dgu bcu rtsa lngar 'gyur te /
translated: That is, there would be 84,695.

original: de bzhin du 'og ma yang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og ma yang bshad par bya'o //
translated: The same should be explained for the lower stages.

original: gal te dad pas mos pa rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar bzung na ni de'i phyir de lta bu ma yin par brtsi dgos te /
analyzed: gal te dad pas mos pa rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar bzung na ni de'i phyir de lta bu ma yin par brtsi dgos te /
translated: If one takes faith in the Great Vehicle as the object of the vajra like samadhi, then one must calculate it as not being like that.

original: dad pas mos pa dbang po'i sgo nas ni gsum mo //
analyzed: dad pas mos pa dbang po'i sgo nas ni gsum mo //
translated: Faith in the Great Vehicle is threefold from the perspective of intellectual faculty.

original: rigs kyi sgo nas ni so sor lnga'o//
analyzed: rigs kyi sgo nas ni so sor lnga'o//
translated: It is fivefold from the perspective of lineage.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sgo nas ni bdun cu rtsa gsum gyi thog tu srid pa'i rtse mo'i rnam pa brgyad las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir brgyad kyis bsnan te brgyad cu rtsa gcig go //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sgo nas ni bdun cu rtsa gsum gyi thog tu srid pa'i rtse mo'i rnam pa brgyad las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir brgyad kyis bsnan te brgyad cu rtsa gcig go //
translated: It is seventy one from the perspective of freedom from attachment, since one is free from attachment to the eight aspects of the summit of existence in addition to the seventy three previously mentioned.

original: rten gyi sgo nas ni nyi shu rtsa dgu'o //
analyzed: rten gyi sgo nas ni nyi shu rtsa dgu'o //
translated: It is twenty nine from the perspective of basis.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this so?

original: 'dod pa'i khams ni skye ba'i gnas dgu dang / gzugs kyi khams na gnas bcu drug dang / gzugs med pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ni skye ba'i gnas dgu dang / gzugs kyi khams na gnas bcu drug dang / gzugs med pa bzhi'o //
translated: The desire realm has nine birth stories, the form realm has sixteen abodes and the formless realm has four.

original: de bzhin du dbang po dang / rigs dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rten gyi sgo nas bsdoms na ni sum khri lnga stong nyis brgya sum cu rtsa lnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po dang / rigs dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rten gyi sgo nas bsdoms na ni sum khri lnga stong nyis brgya sum cu rtsa lnga'o //
translated: In the same way, if one adds the families, the detachments and the bases, there are 35,235.

original: mthong bas thob pa la rigs kyi bye brag ni med do //
analyzed: mthong bas thob pa la rigs kyi bye brag ni med do //
translated: The families are not distinguished among the candidates for the fruit of the perfected being.

original: dbang po dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rten gyi sgo nas bsdoms na ni stong dgu brgya bdun cu rtsa gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rten gyi sgo nas bsdoms na ni stong dgu brgya bdun cu rtsa gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If one adds the families, the detachments and the bases, there are 1,971.

original: gal te mthong bas thob pa rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar gzung na ni 'di ltar brtsi bar bya ste /
analyzed: gal te mthong bas thob pa rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar gzung na ni 'di ltar brtsi bar bya ste /
translated: If one adds the candidates for the fruit of the perfected being who are candidates for the fruit of the perfected being through the diamond-like concentration,

original: dbang po dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rten gyi sgo nas bsdoms na bdun stong bzhi bcu @226b rtsa bdun du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rten gyi sgo nas bsdoms na bdun stong bzhi bcu @226b rtsa bdun du 'gyur ro //
translated: there are 7,047.

original: lus kyis mngon du byed pa ni dad pas mos pa dang / mthong bas thob pa'i nang du 'dus pas mi rtsi'o //
analyzed: lus kyis mngon du byed pa ni dad pas mos pa dang / mthong bas thob pa'i nang du 'dus pas mi rtsi'o //
translated: The candidates for the fruit of the perfected being who realize through the body are included among the candidates for the fruit of the perfected being through faith and through vision. Therefore, they are not counted separately.

original: gal te rtsi na dbang po'i sgo nas ni gsum mo //
analyzed: gal te rtsi na dbang po'i sgo nas ni gsum mo //
translated: If one considers the faculties, there are three.

original: rigs kyi sgo nas ni gal te lus kyis mngon du byed pa de dad pas mos pa yin na lnga'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi sgo nas ni gal te lus kyis mngon du byed pa de dad pas mos pa yin na lnga'o //
translated: If one considers the families, there are five if one manifests the family of faith,

original: gal te mthong bas thob pa yin na ni rigs kyi khyad par med do //
analyzed: gal te mthong bas thob pa yin na ni rigs kyi khyad par med do //
translated: but if one manifests the family of the view, there is no difference in the families.üîΩThere is no difference in the path.üîΩThere is no difference in the detachment.

original: lam ni gnyi ga'i yang dbye ba med do //
analyzed: lam ni gnyi ga'i yang dbye ba med do //
translated: There is no difference in the faculties.üîΩThere is a difference in the families.üîΩThere is a difference in the path.üîΩThere is a difference in the detachment.üîΩThere is a difference in the faculties.

analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sgo nas kyang khyad par med do //
