original: gal te srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa dang rnam pa gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba nas rnam pa brgyad las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar zhig yin na ni lam dad 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sgo nas khyad par yod
analyzed: gal te srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa dang rnam pa gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba nas rnam pa brgyad las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar zhig yin na ni lam dad 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sgo nas khyad par yod
translated: There is a difference in

original: mod kyi lus kyis mngon du byed pa nyid ni lam dang 'dod chags dang bral bas byas pa ma yin pas 'di des byas pa de'i khyad par du ni rnam par mi gzhag 'o //
analyzed: mod kyi lus kyis mngon du byed pa nyid ni lam dang 'dod chags dang bral bas byas pa ma yin pas 'di des byas pa de'i khyad par du ni rnam par mi gzhag 'o //
translated: But it is not posited as a special case of that because it is not made by the path or by freedom from attachment.

original: skal ldan khyad par can na re rten gyi sgo nas ni khyad par rnam pa mang ste /
analyzed: skal ldan khyad par can na re rten gyi sgo nas ni khyad par rnam pa mang ste /
translated: Bhadanta DharmatrƒÅta says: It is distinguished in many ways from the perspective of its basis.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rten can yin pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi rten can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rten can yin pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi rten can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
translated: It is the basis of the desire realm and so on up to the basis of the summit of existence.

original: ji ltar na lus kyis mngon du byed pa nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa'i rten can yin /üîΩ'di ltar rigs pa snyam byed de /
analyzed: ji ltar na lus kyis mngon du byed pa nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa'i rten can yin / 'di ltar rigs pa snyam byed de /
translated: How can the body manifest the base of infinite space and so on?

original: rten gyi sgo nas ni 'dod pa'i khams na skye ba'i gnas dgu dang / gzugs kyi khams na gnas bcu drug ste nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
analyzed: rten gyi sgo nas ni 'dod pa'i khams na skye ba'i gnas dgu dang / gzugs kyi khams na gnas bcu drug ste nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
translated: He thinks that it is logical to say this because from the perspective of its basis, the desire realm has nine birth levels and the form realm has sixteen levels, making twenty five.

original: 'phags pa ni de dag tu 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skyed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa ni de dag tu 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skyed do //
translated: ƒÄryas generate the meditative attainment of cessation in those levels.

original: gal te 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi rten can gyi 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i skyed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir mi 'ong ba lus kyis mngon du byed par gyur pa de'i ldan pa tsam dang 'brel pa'i phyir phyis kyang lus kyis mngon du byed pa srid pa'i
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi rten can gyi 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i skyed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir mi 'ong ba lus kyis mngon du byed par gyur pa de'i ldan pa tsam dang 'brel pa'i phyir phyis kyang lus kyis mngon du byed pa srid pa'i
translated: Nonreturners who manifest the meditative attainment of cessation that is supported by the desire or form realms possess the mere possession of that meditative attainment and are related to it.üîΩ

original: rtse mo'i rten can nyid du 'dod na ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i rten can dang nyi shu rtsa drug yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: rtse mo'i rten can nyid du 'dod na ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i rten can dang nyi shu rtsa drug yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: If it is asserted that nonreturners who manifest the meditative attainment of cessation that is supported by the desire or form realms manifest cessation by the body and later manifest cessation by the body because they possess mere possession of that meditative attainment, then there would be twenty six types of nonreturners who manifest cessation by the body, since they would possess the meditative attainment of cessation supported by the summit of existence.

original: de bzhin du dbang po dang / rigs dang rten gyi sgo nas bgrangs te brtsi bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po dang / rigs dang rten gyi sgo nas bgrangs te brtsi bar bya ste /
translated: Similarly, they should be enumerated and calculated in terms of intellectual faculty, lineage and basis.

original: shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba'i bye brag kyang dbang po'i sgo nas ni gsum mo /
analyzed: shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba'i bye brag kyang dbang po'i sgo nas ni gsum mo /
translated: In terms of intellectual faculty, those liberated by wisdom are of three types.

original: shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba rigs kyi sgo nas ni gal te dus kyis rnam par grol ba zhig yin na lnga'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba rigs kyi sgo nas ni gal te dus kyis rnam par grol ba zhig yin na lnga'o //
translated: In terms of lineage, if they are liberated according to circumstances, they are of five types.

original: 'on te dus dang mi sbyor ba rnam par grol ba zhig yin na ni khyad par med do //
analyzed: 'on te dus dang mi sbyor ba rnam par grol ba zhig yin na ni khyad par med do //
translated: But if he is a non-circumstantially liberated arhat, there is no difference.

original: @227a * // gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩshes rab dang ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dag gis nyon mongs pa dang rnam par thar pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi stobs kyis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: @227a * // gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o // shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dag gis nyon mongs pa dang rnam par thar pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi stobs kyis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir dang /
translated: The same should be applied to the arhat liberated from both parts.üîΩBecause of being liberated from the obscurations of defilement and liberation by the power of wisdom and concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis rnam par thar pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis rnam par thar pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of being liberated from the obscurations of defilement by the power of wisdom and because of being liberated from the obscurations of liberation by the power of concentration.

original: rnam par thar pa dag ni gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba zhes bya ba brgyad 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa dag ni gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba zhes bya ba brgyad 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The eight liberations are explained as follows: ‚ÄúOne who has form sees forms.‚Äù

original: de la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa nyid sgrib pa yin no //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa nyid sgrib pa yin no //
translated: Here, the obscuration of defilement is defilement itself that is the obscuration.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgrib pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa rnams kyis sgrib pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgrib pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa rnams kyis sgrib pa yin te /
translated: The so-called obscurations to liberation are obscurations to the liberations.

original: de yang gang gis rnam par thar pa dag skyed par mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: de yang gang gis rnam par thar pa dag skyed par mi nus pa ste /
translated: Moreover, they are those that prevent the generation of the liberations.

original: lus dang sems las su mi rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: lus dang sems las su mi rung ba nyid do //
translated: They are the unserviceability of the body and mind.

original: 'di la gang zhig nyon mongs pa lnga spangs te zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la gang zhig nyon mongs pa lnga spangs te zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga bshad pa yin no //
translated: Here, ‚Äúhaving abandoned the five kinds of moral defilement‚Äù refers to the five that are unfavorable for liberation, such as the view of self.

original: mi 'phrogs chos ldan zhes bya ba ni yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi 'phrogs chos ldan zhes bya ba ni yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúEndowed with the Dharma that cannot be taken away‚Äù means that he is not subject to regression.

original: 'bras bu kho na las so zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dad pas mos pa yin pa'i phyir dbang po'i sgo nas yongs su rdzogs pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu kho na las so zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dad pas mos pa yin pa'i phyir dbang po'i sgo nas yongs su rdzogs pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: He is not completely perfected in terms of the faculties because he is one who is resolute through faith.

original: lus kyis mngon du byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgo nas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: lus kyis mngon du byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgo nas kyang ma yin no //
translated: He is also not completely perfected in terms of meditative concentration because he does not manifest the meditative development of the meditative concentrations.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i sgo nas ni yongs su rdzogs pa nyid yod do //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i sgo nas ni yongs su rdzogs pa nyid yod do //
translated: It is perfect in terms of its result because it is a nonreturner.

original: dbang po kho na las so zhes bya ba ni mthong bas thob pa yin pa'i phyir dbang po'i sgo nas yongs su rdzogs pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: dbang po kho na las so zhes bya ba ni mthong bas thob pa yin pa'i phyir dbang po'i sgo nas yongs su rdzogs pa nyid yin la /
translated: It is perfect in terms of its faculties because it is obtained by seeing,

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i phyir 'bras bu'i sgo nas kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i phyir 'bras bu'i sgo nas kyang ma yin la /
translated: but it is not perfect in terms of its result because it is not free from attachment.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgo nas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgo nas kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not perfect in terms of meditative attainment

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dag ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dag ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has not obtained the result of nonreturn and meditative attainment.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied in the appropriate way to the others.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa kho na dang zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa kho na'i sgo nas yongs su rdzogs pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa kho na dang zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa kho na'i sgo nas yongs su rdzogs pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: It is perfect in terms of meditative attainment alone because it is perfect in terms of meditative attainment alone,

original: dbang po dang 'bras bu dag gi sgo nas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de ni med do //
analyzed: dbang po dang 'bras bu dag gi sgo nas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de ni med do //
translated: but it is not perfect in terms of its faculties and its result.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu ma thob par 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'dug pa med pas so //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu ma thob par 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'dug pa med pas so //
translated: Because there is no meditative attainment of cessation without obtaining the fruit of non-return.

original: 'bras bu med par snyoms par @227b 'dug pa dang / dbang po las zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang dbang po kho na las yongs su rdzogs pa nyid yin gyi 'bras bu'i sgo nas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de yang med de /
analyzed: 'bras bu med par snyoms par @227b 'dug pa dang / dbang po las zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang dbang po kho na las yongs su rdzogs pa nyid yin gyi 'bras bu'i sgo nas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de yang med de /
translated: There is no meditative attainment of cessation without fruit, and it is fully accomplished from the faculties alone.

original: 'di ltar phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu ma thob pa la 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa med pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu ma thob pa la 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa med pas so //
translated: That is also not the case, because there is no meditative attainment of cessation without obtaining the fruit of non-return.

original: dbang po dang snyoms par 'jug pa las so zhes bya ba ni dbang po rno ba'i phyir dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dbang po dang snyoms par 'jug pa las so zhes bya ba ni dbang po rno ba'i phyir dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: From the faculties and meditative attainment means that it is fully accomplished from the faculties alone and from the meditative attainment of cessation, because one has sharp faculties and obtains the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: dbang po kho na las so zhes bya ba ni dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang po kho na las so zhes bya ba ni dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: From the faculties alone means that it is fully accomplished from the faculties alone, because it is called ‚Äúliberated without time.‚Äù

original: 'di dbang po'i sgo nas ni yongs su rdzogs pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di dbang po'i sgo nas ni yongs su rdzogs pa nyid yin la /
translated: This is complete in terms of faculties.

original: shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'di snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgo nas yongs su rdzogs pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'di snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgo nas yongs su rdzogs pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not complete in terms of meditative attainment, because it is said that one is liberated by wisdom.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ma thob pa ni shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ma thob pa ni shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba zhes bshad do //
translated: One who has not attained the meditative attainment of cessation is said to be liberated by wisdom.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa kho na las so zhes bya ba ni dus kyis rnam par grol ba zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'di dbang po'i sgo nas yongs su rdzogs pa nyid ma yin no //üîΩgnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'di snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgo nas yongs su rdzogs pa nyid ni yin te /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa kho na las so zhes bya ba ni dus kyis rnam par grol ba zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'di dbang po'i sgo nas yongs su rdzogs pa nyid ma yin no // gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'di snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgo nas yongs su rdzogs pa nyid ni yin te /
translated: It is complete in terms of meditative attainment alone, because it is said that one is liberated by time.üîΩIt is complete in terms of meditative attainment, because it is said that one is liberated from both aspects.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa ni gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba zhas bshad do //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa ni gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba zhas bshad do //
translated: One who has attained the meditative attainment of cessation is said to be liberated from both aspects.

original: dbang po dang snyoms par 'jug pa dag las so zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po dang snyoms par 'jug pa dag las so zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: yongs su rdzogs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa nyid yin te /
translated: It is the perfection of faculties and meditative attainment.

original: dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'i phyir dbang po'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'i phyir dbang po'i sgo nas so //
translated: It is by the perfection of faculties because one is liberated without regard to time.

original: gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa las so zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa las so zhes ston par byed do //
translated: It is by the perfection of meditative attainment because one is liberated from both aspects.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam ni gang gis sgrib pa rab tu spong ba'o zhes bya ba ni mi spong ba'i lam srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam ni gang gis sgrib pa rab tu spong ba'o zhes bya ba ni mi spong ba'i lam srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: The uninterrupted path is that by which one abandons the obscurations.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam gang zhig gis dbang po 'pho ba la sogs par sgrib pa rab tu mi spong bar byed pa de yod do //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam gang zhig gis dbang po 'pho ba la sogs par sgrib pa rab tu mi spong bar byed pa de yod do //
translated: The uninterrupted path is that by which one does not abandon the obscurations of the change of faculties and so on.üîΩThe first moment of liberation from the obscurations abandoned by that is the liberated path.

original: des spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa las nges par grol ba dang po nyid du skye ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa las nges par grol ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: des spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa las nges par grol ba dang po nyid du skye ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa las nges par grol ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The first moment of liberation from the obscurations abandoned by the uninterrupted path is the liberated path.

original: dang po nyid du zhes bya ba khyad par smos pa ni /
analyzed: dang po nyid du zhes bya ba khyad par smos pa ni /
translated: The term ‚Äúfirst‚Äù is specified because

original: 'di ltar skad cig ma gsum pa la sogs pa la de dang rigs mthun pa'i lam ni khyad par can gyi lam @228a * //üîΩyin par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar skad cig ma gsum pa la sogs pa la de dang rigs mthun pa'i lam ni khyad par can gyi lam @228a * // yin par 'dod de /
translated: the path of the same type as that is asserted to be a special path in the third moment and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir khyad par can gyi lam ni de dag las gzhan pa'i lam gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir khyad par can gyi lam ni de dag las gzhan pa'i lam gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it is said that the special path is any path other than those.

original: gzhan yang gal te dang po nyid du zhes bya ba ma brjod kyi rnam par grol ba'i lam ni des spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa las nges par grol ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba de tsam zhig smos par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te dang po nyid du zhes bya ba ma brjod kyi rnam par grol ba'i lam ni des spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa las nges par grol ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba de tsam zhig smos par 'gyur na /
translated: Moreover, if the term ‚Äúfirst‚Äù is not stated and only this is said: The liberated path is that which is liberated from the obscurations abandoned by it,

original: de lta na ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa phan chad bar chad med pa'i lam la sogs pa thams cad des spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa las nges par grol bar skye ba yin pas thams cad rnam par grol ba'i lam du 'gyur ba zhig na bar
analyzed: de lta na ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa phan chad bar chad med pa'i lam la sogs pa thams cad des spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa las nges par grol bar skye ba yin pas thams cad rnam par grol ba'i lam du 'gyur ba zhig na bar
translated: then all uninterrupted paths and so on that arise after the Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering would be liberated paths because they arise liberated from the obscurations abandoned by it.

original: chad med pa'i lam la sogs pa yang rnam par grol ba'i lam nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de yang mi 'dod do //üîΩde lta bas na bar chad med pa'i lam sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i ris nas /
analyzed: chad med pa'i lam la sogs pa yang rnam par grol ba'i lam nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de yang mi 'dod do // de lta bas na bar chad med pa'i lam sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i ris nas /
translated: and the uninterrupted path would be the liberated path itself.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i ris kyi bar gang yin pa spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa de las nges par grol bas dang po nyid du skyes pa gang yin pa des rnam par grol ba'i lam yin gyi gzhan ni des spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa lasüîΩnges par grol ba nyid yin yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i ris kyi bar gang yin pa spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa de las nges par grol bas dang po nyid du skyes pa gang yin pa des rnam par grol ba'i lam yin gyi gzhan ni des spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa las nges par grol ba nyid yin yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the first path that is generated is the liberated path, since it is definitely liberated from the obscurations to be abandoned by the perseverance for the knowledge of the truth of suffering on the uninterrupted path, up to the obscurations to be abandoned by the path of meditation.üîΩThe other paths are not liberated from the obscurations to be abandoned by that perseverance.

original: sbyor ba'i lam la sogs pa gsum po de dag las gzhan pa gang yin pa de ni khyad par can gyi lam yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam la sogs pa gsum po de dag las gzhan pa gang yin pa de ni khyad par can gyi lam yin te /
translated: The other paths are the special paths, which are different from the three paths of preparation and so on.

original: skad cig ma bcu drug pa lam la rjes su shes pa'i mtshan nyid phan chad de dang ris mthun pa skad cig ma bcu bdun pa la sogs pa zag pa med pa'i skad cig ma gang yin pa de dag ni khyad par can gyi lam gyi ngo boüîΩnyid yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma bcu drug pa lam la rjes su shes pa'i mtshan nyid phan chad de dang ris mthun pa skad cig ma bcu bdun pa la sogs pa zag pa med pa'i skad cig ma gang yin pa de dag ni khyad par can gyi lam gyi ngo bo nyid yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that any uncontaminated moment that is homogeneous with those, such as the seventeenth moment and so on, is also the nature of the special path.

original: gzhan rnam par grol ba'i ye shes kyi rab kyi mtha' pa zad pa shes pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya ste /üîΩmthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par byed pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan rnam par grol ba'i ye shes kyi rab kyi mtha' pa zad pa shes pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya ste / mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par byed pa'am /
translated: It should be stated that the final summit of the wisdom of liberation, such as the knowledge of elimination and so on, is also like that.

original: yon tan khyad par can mngon par sgrub par byed pa'i lam gang yin pa de yang khyad par can gyi lam kho na yin no //
analyzed: yon tan khyad par can mngon par sgrub par byed pa'i lam gang yin pa de yang khyad par can gyi lam kho na yin no //
translated: Any path that causes one to abide in comfort in this life or that establishes special qualities is also the special path alone.

original: sbyor ba'i lam ni gang gi mjug thogs su bar chad med pa'i lam skye ba'o zhes bshad pas de'i phyir sbyor ba'i lam ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog yin no zhes bya bar mngon no //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam ni gang gi mjug thogs su bar chad med pa'i lam skye ba'o zhes bshad pas de'i phyir sbyor ba'i lam ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog yin no zhes bya bar mngon no //
translated: Therefore it is clear that the supreme mundane state is the path of preparation.

original: lugs las bzlog par bzod pa la sogs pa'i lam gang yin pa de gang gi nang du 'dus par brjod par bya zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: lugs las bzlog par bzod pa la sogs pa'i lam gang yin pa de gang gi nang du 'dus par brjod par bya zhe na smras pa /
translated: If the path of acceptance and so on is reversed, then it should be said that it is subsumed within which path?

original: sbyor ba'i lam kho na'i nang du 'dus na 'di ni sbyor ba'i lam thag ring @228b po yin pas de ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog dag dang khyad par de yod do //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam kho na'i nang du 'dus na 'di ni sbyor ba'i lam thag ring @228b po yin pas de ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog dag dang khyad par de yod do //
translated: If it is subsumed within the path of preparation alone, then it is the distant path of preparation, but it is distinguished from the supreme mundane state.

original: yang na dper brjod pa'i phyir bar chad med pa dang / nye ba kho na sbyor ba'i lam du bshad do /üîΩ// / bam po lnga bcu gnyis pa /
analyzed: yang na dper brjod pa'i phyir bar chad med pa dang / nye ba kho na sbyor ba'i lam du bshad do /üîΩ// / bam po lnga bcu gnyis pa /
translated: Or it is explained that the uninterrupted and proximate paths are the path of preparation alone, because it is an example.

original: de nas der 'gro ba'i phyir 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten na gang nas 'gro ba de lam yin no zhes grags la 'di nas kyang mya ngan las 'das par 'gro zhing phyin par byed de /
analyzed: de nas der 'gro ba'i phyir 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten na gang nas 'gro ba de lam yin no zhes grags la 'di nas kyang mya ngan las 'das par 'gro zhing phyin par byed de /
translated: In the world, it is well known that a path is that from which one goes. Since one goes to nirvana and arrives there from this,

original: de lta bas na lam yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: de lta bas na lam yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: it is taught that it is the path.üîΩSince it seeks nirvana, it is the path.

original: 'dis mya ngan las 'das pa tshol ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skad kyi dbyings las lam tshol bar byed pa yin no zhes 'byung bas gang gis mya ngan las 'das pa tshol zhing thob par byed pa de ni lam yin no //
analyzed: 'dis mya ngan las 'das pa tshol ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skad kyi dbyings las lam tshol bar byed pa yin no zhes 'byung bas gang gis mya ngan las 'das pa tshol zhing thob par byed pa de ni lam yin no //
translated: Since it is said that the path seeks nirvana, that by which one seeks and obtains nirvana is the path.üîΩHow are the liberated path and the special path paths?

original: rnam par grol ba dang khyad par can gyi lam dag ji ltar na lam nyid yin zhes bya ba ni de gnyis kyis mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba dang khyad par can gyi lam dag ji ltar na lam nyid yin zhes bya ba ni de gnyis kyis mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: They do not cause one to obtain nirvana.

original: de thob pa la ni sbyor ba dang bar chad med pa'i lam kho na nus pa yod kyi de gnyis ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de thob pa la ni sbyor ba dang bar chad med pa'i lam kho na nus pa yod kyi de gnyis ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: But it is not that both the liberated and special paths are capable of obtaining that result.üîΩBecause they are similar and greater,

original: de dang 'dra ba dang ches che ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang zag pa med pa nyid du chos na thun pa'i phyir spang ba'i lam dang 'dra ba yin la /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba dang ches che ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang zag pa med pa nyid du chos na thun pa'i phyir spang ba'i lam dang 'dra ba yin la /
translated: the liberated and special paths are similar to the path of abandoning because they focus on the same object, have the same aspect and are uncontaminated.

original: rgyu bsags pa'i sgo nas ches che ba dag kyang yin te /üîΩji ltar bar chad med pa'i lam bden pa bzhi la dmigs shing rnam pa bcu drug dang zag pa med pa yin pa ltar rnam par grol ba dang khyad par can gyi lam dag kyang de dang 'dra la ches che ba nyid kyis de gnyis khyad zhugs pa
analyzed: rgyu bsags pa'i sgo nas ches che ba dag kyang yin te / ji ltar bar chad med pa'i lam bden pa bzhi la dmigs shing rnam pa bcu drug dang zag pa med pa yin pa ltar rnam par grol ba dang khyad par can gyi lam dag kyang de dang 'dra la ches che ba nyid kyis de gnyis khyad zhugs pa
translated: They are greater through the accumulation of causes.üîΩJust as the uninterrupted path focuses on the four truths and has sixteen aspects and is uncontaminated, so too the liberated path and the special path are similar to that.

original: yang yin no //
analyzed: yang yin no //
translated: They are distinguished from those two by being greater.

original: gong nas gong du phyin par byed pa'i phyir ram phung po'i lhag ma ma lus par 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rnam par grol ba'i lam dang khyad par can gyi lam gyis lam gong nas gong du phyin par byed pa'am /
analyzed: gong nas gong du phyin par byed pa'i phyir ram phung po'i lhag ma ma lus par 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rnam par grol ba'i lam dang khyad par can gyi lam gyis lam gong nas gong du phyin par byed pa'am /
translated: Because the path of liberation and the special path cause one to proceed higher and higher,

original: gang gi phyir de gnyis kyis phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par 'jug ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de gnyis kyis phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par 'jug ste /
translated: and because they cause one to enter nirvana without a remaining substratum.

original: de dag skyes nas phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par 'jug pa de'i phyir 'di gnyis lam nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag skyes nas phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par 'jug pa de'i phyir 'di gnyis lam nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because they cause one to enter nirvana without a remaining substratum after they arise, they are paths.

original: gzhan dag na re 'di skad du gong nas gong du phyin par byed pa'i phyir phung po'i lhag ma ma lus par 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'di skad du gong nas gong du phyin par byed pa'i phyir phung po'i lhag ma ma lus par 'jug pa yin te /
translated: Others say: They cause one to proceed higher and higher and they cause one to enter nirvana without a remaining substratum.

original: de lta bas na 'di gnyis lam nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di gnyis lam nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore they are paths.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'dis mya ngan las @229a * //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'dis mya ngan las @229a * //
translated: Because it is the means of attaining nirvana.

original: 'das pa sgrub par byed pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩde bzhin du sla ba yang rnam pa gnyis so zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa bul ba sla ba'i lam yang yod /
analyzed: 'das pa sgrub par byed pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de bzhin du sla ba yang rnam pa gnyis so zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa bul ba sla ba'i lam yang yod /
translated: This is the meaning: because it is the means of attaining nirvana.üîΩSimilarly, the easy path is also twofold.

original: mngon par shes pa myur ba sla ba'i lam yang yod ces bya ba yin no //üîΩyan lag gis yongs su zin pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mnyam pa dag gis 'bad mi dgos bar ngang gis 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yan lag dag gis yongs su zin pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag mnyam pa nyid ni yan lag gis yongs su zin pa dang /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa myur ba sla ba'i lam yang yod ces bya ba yin no // yan lag gis yongs su zin pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mnyam pa dag gis 'bad mi dgos bar ngang gis 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yan lag dag gis yongs su zin pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag mnyam pa nyid ni yan lag gis yongs su zin pa dang /
translated: There is the path of slow superknowledge that is easy, and there is the path of quick superknowledge that is easy.üîΩBecause it is effortless, occurring naturally, due to being endowed with the branches and the balance of serenity and insight.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: Being endowed with the branches and the balance of serenity and insight is being endowed with the branches and the balance of serenity and insight.

original: de dag gis na 'bad mi dgos par ngang gis 'byung ba yin pas de'i phyir lam sla ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis na 'bad mi dgos par ngang gis 'byung ba yin pas de'i phyir lam sla ba yin no //
translated: Because they arise effortlessly, they are easy paths.

original: gang gi phyir bsam gtan dag ni yan lag gis yongs su zin pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag mnyam pa yin pa de'i phyir 'bad pa mi dgos par ngang gis 'byung ba yin pas de'i phyir lam de ni sla ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsam gtan dag ni yan lag gis yongs su zin pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag mnyam pa yin pa de'i phyir 'bad pa mi dgos par ngang gis 'byung ba yin pas de'i phyir lam de ni sla ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the absorptions are fully qualified by their branches and serenity and insight are balanced, they arise effortlessly. Therefore they are called easy paths.

original: yan lag gis yongs su ma zin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / gzugs med pa dag ni yan lag gis yongs su ma zin pa'i phyir 'bad nas 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: yan lag gis yongs su ma zin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / gzugs med pa dag ni yan lag gis yongs su ma zin pa'i phyir 'bad nas 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Because they are not fully qualified by their branches, they arise through exertion.

original: de dag ci rigs par zhi gnas dang lhag mthong chung ba'i phyir 'bad nas 'byung ba yang yin te /
analyzed: de dag ci rigs par zhi gnas dang lhag mthong chung ba'i phyir 'bad nas 'byung ba yang yin te /
translated: Because serenity and insight are weak, they arise through exertion.

original: mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dag ni zhi gnas chung ba'i phyir 'bad nas 'byung ba yin no //üîΩgzugs med pa dag ni lhag mthong chung ba'i phyir 'bad nas 'byung ba yin no //üîΩde'i phyir mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa de dag ni lam dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dag ni zhi gnas chung ba'i phyir 'bad nas 'byung ba yin no // gzugs med pa dag ni lhag mthong chung ba'i phyir 'bad nas 'byung ba yin no // de'i phyir mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa de dag ni lam dka' ba yin no //
translated: The other meditative attainments are called the easy path, because they are the path of the strong.üîΩThe meditative attainment of the summit of cyclic existence is called the difficult path, because it is the path of the weak.üîΩThe other meditative attainments are called the easy path, because they are the path of the strong.üîΩThe meditative attainment of the summit of cyclic existence is called the difficult path, because it is the path of the weak.üîΩThe other meditative attainments are called the easy path, because they are the path of the strong.üîΩThe meditative attainment of the summit of cyclic existence is called the difficult path, because it is the path of the weak.üîΩThe other meditative attainments are called the easy path, because they are the path of the strong.üîΩThe meditative attainment of the summit of cyclic existence is called the difficult path, because it is the path of the weak.üîΩThe other meditative attainments are called the easy path, because they are the path of the strong.üîΩThe meditative attainment of the summit of cyclic existence is called the difficult path, because it is the path of the weak.üîΩThe other meditative attainments are called the easy path, because they are the path of the strong.

original: mngon par shes pa bul ba zhes bya ba ni 'di la mngon par shes pa bul ba yod pas mngon par shes pa bul ba ste /üîΩshes rab chung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩmngon par shes pa myur ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab rno ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa bul ba zhes bya ba ni 'di la mngon par shes pa bul ba yod pas mngon par shes pa bul ba ste / shes rab chung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // mngon par shes pa myur ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab rno ba'o //
translated: The meditative attainment of the summit of cyclic existence is called the difficult path, because it is the path of the weak.üîΩThe other meditative attainments are called the easy path, because they are the path of the strong.üîΩThe meditative attainment of the summit of cyclic existence is called the difficult path, because it is the path of the weak.üîΩThe other meditative attainments are called the easy path, because they are the path of the strong.

original: yang na mngon par shes pa 'di gang zag mong rtul zhing blun pa'i yin pas mngon par shes pa bul ba yin te /
analyzed: yang na mngon par shes pa 'di gang zag mong rtul zhing blun pa'i yin pas mngon par shes pa bul ba yin te /
translated: The meditative attainment of the summit of cyclic existence is called the difficult path, because it is the path of the weak.üîΩThe other meditative attainments are called the easy path, because they are the path of the

original: de bzhin du mngon par shes pa gang zag yid rnon po'i yin pas mngon par shes pa myur ba'o zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩdran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos dran pa nye bar @229b gzhag pa ji skad du bshad pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mngon par shes pa gang zag yid rnon po'i yin pas mngon par shes pa myur ba'o zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o // dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos dran pa nye bar @229b gzhag pa ji skad du bshad pa dag yin no //
translated: The same applies to the quick superknowledges, which are the superknowledges of a person of sharp faculties.üîΩThe four foundations of mindfulness are the foundations of mindfulness of body, of sensation, of thought, and of the dharmas, as they have been explained above.üîΩThe four right efforts are:

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spong ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed do //üîΩrtsol ba byed do //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spong ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed do // rtsol ba byed do //
translated: to generate zeal,üîΩto make an effort,

original: brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: to exert vigor,

original: sems rab tu 'dzin to //üîΩyang dag par rab tu 'jog go //üîΩsdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams ni mi skyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed do zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin to // yang dag par rab tu 'jog go // sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams ni mi skyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed do zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: to control the mind,üîΩto settle the mind in order to abandon the bad, unwholesome dharmas which have already arisen.üîΩTo generate zeal, as above, in order not to produce the bad, unwholesome dharmas which have not yet arisen.

original: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed do zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed do zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: To generate zeal, as above, in order to produce the wholesome dharmas which have not yet arisen.

original: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / mi brjed pa dang / bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / phyir zhing goms pa dang / 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang / ye shes kyis mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed do zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / mi brjed pa dang / bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / phyir zhing goms pa dang / 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang / ye shes kyis mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed do zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: He generates will for the abiding of wholesome states that have arisen, for their non-forgetting, for their cultivation, for their completion, for their repeated practice, for their increase, for their expansion, and for their realization by direct-knowledge.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ni 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong pa'i 'du byed dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ni 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong pa'i 'du byed dang ldan pa /
translated: The four bases of spiritual power are: the base of spiritual power that is concentration of will accompanied by the volition of striving;

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / de bzhin du brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dag ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / de bzhin du brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dag ste /
translated: and similarly, the base of spiritual power that is concentration of energy, concentration of mind, and concentration of investigation accompanied by the volition of striving.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The bases of spiritual power are the causes of spiritual power, that is, the causes of the bases of spiritual power.

original: dbang po lnga ni dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi dbang po dag go //
analyzed: dbang po lnga ni dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi dbang po dag go //
translated: The five faculties are faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: stobs lnga ni dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi stobs dag go //
analyzed: stobs lnga ni dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi stobs dag go //
translated: The five powers are the same as the faculties, but they are called powers because they overpower their opposites.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni dran pa dang / chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dag ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni dran pa dang / chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dag ste /
translated: The seven factors of enlightenment are mindfulness, the investigation of phenomena, vigor, joy, fitness, concentration, and equanimity.

original: dran pa nyid yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag yin pas dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ste btang snyoms nyid yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag yin pas na btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi bar du yang de dang 'dra'o
analyzed: dran pa nyid yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag yin pas dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ste btang snyoms nyid yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag yin pas na btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi bar du yang de dang 'dra'o
translated: Mindfulness is the enlightenment factor of mindfulness. Equanimity is the enlightenment factor of equanimity.üîΩThe eightfold noble path consists of right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.

original: // 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang /
analyzed: // 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang /
translated: The eightfold noble path is right view, right conception, right speech, right activity, right livelihood, right effort,

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //üîΩde gnyis kyis ma rig pa ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir khams gsum pa'i ma rig pa ma @230a * //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to // de gnyis kyis ma rig pa ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir khams gsum pa'i ma rig pa ma @230a * //
translated: right mindfulness, and right concentration.üîΩBecause both of them completely eliminate nescience,

original: lus par spangs pa de'i phyir de gnyi ga byang chub yin te /
analyzed: lus par spangs pa de'i phyir de gnyi ga byang chub yin te /
translated: because they completely eliminate the nescience of the three realms, therefore both of them are enlightenment.

original: 'dis ni slob pa dang so so'i skye bo rnams kyi shes rab ni byang chub tu rnam par mi bzhag go zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni slob pa dang so so'i skye bo rnams kyi shes rab ni byang chub tu rnam par mi bzhag go zhes ston par byed do //
translated: This shows that the wisdom of the learners and the common people is not considered enlightenment.

original: gzhan yang go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: gzhan yang go rims bzhin du /
translated: Moreover, in order,

original: rang gi don byas pa dang yang byar med pa nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang gi don byas pa dang yang byar med pa nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: because they have accomplished their own goal and have no more to do, and because they have realized things as they are.

original: zad pa shes pas bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes so zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: zad pa shes pas bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes so zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: By the cognition of exhaustion, one correctly knows: I have fully known suffering.üîΩI have abandoned the origin. I have manifested cessation. I have cultivated the path.

original: bdag gis kun 'byung ba spangs so zhes bya ba dang / bdag gis 'gog pa mngon du byas so zhes bya ba dang / bdag gis lam bsgoms so zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa'i phyir zad pa shes pa de byang chub yin no //üîΩmi skye ba shes pas kyang bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes te /
analyzed: bdag gis kun 'byung ba spangs so zhes bya ba dang / bdag gis 'gog pa mngon du byas so zhes bya ba dang / bdag gis lam bsgoms so zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa'i phyir zad pa shes pa de byang chub yin no // mi skye ba shes pas kyang bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes te /
translated: Thus, the cognition of exhaustion is enlightenment, because it is the realization of the correct understanding of the four noble truths.üîΩBy the cognition of non-arising, one correctly knows: I have fully known suffering.

original: yang yongs su shes par byar med do zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: yang yongs su shes par byar med do zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: I have no more to fully know.

original: bdag gis kun 'byung ba spangs te /
analyzed: bdag gis kun 'byung ba spangs te /
translated: I have abandoned the origin.

original: yang spang du med do zhes bya ba dang / bdag gis 'gog pa mngon du byas te /
analyzed: yang spang du med do zhes bya ba dang / bdag gis 'gog pa mngon du byas te /
translated: I have no more to abandon. I have manifested cessation.üîΩI have no more to manifest. I have cultivated the path.üîΩI have no more to cultivate.

original: yang mngon du byar med do zhes bya ba dang / bdag gis lam bsgoms te /
analyzed: yang mngon du byar med do zhes bya ba dang / bdag gis lam bsgoms te /
translated: Again, I have cultivated the path.üîΩAgain, it is not to be cultivated.

original: yang bsgom du med do zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya bar yang byar med pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa'i phyir mi skye ba shes pa de yang byang chub yin no //
analyzed: yang bsgom du med do zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya bar yang byar med pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa'i phyir mi skye ba shes pa de yang byang chub yin no //
translated: Thus, because one realizes the non-arising of suffering just as it is, that knowledge of non-arising is also enlightenment.

original: bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes so zhes bya ba 'dis ni zad pa shes pa bstan la /
analyzed: bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes so zhes bya ba 'dis ni zad pa shes pa bstan la /
translated: By this statement, I have fully understood suffering, the knowledge of elimination is indicated.

original: yang shes par byar med do zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi skye ba shes pa bstan pas gnyi ga yang gang zag dbang po rnon po'i yin par ston to zhes thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang shes par byar med do zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi skye ba shes pa bstan pas gnyi ga yang gang zag dbang po rnon po'i yin par ston to zhes thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: By this statement, It is not to be known again, the knowledge of non-arising is indicated. Thus, both are taught to belong to a person of sharp faculties. This should be applied to all.

original: de ltar zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa byang chub yin no zhes yan lag gi don rab tu bsgrubs nas spyi'i don rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa byang chub yin no zhes yan lag gi don rab tu bsgrubs nas spyi'i don rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having established the meaning of the branches by saying that the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of non-arising are enlightenment, in order to establish the general meaning, it is said:

original: de dang mthun pa nyid phyir /
analyzed: de dang mthun pa nyid phyir /
translated: Because it is in accordance with that.

original: sum cu rtsa bdun de'i phyogs mthun //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa bdun de'i phyogs mthun // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The thirty-seven are concordant with enlightenment.

original: byang chub de dang mthun pa ni de dang mthun pa'o //üîΩde'i ngo bo ni de dang mthun pa nyid de /
analyzed: byang chub de dang mthun pa ni de dang mthun pa'o // de'i ngo bo ni de dang mthun pa nyid de /
translated: That which is concordant with enlightenment is concordant with enlightenment.üîΩThat which has the nature of concordant with enlightenment is concordant with enlightenment.

original: de dang mthun pa nyid de'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'o //üîΩbyang chub kyi phyogs la bzang zhing mthun pas na gsung rab las /
analyzed: de dang mthun pa nyid de'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'o // byang chub kyi phyogs la bzang zhing mthun pas na gsung rab las /
translated: Because of that, they are factors conducive to enlightenment.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa sum cu rtsa bdun byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa yin par @230b 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa sum cu rtsa bdun byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa yin par @230b 'byung ngo //
translated: Since they are good and conducive to enlightenment, the scriptures state that the thirty-seven such as the foundations of mindfulness are factors conducive to enlightenment.

original: rdzas sum cu zhes bya ba ni kha cig gi gzhung lugs yin te /
analyzed: rdzas sum cu zhes bya ba ni kha cig gi gzhung lugs yin te /
translated: Some assert that there are thirty substances.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi ltar na lus dang ngag dag tha dad pa'i phyir tshul khrims kyi yan lag rnams rdzas gnyis yin pas bcu gcig yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi ltar na lus dang ngag dag tha dad pa'i phyir tshul khrims kyi yan lag rnams rdzas gnyis yin pas bcu gcig yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: According to the Vaibhasikas, there are eleven substances because the branches of ethics are two substances since body and speech are distinct.

original: dran pa nyer gzhag shes rab ste //
analyzed: dran pa nyer gzhag shes rab ste //
translated: The foundations of mindfulness are wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni shes rab yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni shes rab yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Mindfulness is wisdom.

original: 'dis dran pa nye bar 'jog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dis dran pa nye bar 'jog pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it causes the establishment of mindfulness.

original: 'di ltar mdo las /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo las /
translated: As it is said in the sutra:

original: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: He dwells contemplating the body as a body.üîΩRight effort is the root of supernormal power.

original: brtson 'grus yang dag 'jog ces bya //
analyzed: brtson 'grus yang dag 'jog ces bya //
translated: As it is said:üîΩHe generates desire for the nonarising of evil and unwholesome states that have not yet arisen.üîΩHe makes an effort, arouses energy, applies his mind, and strives.üîΩHe generates desire for the abandonment of evil and unwholesome states that have arisen.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed do //
translated: He generates desire for the arising of wholesome states that have not yet arisen.

original: rtsol bar byed do //
analyzed: rtsol bar byed do //
translated: He makes an effort, arouses energy, applies his mind, and strives.üîΩHe generates desire for the abiding, non-disappearance, non-destruction, and increase and expansion of wholesome states that have arisen.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom mo zhes 'byung ba thams cad sbyar ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom mo zhes 'byung ba thams cad sbyar ro //
translated: He makes an effort, arouses energy, applies his mind, and strives.

original: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The four bases of supernormal power are concentration.üîΩAs it is said:üîΩHe cultivates the basis of supernormal power that possesses concentration due to desire and the volitional formations that accompany it.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa sgom par byed do zhes 'byung ba thams cad sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa sgom par byed do zhes 'byung ba thams cad sbyar ro //
translated: He cultivates the basis of supernormal power that possesses concentration due to energy, mind, and investigation and the volitional formations that accompany it.

original: 'dir spong ba'i 'du byed ces smos pa'i mdo las brgyad 'byung ba yin no //üîΩji lta zhe na de lta bu'i 'dun pa gang yin pa dang / rtsol ba gang yin pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa gang yin pa dang / dran pa gang yin pa dang / shes bzhin gang yin pa dang / sems 'du byed pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: 'dir spong ba'i 'du byed ces smos pa'i mdo las brgyad 'byung ba yin no // ji lta zhe na de lta bu'i 'dun pa gang yin pa dang / rtsol ba gang yin pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa gang yin pa dang / dran pa gang yin pa dang / shes bzhin gang yin pa dang / sems 'du byed pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: The sutra mentions eight applications of abandoning.üîΩWhat are they?

original: sems mngon par 'du byed pa gang yin pa dang / btang snyoms gang yin pa de dag ni spong ba'i 'du byed ces bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems mngon par 'du byed pa gang yin pa dang / btang snyoms gang yin pa de dag ni spong ba'i 'du byed ces bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Any aspiration, any effort, any pliancy, any mindfulness, any equanimity, any mental application, any mental formation, and any equanimity are called the applications of abandoning.

original: de'i phyir re zhig dbang po dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni rang gi ming gis smos pa'i dbang po dang stobs kyi ngo bo nyid dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi rdzas lnga gang dag yin pa de dag las dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po gang dag yin pa de ni shes rab kho na yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig dbang po dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni rang gi ming gis smos pa'i dbang po dang stobs kyi ngo bo nyid dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi rdzas lnga gang dag yin pa de dag las dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po gang dag yin pa de ni shes rab kho na yin la /
translated: Therefore, the five substances of faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom that are called faculties and powers by their own names are the four establishments of mindfulness, which are wisdom alone.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag dag gi nang na chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang yin pa dang / lam dag gi nang na yang dag pa'i lta ba gang yin pa yang rdzas gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag dag gi nang na chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang yin pa dang / lam dag gi nang na yang dag pa'i lta ba gang yin pa yang rdzas gzhan ma yin no //
translated: The factor of perfect discernment of phenomena among the factors of awakening and right view among the paths are not separate substances.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi po gang dag yin pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dag gi nang na brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang yin pa dang / lam dag gi nang na yang dag pa'i rtsol ba gang yin pa de ni brtson 'grus kho na yin no//
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi po gang dag yin pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dag gi nang na brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang yin pa dang / lam dag gi nang na yang dag pa'i rtsol ba gang yin pa de ni brtson 'grus kho na yin no//
translated: The four right efforts, the effort limb of enlightenment, and right effort are only effort.

original: @231a * // rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi po gang dag yin pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dag gi nang na ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang yin pa dang / lam gyi nang na yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni ting nge 'dzin kho na yin no //
analyzed: @231a * // rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi po gang dag yin pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dag gi nang na ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang yin pa dang / lam gyi nang na yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni ting nge 'dzin kho na yin no //
translated: The four bases of supernormal power, the concentration limb of enlightenment, and right concentration are only concentration.

original: gang shes rab kyi dbang po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa ci zhig lus she na /
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi dbang po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa ci zhig lus she na /
translated: What remains that is not the nature of the faculty of wisdom and so on?

original: byang chub kyi yan lag dag gi nang na dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / lam gyi yan lag dag gi nang na yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / tshul khrims kyi yan lag gsum po yang dag pa'i ngag dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag dag gi nang na dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / lam gyi yan lag dag gi nang na yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / tshul khrims kyi yan lag gsum po yang dag pa'i ngag dang /
translated: Among the branches of enlightenment, the branches of enlightenment of joy, pliancy, and equanimity, and among the branches of the path, right thought and right view are wisdom.

original: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba rnams zhes bya ba dag lus so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba rnams zhes bya ba dag lus so //
translated: Among the branches of the path, the three branches of ethics‚Äîright speech, right action, and right livelihood‚Äîare physical.üîΩThey are ten substances.

original: rdzas bcu po yin no zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa lnga dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa lnga ste /
analyzed: rdzas bcu po yin no zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa lnga dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa lnga ste /
translated: The five such as faith and the five such as the branch of enlightenment of joy are ten substances.

original: tshul khrims kyi yan lag gsum ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rdzas gcig tu rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi yan lag gsum ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rdzas gcig tu rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The three branches of ethics are posited as one substance because they are by nature nonindicative form.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi ltar na lus dang ngag gi las dag tha dad cing rigs mi mthun pa'i phyir rdzas gnyis yin pas rdzas bcu gcig yin no //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi ltar na lus dang ngag gi las dag tha dad cing rigs mi mthun pa'i phyir rdzas gnyis yin pas rdzas bcu gcig yin no //
translated: According to the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas, there are eleven substances, since bodily and vocal action are distinct and do not belong to the same class.

original: bsam pa'i dbang gis ni phyogs gnyi ga ltar na yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: bsam pa'i dbang gis ni phyogs gnyi ga ltar na yang nyes pa med do //
translated: But there is no fault in either position, since the number of substances is determined by intention.

original: gal te dngos su tshogs pa de la rdzas ji snyed cig yod pa ril gyis bgrang na ni de dag rdzas bcu ma yin pa de nyid de /
analyzed: gal te dngos su tshogs pa de la rdzas ji snyed cig yod pa ril gyis bgrang na ni de dag rdzas bcu ma yin pa de nyid de /
translated: If one counts all the substances that exist in the collection, then there are not ten substances,

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs rnams rdzas bdun yin pa'i phyir rdzas bcu drug yin no zhes brjod dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs rnams rdzas bdun yin pa'i phyir rdzas bcu drug yin no zhes brjod dgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: because there are seven substances in the equipoise of non-apperception and sixteen substances in the equipoise of cessation.

original: gtso bo smos pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa ni shes rab la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes de skad bshad kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa dang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams ni ci rigs par sbyor ba las byung ba'i yon tan thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa thams cad kyang yin no
analyzed: gtso bo smos pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa ni shes rab la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes de skad bshad kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa dang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams ni ci rigs par sbyor ba las byung ba'i yon tan thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa thams cad kyang yin no
translated: The foundations of mindfulness and so on are explained to be wisdom and so forth because they are mentioned as the most important among the qualities that arise from preparation, but they are also all qualities that arise from hearing, contemplation and meditation, with and without impurity, as appropriate.

original: // gtso bo zhes bya ba ni de'i stobs kyis gzhan dag 'jug pa la bya'i de dag med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: // gtso bo zhes bya ba ni de'i stobs kyis gzhan dag 'jug pa la bya'i de dag med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The term most important refers to the fact that others engage in them through the power of those qualities. They are not nonexistent.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi gtso bo ni shes rab yin pas de'i phyir shes rab smos kyi /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi gtso bo ni shes rab yin pas de'i phyir shes rab smos kyi /
translated: Since wisdom is the most important of the foundations of mindfulness, wisdom is mentioned.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa shes rab kho na yin par ni ma zad do //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa shes rab kho na yin par ni ma zad do //
translated: But the foundations of mindfulness are not just wisdom alone.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: shes rab dang / @231b brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / btang snyoms dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa la sogs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: shes rab dang / @231b brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / btang snyoms dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa la sogs pa yang yin no //
translated: faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, equanimity, correct intention, etc.

original: sbyor ba las byung ba zhes smos pa ni skyes nas thob pa'i dad pa la sogs pa gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba zhes smos pa ni skyes nas thob pa'i dad pa la sogs pa gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression ‚Äúarisen from practice‚Äù is used in order to specify the faith, etc., obtained from birth.

original: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba rnams kyi gtso bo ni brtson 'grus yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba rnams kyi gtso bo ni brtson 'grus yin la /
translated: In the same way, vigor is the principal factor of the right exertions;

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyi gtso bo ni ting nge 'dzin yin pas zhes bya ba rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyi gtso bo ni ting nge 'dzin yin pas zhes bya ba rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: concentration is the principal factor of the bases of supernormal accomplishments.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dag ni ting nge 'dzin yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las byung zhe na /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dag ni ting nge 'dzin yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las byung zhe na /
translated: How do you know that the bases of supernormal accomplishments are concentration?

original: mdo las te /
analyzed: mdo las te /
translated: From the S≈´tra.

original: dge slong dag dge slong gi 'dun pa'i dbang du byas nas ting nge 'dzin thob ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag dge slong gi 'dun pa'i dbang du byas nas ting nge 'dzin thob ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBhik·π£us, the bhik·π£u who has attained concentration through the power of his will,

original: de ni 'di'i 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'di'i 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
translated: this is his concentration of will.

original: dge slong dag dge slong gi sems dang / brtson 'grus dang / dpyod pa'i dbang du byas nas kyang ting nge 'dzin thob ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag dge slong gi sems dang / brtson 'grus dang / dpyod pa'i dbang du byas nas kyang ting nge 'dzin thob ste /
translated: Monks, the concentration of monks is attained through the power of mind, effort, and investigation.

original: de ni 'di'i dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni 'di'i dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is called the concentration of investigation.

original: des lus dang ngag dang yid yang dag par rab tu 'jog pas so zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'jog pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / nges par byed pa'am /
analyzed: des lus dang ngag dang yid yang dag par rab tu 'jog pas so zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'jog pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / nges par byed pa'am /
translated: It is the correct placement of body, speech, and mind.

original: res 'ga' 'dis 'jug par byed pas na rab tu 'jog pa'o //üîΩde ni yon tan thams cad 'byor pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar yon tan thams cad 'byor pa'i mtshan nyid rdzu 'phrul ni ting nge 'dzin de la brten te /
analyzed: res 'ga' 'dis 'jug par byed pas na rab tu 'jog pa'o // de ni yon tan thams cad 'byor pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar yon tan thams cad 'byor pa'i mtshan nyid rdzu 'phrul ni ting nge 'dzin de la brten te /
translated: It is called correct placement because it is sometimes the cause of entry.üîΩIt is the basis for the acquisition of all good qualities.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / rten yin pas na rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / rten yin pas na rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the concentration of monks is called the basis of supernatural power because it is the basis for supernatural power, which is characterized by the acquisition of all good qualities.

original: gang dag rdzu 'phrul ni ting nge 'dzin kho na yin la 'dun pa la sogs pa 'dun pa dang / sems dang brtson 'grus dang / dpyod pa zhes bya ba dag ni rkang pa yin no zhes de skad du zer ba bye brag tu smra ba de dag gi ltar na 'dun pa dang sems pa dag lhag pa'i phyir bcu gcig gi nang du bsnan na byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa bcuüîΩgsum du 'gyur ro //üîΩbrtson 'grus dang shes rab dag ni lhag ma yin te /üîΩyang dag par spong ba dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag gi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dag rdzu 'phrul ni ting nge 'dzin kho na yin la 'dun pa la sogs pa 'dun pa dang / sems dang brtson 'grus dang / dpyod pa zhes bya ba dag ni rkang pa yin no zhes de skad du zer ba bye brag tu smra ba de dag gi ltar na 'dun pa dang sems pa dag lhag pa'i phyir bcu gcig gi nang du bsnan na byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa bcu gsum du 'gyur ro // brtson 'grus dang shes rab dag ni lhag ma yin te / yang dag par spong ba dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag gi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The S≈´tra Elaborating the Ten states:

original: mang por 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i bar rgyas par gsungs zhes bya ba ni mang por gyur cing gcig tu 'gyur ba dang / snang bar 'gyur ba dang mi snang bar 'gyur ba shes pa dang mthong bas nyams su myong bar byed de /
analyzed: mang por 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i bar rgyas par gsungs zhes bya ba ni mang por gyur cing gcig tu 'gyur ba dang / snang bar 'gyur ba dang mi snang bar 'gyur ba shes pa dang mthong bas nyams su myong bar byed de /
translated: One experiences through knowledge and seeing the transformation of many into one, the transformation of one into many, the manifestation of one as many, the manifestation of many as one, original: lus kyis thogs pa med par rtsig pa la yang thal byung du 'gro'o //
analyzed: lus kyis thogs pa med par rtsig pa la yang thal byung du 'gro'o //
translated: The body becomes unobstructed, and one can pass unhindered through walls.üîΩ

original: sa la yang bye'u zul byed de /
analyzed: sa la yang bye'u zul byed de /
translated: By means of the body, he goes through walls, through ramparts, through mountains,

original: dper @232a * //üîΩna chu la bya ba bzhin no //üîΩchu'i rgyun la yang mi 'bying bar 'gro ste /
analyzed: dper @232a * // na chu la bya ba bzhin no // chu'i rgyun la yang mi 'bying bar 'gro ste /
translated: as if through space.üîΩHe dives in and out of the earth as if in water.

original: dper na sa la bya ba bzhin no //üîΩnam mkha' la yang skyil mo krung bcas nas 'dug ste /
analyzed: dper na sa la bya ba bzhin no // nam mkha' la yang skyil mo krung bcas nas 'dug ste /
translated: He walks on water without sinking as if on earth.

original: dper na 'dab chags bya bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'dab chags bya bzhin no //
translated: Seated cross-legged, he travels in space like a bird.üîΩWith his hand he touches and strokes the sun and moon, so mighty and powerful.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che zhing 'di ltar mthu che ba 'di dag la yang lag pas nyug par byed yongs su nyug par byed cing tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du lus kyis dbang sgyur bar byed de /
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che zhing 'di ltar mthu che ba 'di dag la yang lag pas nyug par byed yongs su nyug par byed cing tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du lus kyis dbang sgyur bar byed de /
translated: He exercises power with his body as far as the Brahma world.

original: 'di ni rdzu 'phrul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rdzu 'phrul zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the supernormal power.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the bases of supernormal power?

original: 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: the concentration of will, the concentration of energy, the concentration of mind, and the concentration of investigation.

original: 'di dag ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: These are called the bases of supernatural powers.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid ni de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid ni de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: But concentration does not have that characteristic.

original: de lta bas na rdzu 'phrul ni ting nge 'dzin kho na ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rdzu 'phrul ni ting nge 'dzin kho na ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, supernatural power is not just concentration.

original: 'dir slob dpon 'dus bzang na re de dag la nyes pa 'dir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon 'dus bzang na re de dag la nyes pa 'dir mi 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the master Samghabhadra says that this error does not arise for them.

original: de dag ni ting nge 'dzin rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang rdzu 'phrul yang yin no zhes bya bar 'dod do //
analyzed: de dag ni ting nge 'dzin rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang rdzu 'phrul yang yin no zhes bya bar 'dod do //
translated: They assert that those are both the bases of supernatural power and supernatural power.

original: 'dun pa la sogs pa smos pa ni ting nge 'dzin bzhi tshan nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dun pa la sogs pa smos pa ni ting nge 'dzin bzhi tshan nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of will, etc., is to indicate that there are four concentrations.

original: ting nge 'dzin la la ni dge ba'i rtsa ba sbyor ba'i gnas skabs na gtso bo yin la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la la ni dge ba'i rtsa ba sbyor ba'i gnas skabs na gtso bo yin la /
translated: Some concentrations are primary in the stage of preparation of the roots of virtue.

original: la la ni dge ba'i rtsa ba grub pa'i gnas skabs na gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: la la ni dge ba'i rtsa ba grub pa'i gnas skabs na gtso bo yin te /
translated: Some say: When the roots of virtue are established, they are the principal.

original: 'di la snga ma ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la snga ma ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa yin no //
translated: Here, the former are the bases of supernatural power.

original: phyi ma ni rdzu 'phrul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyi ma ni rdzu 'phrul zhes bya'o //
translated: The latter are called supernatural power.

original: 'di las rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i 'bras bu rdzu 'phrul gyi sgrar bshad pas 'di dag la mdo sde dang 'gal ba yang med de /
analyzed: 'di las rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i 'bras bu rdzu 'phrul gyi sgrar bshad pas 'di dag la mdo sde dang 'gal ba yang med de /
translated: Since the result of the bases of supernatural power is explained in the term supernatural power, there is no contradiction with the sutras.

original: yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu la de'i sgrar brjod pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu la de'i sgrar brjod pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: It is like the expression of the result of complete knowledge in the term complete knowledge.
